title: Private Sedan Transfers between Narita Airport and Tokyo
description:
Travel in style to and from the airport, in a luxurious private sedan. No need to lug heavy bags or worry about catching the right train or bus!
Popular among business travelers and families, this efficient transfer service to and from Tokyo, Chiba, Mitaka, Musashino and Narita Airport is the most hassle-free way to travel.

Your driver will pick you up and Narita Airport and whisk you to your hotel (or viceversa). No stress, no hassle!

title: Akihabara Go Kart Rental and Free Drive around Tokyo
description:
Zip through the streets of Akihabara or head for the Shibuya Scramble behind the wheel of an easy to drive go-kart. Perfectly street legal, you can explore Tokyo in a real life version of the game!
All you need is a Japanese or International Driving License, and you can drive the streets of Tokyo in a fun go-kart. Try it in costume with your friends for a travelling party or rent a speaker equipped go-kart and become a mobile DJ!
Don't want to tackle the roads on your own? No problem, you can hire a go-kart guide to show you around the sights.

title: Tea Ceremony Experience in Asakusa
description: Learn the basics of the Tea Ceremony, from the history of the items to the proper way to eat the sweets and savor a cup of Japanese Green Tea. The instructor explains in a simple and relaxed manner.

title: Evening Sushi Making Lesson with Dinner Party in Central Tokyo
description:
Get hands on with the food and culture of Japan as you learn to make different kinds of fresh sushi. After cooking, have a dinner party. Optional sake tastings are available too.
Sushi is one of Japan's most famous dishes. During this hands-on program guests will learn how to make several kinds of sushi. Impress your friends with your sushi making skills – the perfect Japanese souvenir!

 Learn to prepare "maki sushi" (rolled sushi), "gunkan maki" (sushi rice wrapped with a strip of seaweed and topped with soft ingredients), and "nigiri sushi" (hand shaped sushi). With a little practice, you will soon be making sushi like a pro. Toppings include the famous raw fish often seen with sushi, but also vegetables, meat, and other ingredients, so everyone can find something tasty to eat.

title: 6 Day Springtime Cherry Blossom and Sightseeing Journey from Tokyo to Osaka
description:
Explore Japan when the beautiful cherry blossoms color the land. Visit familiar spots across Japan in this seasonal tour for a memorable spring vacation.
Choose from two departure dates:

1. March Departure - March 25th to March 30th
2. April Departure - April 1st to April 6th

title: Chartered Convertible Yellow Cab Sightseeing Tour in Tokyo
description: Cruise through the busy streets of Tokyo on a chic, open-top yellow taxi. Customize your course and stops for an unforgettable sightseeing experience during your stay.

title: Mt. Fuji Autumn Foliage Viewing Tour from Tokyo with English-speaking Guide
description:
Visit three famous autumn leaf viewing spots at the foot of Mt. Fuji. Explore the Maple Corridor, Mt. Kachi Kachi Ropeway, and a charming thatched roof village by bus.
The contrast of the fall foliage with Mt. Fuji in the background can only be experienced in this season! Walk through the 150 m tunnel of maples known as Lake Kawaguchi's maple corridor with Mt. Fuji in the background. Glide above the trees and see the autumn leaves of Lake Kawaguchi and Mt. Fuji from the Mt. Kachi Kachi Ropeway. Enjoy untouched Japanese scenery at the thatched roof village which features a view of Mt. Fuji.

title: Simple Japanese Kintsugi Gold Repair Technique Class near Shin Koenji
description:
Kintsugi is the Japanese art of fixing broken pottery using lacquer dusted or mixed with powdered gold. Create beauty out of breakages, and enjoy a truly unique work of art.
Learn the basics of kintsugi and make simple repairs to a broken piece of pottery. At the end of the class, you get to keep your own work of art. Keep it as a souvenir of your trip to Japan, or present it as a gift to a friend or loved one.

title: Weekend Edo Oiran Style Cabaret Show at Kaguwa in Roppongi
description:
Take a trip back in time this weekend and catch a fabulous cabaret show that brings old Edo to life. Performers become graceful Oiran, dancing and soaring on stage!
Bring the fantastic nightlife of 17th century Edo to modern Tokyo as you watch this colorful Oiran show! No matter if it's your first time or tenth time to Japan, this show is sure to dazzle and astound you. Dancers leap, spin, and soar on the latest and greatest theater stage, creating a one of a kind extravaganza you have to see.

title: Yakatabune Houseboat Cruising Around Otaru Port (April-Oct)
description: Take a cruise around the shores of Otaru on a classic houseboat. Spend a relaxing time with friends and family on the boat while enjoying the view of the city and the waters.

title: Private Half or Full Day Sightseeing Taxi Tour in Otaru
description: No matter the time of day, enjoy a private tour. See the sights from Mt. Tengu with one of the three most beautiful night views in Hokkaido or visit glass and music box shops.

title: Guided Shiretoko Goko Lake Walking Tour (May~October)
description:
Set off on a beautiful walking tour of the five lakes of Shiretoko Goko. Join an experienced and licensed guide through untouched forest, towering mountain peaks and shimmering lakes.
Get in touch with nature on a gentle 3 kilometer trekking tour of the Shiretoko Goko Lakes! Led by an experienced and passionate guide, this is your chance to see the stunning beauty of spring, summer, or early autumn in Hokkaido's true wilderness. With forests, mountains, and lakes that have never seen the touch of human construction, Japan's natural beauty shines.

title: One Day Fuji Tour by Bullet Train from Osaka (Ends in Tokyo)
description:
This one day tour from Osaka by bullet train will whisk you to see Shizuoka and Mt. Fuji! Get views of the mountain over tea fields, visit spots on the Tokaido Road and enjoy a fresh sushi lunch!
Perfect for visitors looking to get from Osaka to Tokyo on a budget, and are interested in visiting iconic Mt. Fuji!

title: Half and Full Day Mountain Biking Tour in Hakuba
description: Enjoy cycling surrounded by Hakuba's natural beauty on a cycling tour led by an experienced instructor. This is a great way to experience the seasonal beauty of this mountain resort area.

title: Private Taxi Tour of Hakodate's Top Sightseeing Spots
description:
See the Trappistine Convent, Goryoukaku Park, Kanamori Warehouse, the old Public Hall or pretty churches in Motomachi on this private charter tour of Hakodate.
Enjoy visiting the best sights of Hakodate at your own pace, a great way for groups and families to sightsee in comfort and style.

title: Private Guided Tour of the Kushiro Marsh
description: Leisurely stroll through the marshlands of Kushiro and explore the seasonal flowers and birds you can only see here. Have your local guide take you to beautiful and picture perfect locations.

title: Beginner Friendly River Rafting Experience in Minakami
description: Cruise down the river in Minakami to enjoy the cool breeze and the fresh water. Learn to safely drift down on a raft with your team! Rafters of all levels are welcome.

title: Full Day River Rafting & Shower Climbing Combo Tour in Minakami
description: Hop on the raft and head down the Tone River for a fun and adventurous morning, then follow it up with a gentle shower climbing afternoon, filled with natural water slides.

title: Izu Hakone Bus Pass and Jikkoku Mountain Pass Cable Car Value Ticket
description:
This special combo ticket includes unlimited bus rides and a cable car ride to the Jikkoku Mountain Pass, that boasts greats view of Mt. Fuji!
The ticket includes an all-day free ticket for Izu Hakone bus routes between Atami Station and Jikkoku Mountain Pass, as well as a Special Mt. Fuji View Ticket for the Jikkoku Cable Car.

title: Half Day Long Kushiro River Canoeing Tour to Lake Touro from Kushiro city
description: Start from the Gojikkoku Canoe Port on the middle stretch of the Kushiro River and enjoy the quiet Hokkaido scenery on a fun 20 km long tour.

title: Half Day Athletic Canyoning Nature Trip in Minakami
description: Experience an exciting outdoor adventure as you climb and slide down either the Higashi Kurosawa Hanage falls or the Oosawa Maple falls in Minakami!

title: Mt. Asahi and Susoaidaira Flower Trekking Tour with Guide
description: The vast open field, Susoaidaira, is on the north side of Mt. Asahi. Flowers cover the vast field and sway like the ocean waves, for a unique sight.

title: Mt. Tosshou Flower Viewing and Nature Trek with Guide
description: Mt.Tosshou is one of the most famous places for dogtooth violet, and also a great place to observe spring plants as they blossom in Hokkaido.

title: Beginner-Friendly Stream Trout Fishing in Furano
description: Whether a beginner or experienced angler, you can enjoy fishing for rainbow or candy trout in the clear streams of Furano. Have fun in the great outdoors with convenient hotel transfers.

title: Afternoon Walking Nature around Lake Akan with an English-Speaking Guide
description: Take a leisurely trek around clear Lake Akan with a knowledgeable guide. Explore the lush forests of Hokkaido and learn about the history and the ecosystem of this wild, remote part of Japan.

title: Casual Japanese Cooking Class with English Guide in Osaka
description:
Get cooking and make hand-rolled sushi, tempura, or Osaka's famous okonomiyaki. After lunch, enjoy chatting while learning how to fold origami over coffee.
Join us for a friendly homemade taste of of real Japanese cooking, cooked in a local home. It's the next best thing to having your own Japanese mom!

title: Full Day Guided Forest Walking Hiking Tours of Yakushima Island
description: Discover the natural beauty of the forests and the majestic wild animals of Yakushima on a number of courses. Keep your eyes open for the fluffy native deer or the Yaku Saru monkeys.

title: Private Escorted Taxi Service from Kyoto Hotels to Kansai Airport
description: English-speaking staff will meet you at your hotel in Kyoto and escort you to Kansai Airport in a private taxi for a smooth and hassle free transfer.

title: Kushiro Historical Sightseeing Private Taxi Tour (3 hours)
description:
Step back into the history of Kushiro, and learn about the pioneering spirit and culture of this lush area of Hokkaido! Great for small groups and families.
Enjoy a privately chartered tour to the best historical sights in Kushiro.

title: Kushiro Shitsugen Private Sightseeing Taxi Tour (1.5 hours)
description:
Visit a couple of the major sights in Kushiro Shitsugen with this private charter tour, perfect for small groups and families. Enjoy the charm of rural Hokkaido!
Make a quick visit to Kushiro Shitsugen National Park, for a taste of the stunning natural beauty of Hokkaido!

title: Private Charter Taxi Tour of Asahikawa Zoo or Furano from Sapporo
description: See the sights you want on this private tour to Asahikawa Zoo or Furano, perfect for groups or visitors with limited time. Make the most of your time in Hokkaido!

title: Guided Biei and Shirogane Nature Walk
description: Enjoy a personally customized nature walk through the beautiful Biei and Shirogane areas, complete with a knowledgeable guide to the region.

title: Mt. Ashibetsu Guided Mountain Climbing Tour
description: Climb Mt. Ashibetsu in the Yubari Mountains during summer. We adjust the course to suit your needs, letting you make the most of Hokkaido!

title: Summer Kitataisetsu Mountain Climbing Tour
description: Head for the northern peaks of the Taisetsu range and climb through areas filled with alpine blooms during the gentle heat of Hokkaido's summer.

title: Family Rafting Adventure Tour in Furano
description: Enjoy a wet and wild family day of rafting, great for playing in the river, paddling, and creating unforgettable memories all together on a family trip.

title: Rokkosan Snow Park One Day Tour from Osaka
description:
Ski and snowboard to your heart's content, or simply rumble and tumble in the snow! Relax in a luxurious hot spring bath that will melt the cold away. Enjoy all the fun winter in Japan can offer!
Whether you are skilled at winter sports or not, Rokkosan Snow Park has a lot to offer! You can ski or snowboard with your family and friends, or ride a sled down snowy slopes.

Don't have the right gear or apparel? No problem! You can rent winter sportswear and equipment at the park for a small fee.

On top of that, the tour also gives you the option to enjoy a good soak at Arima Hot Spring as well as savor a warm meal -- the perfect combination after hours of playing in the snow!

title: Private Taxi Tour to Akkeshi from Kushiro
description: See the Kushiro Marsh and visit Akkeshi to sample the famous local seafood and fresh oysters on this private chartered tour from Kushiro.

title: Kushiro Port and Fish Market Private Taxi Tour
description:
Coming into Kushiro Port? Why not see some of the best sights in Kushiro and shopping at the market? This two hour chartered tour is great for small groups!
This two hour chartered tour will take you to the Nusamai Bridge, MOO (fisherman's wharf), Port Market and Washo Market.

title: Mt. Aka and Koizumidaira Trekking Tour with Flower Viewing
description: Mt. Aka boasts a wide variety of alpine flowers that bloom all at once. Enjoy a wonderland of flowers on a guided nature hike of Hokkaido!

title: Guided Mountain Climbing Tour from  Kougen Onsen
description: Enjoy trekking through a variety of colors as summer brings alpine flowers into full bloom. From wetlands to craggy rocks, the beauty of Hokkaido is waiting for you.

title: One Day Shirogane Onsen Mountain Climbing Tour in Summer
description: Enjoy an outdoor trek near a town famous for the natural hot springs. After the hike up and back, make sure to stop for a hot soak and relax!

title: Family Friendly Jozankei Canoe Experience in Toyohira River
description:
Cruise down the river with your friends and family as you enjoy the panoramic scenery of the lush green forests. Relax and paddle through the calm waters of Hokkaido.
You may board your own canoe with your dog or cat.

title: Sapporo Area Road Bike Tour from Ainosato Koen Station
description: Set out from northern Sapporo on a back road cycling tour that offers views of the stunning outdoor beauty of Hokkaido while still being close to the city.

title: Okurayama and Hitsujigaoka Hill Morning Tour (with Multilingual Audio Guide)
description:
Get lovely views of Sapporo during this quick tour that covers Okurayama Ski Jump Site and Hitsujigaoka Observation Deck. Discover the beauty of Sapporo in this tour!
Make your way to the Okurayama Ski Jump Site where you will take the lift to the top at 300m. The magnificent view of Ishikara Plains and Sapporo City from the top will certainly take your breath away! Also, try the ski jump simulator machine in the Winter Sports Museum for a realistic experience of a professional ski jumper!

Next, enjoy a peaceful morning at Hitsujigaoka Observation Deck looking at sheep grazing in the grass and the statue of Doctor Clark standing tall in the lush green.

Don't hesitate to sign up for this quick tour to enrich your morning in Sapporo!

title: Shin Chitose Area Road Bike Cycling Tour from Sapporo
description: See the Chitose countryside on a fun and nature filled cycling tour with convenient transportation to and from Sapporo City and Shin Chitose Airport!

title: Mountain Bike Cycling Tour of Lake Shikotsu from Sapporo
description: Pedal your way from Kyukamura to Lake Morappu, or from Chitose to Lake Shikotsu, as you explore Hokkaido. Pick-up from Sapporo is included, making this active tour easy to join.

title: Desert Island Beach Getaway to Kerama's Nagannu Island from Naha
description:
Come enjoy the solitude of the white beaches of Nagannu Island. Get away from the world on this desert island, to swim with the fish in the clear waters or just relax on the pristine sand.
Just 20 minutes by boat from Naha, the emerald waters and pristine white sand of this island are a refuge from the world. See the sea turtles and rare sea birds who make Nagannu their home. With bathrooms, showers and a few shops, you can spend all day relaxing in this paradisaical locale.

Join water sports like wakeboarding and dragon boat rides! You can even try snorkeling.

title: Clear Kayak and Snorkeling Adventure on Minnajima Island from Motobu
description:
Hop in a clear-bottom kayak to feel the refreshing breeze as you paddle across the clear waters of Okinawa. Enjoy getting up close to the colorful fish and corals while snorkeling too!
You can choose either the one-day course (about 6 hours) or the half-day course (about 4 hours) for the same price.

Time schedule
 One-day course - 9:00 to 15:00, 10:00 to 16:00
 Half-day course - 9:00 to 13:00, 13:00 to 16:00

title: Special Chartered Kayak and Blue Cave Snorkeling Tour from Onna
description: Enjoy the tropical ocean of Okinawa in a privately guided tour. The instructor can teach children and beginners, making this a family friendly chance to swim!

title: Mikado Emperor Dress up Plan for Men in Kyoto
description:
Experience wearing a haori and hakama, which are traditional formal garments for men. Dress yourself up and take photos as a memory of Kyoto.
Picture taking in the studio is available for an additional fee. You can also add an optional outdoor stroll with other participants in the Maiko and Geisha plan as well.

title: Kyoto Morning Sightseeing and Afternoon Craft Tour
description:
See Nijo Castle, the Imperial Palace and Kinkakuji Temple during the morning tour. Then try your hand at Japanese crafts at the Kyoto Handicraft Center, to experience Kyoto's traditions first hand.
Get to know Kyoto, the ancient capital of Japan. With visits to important historical sights along with a traditional crafting experience, this is a great tour for kids and adults alike.

Visit Nijo Castle and the gleaming Kinkakuji Temple (also known as the Golden Pavilion), both lovely UNESCO World Heritage Sites. On weekdays stroll through Kyoto's Imperial Palace, which was home to the Emperor of Japan until 1869. On weekends stop by Kitano Tenmangu Shrine, dedicated to the God of Scholarship.

After lunch enjoy trying different Japanese crafts at the Kyoto Handicraft Center!

title: Visit a Japanese-Style Paper Umbrella Workshop and Make Your Own Mini Umbrella
description:
Learn about the process of making a beautiful Kyoto-style umbrella from craftsmen at Hiyoshiya, a workshop which has existed for over 100 years, then create your own mini paper umbrella too!
Japanese umbrellas are traditionally made of bamboo and specially-treated paper. Each can take a few weeks to months to create, and are used as dramatic accessories, decoration or even in kabuki plays!

title: Shower Climbing Adventure Just 40 Minutes from Kyoto
description:
Go canyoning and get in touch with nature just a short train ride away from Kyoto! Climb up waterfalls, jump off rocks or slide down into the river. Enjoy this great adrenaline rush!
Join your experienced guides for a a day of climbing, swimming, diving and water sliding! This is an amateur course, so don't worry about not having any prior canyoning experience.

Enjoy views of waterfalls from above, below and within, experiencing nature in a whole new way. The highest dive is 7 meters, and the longest slide is also 7 meters (subject to change according to the amount of accumulated water)

After an active day of canyoning, you can relax at our home base with music, videos and books.

title: Samurai Dress-up Plan for Children in Kyoto
description:
Create an unforgettable memory for your child by dressing him up and make him feel like a real Japanese samurai. Make sure to take photos of this memorable moment.
For an additional fee, shoot 8 professional photos including three 2L-size photos and a photo card.

title: Half-Day Nature Yoga Lessons in Toyama
description: Revitalize the balance of your body and soul. Relax your body as you take in the power of your  environment. Concentrate on your movements in your yoga class.

title: Lake Tazawa and Nyuto Hot Spring Sightseeing Taxi Tour from Tazawako Station
description: From the banks of deep Lake Tazawa and across the highlands, head to serene Nyuto Hot Springs on a gentle and relaxing sightseeing tour.

title: One Day Mt. Rishiri Guided Summer Climbing and Hiking Tour
description: Climb Mt. Rishiri in the Rishiri Rebun Sarobetsu National Park and enjoy the cooler Hokkaido summer as you enjoy a full day of hiking and climbing.

title: Traditional Soba Noodle Making Experience in Echizen
description: Learn how to make wonderfully chewy noodles in Echizen, the heart of soba country! Beginners and children welcome, have fun making the yummy nooodles from scratch.

title: Half Day River Rafting Adventure in Nagatoro
description: Surround yourself in the beautiful wildlife of Nagatoro  as you hop on a boat and go downstream! Enjoy ripping through the refreshing rapids with your team!

title: One Day Naruto and Seto Inland Sea Kayak & Bike Tour
description: Explore Naruto by sea and land on this fun kayak and biking tour. Get great views of the Seto Inland Sea, and see the charm of rural Shikoku.

title: Full Day Chartered Sightseeing Taxi Tour to Lake Tazawa and Tamagawa
description: Relax in a comfortable taxi as you head to Tamagawa Onsen, a popular hot spring with steaming waters, or check out the many colored waters of Lake Tazawa.

title: White Water River Rafting Adventure in Toyama
description: Splash through the rapids as you work with your team to conquer the fresh water going against you. Rafters of all levels can enjoy this thrilling adventure.

title: Half Day Boat Snorkeling At the Mysterious Blue Grotto on Irabu Island
description: Explore the mysterious Blue Grotto, a popular spot only 10 minutes from the port with fun snorkeling inside the cave and at nearby coral reefs.

title: Sightseeing Taxi Tour to Kakunodate Samurai Street from Tazawako Station
description: Discover the historic samurai residences of Kakunodate on a relaxing chartered full-day taxi tour. Stop by for some famed Inaniwa udon noodles conveniently from the Tazawa area.

title: Half Day Sightseeing Taxi to Lake Tazawa and Kakunodate from Tazawako Station
description: Set out on a short excursion on a relaxing taxi tour around Lake Tazawa and the scenic Dakigaeri Valley. Spot the magnificent red torii gate by the lake along with the samurai houses in Kakunodate.

title: Chartered Autumn Sightseeing Taxi in Chichibu
description: Visit Chichibu to see colored leaves in autumn. Beautiful scenery with reds and yellows. Sightseeing taxi for family, friends, and solo travelers.

title: Full-Day Tanabe and Koyasan Tour on a Private Taxi from Shirahama
description: Spend an entire day witnessing the seasonal mountain scenery as you make a journey toward the lush forests of Koyasan on the Skyline Road from a chartered taxi.

title: Fresh Fruit Picking and Tasting Experience in Saga City
description: Experience an Autumn harvest and indulge the juicy fruit straight off the branch. Select from either grapes, blueberries or mandarin oranges according to the season.

title: Overnight Hiroshima Tour from Kyoto with Return Train to Osaka
description:
Head out from Kyoto on a tour around popular sightseeing spots in Hiroshima, Miyajima and Kurashiki before returning to Osaka to continue your journey.
Depart from quiet Kyoto as you head out to visit the World Heritage Sites Miyajima, Itsukushimajinja Shrine, Hiroshima, and the Atomic Bomb Dome on the first day of your tour. Then, on the second day, stop at the popular Kurashiki and Okayama Korakuen, one of the three most beautiful gardens in Japan, a sterling example of the precepts of Japanese garden design.
Finish your tour in Osaka, Western Japan's bustling hub of activity!

title: Private Full Day Sightseeing Taxi to Yoichi and Shakotan from Otaru
description: In Yoichi, there is Nikka Whisky Distillery, with exclusive tastings. You can enjoy strolling undersea from Bikuni Fishing Port on New Shakotan, the undersea observation boat.

title: Afternoon Cattle Barn Walking Tour at Koiwai Farm in Iwate with Ticket
description: Say hello to the 300 cows living within the massive fields of Koiwai farm. Tour around the facilities where the cows are kept and discover the history of dairy products within Japan.

title: Grape Picking Entry Ticket in Okazaki
description:
Spend time at the vineyards of Okazaki Komadachi Grape Farm to experience picking and tasting the mouth watering grapes of the season while enjoying outdoor activities.
Please stop by the information booth to find out which vineyard is the best of the day.

Facilities and Vineyards
- Yamaoka Park
Vineyards, BBQ, swing, seesaw, river, table tennis.
- Marukyo Park
Vineyards, Heidi's Forest, table tennis, seesaw, swing, carts for infants.
- Jo Park
Vineyards, BBQ, outdoor obstacles, mountain path, observatory, table tennis, goldfish scooping.
- Maruta Park
Vineyards, BBQ, pool, fishing pond, outdoor obstacles, dream car, golf-like game.
- Koh Park
Vineyards, BBQ, foot relaxation, pool.
- Yamasa Park
Vineyards, BBQ, cart, river, play equipment, insect catching.
- Shiba Park
Vineyards, BBQ, play equipment, target shooting, ring tossing, animals, river fishing.

Please call the Okazaki Komadachi Grape Farm to book barbecue after applying.

title: Full-Day Taxi Tour of Kita no Kuni Kara Drama Locations in Furano
description: Visit various locations where the famous Japanese drama, Kita no Kuni Kara was filmed in Furano. Great for fans to reenact the scenes from the show.

title: Half Day Enoshima Cruise Excursion from Hayama
description: Climb aboard and enjoy the sea breeze as you cruise around Enoshima. Check out the classic light house and the gorgeous natural beaches and sea cliffs.

title: Private Chartered Taxi Tour Around Otaru, Sapporo, or Shakotan Areas
description: Let us whisk you to your choice of Sapporo, Otaru, or Shakotan, and enjoy the sights as an experienced driver safely and comfortably handles transportation.

title: Entrance Ticket for Shichiku Garden in Obihiro
description:
Breathe in the scent of the bright seasonal flowers, and stroll under the trees in this romantic garden. From spring to autumn, this is a must-see among Obihiro's famous gardens and parks.
From spring tulips to summer wildflowers, and then the beautiful red leaves of autumn, enjoy the beauty of Hokkaido's bountiful nature at this charming park.

title: Full Day Nature Discovery on a Private Taxi in Tokachi
description: Hop on a taxi and enjoy the  scenery of Lake Onneto and Lake Ashoro in the Akan National Park. Spend a day exploring one of the best natural sites of Japan.

title: Join an English Speaking Guide on a Full Day Walking Tour of Osaka
description:
Get a feel for Osaka with a day exploring one of Japan's ancient capitals! See the city from the air, the ground, and one of its famous waterways on this full day tour.
From 683 to 745, Osaka was the capital of Japan, and even after the capital moved it still remained an important hub for land, sea, and river-canal transportation. Visit Osaka Castle and the surrounding Nishinomaru Garden, graced by over 4,000 cherry trees and a must-see in spring. Next up, go modern with the stunning 360-degree views of the city and surrounding areas from the Aerial Garden Observatory, over 165 meters above ground! Relax on a river cruise, passing Osaka Castle, Twin Towers, Nakanoshima Island, and much more, as you get a look at every side of this unique city.

title: Full-Day Retro Walking Tour with Canal Cruise in Otaru
description: Walk through the port city of Otaru, lined with historical buildings and Victorian street lamps. Take a relaxing cruise down the canal as you discover the city with your guide.

title: Private Charter Sightseeing Tour of Sapporo
description: See Sapporo your way with these private tours! Get picked up at your hotel, and whisked off to see the best sights. Heading to the airport? Do a bit of sightseeing before your flight from Shin Chitose

title: Water Cycle and Life Special Guided Eco Tour in Niseko
description:
From reservoirs to faucets water is part of out everyday life. Learn about the cycle of water in Hokkaido while tasting different fresh spring waters.
Discover the culture, history, and the natural environment during your stay in Hokkaido. An Eco Tour is a customized tour with a collection of hand selected activities by the local guides and staff for a great learning experience.

Detailed contents of the tour will be decided after your reservation is made. English speaking staff will be available to assist you when preparing your itinerary.

title: Snorkeling and Diving on the North Side of Okinawa with Departure from Motobu
description: Enjoy both snorkeling & diving in the tropical waters to the north of Okinawa's main island. You can have fun on land with a special ticket to the Churaumi Aquarium too!

title: Hand Dye Traditional Okinawan Cup Coasters
description: Experience hand dying traditional Okinawan cup coasters for you to take home as a souvenir. Learn to paint using techniques from the 15th century Ryukyu Kingdom.

title: Experienced Diving Course in the Sea of Kerama from Naha
description:
Enjoy a day out in one of the most beautiful seas of Okinawa. Take a boat out from the port of Naha and sail out to explore the incredible underwater life.
The 3 points in our schedule are Zamami island, Kuro island, Tokashiki island, and Gishibu island. In the morning you can enjoy snorkeling and have a lunch break on the boat. In the afternoon, you can either enjoy snorkeling again at another point, or an option of diving is available for 5,000 JPY.

title: Humpback Whale Watching Cruise from Naha (December - April)
description:
Search for and get close to pods of humpback whales that winter and rear their young in the warm waters of the Okinawan ocean from the end of December to early April.
Set sail with a well informed guide on a stable catamaran in search of majestic humpback whales in the warm waters off Okinawa. The whales spend the cold winter in the tropics to raise young calves and enjoy playing, breaching, and tail slapping right before your eyes! Get up close and personal with some of the world's largest mammals.

With a guaranteed refund if you are not able to see whales, this is the best tour to get up close and personal with these majestic mammals!

title: Northern Okinawa Full Day Taxi Charter Tour with Naha Airport or Hotel Service
description:
Explore northern Okinawa on your own terms with this custom charter tour. Visit the famous Churaumi Aquarium, Nago Pineapple Park and other fun sights! 
Northern Okinawa is home to some of the island's most popular attractions. First and foremost is the Churaumi Aquarium, one of the largest in the world. Other sights are the Nago Pineapple Park (where you can eat as much pineapple as you like) and the 14th century Nakijin Castle. Walk through the sub-tropical jungle plants of Nago Paradise or try your hand at making Ryukyu glass at Glass no Mori. Other options include the Bios Hill nature park, cultural attractions of Ryukyu Village or the stunning South East Botanical Gardens. Let your driver whisk you effortlessly to all these sights!

title: Snorkeling Trip to Okinawa's Blue Cave from Cape Maeda
description:
Enjoy snorkeling in Okinawa's Blue Cave. Explore the rocky landscape, see tropical fish all around you and take in the beautiful way the light hits the surface of the cave's blue waters.

Conveniently located in Onna. Pick-ups may be available. Free parking available.

title: Underwater Trial Diving and Snorkeling Experience in Minnajima Island
description: Take a 15-minute boat ride right out of Naha to explore the world under the sea with tropical fish and colorful coral. Let your helpful instructor guide you around the waters of Okinawa.

title: Traditional Okinawan Dinner Show at Yotsutake in Naha
description: Discover the charms of the Ryukyu Kingdom and watch a fantastic music and dance performance at the Yotsutake theatre! You can then enjoy a course meal of healthy and traditional dishes.

title: Sanshin (Okinawan Banjo) Music Lesson and Cooking Class at a Local Home in Nago
description: Experience the heart of Okinawa with this full day sanshin (Okinawan banjo) lesson, followed with a tasty meal of your very own soba noodles and Okinawan doughnuts!

title: Blue Cave Diving and Marine Walk Combination Tour from Onna
description:
Explore the world under the waves in two ways! The bright light of the Blue Cave makes for wonderful diving, and a relaxing marine walk offers open views.
This tour includes everything you need for a marine walk, diving in the Blue Cave, food to feed cute tropical fish, a waterproof camera to capture unique memories, and much more. Enjoy a a great family friendly tour and check out the beauty of Okinawa for yourself.

title: Sesoko Island Boat Tour and Banana Boat Ride from Onna
description:
Head for Sesoko Island for an unforgettable boat tour and snorkeling trip. Have fun with coral reefs, pristine beaches, and a banana boat ride.
Hop aboard a speed boat for a small group tour of the idyllic Sesoko Island and tour of divine snorkeling points. Okinawa's warm waters teem with vibrant and colorful aquatic life that you can see swimming before your own eyes. The banana boat ride will have you feeling as if you are flying over the waves after playing on the white sandy beaches.

Private charters are also available, for unforgettable experiences with friends or family.

title: Blue Cave Snorkeling Tour from Onna
description:
Snorkel in the Blue Cave, where the sun and sea combine to make the water glitter like crystal. The calm waters are perfect for families, children, and beginners.
Jump in with a family friend snorkel adventure. Gentle waters detailed instructions from caring guides means children as young as 5 can join! The oceans around Onna are filled with coral reefs and brightly colored tropical fish swarm in playful droves, creating unique and colorful scenes that will leave memories lasting a lifetime.

title: Okinawa Highlights Bus Tour and Dinner Show at Urashima
description:
Enjoy the best of Okinawa! See Churaumi Aquarium, Kouri Island and Ryukyu Village, before heading to dinner show featuring traditional Ryukyu dances.
Experience the best sights of Okinawa and enjoy an evening of entertainment and local cuisine! Visit the famous Churaumi Aquarium, home to gigantic whale sharks, families of elegant manta rays and thousands of different species of marine life. Gaze over the Kouri Island Bridge, which stretches over the bright azure ocean of Okinawa. Then dive into the traditional side of Okinawa at Ryukyu Mura Village, and learn more about the unique Ryukyu culture. Settle in for dinner and a traditional dance show at Urashima, for a taste of local cuisine and elegant Ryukyu dances.

title: Okinawa Private Trial Diving Tour from Onna
description: Go on your first diving adventure and jump into the waters of Okinawa! See a world like no other as you swim with marine life. Let your instructor guide you as you dive into a whole new experience.

title: Hoverboarding Experience and Marine Activities in Sesokojima Island
description: Jet across the clear waters of Sesokojima Island on a hoverboard. Beginners and advanced boarders are welcome to join and enjoy snorkeling, parasailing and other fun marine activities.

title: Leather Work Experience and Ticket to Okinawa World Set
description: At Okinawa World you can experience the culture and history in Okinawa. Check out the Eisa show and limestone cave. Then make your own cute leather-work souvenir. Great for kids!

title: One Hour Mangrove Forest Promenade Guided Trekking Tour from Highashison
description: Join a guided walking tour on a promenade observing the mangrove forest and creatures. Children as young as 3 can join this fun and informative outdoor activity.

title: Sunset Sea Kayak Cruise from Yomitan
description: Slowly row your kayak into the sunset as you paddle through the sea of Okinawa. Witness the breathtaking scenery of the sun setting into the horizon for an unforgettable experience

title: Traditional Okinawan Bingata Dyeing Class in Naha
description: Recreate the delicate and colorful patterns of traditional Okinawa art in this fun experience! Great for kids and groups. Take a home a unique souvenir.

title: Family-Friendly Underwater Seawalk Half Day Tour from Onna
description:
Explore the tropical waters of Okinawa from under the waves in this Mermaid Seawalk tour. The special helmet makes it easy to join, even for children.
Have fun under the waves and feel like a mermaid as you get the fish eye view of the sea. Schools of tropical fish dart around in bright flashes as you walk along the bottom of the water! Uniquely wide viewing helmets let you get amazing views, and the simple gear means children eight years old and up can join in. Since you are walking, you can see the lively tropical fish even if you can not swim.

title: Southern Okinawa Half-Day Private Charter Tour from Naha
description:
Ideal for groups, relax as your driver escorts you to all the best cultural and historical sights of southern Okinawa. Choose from 3 different courses!
Southern Okinawa is a rural delight, with a variety of exciting sights.

Check out the cultural displays and Gyukusendo Cave at Okinawa World, watch traditional Okinawan dances (called udoi) or ride a glass boat and see tropical fish from Mibaru beach. Important historical locations, like the Himeyuri Monument and the Okinawa Peace Memorial Museum are also on route.

No need to worry about getting lost, as your driver will take you to each of your desired locations. Go at your own pace, and enjoy all that Okinawa has to offer.

title: Special 10 Course Kaiseki Dinner in Kyoto's Gion District
description:
Enjoy an authentic and delicious 10-course dinner in Kyoto. First explore the Shirakawa river and make your way through the traditional geisha district of Gion. Then enjoy your traditional meal. 
Explore the Shirakawa River and Gion district at night just before enjoying a grand, 10-course meal prepared especially for this tour. Take the chance to see the beautiful scenery of the river, the historic geisha district and to enjoy the delicious Kyoto-style cuisine.

title: Half-Day Decorative Sushi Making Course in Kyoto
description: Experience making your very own sushi from the rice and arrange it to make a delicious lunch. Beginners are welcome to try making their own nigiri, rolls and other regional sushi.

title: Half Day Traditional Furoshiki Wrapping Cloth Lesson with Souvenir in Kyoto
description: Learn how to use a traditional Furoshiki, a handy cloth for wrapping a variety of items in an environmentally friendly manner. Take a cloth home with you after the lesson.

title: Kimono Rental and Dress-up Experience in Kyoto
description: Select from a great variety of traditional kimonos and garments for both ladies and gentlemen and experience walking around the ancient city of Kyoto.

title: Shabutsu Buddhist Image Copying at Bishamondo Shourinji Temple in Kyoto
description:
Take home the peacefulness of Kyoto when you practice shabutsu at Shourinji Temple. Tracing the picture of a Buddha is said to help you meditate and bring enlightenment.
Shabutsu is the practice of copying Buddhist images by hand, once used to spread the teachings before the printing press. Copying these images is now a form of meditation, to clear the mind and focus on beauty. Trace over the lines within the quiet tatami halls and garden-facing porches of the temple, guided by the monks of Shourinji Temple. The temple was built in 1550, and the Heian-era statue of Bishamonten which graces the altar was originally found hidden in the ceiling of Tofukuji Temple.

title: Churaumi Aquarium and Dai Sekirinzan Park Hiking Tour from Naha
description: Trek up the scenic Dai Sekirinzan Park to witness the massive lava blocks and tropical jungle. Tour around Hedo Cape and Churaumi Aquarium, all with a convenient multilingual audio guide.

title: Beginner Friendly Introductory Surfing Lesson from Onna
description: Experience your first surfing lesson in the refreshing beach of Okinawa. Let your helpful instructor teach you the basics to master paddling and eventually ride the waves.

title: Full Day Minnajima Island Adventure and Marine Activity Tour from Motobu
description: Make way to the crescent-shaped Minnajima floating off the Motobu Peininsula for a day of swimming, marine sports, sandy beaches and an included lunch.

title: Okinawa Mermaid Makeover and Photo Shoot in Onna
description:
Trade your legs for a colorful tail and unleash your inner mermaid! Adorn your hair with fancy accessories and get all glammed up for a photo session at the beach.  Children's sizes also available.
There's a mermaid in all of us, and this activity takes you to a private beach and lets you turn your long-time dream into reality. Choose from a variety of vibrant colors and put on a tail that best suits your personality. Complete the look with colorful accessories and you're all good to go! 

This activity can be enjoyed with friends or family. Children ages 4 and up can also participate. We also recommend this one-of-a-kind experience to expecting mothers who want to make their maternity photos extra special.

title: Sesokojima Island Parasailing and Marine Adventure
description: Fly in the sky while parasailing into the beautiful scenery of Okinawa. Enjoy the view of the beaches and island, then spend time having fun banana boating, snorkeling and more!

title: Manza Cape Sightseeing from Banana Boat with Departure from Onna
description: Slip and slide through the spectacular view of the famous Manza Cape that people normally don't see! Anyone can take a thrilling ride on the banana boat!

title: Ocean Parasailing from Motobu Port
description:
Check out the shimmering seas of Okinawa from a bird's eye view while parasailing. Perfect for family, friends, and children, this is an all-ages tour.
Cruise out over the waters and then begin to lift off into the air behind a powerful boat. You will get amazing bird's eye views of the shining blue waters of Okinawa as you glide high above the waves! Parasailing is great for families, letting children ride with adults, and it makes an exciting addition to any solo or group trip. Located near the Churaumi Aquarium, you can easily add parasailing to the day's plan.

title: Snorkel All Day at Three Points in the Kerama Islands with Departure from Naha
description:
Jump on in to clear blue waters as you, the guide, and your friends swim, meet cute tropical fish, and see lively coral reefs. Perfect for all ages, and even dogs!
Just 40 km from Naha, this group of 20 small islands has some of the clearest diving spots in the world. Explore the underwater beauty of Okinawa, and check out the turquoise waters around Sea Turtle Island. Snorkel at three gorgeous and clear spots chosen from among Zamamijima (surrounded by lovely coral reefs), Kurojima, the emerald waters of Tokashikijima or Gishippu Island, famous for its turtles. The same boat will be shared by divers and snorkelers, so whether above or below the water, you can enjoy nature!

title: Private English Scuba Diving Tour in the Blue Cave
description:
Always wanted to try diving? This is your chance! Learn the basics of scuba diving in the magical Blue Cave, and enjoy the sea life and ocean scenery.
Appropriate for beginner divers, the instructors or certified divers will be right by your side to make sure you can explore the glowing Blue Cave in safety. From kids to senior guests, anyone can enjoy this diving experience!

See the ocean as you never have before, in one of only two natural blue caves in the world. The light reflects off the walls, creating a mystical aura of blue light.

Get to know Okinawa's colorful sea life, among the coral and schools of tropical fish. With a free photo service and fish feeding included, make this one of your fondest memories of the beautiful island.

title: Churaumi Aquarium and Sightseeing Bus Tour (from Naha, Ginowan, Chatan and Onna)
description:
Hop aboard a full day bus tour that takes you to four of Okinawa's most popular destinations, including three hours at the famous Churaumi Aquarium. Easy pick-up and English audio guides included.
With a convenient pick-up and drop-off at a large number of hotels, as well as audio guides in English, Chinese and Korean, this is a hassle-free way to check out some of Okinawa's best sights.

Visit the Churaumi Aquarium, one of the largest in the world. Watch as giant whale sharks swim right past you, and see 20,000 different types of fish and a coral nursery. Next is Nago Pineapple Park, where you can sample the sweet fruit. Also known as Butterly Paradise, has thousands of tropical flowers, as well as a butterfly park filled with tree nymph butterflies.

title: Raden Mother of Pearl Decoration Art Lesson in Kyoto
description: Attach thin sheets of mother-of-pearl to gorgeous lacquer goods and create an original work combining classic art and styles with modern design.

title: Koto Music Lesson For All Ages in Kyoto
description: Join in and learn the basics of playing the traditional Japanese koto (13-stringed zither). Open to solo travelers and groups, pluck the strings and learn to play the folk tune 'Sakura'.

title: Half Day Art of Japanese Calligraphy Class at a Traditional Machiya in Kyoto
description: Try your hand at the flowing and delicate art of Japanese Calligraphy. Join a lesson held at a traditional Kyoto house and learn to elegantly scribe kanji characters.

title: Traditional Japanese Art Lesson
description: Paint on post cards using traditional Japanese paints. The base pattern makes it easy to create your own work of art, even without a lot of practice!

title: One Day Express Kyoto Tour from Tokyo with First Class Bullet Train Tickets
description:
Ride in style in first class on Japan's famous bullet train, and experience the 1,200 years of Kyoto's rich history. See all the city's top sights in one day!
Hop on the bullet train at Tokyo Station, and get whisked in style all the way to the ancient capital of Kyoto for a day of sightseeing! After lunch at the New Miyako Hotel spend the afternoon visiting some of the ancient capital's most famous places including Sanjusangendo Temple, Heian Jingu Shrine, and the dramatic Kiyomizudera Temple. Return to Tokyo by bullet train in the evening, riding first class.

title: Half Day Ikebana Flower Arrangement in a Traditional Kyoto Townhouse
description: Visit a traditional Japanese townhouse and learn the art of Japanese flower arrangement, Ikebana. Make use of delicate flowers and create a unique arrangement for the season.

title: Introductory Paragliding Course for Beginners in Kyoto
description: Feel the joys of flying in the sky at ease on a paraglider. An instructor will teach you carefully, so beginners are welcome to join and soar the skies.

title: Private Tour of Kyoto Temples and Zen Meditation at Shorinji Temple
description:
Let a Zen master teach you Zazen meditation, and experience the culture of the temples during a walking tour of Tofukuji Temple and Fushimi Inari Shrine.
Step into the world of the monks as you practice Zazen meditation at Shorinji Temple before learning about the history of Zen Buddhism during your guided tour of Tofukuji Temple. See the other side of Japanese spirituality at the many shrines of Kyoto, including the beautiful Fushimi Inari Shrine, where thousands of vibrant torii gates lead up the mountain. Let yourself enjoy the peace and harmony of Kyoto.

title: Full Day Historic Kyoto and Nara Tour with Dinner in Kobe from Osaka
description: Explore three very popular cities of Japan on a full day bus tour. Visit historical temples and beautiful parks of Kyoto and Nara, then enjoy a delicious dinner by the sea in Kobe.

title: Incense Bag (Japanese Sachet) Making with Fragrant Wood Chips in Kyoto
description: Wrap fragrant wood chips together to create a personal incense as you learn this traditional art of Kyoto. The finished Nishijin brocade or crepe bags give off a gentle fragrance.

title: Delicate Chinkin Style Lacquerware Decoration Workshop in Kyoto
description: Add delicate and shimmering designs with a lesson in classical Kyoto style chinkin lacquer decoration. Often used for tea ceremony utensils, add a tasteful touch to a cute item for your home.

title: Japanese Princess Twelve Layered Ceremonial Kimono Dress Experience in Kyoto
description: Dress up in an elegant kimono, and we will guide you to an elegant world. Enter a merchant's house in Kyoto where you can hear traditional Japanese court music and feel like a time traveler.

title: Private Dinner with a Kyoto Maiko at Nishijin Tondaya with English Support
description:
Meet one of Kyoto's lovely maiko, who will dance and provide traditional Japanese style hospitality during a private dinner at the Nishijin Tondaya machiya townhouse.
In 1999 Nishijin Tondaya was designated as a cultural asset of Japan, and now is dedicated to preserving the historic customs of the women of Kyoto. After your tour of the beautiful machiya, sit down for an elegant dinner of Kyoto cuisine with maiko entertainment, including a traditional dance performance. English interpretation is available, providing a fantastic chance to learn about the world of the geisha and experience this iconic part of Kyoto's culture.

title: Buddhist Zazen Meditation at Bishamondo Shourinji Temple in Kyoto
description:
Soothe heart and mind with Zen meditation at Shourinji Temple in Kyoto. Seek calm in the quiet temple grounds then enjoy a reflective cup of tea afterwards.
Zazen seated meditation practitioners seek to calm the body and mind to bring themselves closer to enlightenment. This is the most important aspect of Zen Buddhist practice, learning to sit quietly and detach from thoughts and judgement. Join the monks of Bishamondo Shourinji Temple as they lead you into the first steps of this meditative practice within the quiet tatami halls and garden-facing porches of the temple.
Shourinji Temple itself was built in 1550, and the Heian-era statue of Bishamonten which graces the altar was originally found hidden in the ceiling of Tofukuji Temple.

title: Introductory Traditional Kyo-Yuzen Hand-Dyeing Workshop in a Machiya
description:
The art of Kyo-Yuzen has been a part of the crafting culture of Kyoto 
for hundreds of years. Now you too can create a one-of-a-kind hand-dyed work of art.
The traditional art of "Surikomi Yuzen" (Yuzen-style brush dye technique) was created  in the mid-18th century and has been the most popular way to dye kimono cloth ever since. The craftsmen of Marumasu-Nishimuraya, a 100 year-old business, will take you step-by-step as you make your own masterpiece.

Using paper stencils and ink, layers of color are carefully brushed onto fabric. Designs range from realistic flowers and plants to abstract designs. Sit with the craftsmen as they help you create Kyo-Yuzen pieces, such as handkerchiefs, mobile phone cases or Japanese fans.

title: Beauty of Kyoto and Nara Highlights Full Day Tour from Kyoto
description:
Dive deeply into the richness of both Kyoto and Nara as you visit temples, shrines, and even the Imperial Palace. Treat yourself to a day in the majestic splendor of these ancient places.
Start your adventure into history in Kyoto, one of Japan's ancient capitals. Begin with a visit to important historical sights such as Nijo Castle, the Temple of the Golden Pavilion, and Kyoto's Imperial Palace. After visiting these wonders, break for lunch before making your way to the idyllic town of Nara.
In Nara, take a moment of Zen at the tranquil Todaiji Temple, home of the world's largest Buddha statue. Learn the legends about the deer that freely roam Nara Park. Stroll through the gardens with these friendly creatures until you reach the Kasuga Grand Shrine. Of course, there is time to pick up some traditional souvenirs too, before convenient transport back to Kyoto.

title: Maiko Performance with Traditional Banquet in Gion (English-Guided)
description: Experience an enchanting time with a maiko as you savor an elegant course-style dinner. Watch an elegant dance performed before you and play traditional games for a memorable time in Gion.

title: Japanese Traditional Taiko Drumming Experience in Kyoto <1 hour>
description: Feel the rhythm of Japanese traditional taiko drumming in Kyoto. No experience or Japanese language needed, just grab the sticks and dive into this fun cultural experience.

title: Maiko Dress-Up and Photo Studio Experience near Honganji in Kyoto
description: Become a Maiko for a day! Dress yourself up in an elaborate kimono and traditional makeup. Bring a lovely memory home with professional photos of yourself!

title: Maiko, Geisha or Samurai Makeover and Photo Session in Kyoto
description:
Become one of Kyoto's lovely maiko for a day. Professional staff will do the white make up and help you dress in a bright kimono before a photo shoot! You can also stroll Kyoto for even more pictures.
See yourself in a whole new way with a Maiko, Geisha, or Samurai transformation! Plans available for women, men and kids means unforgettable memories for the whole family during your visit to Kyoto. Topof-the-range cosmetics (both traditional and modern), over 100 different beautiful kimono to choose from and fantastic professional photographers are waiting for you. English, Chinese, Spanish, and Italian speaking staff mean an easy and hassle free experience from start to finish. You will receive all your photos or albums on the day, so no need to wait, letting you get back out and explore more of Kyoto.

*Maiko/geiko dress-up limited to female participants only, as samurai dress-up is to men.

title: Machiya Tour and Tea Ceremony Experience at Nishijin Tondaya in Kyoto
description:
Enter the enchanting world of old Kyoto at the Nishijin Tondaya estate, where you can tour the machiya before taking part in a tea ceremony, dressing in silk kimono or enjoying a Kyoto lunch.
Tour this example of old Kyoto, a money exchange house from the late 1800s. In 1999 Nishijin Tondaya was designated as a cultural asset of Japan, and now is dedicated to preserving the historic customs of the women of Kyoto. After your tour of the beautiful machiya, experience a traditional Japanese tea ceremony. Don't worry if this is your first time, the knowledgeable professionals of Tondaya will take you step-by-step through this age old custom. You can enhance your tea ceremony experience by wearing a kimono, and learn how to move gracefully while wearing this gorgeous, refined piece of silk art!

title: Private Soba Noodle Making Class with Sake Tasting in Gotanda
description: Roll up your sleeves and make your very own soba noodles! Learn the art of soba making from kneading to cutting. Pair it with delicious sake and local food for a truly memorable experience.

title: Nikko City Area Discount Train Pass with Entrance to Edo Wonderland
description:
Enjoy Nikko with this discount pass. Just hop on the train to see the World Heritage sites like Toshogu Shrine, then enjoy your day at Edo Wonderland to see a slice of life from Japanese history.
Enjoy the perks of the Theme Park and Nikko City Area Pass and organize your own self-guided tour. Take your time enjoying the many World Heritage sites in the area along the route between Asakusa and the unlimited ride zone. After visiting iconic locations like Toshogu Shrine, spend the rest of your day at Edo Wonderland. You can also receive discounts on souvenirs, restaurants and several tourist facilities and rides.

title: Samurai Armor Photo Shoot Experience in Shibuya
description:
Transform into a mighty samurai with the bold armor of warlords of the Sengoku period. Suit up (with help from a pro) and strike a pose for the camera, a unique souvenir of your time in Tokyo!
Enjoy an exceptional armor experience wearing the dramatic decorative armor with designs from former warlords of the Sengoku period! Select your favorite warlord's armor and get helpful assistance from professional dressers. Strike a pose in the specially prepared studio and share your pics with friends and family back home.

title: Shodo Lesson at the Home of a Calligrapher in Central Tokyo
description:
Discover the art of the brush and ink. Learn how to write your name or favorite words in Japanese using traditional shodo calligraphy techniques from an award-winning English-speaking instructor.
Begin from the basics or advance in your skills in writing with shodo brushes and ink. Enjoy a fun calligraphy lesson at a local home with a professional Japanese calligraphist. Pick a favorite word or name and learn to write it neatly using expressive strokes of the brush. Take this great opportunity to ask any questions or tips on writing Japanese in a fun and informative English class.

title: Evening Walking Food Tour in Trendy Shibuya with English-Speaking Guide
description:
Satisfy your hunger with local  delicacies as an English-speaking guide introduces you to trendy Shibuya. Journey from hidden local eateries to an underground food market in Shibuya station.
From starter to dessert, this fun foodie tour will take you for a jaunt to local izakaya and restaurants off the beaten path! Eat like Tokyoites do, and start your evening making new friends and experiencing the city's bustling nightlife.

title: All-You-Can-Drink with 100 Types of Sake in Tokyo at a Local Bar in Shibuya
description: Dive into Sake with more than 100 types to try! Bring your own snacks and have fun with no time limit and free re-entry. Just a short walk from Shibuya Station, the perfect spot for everyone.

title: Reserved Ticket for Madame Tussauds Tokyo in Odaiba
description:
The Tokyo chapter of Madame Tussauds has over 60 life-size figures of celebrities from all over the world. Have fun striking poses with Hollywood stars, famous athletes and Japanese celebrities.
Enjoy a large selection of life-sized waxworks of famous celebrities at Madame Tussauds, Tokyo. First established in London 250 years ago, Madame Tussauds is a hands-on attraction with a venerable history. With no ropes or other partitioning, visitors can not just enjoy taking pictures with their favorite celebrities, but also have enormous fun putting their arms around the figures or striking similar poses.

title: Half Day Local Food and Shopping Street Tour of Tokyo in English
description: Get a truly local experience during a fun walking tour off the beaten path! Your guide will introduce you to delicious local treats and get a feel for the energy of the Sunamachi shopping street.

title: Street Food Walking Tour of Asakusa with a Maid Guide
description: Along with your friendly maid guide, explore the traditional Asakusa area and try many of the tasty local treats! From sweets to savory, get a real taste of Tokyo. Get dressed in a kimono too!

title: Tea Ceremony and Take- Home Yukata Experience in Tokyo
description:
Learn how to wear a yukata (light cotton kimono) and obi sash, which you will then get to take home! Then take part in a traditional tea ceremony.
This unique activity allows guests to select and wear a colorful yukata (a light cotton kimono) with an obi sash. Assisted by the instructor, you will learn how to dress yourselves in a yukata. 

After getting fully dressed, join a serene tea ceremony. Watch the professional tea masters prepare the perfect bowl of matcha tea, to be savored with a sweet.

Then we will help you take photos in our Japanese-style tearoom or in the garden. The best part is that you can take the yukata home with you, as a souvenir of your visit to Japan!

title: Oiran Cabaret Show Reservations for Kaguwa in Roppongi
description:
Watch dramatic dinner theater incorporating decadent entertainment and delicious cuisine, all in a theater lavishly decorated to resemble a Meiji Era entertainment quarter.
This new style of Japanese entertainment has taken Roppongi by storm! Oiran courtesans, samurai and geisha dance across a kaleidoscopic rotating stage in a series of beautiful, exciting Japanese performances. The cast of 11 professional dancers and drag queens will bring the sensuality of Tokyo's old 'pleasure quarters' to life during this exciting 50 minute show. Enjoy dinner and drinks on the expansive premises and prepare yourself for a night of fun antics. Take advantage of the convenient all-you-can drink plans while watching the performers fly overhead.

title: Private Japanese Calligraphy Lesson in Tokyo at Koishikawa Koryuan
description:
Learn about the traditional Japanese art of shodo, ink brush calligraphy. Focus your mind, and create your own unique calligraphy piece!
Shodo is an artistic form of writing, where practitioners use a brush and liquid ink to write out kanji characters, kana or entire phrases and poems. The balance of the strokes and placement are supposed to evoke a certain feeling or image.

Join this class, and learn the basics of this contemplative art. You will start out by preparing the ink from an ink stick, then get to grips with the brush. Choose what you wish to write, such as your name in kanji!

Experience this traditional calligraphy class with explanations in English (or other languages), to get a deeper look into the art.

title: Private Tokyo Sightseeing Tour & Narita Airport Drop-off
description:
Customize your itinerary with your English-speaking driver to stop by must-see Tokyo locations like Asakusa or Tokyo Skytree. Then be dropped off at Narita Airport in time for your flight.
For those passing through the city with only one day to spare or travelers with a busy schedule looking to do some quick sightseeing before heading home, this private tour is the perfect option. Make the most out of your last remaining hours in Tokyo, visiting must-see destinations throughout the city before being dropped off at Narita Airport in time for your flight. Along the way, drive by the famous shopping districts of Ginza and Harajuku, take an elevator to the top of the Tokyo Skytree, or eat some delicious local specialties, it is all up to you! 

Make sure to book your tour with enough time for you to reach the airport and make your flight. 3, 6, and 9-hour tours are available.

Select a start time following these guidelines:
3 Hour Tour: 6.5 Hours before your flight
6 Hour Tour: 9.5 Hours before your flight
9 Hour Tour: 12.5 Hours before your flight

title: Private Pop Culture, Manga and Anime Tour of Tokyo
description:
Plunge into the world of manga and anime on this private tour of Japanese pop culture, and visit the spots frequented by the otaku elite with an English speaking driver!
From old-school shoujo manga like Sailor Moon and shonen anime like Naruto and One Piece, to unique spots like maid cafes and game centers, come see the best of the otaku world for yourself on this private anime tour of Tokyo. Jump right into the world of Akihabara, filled with anime goods and electronics or make for Harajuku and the famous Takeshitadori Street, home of the whole rainbow of fashions that come from Japan. Search your way through Nakano Broadway for a multilevel store filled with anime goods, a maid cafe and more memorabilia for every manga, cartoon, anime, or game you can imagine.

title: SEIBU 1 Day Pass + Nagatoro
description:
Use your SEIBU 1 Day + Nagatoro pass to design your own trip. Visit locations in Tokyo and Saitama including historic Kawagoe and enjoy special access locations within the beautiful Chichibu.
Plan your own self-guided tour through cities like Kawagoe and Chichibu from Tokyo. Depending on the season you can locate the best sakura viewing spots such as Hitsujiyama Park and its pink moss phlox, festivals including the Chichibu Yomatsuri, which is listed as a UNESCO Intangible Culture Heritage.

title: Tea Ceremony Experience in an Authentic Tearoom in Ginza
description:
Encounter the world of tea in a quaint tearoom located near the famous Kabukiza in Ginza. With a friendly English-speaking tea master, learn more about the ceremony with delicious tea and sweets.
Centrally located in one of Tokyo's most fashionable areas, this is a tea ceremony with a difference, as you get to experience grinding your own matcha tea!

title: Private Tokyo Tour to a Bonsai Studio, Miso Shop and Japanese Garden
description:
Experience the quiet side of modern Tokyo on this relaxed tour. Your bilingual guide will take you around a bonsai studio, miso shop and historic garden in a private car, for a seamless tour.
Take the chance to see the important parts of Tokyo that are off the beaten path, and learn about Japanese culture through the beautiful bonsai museum and historic feudal-era garden. Enjoy the chance to experience the essential elements of Japanese cooking at a miso shop, to discover where the 'umami' of the local cuisine comes from. There is no need to worry about transport or language barrier with the private car and bilingual guide who will take you to and from your Tokyo hotel and guide you around the sights.

This is an ideal tour for visitors looking for a more relaxing experience, skipping the neon and busy streets for a more local atmosphere.

title: Samurai Warlord Experience with a Professional Photo Shoot in Tokyo
description:
Strike a pose while dressed in the armor of a brave samurai of the Sengoku period. Try on special armor replicas of famed warlords and have professional photos taken for you as a souvenir!
Choose from one of four samurai warlords and wear a replica of their fearsome armor. The famous samurai you can turn into are: Yukimura Sanada, Masamune Date, Nobunaga Oda, or Kanetsugu Naoe. 
Once you've dressed up as your samurai alter ago, a professional photographer will help you pose and take fantastic pictures of you, one of which you will receive as a souvenir!

title: Cross-Dressing or Makeover Photo Shoot Experience in Tokyo
description:
Experience an out-of-the-ordinary dress-up session in a professional photo studio. Select from wedding dresses, gothic-lolita, to even cross dressing and drag queen outfits for memorable pictures.
Open to men, women and non-binary guests, this photo studio welcomes everyone!
From standard daily clothes to wedding dresses, evening gowns, party dresses, gothic-lolita, cosplay outfits and more! Have professional make-up staff do your hair and make-up, for a transformation into a whole new you . For those up for something different, take this great opportunity to try the Japanese-style "kawaii" drag queen or "visual-kei" drag king make-up and styling.

title: Nikko Area Discount Train Pass with Theme Park Entry
description:
Tour the Nikko area and its theme parks just the way you want to with a discount pass. Stop by Tobu World Square and Edo Wonderland and tour the various World Heritage sites like Toshogu Shrine.
Travel to Nikko and make your own self-guided tour along the designated train and bus route. Along with famous places like Toshogu Shrine or Kegon Falls, you can visit the famous theme parks, Edo Wonderland and Tobu World Square as entry fee to the parks is included when your purchase this convenient pass.

title: Kimono Rental and Dressing Experience in Asakusa with English Assistance
description: Get dressed in a pretty Japanese kimono, and explore the traditional streets of Asakusa in style. Lots of different patterns to choose from, and the owner will be happy to give you sightseeing tips!

title: Japanese Perfumed Incense Sachet Making Experience in Asakusa
description: Step back in time to historic Edo as you use high quality materials to mix a gentle scented sachet, perfect for adding a touch of Japan to your home. The instructor will also teach you about incense!

title: Karate Lesson and Calligraphy in Nihonbashi
description: Feel the heart and spirit of Japan through karate and calligraphy. Discover Japanese manners and beliefs through the art of writing and traditional martial arts in either English or French.

title: Full Day Nissan Yokohama Plant and Cup Noodle Museum Tour from Tokyo
description:
Visit the port city of Yokohama to discover the world-class technology behind Nissan automobiles and instant Cup Noodles for a cultural and educational experience of daily tech.
Let your guide take you right into the heart of Yokohama from your hotel in Tokyo. Explore the history and manufacturing processes of automobiles on assembly lines within the Nissan Yokohama plant. Then see how some of the same techniques go into a worldwide hit food at the Cup Noodle Museum.  Learn the history of the famous instant ramen noodles and their evolution throughout time. You will also be able to make your very own Cup Noodles to take home!

title: Four-Hour Ninja Experience in Tokyo
description: Go into the  depths of the mountains to learn the techniques of becoming a ninja from a master. Discover their history and philosophy while mastering the arts right in Tokyo.

title: Private Rickshaw Tour of Asakusa (45 Minute Plan)
description: Charter a rickshaw for 45 minutes and enjoy a tour of traditional Asakusa in comfort and style while seeing hidden sights! An only-in-Japan experience.

title: Fugu Pufferfish Dinner or Lunch in Asakusa
description:
Try pufferfish at the famous restaurant Genpin Fugu in Asakusa! Enjoy top-class fugu, the perfect only-in-Japan experience for adventurous eaters! 
Carefully prepared by licensed chefs, come taste the infamous but tasty fugu pufferfish! Take the hassle out of ordering in Japanese with the set course of your choice, and impress friends back home! A glass of beer or a soft drink is included in the plan.

title: Private Transfer Services between Yokohama Port and Central Tokyo
description:
Disembark from your cruise ship in Yokohama and head to Tokyo in a private car or van. Your driver will take you straight to your hotel in one of the 23 special wards. Return transfers also available.
If you need to get to Tokyo from your Yokohama cruise, this option will allow you to be dropped wherever you need in Tokyo's 23 special wards. You will be picked up in a private car, minivan or full size van depending on the number of passengers, and easily escorted to the city. 
Heading for a cruise from Yokohama and need to get there from Tokyo? You can book that too! Just specify your needs when booking.

title: Private Taxi Transfers between Yokohama Port and Tokyo with English Support
description:
This convenient transfer service cane take you to or from Yokohama Port to Tokyo during your cruise stop in Japan. Just hop into a comfortable car with English support for a hassle-free experience.
Conveniently make your way to or from Yokohama Port to the central areas of Tokyo on a private taxi. Besides the major Osanbashi Port (Yokohama International Port Terminal), pick ups and drop offs are also available at Daikokufuto and Yamashitafuto ports (sometimes used by Majestic Princess and SuperStar Virgo cruise ships)

title: Mt. Fuji, Lake Kawaguchi and Oshino Ninja Village Bus Tour from Tokyo
description:
Climb to the fifth station of Mt. Fuji for a spectacular view before soaring above mountains on a 4D virtual ride. Explore Lake Kawaguchi and a Ninja Village within Oshino Hakkai too!
This budget tour is a great option for a day trip to Mt. Fuji from central Tokyo. Not only will you get to see the majestic Mt. Fuji and dramatic vistas over Lake Kawaguchi, but also experience the unique 'Fuji Airways', an awesome 4D ride that allows you to experience flying over the mountain in all four seasons. Stroll though the quaint traditional houses of Oshino Hakkai, then have lunch at the Ninja Village (halal option available)!

title: Japanese Classical Buyo Dance and Kimono Wearing Lesson in Tokyo
description: Step into the world of Kabuki theater by learning to perform a traditional Japanese dance. Discover the meaning of each movement with lessons in either English or French.

title: Cosplay Experience and Photo Shoot in Akihabara
description:
Transform into your favorite character in the hometown of anime, Akihabara! Our staff of cosplayers can help with make-up or you can wander town in costume for an unforgettable time.
Discover a whole new style with a fun cosplay experience. Actual cosplayers on staff are available to help you perfect your look by doing your make-up, for a one of a kind Japan experience.
We offer a wide range of costumes from all over the latest hit anime and more. If you have a specific request for something you do not see in our pictures, just let us know and we will try to help! We also have a wide variety of props and accessories available to rent on the day of your shoot.

title: Full Day Cycling Sightseeing Tours of Tokyo from Toranomon Hills
description:
Set out from central Tokyo on a cycling tour and discover a new side of the city. From historic Asakusa to trendy Aoyama or even Tokyo Bay, pedal into adventure.
Choose from 4 different courses to suit your interests and schedule! From Tokyo's traditional side to an evening cruise and cycle tour, explore the city in a whole new way with a friendly guide and lots of snacks.

title: Half Day Traditional Cloth and T-Shirt Indigo Dyeing Lesson in Asakusa
description: Transform your choice of T-shirt, tote bag, Japanese wash cloth or handkerchief into an indigo dyed piece of usable art. Create something truly one of a kind.

title: Samurai Experience at the Jidai Academy Dojo in Tokyo
description:
Learn the basics of fighting with a katana sword, and get in touch with your inner samurai. Open to everyone from beginners to martial artists, come learn the art of the sword in central Tokyo.
The Samurai class was established by the 12th century.  Samurai worked for feudal lords and are famous for their bravery and code of honor called Bushido, a strict ethical code which ruled their lives. Accompanied by an English interpreter, dive into the world of these famous Japanese warriors and learn about their history and sword fighting techniques.

title: Kimono Rental and Kimono Dressing in Nihonbashi
description:
Wear a beautiful kimono of your choice, take pictures and explore the city dressed to impress. We will store your clothes and belongings for you!
Experience walking down the streets of Tokyo dressed in a colorful kimono, or just enjoy taking a few pictures in a traditional tatami room, its up to you! Your friendly professional dresser will help you put on the kimono of your choice, which is yours until 18:00. Stroll down the avenues of Ginza, visit a nearby shrine or go out for tea! Your clothes and belongings will be stored for you, so no need to carry heavy bags. With explanations in both English and Japanese, this is a great easy way to experience Japan's traditions firsthand.

title: Wear Kimono in Asakusa with a Rental Dress Up Experience in Tokyo
description:
Dress in a beautiful kimono and walk through lovely Asakusa! Choose your favorite kimono from a huge selection of designs. Everything from the traditional to modern and cute is available.
Explore Asakusa, a unique neighborhood of Tokyo, where you can immerse yourself in both the rich cultural traditions of Japan as well as experience the ultra-modern SkyTree. Wear a kimono as you tour Asakusa's many sights and take lots of gorgeous pictures dressed up in your choice of kimono!
You can add a professional photo shoot around the area's most lovely sights or the indoor studio, accompanied by a photographer. This is a great option for couples celebrating an engagement, wedding, anniversary or as a beautiful memento of your trip to Tokyo.

title: Tokyo Afternoon Tour and Sumida River Cruise
description:
A visit to Tokyo’s oldest temple, a relaxing river cruise and sweeping views are all in store during this leisurely afternoon tour of the city.
Spend your afternoon visiting some of Tokyo’s most impressive sights. Stop at Sensoji, which houses a golden statue of Kannon, the Goddess of Mercy, that legend states was fished from the Sumida River in the 7th century. 

Peruse the colorful craft and food shops on the promenade leading up to the temple, finding local treats to snack on. Driving through Ginza, visitors are treated to the bright neon signs that Tokyo is famous for. With stops at the Imperial Palace and an observation deck 40-floors up, this is a tour bound to keep you entertained from start to finish.

title: Full Day Tour to Nikko and Edo Wonderland from Tokyo
description:
Experience becoming a ninja for a day and enjoy a full day of exploring in Nikko. Take a peek at the culture and life during the influential Edo era, and visit gorgeous Toshogu Shrine. 
This one-day tour of Nikko provides visitors a comprehensive look into  life during Edo era Japan. Visitors start with a trip to the ancient Toshogu Shrine, a World Heritage Site known for its elaborate architecture and the famous Three Wise Monkeys carving. Spend the afternoon at an interactive theme park, Edo Wonderland, where visitors are transported back in time. Guests can experience life in ancient Edo, honing their skills in throwing ninja stars and samurai archery, or even dressing up in the traditional clothing of the era. The ninja show at Edo Wonderland is not to be missed!

title: Evening Street Food and Walking Tour of Shinjuku Kabukicho
description:
Kabukicho is Shinjuku’s center for shopping and entertainment. Spend your evening amid the bright neon lights of Tokyo’s modern shopping district!
During this evening walking tour in Shinjuku, visitors will get to see the dramatic transition from day to night, as the neon signs replace the sun.

Begin your evening in the Shinjuku East Shopping area, home to some of Japan’s largest and most recognizable department stores. Next stop at Hanazono Shrine, located adjacent to the famous Golden Gai, known for its unique architectural style and distinct nightlife.

The tour ends at Omoide Yokocho, where guests can find great ramen restaurants, izakayas (pubs), pachinko parlors, and have an unforgettable after-hours Tokyo experience!

title: Private Transfer from Haneda Airport and Hakuba or Nozawa Ski Resorts
description:
Head straight to the snowy slopes of Hakuba or Nozawa resort with your ski gear directly from Haneda International Airport (HND) on this convenient private charter. Return transfers also available!
This all-inclusive service makes traveling between Haneda Airport and Hakuba or Nozawa Ski Resort a breeze! Highway tolls, parking fees and Meet & Greet fees are all included. From solo travelers to groups of 60, we have you covered!

title: Reservations for an Owl Cafe' Experience in Shinjuku
description:
Don't miss the chance to experience one of Japan's famous owl cafes when visiting Tokyo! Conveniently located in central Shinjuku, have a blast meeting and petting various types of cute owls!
More of a 'owl meeting spot' than a cafe', while in Japan take the chance to get up close with lots of different owls at this neat shop.

title: Convenient Kimono Rental and Dress-up Studio in Asakusa
description:
Dress yourself up in a fashionable kimono in the heart of Asakusa. Select from nearly 3,000 gorgeous designs to find a perfect one for an unforgettable time in Tokyo.
