Summer Season offers a different experience to the big rapids and strong white water of spring. With less water flowing down the Tone the rapids mellow out and there is more time to mess about on the river.

title: Half-Day Downstream Hydrospeed River Adventure in Minakami
description: Slip and slide down close to the surface of the cool rapids as you speed down the fresh waters of Minakami. Enjoy the adventure and thrill with your friendly guide.

title: Overnight Stay at Hotel New Akao in Atami and Bullet Train Pass
description:
This is a unguided free plan including an overnight stay in Atami and round trip Shinkansen tickets. Relax at a Japanese ryokan inn with hot springs for a relaxing experience.
Travel by Shinkansen bullet train to Atami, a famous hot spring resort that has delighted travelers since the 8th century. The combination of sea and natural hot springs creates a feeling of complete relaxation.

title: Relaxing Half Day Canoe Adventure on the Kushiro River from Kushiro City
description: Set out along the broad expanse of the Kushiro River on the meandering part of the river. Take a break on the sandbanks, walk in the shallows, and have fun outdoors.

title: Guided Mountain Climbing from Asahidake Onsen in Summer
description: From natural lakes to mountain peaks, Hokkaido's summer offers beautiful vistas galore. Hike through fields of alpine wildflowers and far more during your course.

title: Kushiro Private Taxi and Train Tour (3 hours)
description: Perfect for train enthusiasts, take a leisurely ride on the Norokko train across the marsh plains of Kushiro. Your private taxi guide will show you the best sights

title: Airport Drop Off Service from Kyoto Hotels to Itami Airport with Staff Escort
description: English-speaking staff will meet you at your hotel in Kyoto and guide you to the Airport Bus by taxi for hassle-free and simple way to catch your flight.

title: Private Kyoto to Osaka Hotel Taxi Plan with Staff Escort
description: Enjoy peace of mind and the highest in convenience with an escorted ride in a private taxi from your hotel in Kyoto to your next hotel in Osaka.

title: Berry Jam and Fresh Ice Cream Making Experience in Nakafurano
description: Make delicious berry jam using the farm's fresh strawberries and fruit, then make gelato-style ice cream using fresh Hokkaido milk and natural vanilla.

title: Sunrise Canoe Tour in Minakami
description: Set out onto the quiet lake early in the morning, and watch as the sunrise slowly brightens the day as the light rolls over the mountains and onto the water.

title: Mt. Koya One Day Train Tickets, Bus Pass and Lunch Package from Osaka
description:
This is an unguided tour allowing you to explore Mt. Koya. With an included bus pass for Mt. Koya, and lunch,  this is a convenient way to tour the area.
Set out on an self guided journey to Mt. Koya, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Once at the mountain, you can enjoy lunch at Henjokoin Temple, Ekoin Temple or Tentokuin Temple where you will dine on authentic Buddhist vegetarian cuisine. Then, enjoy learning about the temples on a tour with an English speaking guide.

title: Trekking Adventure to Yaku Cedar Trees in Yakushima
description: Yakushima is known for the colossal Yaku Cedars that are said to be over 1,000 years old. Witness the rare scenery created by mother nature in the world heritage site.

title: Eco-Friendly Jomon Cedar Sightseeing Hike and Trekking Tour
description: Hike up the extreme course to the famed Jomon cedar. Follow your experienced guide to experience an eco-friendly journey to marvel at the sight of the thousand year cedar forest in Yakushima.

title: Beginner Friendly Shiratani Unsuikyo Trekking Adventure
description: The area along the Shiratani River is perfect for a walking tour, and friendly to beginners. Enjoy walking in the mysterious forest of moss and trees.

title: Relaxing Owl Cafe and Photo Experience in Osaka
description: Say hello to the friendly owls at the newly opened owl cafe in Tenmangu, Osaka. Hold, pet and take memorable photos of the beautiful feathered creatures while relaxing with a drink.

title: Half Day Special Kira-Kotan Nature Hike from Kushiro City
description: Kira-Kotan, normally off-limits, is yours to explore with the guide on this private tour. Get a rare chance to truly be surrounded by nature in Hokkaido.

title: Private Sightseeing Taxi Tour of Kushiro's Industry (3 hours)
description:
Learn about the industries which have made Kushiro blossom since its pioneering days! Business buffs will have a blast on this private charter tour.
Visit Kushiro Bay, Marine Topos (Marine Exhibition), Chiyonoura Marine Park, Coal Mine Exhibition Pavilion and the Fukutsukasa Sake Brewery.

title: Guided Mt. Daisetsu Snowshoe Hiking Tour
description: The best powder snow in Japan! Play with the powdery snow and enjoy winter! Snowshoeing is beginner-friendly and you can walk easily on the snow.

title: Mt. Nipesotsu Guided Flower Viewing and Trekking Tour
description: Mt. Nipesotsu, the highest mountain in Higashi Taisetsu is home to many types of mountain flowers. See the natural beauty of Hokkaido on this guided tour.

title: Arashiyama and Hoppou Yasouen Nature Trek and Flower Viewing Tour
description: There are many species of  forest floor plants in the broadleaf forest of Asahikawa. See the many colors and shapes during a guided walking tour.

title: Exciting White Water Rafting Adventure in Furano (April~November)
description: Join your guide on the raft as you race down the river currents in a thrilling adventure ride. Splash through waves and work together as you paddle your way through!

title: Full Day Tour of Kyoto with Maiko Meeting (Departs from Osaka)
description:
Soak in the nostalgic atmosphere of Gion. Enjoy a hot pot lunch or see a maiko dance. See the lovely Kinkaku-ji and get a panoramic view of Kyoto from  the majestic veranda of Kiyomizu-dera. 
This tour takes you to Kyoto's best sights including the Kinkaku-ji Temple, Gion and Kiyomizu-dera Temple. You can also choose one out of two options for lunch: unlimited chanko hotpot (the beloved dish of sumo wrestlers!) and take a group photo with a maiko or geisha; or traditional Kyoto cuisine which includes a maiko dance performance and the opportunity to take a personal photo together with a maiko.

title: Special Chartered Taxi Tour Around Sapporo for Families or Small Groups
description: Relax in a jumbo taxi as you cruise around Sapporo and discover the city. Let our friendly driver show you the popular tourist spots! The drivers can speak some English, and are happy to help.

title: Private Sea Kayak Expedition Tour from Sapporo
description:
Limited to one group a day, go on a private adventure on a sea kayak. Enjoy with your guide from the Safe Canoeing Association as they take you to special spots.
Please enjoy a hand selected tour created by your guide and the staff in Hokkaido. English speaking staff will be available for you to customize your tour according to your preference.

title: Sapporo Sightseeing by Private Taxi (2,4 or 8 Hours)
description: Let the experienced taxi driving guides show you all the best sights in Sapporo! Check out the Meiji era buildings, clock tower, fun parks and the bustling market.

title: Full Day or Half Day Sightseeing Taxi Tour in Sapporo from Otaru or Sapporo
description: Discover the main city of Hokkaido with a panoramic view from the observatory above the Okurayama Ski Jump Site or savor a visit to the Ishiya Confectionary Chocolate Factory.

title: Full Day Kyoto Bus Tour to 3 World Heritage Sites from Osaka
description: Venture through the ancient capital city to see the famous Fushimi Inari Shrine, Kiyomizudera Temple and the Kinkakuji Temple. Visit the highlights of Kyoto on a convenient bus.

title: Realistic Flight Simulator and Pilot Training Experience in Osaka
description: Lift-off with a Flight Simulation Experience using a full flight training device certified by the Japanese Civil Aviation Bureau for a real taste of what being in the pilot seat is like.

title: Bus Transfer from Kansai Airport to Osaka Hotels with Staff Assistance
description: This pick-up and drop-off service will whisk you from Kansai Airport to a hotel in Osaka. A staff member will ride with you to make sure you don't get lost.

title: Private Taxi Charter for Golfing from Sapporo or New Chitose Airport
description: Head out for a day on the greens with convenient pick-up and drop-off service from your choice of central Sapporo or New Chitose Airport.

title: Winery Tour and Tasting from Sapporo
description: Visit a small winery near Sapporo and discover the many elements that make each one unique. Stroll in the  vineyard, taste wine, and enjoy a peaceful time!

title: Kayak and Caving Tour along the Maribu Beach from Onna
description: Join a guide as you explore a huge cave and secret beach. Enjoy the adventure on a kayak with your family, along with breathtaking views and fantastic kayaking.

title: Speedy Go Kart Rental and Self-Guided Sightseeing around Okinawa
description:
Hit the streets of tropical Okinawa as you zip through the local neighborhood on a fun Go Kart. Strap on your seat belt and drive through the island for an adventurous sightseeing trip.
Feel the refreshing breeze against you as you speed through the streets of Okinawa in a legal Go kart. Just bring your driver's license and take a self-guided tour to go anywhere you like! Enjoy the view of the beautiful beaches or venture through the American village theme park to get an almost real-life video game experience you can only have here.

title: Maiko and Geisha Photo Shoot and Stroll in Kyoto
description:
Take photos of yourself dressed as a Maiko and a Geisha and stroll the ancient streets of Kyoto in the elaborate and traditional outfit for an unforgettable experience.
Receive 40 shots with different poses with eight 2L-sized photos and 2 photo card.

title: Neo-Oiran Transformation and Photo Shoot Experience in Kyoto
description:
Transform into an elegant Japanese Oiran courtesan with a modern twist. Select from a variety of authentic kimonos and hair styles and take photos to take home.
Receive 20 shots with different poses with three 2L-sized photos.

title: Private Osaka to Kyoto Hotel Taxi Plan with Staff Escort
description: Enjoy peace of mind and the highest in convenience with an escorted ride in a private taxi from your hotel in Osaka to your hotel in historic Kyoto.

title: Snorkeling Half Day Tour with Thrill Rides in the Kerama Islands from Naha
description:
Relax with an easy snorkel in the emerald green sea of the Kerama Islands before some exciting water thrill rides. Taste the calm and rush of Okinawa!
Snorkel and play in the clear waters of the Kerama Islands. Feed cute tropical fish that usually don't approach the beach. You may even come across sea turtles or whales! Our staff is on hand to assist nervous swimmers and young children, so everyone can enjoy themselves completely. In addition to snorkeling, you can hang on tight to a banana boat or other thrilling ride for some high speed fun!

title: Morning, Sunset, and Night Sea Kayaking Eco Tours from Nakijin
description:
Enjoy kayaking at different times of the day and discover the fresh air of the morning, the changing scenery of sunset or the mysterious world at night.
This tour is operated only in Japanese.

title: Half Day Marine Sports and Thrill Ride Combo Plans in Nago
description: We offer set plans with marine sports including parasailing and banana boating to enjoy the sea of Okinawa to the fullest. Make a fantastic memory of your journey!

title: Half Day Private Chartered Sightseeing Taxi with Temple and Shrines in Takachiho
description: Step away from the everyday with a private taxi tour of famous shrines and temples, said to bring great fortune to visitors, in all areas of life.

title: 60 Minute Cruise of Southern Lake Biwa on a High Speed Boat
description: Hop aboard at Otsu Port, near Kyoto, and zip around the southern side of Lake Biwa. Relax in a modern high speed boat, and watch the scenery go by.

title: Mizu Yokan Jellied Sweet Making Experience in Echizen
description: Mizu yokan is a refreshing traditional Japanese jellied dessert, made from sweetened red beans. Learn how to make this local treat, a great activity for kids and groups.

title: Bridal and Engagement Kimono Photo Shoot in Fukuoka
description: Capture your special memories on camera, during this Japanese-style wedding photo shoot! Relax with sweets and matcha tea while you wait for your photos!

title: Panoramic Day Cruise Around Hotokegaura Cliffs in Aomori
description: Tour around the scenic areas of Hotokegaura on a comfortable cruise boat where large rocks and dynamic cliffs tower over. Get off board to stroll around the beach for an up close view.

title: Budget Friendly Mt. Fuji and Nature Tour from Lake Kawaguchi
description:
Hop aboard from the foot of Mt. Fuji and visit the mountain's 5th Station and nearby attractions. See the incredible Lava Forest, Fuji Sengen Shrine and Narusawa Ice Cave!
Mount Fuji is not only the symbol of Japan, but has long been worshiped as a sacred mountain as well. The Aokigahara Forest is one of the most mysterious places in the region, with its wild forests and caves, including the Wind Cave and Narusawa Ice Cave (which stays at 3 - 5 degrees celsius all year long). Of course, we can't forget the Fuji Five Lakes, which are also considered part of this World Cultural Heritage Site. On this tour, you will visit Lake Motosuko- the deepest among the five lakes!

title: Shikoku 88- Temple Pilgrimage Tour by Private Taxi from Kochi
description:
Want to visit specific temples on the Shikoku Pilgramage route, but have limited time? Why not charter a private taxi for you or your group? 
If you need the taxi for more than 7 hours, please apply for our one day plan.

title: Fun Beach Activities and All-You-Can-Ride Marine Sports on Miyakojima Island
description: Spend a day out in the clear blue waters of the tropical island of Miyakojima! Enjoy a full day of marine activities, such as snorkeling, banana boating, swimming and more!

title: Windsurfing Equipment Rental in Wakayama City
description: If you're unsure of what to do on the beach for a short period of time, try windsurfing. Join empty-handed and enjoy drifting across the sea while feeling the wind.

title: Tombodama Lampwork Glass Bead Making Experience in Kobe
description: Learn how to make cute glass beads in the Kobe Tombodama Museum. Choose your favorite color of glass, and shape it over a burner. You can take your beads home on the same day, great for kids!

title: Taxi Tour of Mysterious Nature Sceneries of Tokachi
description: Spend a day touring around the many lakes, parks and mountains in the Tokachi area. Discover the unique scenery you can only see up in northern Japan.

title: Discover the Nature and Agriculture of Tokachi on a Private Taxi
description: Cruise on a comfortable taxi to visit farms, universities and museums. Learn more about Tokachi, one of the largest agricultural cities in Japan.

title: Traditional Okayama Bizen Ware Ceramic Experience in Hyogo
description: Learn to make traditional pottery, the Bizen ware, known for its beautiful reddish brown finish. Select from a variety of courses and get creative with clay.

title: Make Summer- Inspired Pottery in Kamakura
description: How about making your own ceramic dish as a special souvenir of your visit to Kamakura! The cool blue and white are perfect complements to the summer season. Beginners welcome!

title: Short Private Chartered Tour of Kochi by Taxi
description: Do some sightseeing on your way from or to the airport, and see the sights related to the famous Ryoma Sakamoto on this private chartered tour.

title: Family-Friendly Summer River Ducky Rafting Cruise in Obihiro
description: Paddle down the calm waters of the river on a ducky raft with your friends or family. Select a course of your choice to enjoy the lush greens and vast nature of Hokkaido on a fun day cruise.

title: Beginner Friendly Yoga Class in Zushi
description: Enjoy an hour of relaxing yoga in Zushi! Improve posture, forget about stress and strengthen your body all at once. Special price for first time visitors!

title: Overnight at the Historical Fukuzumiro Ryokan in Hakone (Garden- Facing Room)
description:
Experience true Japanese hospitality at this historical inn in beautiful Hakone. Enjoy the quiet of the rooms facing the garden, and savor an elegant dinner!
The Fukuzumiro Ryokan has been in operation since 1890, right in the heart of the Tonozawa hot springs area in Hakone. With only 17 rooms, each decorated differently, this historical hot springs resort has been a favorite of Japanese writers and artistes for over 125 years!

The traditional atmosphere, lovely Japanese-style garden and bamboo-enlivened architecture make this a unique gem, perfect for a truly relaxing ryokan experience.

Guests can relax in public hot spring baths, or enjoy one for private use. After soaking, tuck into a delicious Japanese meal featuring local specialties!

title: All-You-Can-Ride Marine Sports and Barbecue Plan at Miyakojima Island
description: Spend a whole day on Miyakojima Island riding banana boat, floats, thrill rides and more! After a day of fun, enjoy a delicious barbecue for lunch or at sundown for a memorable Okinawan vacation!

title: Charter Taxi Wine and Hot Spring Relaxation Tour in Tokachi
description: Leisurely spend your time in Tokachi on a comfortable taxi and relax in a hot spring then enjoy various types of wine for a luxurious experience in Hokkaido.

title: Full Day Otaru and Mt. Tengu Ropeway Tour (with Multilingual Audio Guide)
description:
The former port city of Otaru offers a splendid experience for visitors to Hokkaido. Walk among the thriving community of artists, canals and museums, a perfect day trip from Sapporo.
Enjoy Otaru with English, Chinese, and Korean audio guidance! Ishikari Bay offers a fantastic backdrop as you make your way to the Otaru Bine winery, housed in a former bank. Walk along the Otaru Canal, lined by exquisite Victorian street lamps. After a relaxing stroll enjoy an all-you-can-eat lunch buffet. After lunch, stop by the pretty Kitaichi Glass Museum and the Otaru Music Box Museum.

Guests on the Ropeway Course can ride the Tenguyama Ropeway to the top of Mt. Tengu. Drink in the panoramic views of Otaru and Ishikari Gulf stretching below you!

title: Hourly Private Taxi Sightseeing Course in Western Kanagawa
description: Let your local driver take you around on a chartered taxi tour of the western side of Kanagawa and explore popular areas such as Odawara, Yugawara or Hakone.

title: Hakone Lake Ashi Sightseeing Cruise Round Trip Ticket
description:
Board the Lake Ashi Sightseeing Cruise for a round trip pleasure cruise to and from one of the four ports on the lake. Enjoy a lovely time on the water.
Board and return at your choice of Hakone-Sekisho-Ato Port, Moto-Hakone Port, Hakone-en Port, or Kojiri Port for a 30 minute to 70 minute sightseeing cruise on the lake.

title: Glass Work Crafting Lesson in Kawagoe
description: Choose from five different styles and create your own personal piece of art. Make a glass bead, sandblast or carve your design into glass for a unique souvenir.

title: Kobe Sightseeing and Nada Sake Brewery Walking Tour Departing from Kyoto
description:
See the best of Kobe on this full-day walking tour, including the elegant Ijinkan in the Kitano District and a sake-tasting session at the Nada Sake Brewery.
Visit the charming city of Kobe, one of Japan's oldest ports. Explore the famous Kitano District, among the beautiful Meiji-era homes of the first expats in Japan. After a filling buffet lunch relax in Meriken Park, enjoying the elaborate sculptures and views of the sea. 
The best part of the tour will be the Hakutsuru Sake Brewery Museum! The knowledgeable staff will explain the mysteries of sake to you, and of course guests will be able to taste some of their fine sake too.

title: Body Board Lesson for Beginners in Ichikawa
description: Catch a wave up close and personal on a body board during a fun lesson led by experienced instructors. Personalized instruction will help you ride.

title: Private Historic Jumbo Taxi Tour of Yokohama (2 Hours)
description: Leisurely cruise through the city of Yokohama and see the historic highlights and the scenic spots of the port city on a luxurious 6 person taxi in just 2 hours!

title: Private Sightseeing Tour of Hachimantai and Towada by Jumbo Taxi
description: No need to worry about hard to reach places when you enjoy a guided taxi tour. Visit the Koiwai Farm and Lake Towada, and the hot springs of Hachimantai.

title: One Day Hiroshima and Miyajima Tour from Osaka
description:
Head out of Osaka via shinkansen bullet train to visit famous locations in Hiroshima and Miyajima. Stops include the World Heritage Site of the Atomic Bomb Dome, and the floating Itsukushima shrine.
Get into the history and nature of Hiroshima on a one day tour that includes the UNESCO World Heritage Site of the Atomic Bomb Dome. Head out from the city and look forward to seeing wild deer in the untouched abundant nature of Miyajima.

Cherry blossoms blooming season: End of March to the beginning of April

title: Stargazing Cruise with a Drink in the Seas of Ishigaki Island
description: Sail out under the night sky and see the countless stars of the Milky Way. On the night of the full moon, the reflection on the ocean makes a moon river.

title: Horse Back Riding Lesson in Minakami
description:
This program includes basic lessons such as how to handle the reins, move forward, and stop. Even beginners will soon be riding with confidence.
Experience the joy of horse back riding and the healing power of nature and horses.

title: One Day Tour to Mt. Fuji by Bullet Train from Osaka (Lunch Included)
description:
Experience a different side of Mt. Fuji in Shizuoka, with great views of the mountain over tea farms! Visit a post town along the Tokaido Road, enjoy fresh local sushi and ride on the bullet train!
A great option for visitors staying in Osaka or Kyoto, who are looking for a day trip with a difference! Instead of going to Hakone, like most Mt. Fuji tours, this bullet train full day tour will take you to the Shizuoka side of the mountain, an area famous for green tea and fresh seafood.

title: Mount Fuji Tour and Natural Beauty Sights from Tokyo
description: Visit Mt. Fuji and other beautiful locations in the foothills of the iconic mountain, all with an English speaking guide! The clear lakes of Oshino Hakkai and the sacred Shiraito Falls are waiting.

title: Two Day Tour to Kyoto from Tokyo (Bullet Train and Hotel Package)
description:
This convenient bargain package allows visitors to spend 2 days in Kyoto, with a night at the hotel of your choice and bullet train tickets included. 
Take the hassle out of an overnight trip to the ancient capital of Kyoto. Just hop on the shinkansen and head to Kyoto!

See Kinkakuji Temple (the Golden Pavilion), beautiful Kiyomizudera Temple, the Heian Shrine and Fushimi Inari. Go geisha-spotting in Gion, or shopping at Nishiki Market... see exactly the sights you wish to see, and explore at your own leisure. 

Less expensive than booking separately, this plan includes tickets for the Nozomi bullet train and one night at your preferred hotel.

title: English Language Tea Ceremony in Tokyo
description:
Sit down and learn about the art of tea, explained by professional tea masters. Sip rich matcha tea and taste sweets in a serene tatami tea room.
Step into a moment of perfect peace with a tea ceremony. This Japanese art takes everything into account, from the arrangement of scrolls, flowers, tea instruments and even clothing, to create the perfect time with a unique, seasonal atmosphere. At TJT Studio we offer the opportunity for visitors to experience a traditional tea ceremony with explanations in English, to allow you a deeper look into the art.

title: Make a Traditional Tenugui Hand Dyed Towel in Eastern Tokyo
description:
Create your very own unique tenugui hand towel featuring a bright and vivid pattern with traditional chusen dyeing techniques. It makes for a useful and fun souvenir.
Tenugui towels can be used as hand towels, bandannas, scarves, wrapping material and more, are beautiful and useful gifts. Learn how to create bright patterns using the chusen dyeing technique with an English speaking assistant! Once you completely understand the process, lay the design out onto your cloth, and then create your personal towel. Open to groups and solo travelers, have fun printing the seasonal whimsical designs on the cotton towels. Thanks to the amazing thinness of a tenugui, it dries quickly enough to take home on the same day.

title: One Day Kyoto Premium Sightseeing Tour from Tokyo by Shinkansen Bullet Train
description:
Set out from Tokyo to Kyoto, where you can travel in the gorgeous history of Japan. See the ancient capital's beautiful shrines and temples with your English speaking guide.
Looking for a day trip from Tokyo to Kyoto? Look no further! This tour whisks you away on the Nozomi, Japan’s fastest bullet train. Speed down to Kyoto and visit some of the most famous temples and shrines in the country! After you arrive in Kyoto, you will be welcomed with a buffet-style lunch, perfect for giving you the energy for the day. Begin at the Heian Jingu Shrine, built to commemorate the 1,100th anniversary of the city of Kyoto. Of course, no trip to Kyoto is complete without visiting both Sanjusangendo and Kiyomizudera Temple. The latter boasts spectacular panoramic views of the city.
An ideal tour for mature visitors who would like to explore Kyoto at a reasonable pace.

title: Half Day Glass Blowing Workshop for All Ages in Yamakita
description: Create a unique and personal drinking glass in a simple class perfect for all ages. Children as young as 4 can join in, making this a family friendly activity.

title: Entry Tickets for Historic Theme Park Ise Bunkamura in Ise City
description:
Enjoy a quick and simple way to get your tickets for Ise Azuchimomoyama Bunkamura, a them park built around a castle replica. Watch fun live performances and get a feel for the history of Japan.
You can feel as if you were in the warring states period on entering the village located in the magnificent landscape of Ise-Shima with a vast area of about 330,000 square meters.
Get around within the village with the Ryoga Bus.

title: Fishing Tours for All Levels on Yonaguni Island
description: From experienced anglers to beginners, we have plans that anyone can enjoy! Catch fresh fish in the turquoise waters of Okinawa. Your freshly caught fish will be cleaned and filleted for you.

title: Japanese Plastic Food Sample Cake Making Experience in Fukuoka
description:
Create your own plastic food art, and experience this unique bit of local culture! Make a cute cake, and decorate it to perfection. Great for kids!
At Japanese restaurants you will often see plastic food in the display windows, which let potential customers know what the dishes actually look like. A big hit with visitors from abroad, now you can try making your own version of these neat food samples. Create a super realistic cake, a cool unique souvenir of Japan!

title: Industrial Revolution and World Heritage Private Sightseeing Taxi Tour in Saga
description: Get deep into Japan's history with a visit to the oldest Western style wooden building and a number of other World Heritage Sites. Full day and overnight courses available.

title: Fun Powered Tandem Paraglider Flight in Joso Ibaraki
description: Strap in with a veteran instructor and fly through the sky! Each flight is different, from exciting low altitude hops to relaxing birds-eye sightseeing flights.

title: Beach and Boat Scuba Diving for Licensed Divers on Kume Island
description: Enjoy the sea of Kumejima Island with fabulous dives into the tropical waters. We welcome solo divers or beginners with a fresh license as well as advanced divers.

title: Half Day Snorkeling Adventure on Kume Island
description: Experience the undersea world around Kumejima Island. Even people who cannot swim can join, take a peek at the tropical world of the fish with the experienced staff.

title: Full Day Tour of the Seto Inland Sea Islands by Bike and Kayak
description:
Bike around the Shiwaku Islands, Shimanami Kaido, Tobishima Kaido or Shodo Island! Explore the beautiful Seto Inland Sea by kayak, for a full day of fun.
Choose from one of four locations, to customize the tour to your interests! Explore the best sights around the Seto Inland Sea, for a more rural experience of Japan.

title: Half Day Welcome Mirror Crafting Workshop in Kotokuji
description: Make a welcome mirror with your partner before your wedding ceremony, and add any design you like on it. Turn a plain mirror into a lifetime treasure.

title: Private Taxi Transfer to and from Saga Airport and Takeo Onsen Station
description: Hop on a taxi and make your way to the Ureshino hot springs straight from the sky or land. Convenient transfers from Saga Airport and JR Takeo Onsen Station are available.

title: Cute Kimono Rental and Dressing in Yanagawa
description: Go sightseeing around Dazaifu and Yanagawa dressed in a beautiful kimono! Choose your favorite pattern, then enjoy taking pictures around the town.

title: Half Day Kayak Tour for Beginners on River or Lake in Hachinohe
description: Enjoy a half day tour starting from the basics of paddling, so even beginners can jump in. The guides will help you enjoy the outdoors with no worries.

title: Pottery Making Experience in Ishikawa Prefecture
description: Perfect for kids and first-timers! Learn how to use a potter's wheel and create your own lovely bowls, cups and more! Located in Kakuho, Ishikawa.

title: Half Day Beginner Friendly Horseback Riding Experience in Akita
description: Sit back on a horse and relax as you trot through the field of Akita on a horse. Ride safely and smoothly as your friendly guide will hold the resigns.

title: Airport Transfers by Private Taxi for Kochi
description: Our friendly drivers will pick you up and take you to your desired hotel or other location in Kochi. Wheelchair accessible vans available!

title: Outdoor Group Barbecue Experience at Nishiyamada Farm in Saga City
description: Go outdoors on a sunny day with your friends and family to enjoy a day of grilling tasty meats and vegetables on a barbecue grill. Bring your own drinks and have a memorable time.

title: Easy Half Day Chartered Sightseeing Taxi in Kashima
description: Set out on a cultural tour that includes the huge Yutoku Inari Shrine. After that, head to Hama Sakakura street, where traditional breweries are waiting.

title: Taxi Tour the Homeland of the Last Samurai Tsugunosuke Kawai
description: Explore the birth place of the samurai, Tsugunosuke Kawai who served the Makino clan  almost 200 years ago. Trace back his life in Nagaoka city through your tour.

title: Private Shore Excursion Tour of Nagasaki in English with Port Transfers
description: Trace back the history of Nagasaki on a convenient taxi tour from Nagasaki Port. Stop by the iconic Peace Park, Glover Garden, Confucian Shrine and many more with an English-speaking driver.

title: Half-day Pilgrimage Taxi Tour Around 7 Places in Sanuki
description:
Experience a traditional pilgrimage route with a convenient taxi to 7 places including Zentsuji, where Kukai was born. A driver who is very knowledgeable about the pilgrimage will guide you.
Shikoku is famous for Ohenro pilgrimages and udon noodles. In this course, you can go around 7 places in 4 hours. A driver in the traditional pilgrimage costume will guide you on a lovely taxi, and we can loan out pilgrim’s outfit for you. Enjoy a pilgrimage tour! This course is also recommendable to people who want to visit temples for sightseeing, and to savor Sanuki udon.

title: Chartered Taxi Tour of Hirado City in Nagasaki
description: Explore the historical trade port city of Hirado. Hop on a private taxi to witness the historical buildings with Chinese, Portuguese and Dutch architecture influences.

title: Heian Costume Kimono Wearing Experience on Miyajima
description:
Try taking a photo dressed up in a gorgeous kimono on Miyajima. The classic kimono and natural beauty make it feel as if you are an aristocrat travelling through time.
Special Value Plan!
Transfer your gorgeous kimono photo onto a local rice scoop as a unique souvenir and save. Your kimono dressing fee will be discounted 300 JPY!
*Photo transfer fee varies by size of rice scoop.
*Discount is already displayed in the prices shown.

title: Value Yunessun and Mori no yu Passport Entry with Lunch in Hakone
description:
Enjoy a discount ticket with full entry to every bath and swimming pool in both Yunessun and Mori no yu, along with lunch at the Fontana restaurant.
Whether winter or summer, the waters of Hakone are waiting for you. Yunessun and Mori no yu feature a huge range of indoor and outdoor baths with stunning landscapes and unique themes. Try a soak in coffee, tea, wine, or even Japanese sake baths, or head for a dip in a natural cedar tub. Lunch at the restaurant Fontana is included, and you can walk right in, still in your bathing suit.

title: Chartered Taxi Tour of the Sea of Japan Coastline from Shinai
description: Enjoy the panoramic view along the Chokai Blueline road and drive along the sea of Japan. Stop by historic and beautiful scenic points from Fukura to Kisakata city.

title: Half Day Snorkeling Adventure in Ubara
description: Join us in the Boso Sea for a safe and fun snorkeling tour. Discover fish and wildlife in the water and have fun swimming and playing too.

title: Two-Hour Private Taxi Tour to Tottori's Sand Dunes or Fish Market
description: Venture out on a comfortable taxi to the famous sand dunes to witness the panoramic, desert-like scenery or enjoy tasting snow crabs and other seafood from the Sea of Japan.

title: Make All Natural Jam, Pickles and Dried Fruit in Saga City
description: Cook up your very own all-natural jam using fresh fruit to take home. Or learn traditional methods of making Japanese style pickles or seasonal dried permission.

title: Half Day Private Chartered Sightseeing Taxi in Takeo City
description: Discover lovely Takeo City in Saga. Visit the Shidayaki Pottery Kiln, where high quality ceramics are still produced with traditional attention to quality.

title: Chartered 4 Hour Taxi Sightseeing Tour in Chichibu
description: See the sights of Chichibu with a private taxi. Whether a more active time picking fruit and playing, or a quieter time exploring, there are courses for everyone.

title: Easy Car Rental Service from Narita Airport
description: Drive around Tokyo or head towards more rural areas on a convenient car or minivan straight from Narita Airport. Helpful English GPS and road service will make it easy for you to navigate!

title: Winter Morning Ducky Raft River Cruise in Obihiro
description:
Enjoy the beautiful winter scenery as you cruise along the Obihiro River in a ducky raft. Catch a glimpse of the frosty landscape and several swans along the way. Afterward, enjoy a relaxing tea time.
Cruise down the Obihiro River in a ducky raft for a peaceful morning soaking in the beautiful winter landscape. A great option for families as children over 3 are welcome to participate.

title: Relaxing One Hour Bay Cruise in Katsuura
description: Feel the comfortable Pacific Ocean sea breeze as you cruise around the calm Katsuura Bay. Stop in at the largest underwater observation tower in East Asia and get a fish eye view.

title: Popular Sightseeing Areas of Sakata City on a Private Taxi
description: Take a cruise around the city of Sakata and discover the history of the area visually by visiting temples and traditional houses on a comfortable taxi.

title: Fudasho Temple and Shrine Pilgrimage Sightseeing Taxi
description:
Cruise down the roads of Chichibu and feel the history of the region as you visit a number of Fudasho, temples and shrines that sold charms to pilgrims.
Choose from three courses on your journey. Course A  visits about half of the Chichibu Fudasho temples and shrines. Course B visit Fudasho in the mountain area, while Course C takes you to places on Course B and Mistumine Shrine.

title: Private Oboke and Iya Valley Sightseeing Taxi Full Day Charter
description: Skilled and knowledgeable local drivers will guide you to highlights and hidden spots alike to discover Oboke and Iya Valley outside of guidebooks.

title: Kumano-Kodo and Hongu Taisha Shrine Walking Tour with English-speakiing Guide
description:
Embark on a pilgrimage to Kumano Hongu Shrine using the Kumano Kodo path. Hike through ancient forests lined with beautiful trees with your guide until your arrival at the shrine's massive torii gate.
Kumano Taishi is the headquarters of the Kumano Shrine and has 3000 smaller shrines spread across the country. The shrine dates back over 900 years and along with Hayatama Taisha and Nachi Taisha, is one of the top 3 shrines in Kumano.

title: Vegetable Harvesting and Barbecue Experience on a Farm in Chiba
description: Enjoy a day outdoors to experience picking fresh fruit and seasonal vegetables on a farm to taste on the spot. Grill it as a barbecue or take it back to savor them at home.

title: Indoor Swim School Lessons for Swimming With Dolphin in Urayasu
description: Learn the skills to swim with dolphins. From beginner courses to advanced skin diving, you can learn how to smoothly swim in the water and have fun.

title: Discover Traditional Japanese Porcelain on a Private Taxi in Saga
description: Stop by before or after your trip to the Ureshino hot springs to discover the beauty of Arita porcelain and Imari porcelain with transfers to the Saga Airport or Nagasaki Airport.

title: Seniors Surf and Body Board School in Ichikawa
description: You are never too old to have fun in the sun and on the water. For riders ages 60 and up, enjoy a surfing or body boarding lesson and feel young again.

title: Himeji Castle and Akashi Kaikyo Bridge World Heritage Walking Tour from Kyoto
description:
Enjoy easy departure from Kyoto as you head to one of Japan's most iconic sights, Himeji Castle! Walk part of Akashi Kaikyo Bridge, the world's longest suspension bridge, hanging over the water.
Discover Himeji, home to the "White Heron Castle". See the castle up close, then later, take a stroll around the vast grounds of Kokoen Garden and enjoy the beautiful scenery of the historic Japanese garden along with views Himeji Castle nestled away in the surrounding landscape.

title: Kobe Beef and Night View Special Private Tour
description:
See and taste the best of Kobe with a private guided tour. Enjoy shopping at Harborland, then dine on certified Kobe beef and see the night skyline.
Delight in a half day tour of fine shopping at the hundreds of trendy boutiques, shops, and restaurants at Kobe Harborland. After shopping or relaxing, head for one of the certified Kobe beef specialty stores, where a truly award winning dinner awaits. Savor the melt in your mouth softness and subtle sweetness of the beef, and indulge in a wonderful dinner, then head out to see the "ten million dollar view" of the night time skyline and lights of the city surrounded by the sea and mountains.

title: Morning Tour of Historical Kanazawa with an English-Speaking Guide
description: Slip back in time to the era of the samurai on a bus tour around the city of Kanazawa. Visit the castle, Kenrokuen Garden, geisha houses and more, all with an informative English-speaking guide.

title: Half-Day Historical Shirakawa-go Village Tour on a Private Taxi
description: Cruise through the scenic route on the Shirakawa-go White Road and make your way toward the ancient village with unique architecture surrounded by nature.

title: Traditional Kaga Embroidery Handcraft Lesson in Kanazawa
description: Create a cute ornaments like a key holder, hair clip or other shapes using traditional Kaga embroidery techniques. Passed down for centuries, this style will bring a smile to your face.

title: Three Hour Local Sightseeing Taxi in Kamakura
description: See a new side of Kamakura with an in-depth taxi tour to some of the more hidden spots. If you have visited Kamakura before, discover a brand new view!

title: Stand Up Paddle Board (SUP) Yoga Class in Zushi Bay
description: For a truly fun workout, enjoy yoga directly on the ocean of Zushi! The stable paddle boards and on-land warm up mean that even beginners to SUP can participate.

title: Rickshaw Tours of Otaru
description: Explore the charming port town of Otaru on a swift and comfortable rickshaw, and enjoy a taste of Japanese culture while seeing the best sights!

title: Cruise Lake Biwa on a Paddle Steamer with Lunch
description: Cruise wide Lake Biwa on a classic style paddle steamer. Choose from an 80 minute relaxing course, or a speedier  60 minute course and enjoy the panoramic view from the sky deck.

title: Half Day Tottori Dune and Sanin Kaigan Chartered Tour from Tottori
description:
Discover the beauty of cliff, wind, and wave with a trip to the largest sand dunes of Japan and the Sanin Kaigan cliffs, where waves crash and break in a natural symphony.
Some of the highlights of this course include the Tottori Dunes, the largest sand dune in all Japan. Formed over 100,000 years as the Chiyo River and winds pile and arrange sand, this is a sandy beach dune on an unbelievable scale.

The Sanin Kaigan cliffs are a sight of love to the great writer Toson Shimazaki. Formed by the rough waves of the Sea of Japan, wind, and snow, the seawater is startlingly clear, down to 25 meters. See the rugged and stark beauty of the cliffs for yourself.

title: Private Transfers to or from Yokohama and Narita Airport with English Support
description: Take a comfortable private ride from your Yokohama hotel to Narita Airport or vice versa. Enjoy the journey that is perfect for families, couples and groups hoping to travel with ease.

title: Evening Kojo Yakei Sparkling Factory Night Cruise in Yokohama
description:
At night the factories of Kawasaki transform into glowing pieces of art, with gleaming steel and mists of steam combining with changing lights and more to create a unique romantic scene from industry.
Discover the hit new craze of Japan, a 90 minute cruise that takes you drifting past factories of twisting pipes and towering castles of steel. Sparkling in the dark, reflecting dramatically on the night sea, these normally hectic hives of industry transform into dramatic man made art installations. The glow of lights, spouting flames, spreading steam, and mazes of ladders transform into unearthly structures that seem to be suspended in the air, and the scenery is surprisingly romantic. Hop on board tonight for a modern Japanese twist on a romantic night cruise.

title: Miyajima, Itsukushima Shrine and Mt. Misen Hike Tour (English or French Guide)
description: Visit one of the most scenic places in Japan, Itsukushima Shrine and marvel at the towering Grand Torii. Visit Daishoin Temple before  hiking up Mount Misen for an overlooking view of Seto Inland Sea.

title: Car Rental Services from Nagoya Station
description: Rent a car in Nagoya and make your way around Chubu to its beautiful landmarks like Nagoya Castle, and Korankei Gorge. Or, take a trip to the Kansai area and enjoy traditional Kyoto or bustling Osaka.

title: Classic Kimono Bustle Dress Photo Shoot Experience in Yokohama
description:
Dress up in a gorgeous bustle dress with kimono elements for a special photo session by historical buildings in Yokohama. Enjoy a unique transformation session with helpful English assistance.
Over 150 years ago, Japan first opened its doors to the outside world to welcome Western culture. In the mid 1800's the first western bustle-dress store opened in Yokohama, which spread rapidly among Japanese women. Dresses were significantly different from the kimono and was a challenge for Japanese women to wear and get used to. That is when dresses were created using kimono fabric for Japanese women to comfortably wear. 
Take this is opportunity to wear a piece of history in Yokohama where many retro buildings still remain. Bring back beautiful photos in a modernized kimono bustle dress as a memorable souvenir of Japan.

title: Full Day Free Diving Specialty Practice Course in Urayasu
description: Free diving is competitive sport to enjoy diving in one breath and challenge your limits. Learn the basics of free diving in a safe in-depth full day lesson.

title: Relax and Refresh at the Masutomi Hot Springs in Yamanashi
description: Focusing on the balance of the body the soul with a refreshing experience outdoors. Enjoy a lunch set made from local products then take a relaxing dip in the hot springs.

title: Soar Over Tokyo with a Paragliding Tandem Flight Experience in Uenohara
description: Lift off into the sky and glide over the lush forests of Yamanashi on this exciting paragliding adventure! Enjoy a day in nature just a stone's throw from Tokyo.

title: Kimono or Hakama Dressing and Rental in Yokohama
description:
Yokohama is an ideal day trip from Tokyo, and a fun place to explore while dressed in a gorgeous kimono. Experience wearing Japan's traditional outfit, and have fun taking pictures around the city!
Filled with lovely parks and retro buildings, Yokohama is a great spot to explore and experience a different side of Japanese culture. While kimono are a fun choice, why not try the more unusual 'hakama', a split skirt and kimono combination that became popular during the Meiji era, and is still worn for university graduations!

title: Make a Silver Ring with Cubic Zirconia in Yokohama
description: Using silver clay, even beginners can create a pretty silver ring in just 2 hours! Decorate the ring with zirconia crystals, with 7 colors to choose from.

title: Short Private Sightseeing Taxi Tour of Yokohama
description: See all the top sights of Yokohama in 2 hours on this fun private charter tour! From historical buildings to elegant ships, enjoy the best of the city.

title: Stylish Kimono Rental and Dressing near Dazaifu Station
description: Experience a beautiful kimono or hakama transformation and enjoy a scenic stroll in Dazaifu. Take memorable photos outside or have professional photos taken in a studio to take home.

title: Private 3 Hour Taxi Charter to Ryoma Sakamoto Sights in Kochi
description: See the sights related to Kochi's most famous son, Ryoma Sakamoto, on this private chartered taxi tour. Ideal for groups and visitors with limited mobility.

title: Japanese Plastic Food Sample Art Experience in Nagoya
description:
Japan's food samples have become famous worldwide. Try your hand at creating your own plastic food art, and experience this unique bit of local culture in Nagoya!
Choose your favorite treat to create, from dainty fruit tarts to bowls of ramen! The faux foods are a neat souvenir, and are realistic enough to trick friends and family. Artistic skills are not required, and children are welcome! A big hit with visitors from abroad, now you can try making your own version of these neat food samples.

title: Kaikaro Teahouse Tour and Japanese Sweets in Kanazawa
description:
Visit a 190 year old historic tea house in Kanazawa and taste the deep flavors of matcha green tea along with traditional gold leaf dusted Japanese sweets for an authentic experience.
Designated as a Important Cultural Property by Kanazawa City, Kaikaro is the largest teahouse in the Kanazawa region, and boasts a history of over 190 years. Explore the authentic chaya teahouse featuring tatami mats decorated in gold-leaf-coated mizuhiki cord and vermilion‐lacquered walls distinctive of the Kanazawa region.

title: Beginner Hand Forming Pottery Lesson in Ishikawa
description: Fun for  kids and first-timers, learn how to create handmade dishes as presents for your family and friends. Come and visit our pottery studio Uminosora!

title: Thrilling Flyboard Adventure in Kamakura
description: Just an hour away from central Tokyo you can lift off into the air on a Flyboard! Race above and dive under the waves in this hit new sport.

title: Dried Flower Arrangement and Crafting Courses in English in Nagoya
description: Enjoy a hand crafting experinece to make a lamp, wreath, terrarium or accessories using natural dried flowers from Hokkaido. Great for personalized gifts or souvenirs.

title: Handmade DIY Crafting Experience with English Assistance in Nagoya
description: Enjoy making easy crafts for your home or for yourself. Select from a variety of courses such as making snow globes, terrariums, resin jewelry, journals and many more.

title: Half Day Sea Kayak Lesson and Island Tour from Zushi
description: Perfect for people new to sea kayaking, you can combine an easy lesson with a fun island tour. Discover bright and clear waters as you paddle over the water.

title: Half-Day or Full-Day Sea Kayaking Experience in Zushi
description: Enjoy a day time sea kayak adventure in Zushi Bay, and see the marine life up close! Beginners are more than welcome, come learn the basics of kayaking.

title: Family Friendly Fun Beach Snorkeling Adventure on Shimoji Island
description: Come enjoy the breathtaking view of Kyafa Beach where hundreds of species of fish swim among tons of corals, creating amazing views when snorkeling or kayaking.

title: Beginner Kiteboard Experience in Miyako Island
description: Learn from experienced teachers as you soar through the land, sea and air on a kite board in the most beautiful sea of Miyako island in Okinawa.

title: Samurai Discovery Full Day Walking Tour in Nagoya
description:
Walk through time on a historical tour of Nagoya, featuring the samurai era castle and the ultra modern Sakae region, along with the Osu Kannon Temple.
Nagoya is Japan's fourth largest city, conveniently located along the Tokaido Shinkansen bullet train line. More than just a transportation hub, Nagoya fascinates visitors with its unique combination of rich historical legacy and high-tech industrial development. The coexistence of old monuments and modern-day districts creates a specific atmosphere that summarizes the best of the varied experiences Japan offers. In Nagoya you can hop between the centuries while casually walking around the city's central area. Here you can not only visit famous sightseeing spots, but also see the life of local people and learn much about Japan's history and traditions. 

In this one-day walking tour you will visit Nagoya's best known attractions with a professional guide. You will be introduced to the highlights of Nagoya Castle, Sakae downtown area, and Osu district. At the end of the day you will know a lot more about Japan's samurai history and the lifestyle of the area.

title: Gel Candle Making Experience in Otaru
description: Make an original gel candle using cute glass figurines, with a choice of over 100. A great break from sightseeing for kids, and a fun souvenir for guests of all ages!

title: Retro Day Cruise on the Otaru Canal
description:
Cruise down the Otaru Canal as you check out the scenery from the water. Classic warehouses line the canal, creating a retro atmosphere to enjoy as you learn about the town.
See the sights of Otaru from the water, and take gorgeous pictures from a whole new perspective.

title: 4 Hour Private Charter Taxi Tour around Abashiri
description: This private sightseeing taxi tour can take you to and from Memanbetsu Airport. See the best sights of Abashiri and the area nearby, including the Sea of Okhotsk, Kitami, Saromako, Sharicho and more.

title: Hourly Chartered Taxi Sightseeing Course in Eastern Shizuoka
description: Cruise around in a private taxi on your own personal tour of Eastern Shizuoka. Select your own itinerary and let your experienced driver get you there.

title: Full Day Temple and Shrine Sightseeing Taxi from Nara to Kyoto
description: Make your from Nara to Kyoto, stopping along the way to visit World Heritage sites and classic shrines and temples as you travel. Convenient drop-off at Kyoto Station.

title: Relaxed Tea Ceremony Experience in Nara
description: Enjoy a traditional Japanese tea ceremony in a relaxing atmosphere. Sip a cup of matcha tea, and learn about this elegant art of hospitality.

title: Private Customized Taxi Tour Around Yokohama
description:
Spend a full day or half-day touring around the city of Yokohama and visit places of your choice right from your hotel. This hassle-free taxi charter includes English support for your peace of mind.
Travel in comfort on a convenient taxi which will take you around all the hottest spots of Yokohama. Customize your own self-guided tour around the city or consult with an English-speaking assistant to find places of your interest.

title: Reservations for an Owl, Falcon and Hawk Cafe in Yokohama
description: Conveniently located near the Yokohama Chinatown, spend time with rare birds of prey, including cute owls and cool falcons! Get up-close to pet and take photos with these majestic feathery creatures.

title: Convenient Car Rentals from Hakodate Station
description: Tour around the popular bay area of Hokkaido on a car. With a handy English GPS, visit Goryokaku or drive up Mr. Hakodate to witness the gorgeous city night view.

title: Tour Around Onuma Quasi-National Park on a Private Taxi
description: Just outside of Hakodate, visit Onuma city and the Quasi-National Park. Enjoy the natural scenery on a comfortable taxi along with tasting local foods and visiting famous spots.

title: Shimanto Houseboat Course by Private Taxi from Kochi (6 Hours)
description: Head towards the beautiful clear Shimanto River, to experience a cruise and maybe try the famous local eel! A great tour for nature lovers.

title: Two Dives in Futo, Yawatano, or Kawana from Tokyo
description: Transport service from central Tokyo to the dive spots. Futo is one of the best spots in Higashi-Izu. You can see many fish at Kawana. Enjoy the ocean!

title: 7.5 Hour World Heritage Site and Horyuji Temple Sightseeing Taxi Tour in Nara
description: Smoothly and comfortably travel between a number of temples, shrines and other ancient sites in Nara on a full day taxi tour of this historic city.

title: Nara Afternoon Tour to Todaiji Temple and Kasuga Taisha Shrine from Osaka
description:
Spend an afternoon visiting Nara’s most beautiful sights such as the Kasuga Shrine and Todaiji Temple's giant Buddha while mingling with Nara’s famous deer.
A visit to the "must-see" Todaiji Temple is first up on this afternoon tour to scenic Nara. Todaiji is the world’s largest wooden building, and houses a 15m bronze Buddha, the largest in Japan.

After seeing Todaiji Temple, head to Nara Park to soak in the beauty of park and mingle with the city’s most famous inhabitants, the deer! They are considered messengers to the gods of nearby Kasuga Taisha Shrine, decorated with a myriad of bronze and stone lanterns.

title: Niseko Private Charter Taxi Tour (2 or 8 Hours)
description:
Visit the mountains and hot springs of Niseko, or check out the Arai Memorial Museum of Art's collection of Picasso block prints on this private tour!
Discover all the best sights in Niseko on a private charter tour of this beautiful mountain area. Your licensed taxi guide will be happy to customize the tour to your interests!

title: Full-Day Sightseeing Tour from Shirahama to Nara on Chartered Taxi
description: Comfortably travel as a family or for business while journeying out to Totsukawa and Nara area from Wakayama. Pick your own course and stop by locations of your choice on a taxi.

title: Chartered Taxi Sightseeing in Kumano City and Ise-Shima Area
description: Tour around the Shirahama area on a comfortable chartered taxi. Get the most out of your visit in Wakayama by customizing your destination and routes for sightseeing or even for business.

title: Kumano-Kodo Walking Tour with Daimon-Zaka, Nachi Taisha Shrine and Nachi Falls
description:
Join a walking tour of the Kumano Kodo pilgrimage path with an English-speaking guide. Hike the Daimon-Zaka slope and visit Nachi Taisha Shrine to see its beautiful buildings and stunning Nachi Falls.
To visit the Nachi Taisha Shrine and falls, most people choose to use a car. Instead of getting behind the wheel, why not walk this historic road lined with cedar groves, following in the footsteps of pilgrims?

At 133 meters, the Nachi Falls are the tallest waterfall in Japan, and have been venerated for centuries.

title: Half-Day Hakodate and Onuma Tour on a Private Taxi
description: Enjoy visiting highlights of Hokkaido with convenient airport transfers. Visit famous spots such as the Orthodox Church in Hakodate or  cruising around Onuma.

title: Bird Watching Tour in Nemuro
description: Enjoy wild bird watching in Nemuro, an area famous for having over 360 kinds of birds, about two thirds of Japan's wild birds! From summer to winter, you can see them in all seasons.

title: Half Day Glass Working Workshops and Lessons in Karuizawa
description: Choose from glass blowing, sand blasting, or carving and create a unique piece of art as a long-lasting souvenir. Great for families or tourists.

title: Star Gazing Night Tour on Ishigaki Island
description:
Relax under the starry night sky on Ishigaki Island, the only place in Japan where you can see the Southern Cross and view the dazzling constellations.
The Yaeyama Islands and Ishigaki Island are the southernmost parts of Japan, just 24 degrees north of the equator. This locations means the Southern Cross, and a total of 84 of the 88 modern constellations can be seen on clear nights! Join us on a star gazing tour, where it looks like you can reach out and touch the glittering jewels of the sky.

title: Private Taxi Tour to Red-Crested White Cranes Preserve from Kushiro
description: Kushiro is famous for the local red-crested white cranes in the Tanchozuru Natural Park. If you are lucky, you may catch a sight of them being fed or see them fight off hawks and eagles.

title: Sea Kayaking and Mangrove Kayaking Tour of Iriomote Island
description: Enjoy an introduction to sea kayaking for beginners and cross the Funauki Gulf before getting on a kayak heading to Mizuochi Waterfall and seeing mangroves.

title: Private Taxi Tour to Lake Akan from Kushiro (7 hours)
description:
Visit the beautiful Lake Akan, located in a National Park established back in 1938! Great to get a taste for the wilder side of Hokkaido.
See tranquil Lake Akan, and keep an eye out for the cute marimo seaweed!

title: Ishigakijima Half-Day Snorkeling Tour (Morning or Afternoon)
description:
Snorkel to your heart's content in Ishigaki's clear waters on this half-day tour, among coral reefs and tropical fish. Solo travelers and groups welcome!

See the colorful tropical fish, sea turtles and coral reefs for which the island in justly famous. The captain will choose the best snorkeling spot based on ocean conditions and weather, to make sure you see the best marine life possible. First time snorkeling? No problem! Our instructors will teach you the basics and stay right by your side, while wetsuits will help keep you afloat.

title: Wind Surfing Full Day Trial Lesson for Beginners in Zushi
description: Get onto the waves and feel the rush of the wind with this one day trial lesson. Our staff is here to support you so you can refresh yourself as you skim the waves.

title: Stand Up Paddleboard Active Excursion in Kamakura Zushi
description: Try out the latest fun on the waves, SUP. Stand up paddleboarding is easy to learn and great way to have fun while exercising and playing in the water.

title: Six Hour Sightseeing Taxi Tour to Horyuji Temple and Nara Park from Nara
description: Starting from Horyuji Temple, visit many other ancient temples on an early morning course designed to beat the crowds. Discover Nara at a quiet time.

title: Sushi Chef for a Day! Learn to Make Sushi in Izu
description:
Pop on the sushi chef hat and cooking coat! Using the freshest fish from Izu, learn to make your own nigiri sushi  and taste what you make on the spot!
Select your favorites from a wide range of the seafood from Izu to make your own sushi. Learn how to handle the rice that was harvested from Ishikawa prefecture to compliment the fresh fish. Unify all the ingredients with traditional vinegar and wasabi grown in Izu to create delicious nigiri style sushi. Feel like a professional chef by wearing the traditional sushi chef hat and coat. You can even take the sushi chef hat with you so you can continue your sushi experiments at home!

title: Half Day Sightseeing Bus Tour of Atami on the Izu Peninsula
description:
See the best of the seaside town of Atami on this bus tour! Ride the Atami Ropeway, visit Kinomiya Shrine and stroll through beautiful gardens.
This budget-friendly morning tour will take you to all the best sights in Atami! Ride the ropeway up to Atami Castle, circle the famous tree at Kinomiya Shrine, and enjoy some time in either Atami Ume Garden or Himenosawa Park. Finish your tour with a trip to the Jikkoku Mountain Pass, where on clear days you can see Mt. Fuji.

title: Short Horse Back Riding Trail Experience in Minakami
description: Available to children and those who have never ridden a horse before, go for a short lead trail ride through the quiet forests of Minakami.

title: Guided Tour of Kirin or Asahi Beer Factory in Nagoya
description:
Enjoy Japan's best beers and tour the Kirin Beer or Asahi Beer factory. Watch the process of how the beer is made with the help of your guide and finish off the tour with 3 free glasses of the beer.
You can choose which factory you would like to tour - Kirin or Asahi. Your English-speaking guide will help you along as you watch and learn about the brewing process. Unwind after your walk around the factory with 3 complimentary glasses of your choice of beer.

title: Private Transfer Service from Chubu International Airport to Nagoya Hotels
description:
Make your way from Chubu Airport (NGO) to your hotel in Nagoya with ease, thanks to this private transfer service. Relax after a long flight, and forget about dealing with heavy luggage! 
This all-inclusive service makes getting to your hotel in Nagoya a breeze! Highway tolls, parking fees and Meet & Greet fees are all included.

title: Japanese Shodo Calligraphy Lesson for Beginners in Nagoya
description: Experiment using black ink and a calligraphy brush to learn to write your own name in Japanese. Enjoy the art of kanji writing, then take your written works home as a souvenir.

title: Half Day Culture Tour Around Popular Sightseeing Spots of Nagoya
description:
Drop into the heart of Nagoya with your guide and visit the historical and local highlights such as Nagoya castle and the Osu Shopping District for a taste of real Japan.
Visit the highlights of one of the busiest cities of Japan. Filled with many corporations and industries, Nagoya is the third largest metropolitan region of Japan, but maintains a distinct local flavor all its own. Begin your tour by exploring the massive grounds of Nagoya Castle and while browsing through the exhibits. Then make your way down to Osu where you can give your prayers at the Osu Kannon Temple and shop around the massive shopping district with over 1,200 shops. Find out more about this influential city with your knowledgeable local guide.

title: Small Group Beginner's Peaceful Tea Ceremony Experience in Nara
description: Soothe your mind with an elegant and peaceful tea ceremony in historic Nara, a short walk from Todaiji Temple. Located in a Showa era building, this tea ceremony takes you back to a quieter time.

title: Day Trip to Biwako Valley Ski Resort with Ropeway and Snowland Entry Tickets
description: Board the bus for a day trip to Biwako Valley Ski Resort in Shiga. Enjoy one of two ski plans each with a lift ticket, ropeway fee and entrance to the Snowland amusement park included.

title: Full Day Osaka Walking Tour with English-Speaking Guide from Kyoto
description:
Head to Osaka for a day-trip through one of Japan’s most important cities! See the city from Floating Obsevatory, visit Osaka Castle and take a river cruise.
Originally named "Naniwa", Osaka was the capital of Japan from 683 to 745, and remained an important hub for land, sea, and river-canal transportation even after the capital moved. No tour of Osaka is complete without a trip to Osaka Castle and the surrounding Nishinomaru Garden, which has over 4000 cherry trees.

Next visitors are treated to 360-degree panoramic views of the city from the Aerial Garden Observatory. Filled with waterways, a boat tour is a wonderful opportunity to appreciate views of Osaka from a different perspective. Come visit this energetic city!

title: All Level Tropical Scuba Diving Tours on Iriomote Island
description: Under the sea of Iriomote Island is a majestic world full of bright coral and lively fish just waiting to be seen during a friendly half or full day scuba dive.

title: Night Safari Forest Discovery Tour from Ishigaki City
description: Walk out into the tropical forests of Ishigaki and join a guide in discovering some of the hundreds of animal species that make Ishigaki Island their home!

title: Half Day Reef Snorkeling Adventure in Ishigaki
description: Discover the vibrant and colorful world of coral reefs near Ishigaki Island on a half day tour with a skilled instructor. Get off the beach and into the water!

title: Half Day Jungle Trek and Waterfall Tour
description: Explore the tropics on a fun and easy trekking tour. Walk through the jungle and streams as you make your way to to a waterfall you can play under!

title: Full Day Private Chartered Taxi Nature Sightseeing Tour of Furano and Biei
description: Set out with easy pick-up from Otaru or Sapporo and visit a variety of places including Asahiyama Zoo, the Hill of Ken & Mary, or the Kitanokunikara Museum.

title: Private Asahiyama Zoo Full Day Private Taxi Tour
description:
This private charter tour will take you to see the northernmost zoo in Japan, Asahiyama Zoo! You can also check out other nearby sights, all at your own pace.
The licensed taxi guides will be happy to take you to meet the huge polar bears, cute penguins and other inhabitants of Asahiyama Zoo! No need to worry about renting a car or keeping up with a group tour, take your time exploring.

title: Personal Glass Sandblasting Experience in Minakami
description: Set up a unique design with a variety of stickers, then frost the glass with a special sandblaster. Enjoy a uniquely personal glass to take home.

title: Trekking Adventure to Yaku Cedar Land or Western Forest Trail in Yakushima
description: Yakushima is known for the colossal Yaku Cedars that are said to be over 1,000 years old. Witness the rare scenery created by mother nature in the world heritage site.

title: Kobe Sightseeing and Nada Sake Brewery Walking Tour from Osaka
description:
Head for Kobe to see the city highlights, and out to Nada, where Japanese sake is lovingly brewed by masters of the craft on a full day tour.
From high rises to gentle parks, Kobe is home to a huge variety of wonderful spots, and your guide is out to show them off! After a buffet lunch, head out to Nada, where Japanese sake is carefully brewed, and enjoy both a tour and tasting.

title: Pocket Wifi Rental in Osaka with Hotel Delivery (2-Day to 30-Day Plans)
description:
Stay connected at all times during your trip to Japan with a portable wifi router. Delivered directly to your hotel or residence, choose from a range of plans, great for both work and vacations.
Get high speed, mobile broadband for your iPad, laptop and smartphone anytime and anywhere in Japan. The Pocket Wifi can quickly create group internet access and individual WiFi hotspots; connect wirelessly to many devices such as iPads, laptops, digital cameras, iPhones, Android phones and game devices to let you play games online, transfer pictures and keep in touch.

Returning the WiFi is easy, with a premade postal form included in the package. All you have to do is take your pocket WiFi and its components, along with the postal form, to the nearest convenience store. You can also drop it off at Yamato Transport Services at major airports, as well as from various spots in the city.
(Please be advised that not all convenience stores will be able to accept the package.)

title: River And Marsh Canoe Tour of Nemuro
description: Discover serene Nemuro by canoe. Head down the river like a salmon as the pristine forest welcomes you. Trace the meandering river and enjoy spotting the local birds.

title: Yakushima Forest Trek with English Speaking Guide and Lunch
description: Discover the best of Yakushima, from magical Shirataniunsuikyou, to Yakusugi Land, or Ryujinsugi with an English speaking guide who will share their passion for adventure.

title: Nabana no Sato Winter Illumination and Mitsui Outlet Shopping Tour from Osaka
description: Take a speedy bus out to the Mitsui Outlet Park to shop around 240 brand-name stores. After sundown, wander into a field of lights at the Nabana no Sato for a dazzling display of Christmas lights!

title: Fashionable Kimono Rental and Dress-up in Shinsaibashi
description: From a collection of nearly 4,000 colorful and decorative kimonos, find a perfect one to embellish yourself in. Go on a stroll through Osaka and take stylish photos during your journey.

title: Double Decker Bus Tour of Osaka's Best Sights
description:
Check out Osaka's top sightseeing spots in just over 1 hour! See Osaka Castle, Dotombori, Tsutenkaku and more. Get a great view from the top of the bus.

This tour includes a multi-lingual audio guide in English, Mandarin, Cantonese and Korean. Choose from a morning or afternoon tour of Osaka's best sights, and make the most of your time in this bustling city. Check out Osaka Castle, Shitennoji Temple and other sights. 

Ideal for visitors with small children, seniors or those don't wish to walk long distances, this convenient tour will allow you to see Osaka's top sights from your bus seat!

title: Half Day Private Walking Shopping Tour of Osaka
description:
Walk through the busy streets of the merchant city of Osaka. From takoyaki makers, lacquer pottery and brand name clothes, there's something for everyone in Osaka!
Visit one of Japan's economic centers and shop through the popular city of Osaka. Formally a merchant town, the busy streets of Osaka still have local old fashioned shops among chic boutiques. Also known as the nation's kitchen, make sure to pick up a few snacks or sample all of the best Osakian cuisine. After some local delicacies, begin your shopping expedition for some cute and fancy Japanese fashions. Find the latest styles and limited seasonal products at Daimaru Shinsaibashi and Midosuji Street.

title: Private Two Day Tour of Mt. Koya with Accommodations at Ekoin Temple
description:
Visit Mt. Koya, home to the Koyasan Shingon Buddhism sect to tour Ekoin and Kongobuji Temples. Stay overnight in Ekoin Temple, and try shojin ryori.
Visit treasures of art and learning alike during a privately guided two day tour of Mt. Koya. Visit the Reihokan Musuem with a 50,000 item collection of historically diverse artifacts. Become part of a rare three dimensional mandala as you walk the Danjo Garan, whose buildings and paths lay out the diagram. Get a small taste of the lifestyle of a pilgrim monk when you stay at Ekoin Temple, and enjoy dining on vegetarian shojin ryori cuisine. This is also your chance to take a rare night time tour of Okunoin and possibly join the monks for morning rituals.

title: Private Taxi Tour of Kushiro National Park and Akan National Park from Kushiro
description: Enjoy the wild nature of Kushiro-shitsugen National Park and Akan National Park, and catch a glimpse of the famous local cranes on this full day taxi tour!

title: Osaka Specialty Takoyaki Making Class with English-Speaking Instructor
description: Try your hand at making Takoyaki, a popular Japanese delicacy made with chunks of octopus and batter. Learn to cook up the Osaka specialty while wearing an elegant Kimono.

title: Osaka Tea Ceremony Experience with Kimono Dress-up
description:
Experience the traditional culture of Japan in the "Way of the Tea," popularly known as Tea Ceremony. Learn to prepare a bowl of matcha green tea while wearing a graceful kimono.
Please note that during hot summer days, you will be wearing a yukata (light cotton kimono) instead of a full kimono.

title: Convenient Car Rental Service in Osaka from Umeda or Namba
description: Get around Osaka the way you want to in a comfortable car or minivan. Tour around the busy streets of Umeda or Namba and make shopping and touring easier with a handy English audio GPS.

title: Kimono Rental and Dressing Experience for Couples in Shinsaibashi
description:
Walk through the busy streets of Osaka in a lovely kimono with your significant other. Have a matching look for a picture-perfect moment during your time in Japan.
Even if your requested time is full, there may be availability before or after your desired time. Please select a second or third choice of your preference.

title: Okonomiyaki Cooking Experience in Shinsaibashi, Osaka
description: Drop in to a friendly café in Shinsaibashi and enjoy cooking the down home soul food of the city. Make new friends as you cook and eat savory okonomiyaki, a real Osaka treat!

title: Full Kimono Rental and Dressing Experience in Osaka
description: Set out around town for sightseeing or a date in a lovely kimono. This includes both the kimono rental and  dressing for a hassle free experience.

title: WiFi Router Rental with Pick-up at Shin-Chitose Airport (2-Day to 30-Day Plans)
description:
Stay connected at all times during your trip to Japan with a portable wifi router you can pick up and drop off at Shin-Chitose Airport. Choose from a range of plans, great for both work and vacations.
Get high speed, mobile broadband for your iPad, laptop and smartphone anytime and anywhere in Japan. The Pocket Wifi can quickly create group internet access and individual WiFi hotspots; connect wirelessly to many devices such as iPads, laptops, digital cameras, iPhones, Android phones and game devices to let you play games online, transfer pictures and keep in touch.

Visit the Baggage Storage counter located on the 1st floor of the domestic terminal for pick-up and drop-off.

title: Glass Wind Chime Blowing Experience in Kitahiroshima
description:
Learn to make elegantglass wind chimes, a popular ornament used during the hot Japanese summer! You will also be able to make your own glass cup too.

The glass atelier is located in Kitahiroshima, which is between Sapporo and New Chitose Airport. Relaxing and educational, this is a great way to spend a few hours in Hokkaido!

title: Glassblowing Class for Beginners in Kitahiroshima
description:
Learn how to blow glass in Hokkaido! Make a glass beer mug, then choose among a glass, paper weight, and single-flower vase as your second project.
The glass atelier is located in Kitahiroshima, which is between Sapporo and New Chitose Airport. Relaxing and educational, this is a great way to spend a few hours in Hokkaido!

title: Wi-Fi Router Rental Service with Unlimited Data in Hokkaido
description:
Stay connected anytime and anywhere with a portable Wi-Fi router! Update your status on Facebook or tweet from anywhere during your trip to Hokkaido!
Receiving and returning the Wi-Fi router is extremely simple. The reserved Wi-Fi router will be waiting for you at your hotel reception desk on the date of your arrival in Japan.To use the Wi-Fi router, follow instructions provided in the kit and make simple adjustments to your device.
To return it, simply place the Wi-Fi router and accessories in the provided return envelope and ask the hotel receptionist to post it for you, or drop the pre-addressed package into any Japan Post.
Connection is available for smartphones and laptops, for up to 10 devices simultaneously, letting you and your group all enjoy simple and easy access.

title: Ceramic Art Making Experience in Sapporo
description: Choose from various types of clay and glazes, to make a totally original piece of pottery! Take a break from sightseeing in Sapporo and have fun learning how to sculpt your own ceramics.

title: Sightseeing Bus Tour of Sapporo's Best Sights (Multilingual Audio Guide)
description:
Hop aboard a special bus and whisk around Sapporo, passing all the major sights in this fun, quick 2.5 hour tour. Get to know the layout of the city with a handy English or Chinese audio guide.
This round trip bus tour will pass by all of Sapporo's best sights, allowing you to easily decide which spots you wish to visit and know the layout of the city better!

title: Kimono Dressing and Rental Experience in Sapporo
description: Enjoy exploring Sapporo and taking pictures dressed in a beautiful kimono! Choose from a huge variety, including bridal and glamorous oiran style kimonos.

title: Wheelchair-Friendly Osaka and Umeda Sky Building Tour with a Local Guide
description: Tour around Osaka in a barrier-free environment tailored for travelers with walking disabilities. Visit the famed Osaka Castle and spend some time at Dotonbori before heading to Umeda Sky Building.

title: WiFi Router Rental with Pick-up at Kansai Intl Airport (2-Day to 30-Day Plans)
description:
Stay connected at all times during your trip to Japan with a portable wifi router you can pick up and drop off at Kansai Intl Airport. Choose from a range of plans, great for both work and vacations.
Get high speed, mobile broadband for your iPad, laptop and smartphone anytime and anywhere in Japan. The Pocket Wifi can quickly create group internet access and individual WiFi hotspots; connect wirelessly to many devices such as iPads, laptops, digital cameras, iPhones, Android phones and game devices to let you play games online, transfer pictures and keep in touch.

Visit the counter in the International Arrival Lobby, located on the 1st floor of Terminal 1 (Near the South Arrival Exit and next to Airport Exit F).

The counter is open from 7:00am - 10:00pm, but after-hours returns can be made via the return box.

title: Private Local Food and Drinking Evening Tour of Osaka (English-Speaking Guide)
description:
Visit two of Osaka's best drinking areas while eating and drinking like the locals. Experience a standing bar and try some delicious local cuisine, accompanied by an English-speaking guide. 
After sundown, the bars and izakayas in Tenma liven up with after work salary men and office ladies. Join the crowd of locals with a cup of sake or beer while savoring some local dishes at an open bar. 
After a few bites, head over to Kyobashi on a train to experience a standing bar and more food. Discover Osaka through their unique food, drinking culture and history all on this night time walking tour.

title: Furano and Biei One-Day Tour by Chartered Vehicle from Sapporo
description:
This is a great way to see the Hokkaido rural landscapes of Biei and Furano. Hokkaido is a large area which makes hard to cover.This private tour will help to make your trip an unforgettable one.

Please note: This seasonal tour runs annually between June and August. The dates are subject to change.This is a private seasonal (available from May to September) tour by chartered vehicle. The route is totally flexible. Please let us know if you have any specific spots to visit.
