Recommended spots:
- Furano Flower Field (Farm Tomita)--In 1950s, the owner of Farm Tomita started cultivating lavender for perfume. Today, lavender fields attract large numbers of visitors to the region every summer. The full blossom of lavender is in July, but you can enjoy many other colorful flowers from May till September.

- Biei Panorama Road--Surrounded by a picturesque landscape of gently rolling hills and vast fields, Panorama Road has many photo spots. 

- Shikisai Hill--Wonderful panoramic flower garden with a spacious landscape extending as wide as 17 acres. Dozens of flower varieties are in blossom from spring to autumn, and form a flower paradise. You are welcomed to come and enjoy the unique view and the fragrance among the flowers.

title: Private Cherry Blossom Tour in Hirosaki with a Local Guide
description:
There are about 80 types of cherry trees of a total of approximately 2,600 cherry trees that fill Hirosaki Park. This includes the Yoshino cherry tree, which is said to be Japan's oldest. Hirosaki Park is one of Japan's leading cherry blossom viewing sites. Visitors are especially encouraged to celebrate the scene around the end of April. In this tour that is led by a local guide, the most beautiful cherry blossoms in the park will be introduced. You will also explore other Hirosaki attractions scattered around the park.

Please note: This seasonal tour runs annually between April and May. The dates are subject to change.After leaving the designated departure location, the tour will start by heading to the southern part of Hirosaki Park. Hirosaki was once famous for having the castle of the Tsugaru clan, but during the Meiji era, it became also known for its western-style buildings.
Aside from the natural sites, you will also tour sites where, historically, foreign teachers had come and learn about their teachings. It is here that Christianity was originally promoted in Japan. Western culture can be further seen in the European building styles on display. This unique style was born from the cultural enlightenment that Japan experienced during this time.
After exploring the mansions and other structures, you will enjoy the main event of the tour, the cherry blossoms in Hirosaki Park. 
The blossoms are scattered across various places in Hirosaki Park and visited by two million people each cherry blossom season. Your guide will take you through the trees, stopping at the breathtaking vantage points.
After the cherry blossom viewing, you will visit the merchant and samurai houses from the Edo period that remain in the northern part of the Hirosaki park. The attractions in this area are said to have been built 250 years or more ago by a wealthy merchant. You can still go in this building, known as "Ishiba's Residence," and see a merchant's home and shop from a long, long time ago. The store has the appearance of a hig

title: Shuttle Service to Mt. Bandai and Inawashiro from Haneda and Tokyo
description:
This is a shuttle bus service between Haneda airport or Tokyo station to the Aizu Mt. Bandai area. With this 4.5-hours shuttle service on an air-conditioned motor coach, you can go to the great snow resort "Mt. Bandai" and "Inawashiro". This area, located in northern part of Japan, has the best quality of snow, is called "Micro Fine Snow". There are five famous ski parks around Mt Bandai. Aside from the ski parks, Aizu city is known for its 1200 year history of Buddhist and Samurai culture. This shuttle bus runs between Haneda international airport and the Hotel Listel Inawashiro or Urabandai Royal Hotel or Urabandai Lake Resort.This is shuttle bus service between Haneda airport or Tokyo station to Mt. Bandai and Inawashiro area.
With this shuttle service, you can go to the great snow resort "Mt. Bandai" and "Inawashiro".

This area in the northern part of Japan is famous for having the best quality of snow, is called "Micro Fine Snow". There are five famous ski parks around Mt Bandai. Aizu city is known also for its rich 1200 year history of Buddhist and Samurai culture.

 The pick-up time is as follows: 
8:30am from International Terminal of Haneda Airport
9:00am from Kajibashi Bus Parking of Tokyo Station

Upon arrival in the Mt. Bandai and Inawashiro areas, there are 3 drop-off locations: Hotel Listel Inawashiro, Urabandai Royal Hotel and the Urabandai Lake Resort. 
The arriving time is as follows:
13:10pm at Listel Inawashiro Hotel
13:40am at Urabandai Royal Hotel 
13:50am at Urabandai Lake Resort

There are 5 famous ski parks which have the best quality of snow in Japan: the Alts Bandai Ski Park, the Ura-Bandai Nekoma Ski Park, the Grandeco Snow Resort, the Ura Bandai Ski Park, and the Inawashiro Ski Park.

title: Shuttle Service to Haneda and Tokyo from Mt. Bandai and Inawashiro
description:
This is a shuttle bus service between the Aizu Mt. Bandai area to Haneda international airport. Use this 4.5-hours shuttle service on an air-conditioned motor coach go back to to Haneda airport from the great snow resort  "Mt. Bandai" and "Inawashiro". In the Mt. Bandai and Inawashiro area, located in northern part of Japan, has the best quality of snow, is called "Micro Fine Snow". There are five famous ski parks around Mt Bandai. Aside from the ski parks, Aizu city is known for its 1200 year history of Buddhist and Samurai culture. This shuttle bus runs between the Hotel Listel Inawashiro or Urabandai Royal Hotel or Urabandai Lake Resort and Haneda International Airport.This is shuttle bus service between  Mt. Bandai and Inawashiro area to Haneda airport or Tokyo Station.
With this shuttle service, you can go back to Haneda airport from the great snow resort "Mt. Bandai" and "Inawashiro".

This area in the northern part of Japan is famous for having the best quality of snow, is called "Micro Fine Snow". There are five famous ski parks around Mt Bandai. Aizu city is known also for its rich 1200 year history of Buddhist and Samurai culture.

The pick-up time is as follows:
 14:30pm at Urabandai Lake Resort
 14:40pm at Urabandai Royal Hotel
 15:10pm at Hotel Listel Inawashiro

The arriving time is as follows:
19:20pm at Kajibashi Bus Parking of Tokyo Station
19:50pm at Departure Floor of Haneda International Airport

There are 5 famous ski parks which have the best quality of snow in Japan: the Alts Bandai Ski Park, the Ura-Bandai Nekoma Ski Park, the Grandeco Snow Resort, the Ura Bandai Ski Park, and the Inawashiro Ski Park.

title: The Lock-Up Dinner Reservations and All-You-Can-Eat in Sapporo (Mon-Thurs)
description: Enter the tastiest prison you'll ever be in at The Lock-Up in Sapporo. Dig in to a 2 hour all-you-can-eat and drink dinner but keep an eye open for monsters in the halls.

title: Blue Cave Snorkeling and Sea Kayak Tour from Yomitan
description: Feed tropical fish and see the colorful coral in the beautiful sea of Okinawa. Take a swim with a snorkel into the Blue cave then sail out into the horizon on a sea kayak.

title: Blue Cave Scuba Diving and Two Marine Thrill Rides Combo from Onna
description:
Double your fun in Okinawa with a gorgeous scuba through the Blue Cave and two exciting rides on the waves. Mix and match for the ultimate in fun and relaxation, just for you.
This tour includes everything you need for diving in the Blue Cave, food to feed cute tropical fish, a waterproof camera to capture unique memories, and much more. Blast over the waves on two exciting marine rides, and enjoy a a great family friendly tour; a perfect way check out the beauty of Okinawa for yourself.

title: Central Okinawa Half-Day Charter Tour
description:
Visit the sights of central Okinawa with this hassle-free charter tour. Check out Cape Manza or Nakagusuku Castle at your own pace. Choose from 2 courses!
Visit the 280 year old Nakamura House and the ruins of Nakagusuku Castle, remnants from the Ryukyu Kingdom. Experience traditional Okinawan culture first-hand at the Ryukyu Village, then explore the lush, wild grounds of the South East Botanical Gardens. For more natural beauty check out Bios Hill and the elephant-shaped cliff of Cape Manza. Those with a sweet tooth should also try local snacks made with the local Okinawan black sugar (kurozato).

Relax as your driver negotiates the local roads, and explore the island at your leisure.

title: Fun Wakeboarding Experience for All Levels on Sesokojima Island
description: Head out to the sea and glide across the clear waters on a wakeboard.  Feel the thrill as you get towed by a speedy boat. Beginners can learn the basics and experts can learn new techniques.

title: Full Day Okinawa Discovery Tour Bus with English Audio Guide from Naha or Chatan
description: With free Wi-Fi and an audio guide in 8 languages, take your time at the Churaumi Aquarium, relaxing on beautiful Kouri Island and seeing the world under the sea at Busena observatory.

title: Afternoon or Night Snorkeling in the Blue Cave from Yomitan
description: Go snorkeling in the Blue Cave, with super clear and bright waters. At night you can see noctilucas which light up with movement, creating trails of light through the water.

title: Half Day Okinawan Stone Bracelet or Necklace Workshop in Nakijin
description: Create a personal accessory with natural stones. Try making a Ryukyu bracelet for either yourself or as a gift for a special someone in your life.

title: Sugarcane Harvesting and Okinawan Home Cooking Experience in Nago
description: Harvest the sweet Okinawan sugarcane, then learn how to make delicious Okinawan soba at a local home! Get in touch with the heart of Okinawa!

title: Fun and Simple Sea Kayaking Tour around the Manza Cape
description: Slowly cruise through the waters of Onna on a sea kayak. Let your instructor take you to the best points to view the magnificent Manza Cape from all angles.

title: Half Day Banana Boat Snorkel and Kayak Experience for Kids
description: Make memories with your children in Okinawa with some water sports! Kids ages 3 and up can join you on a banana boat, play with fish and cruise down on a sea kayak.

title: Naha Sunset Dinner Cruise Reservations
description:
Take a leisurely cruise into Okinawa's stunning orange sunset from Naha while enjoying an elegant dinner and live music on the East China Sea.
Okinawa's sunsets are famously beautiful, and there is no better way to spend the evening than on the waters of the East China Sea watching the horizon turn brilliant shades of orange and red while the ocean breeze plays on your skin.
Choose from a wide menu of Continental style cuisine or Okinawan-influenced dishes to best fit your preferences. Listen to live music and relax on this special evening cruise, a perfect treat for families, groups of friends or couples. 

Guests celebrating a special occasion can even order cakes and bouquets of flowers in advance, to make the evening an event to remember!

title: Banana Boat, Float Tow and Jet Ski Beach Fun at Sesokojima Island
description: Experience a thrilling ride on a banana boat, half pipe float, and jet ski on the beach of Sesokojima Island! Only minutes from the Churaumi Aquarium, plan a fun filled day in Okinawa.

title: Water Jet Pack and Beach Activities on Sesokojima Island
description: Experience the thrill of jetting water out of your back to fly above the clear Okinawan sea. Enjoy the latest jet pack experience along with parasailing, jet skiing and more!

title: Adventure Sea Kayak Tour and Blue Cave Snorkeling from Onna
description: Jump into adventure as you join your guide kayaking along steep cliffs and snorkeling into many caves. Visit the magical Blue Cave and swim with cute fish as well!

title: Ryukyu Dress Experience with Two Kimono in Naha
description: Transform yourself with two Okinawan kimono. Easy to wear, you and your family or friends can change your style, and snap photos with your own cameras.

title: Fabric Dyeing Using Real Okinawan Coral in Naha
description: Take real Okinawan coral and use bright colorful dyes to make your very own T-shirt, tote bag or cloth as a truly unique souvenir. Perfect for all ages, make a cute souvenir today.

title: Churaumi Aquarium and Okinawa Highlight Tour with Musical Show Dinner from Naha
description:
Discover the real Okinawa with a visit to the wonderous Churaumi Aquarium. Then head to Kouri Island and Ryukyu Village before a dinner show featuring local cuisine and music.
Hop right in for a full day of real Okinawa. Gaze over the Kouri Island Bridge as it stretches far across the bright azure ocean. Explore the famous Churaumi Aquarium, home to gigantic whale sharks, families of cute manta rays and thousands of different species of marine life. No tour of the island would be complete without a chance to learn the culture and history of the area, and that's just what you can do at Ryukyu Mura Village, where unique Ryukyu cultural arts are shown. Last, but certainly not least, is the local style dinner and lively music show at the Angama Restaurant.

title: Churaumi Aquarium, Kouri Island Bridge and Ryukyu Village Bus Tour from Naha
description:
See the best sights on Okinawa with this full day tour including the Churaumi Aquarium, turquoise sea views from Kouri Island Bridge and Ryukyu Village! All admission fees are included.
Make the most of your time in Naha with this trip to three of the island's most popular and beautiful sights. Gaze over the Kouri Island Bridge, which stretches over the bright azure ocean of Okinawa. Explore the famous Churaumi Aquarium, home to gigantic whale sharks, families of elegant manta rays and thousands of different species of marine life. You can even have lunch overlooking the tank! Then dive into the traditional side of Okinawa at Ryukyu Mura Village, and learn more about the unique Ryukyu culture.

title: Traditional Okinawan Shisa Lion Dog Crafting in Nago
description:
All over Okinawa you will see statues of shisa (guardian lion-dogs) on houses or temples. Now you can make or paint your own little guardian to bring home!
At Ryukyu-gama Shisa Park, you can create a shisa couple to bring home as a souvenir of Okinawa. Shisa come in pairs and are often posted on gates or roofs of houses, to protect its inhabitants. The male shisa has his mouth closed to ward away evil spirits and the female's mouth is open to share goodness. 

Ranging from fierce to completely adorable, there is a shisa to suit your tastes. Located near the Churaumi Aquarium, this is a popular activity for visitors of all ages!

title: Lanes & Lanterns: Traditional and Modern Night Tour of Kyoto
description:
Get a taste of Kyoto after dark! See the lantern-filled lanes of Gion and Pontocho. Find out where to grab a drink, which food stalls near Yasaka Shrine are the best and enjoy Kyoto's nightlife.
Your English-speaking guide will bring you around Kyoto for an introduction to the ancient capital's most lovely spots to see in the evening, and see how traditional and modern Kyoto intersect. View the many lanterns lighting the way in the geisha districts, try various Japanese snacks and drinks in tachinomiya shops, and spot geisha and maiko on their way to appointments in tea houses.

title: Beginner Friendly Japanese Shodo Calligraphy Lesson in Kyoto
description: Experience the art and culture of Japanese calligraphy in Kyoto. An introductory lesson will be given by an experienced teacher to write with a brush and ink.

title: Cool Traditional Crest Printing Experience in Kyoto
description: Choose from over 5000 different traditional family crests and symbols, and dye the crest onto your choice of accessory. A fun 'only-in-Kyoto' experience, and great souvenir!

title: Traditional Yatsuhashi Confectionery Cooking Class in Kyoto
description: Experience making a traditional Japanese confectionery from Kyoto. Savor the freshly made Yatsuhashi rice cake on the spot or to take home as a souvenir.

title: Yuba Kaiseki Dinner Course at Nanzenji Temple's Junsei Restaurant in Kyoto
description:
This dinner course features yuba ('tofu skin') a quintessential Kyoto-style dish. Enjoy the freshest yuba prepared right at your table, at the elegant Junsei Shoin.
Savor a dinner of traditional Kyoto-style cuisine in the elegant Junsei Shoin building, recently designated as a Tangible Cultural Property of Japan. Gaze over the lovely garden, and experience a moment of culinary zen!

title: Kyoto's Famous Guided Walking Tour with English-Speaking Guide
description:
This half-day walking tour will take you to see some of Kyoto's hidden gems. Explore the Gojo Rakuen geisha area, unusual shrines and traditional workshops, and make new friends as you explore!
Get away from Kyoto's major sights, and see a more hidden, traditional side of the ancient capital. This is one of Kyoto's most famous and long-running walking tours, also known as WALK IN KYOTO TALK IN ENGLISH founded back in 1996 by the renowned guide Johnny Hillwalker.

Visit small shrines usually overlooked by larger tours, learn about the important Higashi Honganji Temple, and go back in time in the traditional streets of old geisha districts and workshop areas. Enjoy a cup of tea and a Japanese sweet as a well-deserved break too! See the best of Kyoto without breaking the budget.

Tour runs every Monday, Wednesday and Friday except in December, January and February.

title: Blue Cave Private Trial Diving Tour from Onna
description: Dive into the mystic waters of the Blue Cave. Enjoy an ethereal atmosphere as you swim with colorful fish. Learn diving at your own pace as you join this private tour tailored to suit your needs.

title: Family and Pet Friendly SUP Experience from Onna
description: Bring your family along with your dog to the beautiful beach of Maedamisaki for a fun SUP adventure. Enjoy a day out to relax on the waters or explore the underwater reefs.

title: Half Day Snorkel and Fish Feeding Activity in the Blue Cave from Cape Maeda
description: The Blue Cave shines with a mysterious light, as if the water is covered with a blue carpet. Enjoy snorkeling in the natural Ryukyu limestone cave and feeding cute fish.

title: Metallic Ring Making Workshop in Naha
description: Spend some time indoors with your friends or family to make a cute ring to take home. Shape your ring to the perfect size and add a simple design using handy tools.

title: Water Sport Value Pack Snorkel and Boat Rides in Okinawa
description: If one sport is not enough, try three! Enjoy a ride on a banana boat to snorkel and play with fish. Then take a slow cruise on a kayak to get the best of Okinawa!

title: Culture and Cuisine Half-Day Charter Tour
description:
This private charter tour will whisk you around the island to experience the best of Okinawa's flavors and Ryukyu culture. Drumming, dancing and markets await!
Watch the energetic Eisa drum dances at Okinawa World, or the elegant traditional udoi dances. Try Okinawa's unique cuisine, such as soki soba (noodles with ribs), sata andagi (sugar doughnuts), the tasty umi budou (sea grapes) or fresh fish! Explore the Makishi Market, where stalls on the 2nd floor can prepare delightful dishes with the fresh ingredients you purchase on the 1st floor.

No need to worry about getting lost, as your driver will take you to each of your desired locations at your own pace. Great for groups and culture lovers!

title: Seashell and Coral Photo Frame Making Workshop in Nago
description: Pick out some pretty seashells and corals to make your very own photo frame. Great for young children to play with paint and clay while making a cute souvenir of Okinawa to take home.

title: Exciting Fly Boarding Challenge and Fun Marine Activities in Sesokojima Island
description: Jet up into the air using extreme water pressure to enjoy a thrilling ride on a flyboard! Only minutes from Okinawa island, continue your beach fun with some snorkeling, parasailing and more.

title: Boat Snorkeling Around Minnajima Island from Motobu Port with Lunch
description:
Step ashore onto the paradise island of Minnajima, known for its white sandy beaches and turquoise blue sea. Snorkel through the waters to discover the world under the beautiful sea.
Ride on a cruiser out to the paradise island of Minnajima for a perfect vacation getaway. Take a swim with your snorkeling equipment into the clear blue waters to meet the tropical marine wildlife or simply relax on the white sandy beaches under the parasol. Spend a half-day or whole day on the Michelin Star awarded island, basking under the sun or enjoying the refreshing ocean breeze.

title: Cute Seashell Crafting Session in Okinawa
description: Go out to the local beach to collect pretty seashells to create a cute craft at a local home. Great for kids and an opportunity to make a memorable gift during your stay in Okinawa.

title: Half Day Winter Whale Watching Tour from Motobu (January~April 15th)
description:
Get up close to pods of humpback whales off Iejima Island as they winter and rear their young. See huge breach jumps and mighty tail slaps from the boat.
Special bonus:
Participants on the whale watching tour can also receive a 20% discount for marine sports on the day of their tour. You can try parasailing or an underwater Sea Walk at a discounted price of 5,500 JPY per person on the day.

title: Local Okinawan Style Lunch Courses in Naha
description: Dine on the local flavors of classic Okinawan dishes in a relaxing shop. Discover another side of Ryukyu culture with an optional dance performance too.

title: Kimono or Yukata Rental in Central Naha
description: Dress yourself up in a traditional kimono or a lighter yukata. Take memorable photos while taking a walk down the streets of Naha in the traditional outfit.

title: Ceramic Lion Dog Shisa Making and Painting Experience
description: Make your own guardian spirit animal for you to take home! Form it with clay and decorate it with your favorite colors. Great for a souvenir and memory of Okinawa!

title: Mangrove Kayak Eco Tour on the Okukubi River from Onna
description:
Paddle along the tropical Okukubi River, where countless mangrove trees grow and fish swim, on a family friendly eco tour perfect for all ages.
Kayaking may look tough, but skimming over the river is actually very smooth. With detailed instruction from your guide, you will be paddling the warm river soon. This tour is also family friendly,  and suitable for children 3 and up! Kayaking in the mangroves is a fun and exciting way to learn about this complex ecosystem. Enjoy the lively and unique atmosphere while learning from a knowledgeable guide as you drift on the Okukubi River.

title: Banana Boat and Marine Sports Experience Plan in Ginowan
description:
Start with a high speed banana boat ride and then make your thrilling day complete with your choice of two more activities from jet skiing to float rides.
Race over the ocean waves of Okinawa with a thrilling three ride package of marine sport activities in Ginowan! Start with a banana boat ride, then choose two more activities, with a wide range of floats or jet skiing. Every float flies over the water in a completely different style, so no two rides will ever be the same, making sure the thrills are non-stop. Great for families too, as kids from six and up can ride the floats over the waves, too!

title: Half Day Pottery Wheel Lesson at Zuikougama Kiyomizu in Kyoto
description:
Shape clay into elegant Kyoto style pottery on a potter's wheel in an English classroom. The centuries long traditions of Kyoto are waiting for you.
Learn how to create your own piece of beautiful Kiyomizuyaki pottery at Zuikogama, where expert craftsmen have been producing Kyoto-style pottery since 1771. Great for visitors of all ages, the passionate instructors will help you get a feel for the heavy clay and pottery wheel. Create a unique memento of Kyoto, so you can remember your trip every time you use your pottery cup or dish at home.

title: Half-Day Pottery Courses for Beginners in Kyoto
description: Experience working with clay and ceramics to make perfect gifts for a special someone or occasion. Get creative and have experienced instructors assist you to form your piece.

title: Traditional Tea Ceremony Experience near Kinkakuji Temple in Kyoto
description: Conveniently located a minute away from the Kinkakuji temple, enjoy a special tea ceremony at Koto. Ceremonies in English are also available for a memorable time in Japan.

title: Paraglide and Tandem Paraglide Experience in Northern Kyoto
description: Enjoy two courses in the sky by flying solo at a low altitude in the morning, then at a higher altitude with a tandem paraglider in the afternoon.

title: Half or Full Day Paragliding Adventure in Kyoto
description: Float through the sky just a short train ride from central Kyoto. Skilled instructors will help you get your feet off the ground so you can enjoy floating.

title: Rickshaw Ride from Kodaiji and Philosopher's Walk
description:
Step back in time and experience a unique Kyoto rickshaw tour near
Kodaiji! This private tour will allow you to customize the perfect day.
The word rickshaw originates from the Japanese word “jinrikisha”, which means “human-powered vehicle”. They first appeared in Japan in the late 19th century. In modern day Japan, Ebisuya's “shafu” (rickshaw drivers) provide “omotenashi,” a distinctly Japanese form of hospitality.

Choose the private tour that fits your needs, from 12 to 120 minutes, which each driver will customize to best fit the season, weather and your interests. Climb aboard the luxurious rickshaws and move deftly through the area around Kodaiji temple, known for its beautiful 'maki-e' (lacquer work incorporating silver and gold).

title: Kyoto by Night with Maiko Performance, Tea Ceremony and Zen Cuisine
description:
Step back in time with a visit to Gion Corner, where a showcase of traditional Japanese arts is held. After that, delight in a candlelight tea ceremony before a shojin ryori dinner.
Spend a luxurious night out in Kyoto, and dive into the traditions of the ancient capital. Begin your night at Gion Corner, where you can watch a selection of traditional dances, music, and stage performances. Afterwards, set off on a stroll through Gion. You may even be lucky enough to see a maiko (apprentice geisha) as you take in the night air. Bring calm and relaxation to your evening with a candlelight tea ceremony followed by dinner at Yoshi-ima Ryokan, a traditional Japanese inn. Delicate shojin ryori, Buddhist vegetarian cuisine awaits, with fresh seasonal ingredients, and a subtle flavor.

title: Muslim-Friendly Guided Walking Tour of Kyoto with Halal Lunch
description:
Spend a full day exploring the must-see sights of Kyoto. Walk along the charming streets of Gion, see the majestic halls of Kiyomizudera, and discover exciting tastes at Nishiki Market.
Visit the iconic sights of Kyoto as you join this tour tailored to suit the needs of Muslim guests. 

The tour first stops at Nishiki Market, where you can find fruits, seafood, sweets, local crafts and novelty items. You'll also get to see Yasaka Shrine, famous for the Gion Festival. Lunch is just as exciting, as Halal Yakiniku Narita, a certified Halal restaurant, prepares Japanese beef for you.

After lunch, you'll explore the geisha district of Gion, where you will also find the oldest Zen temple, Kenninji. The last stop of the tour is the gorgeous Kiyomizudera, where you can see marvelous views of the charming city that is Kyoto.

title: Kyoto Full Day or Half Day Private Charter Tours with English Speaking Driver
description: Weave through the historic streets of Kyoto as you visit popular temples and shrines or relax in the bamboo forest of Arashiyama, all with an English-speaking driver. See the sights at your own pace!

title: One Day Premium Tour of Kyoto and Arashiyama with Lunch at a Temple
description: See Kyoto and Arashiyama's most stunning spots, including the famous Bamboo Grove! Experience sutra copying at Daikakuji Temple, savor a Buddhist lunch at Tenryuji Temple and ride a rickshaw.

title: Traditional Kyoto-Style Hand Crafting Experience in Kyoto
description: Make your very own traditional Japanese crafts for you to take home as souvenirs. Enjoy embroidery, Kyo-Yuzen style fabric dying and cocoon doll right in Kyoto city.

title: Japanese Sweets Making Experience in Kyoto
description: Make cute sweets while visiting Kyoto, as a fun break from sightseeing in the ancient capital. Choose from a variety of types, so kids and adults can all have a great time. No cooking skills needed!

title: Gion Geisha District Evening Walking Tour in Kyoto with English-Speaking Guide
description:
Learn about the life of geisha and maiko on this evening tour, led by a knowledgeable guide. Feel the history of Gion as you walk, and see Kyoto's famous maiko!
Gion is Kyoto’s most traditional district, and a special place where the culture of Kagai (the world of maiko and geiko) is still vibrant. Get to know the story behind this area as you look for maiko and geisha on their way to the ochaya (tea houses). Stroll through lanes lined with machiya and ochaya, all lit by brilliant red lanterns. You may see maiko and geisha on their way to appointments, and can learn about the history of these 'flower towns'.
Your knowledgeable English-speaking guide will help you discover the secrets of the Old Capital, all while making new friends on a fun evening tour!

title: Kansai International Airport Shuttle To and From Kyoto with Free WiFi on Board
description:
Ride a convenient door to door shuttle between central Kyoto central and Kansai International Airport (KIX). Great for both solo travelers and groups!
Book comfortable and hassle-free transportation service between Kansai International Airport (KIX) and central Kyoto. Prearrange your transportation to and from the airport so you can enjoy no stress arrival and departure from Japan’s ancient capital.
Suit your needs with one-way or round-trip service. Relax and enjoy the ride as the scenery and temple-graced city passes by your window. With an easy-access Kansai Airport Desk staffed by friendly agents located in the main arrival hall, what could be more convenient?

title: Full Day Biking Tour of East or West Kyoto's Finest Sites
description:
Experience the beauty of Japan's ancient capital city up close, as you pedal down the streets of East or West Kyoto on this fully-guided, private bicycle tour!
There is no better way to explore the temple and parks of Kyoto than on a private bicycle tour.
See historical locations such as Nishi-Honganji Temple, Nijojo Castle, and of course Kinkakuji (Temple of the Golden Pavilion). Feel the serenity of Ryoanji's fine Zen rock garden.

Head off the beaten path as you make your way to Hirosawanoike Pond and Arashiyama, known for its bamboo forests and Iwatayama Monkey Park. You will have ample free time to explore the area.              

This private biking tour is great for both groups and solo travelers, as the tour will go at your own pace.

title: Meet Maiko and Have Tea Time in Gion
description:
Join real geisha and maiko in Kyoto as you sip green tea and watch an elegant performance. Taking place at a traditional Kyoto tea house, this is a special chance to meet and talk with the maiko.
Since the 1800s, geisha and maiko have been a beautiful sight throughout Kyoto. With their signature white make-up and elaborate kimonos, they are a sight to see. Trained in numerous Japanese arts, from classical instruments to dance and tea ceremony, being entertained by a geisha or a maiko (apprentice) is truly unforgettable.

Normally new customers won't be seen without a recommendation from a regular client. However the Tomikiku tea house in Gion offers this once in a lifetime opportunity. Relax as you are served green tea and watch a graceful dance and lyrical music performance, then you may even play traditional games with a geisha or maiko before taking photos. Some of the maiko speak English, giving you even more chances to ask questions easily.

title: Kyoto-Style Vegetarian Cooking Lesson at a Machiya
description:
Enjoy cooking a tasty meal of 'obanzai', traditional and healthy vegetarian cuisine, using fresh Kyoto vegetables and other local ingredients!
Learn the secrets of 'obanzai ryori' just 5 minutes away from the Kyoto Imperial Palace! This cooking lesson uses local Kyoto vegetables and ingredients to create satisfying dishes and showcase a unique side of Japan's culinary arts. 

These vegetarian side dishes are colorful and wholesome, and the menu will change seasonally, using the freshest local ingredients to highlight the meal. This is a great way to learn about Japanese cuisine and healthy cooking at the same time! For vegetarians and carnivores alike, bring home the knowledge of Kyoto cuisine.

title: Kyoto Highlights with Hot Pot Lunch or Maiko Performance in Gion (from Osaka)
description:
Let the nostalgic streets of Gion mesmerize you with visits to Fushimi Inari Shrine and Arashiyama. Get a group photo taken with a maiko or see a dance performance for a memorable time in Kyoto. 
Visit the geisha district of Gion, see the remarkable Fushimi Inari Shine and enjoy the seasonal views of Arashima and its bamboo grove on this tour! Choose from one of two available options for lunch: unlimited chanko hot pot with group photo with a maiko or geisha; or traditional Kyoto cuisine with a dance performance by a maiko followed by a personal photo op.

title: Maiko Performance with Kaiseki Dinner, Lunch or Light Snacks Plan near Gion
description:
Witness a classic performance by a maiko in a classic restaurant near Gion while enjoying unlimited drinks and a delicious traditional kaiseki course meal for your choice of lunch or dinner.
Experience the grace of Kyoto's maiko and the best of Kyoto's hospitality! Enjoy a dinner of fine Japanese cuisine while watching the maiko dance, and discover the beauty and artistry of the ancient capital's icons.

title: Modern Japanese Kimono Full Day Rental and Free Strolling in Kyoto
description:
Stroll the streets of Kyoto in a bright and chic kimono. Snap memorable photos as you mix the ancient city with the latest in modern fashions.
Blend Japan's two sides, ancient history and modern fashion, together with an avant-garde kimono rental. Dress up in a fashion forward bright and colorful style as you walk around the town.

title: Half-Day Japanese Confectionery Making in Kyoto
description: Learn to make traditional Japanese sweets and taste them right on the spot. From steam buns to tea ceremony sweets. Children and chefs of all levels are welcome to participate.

title: Tickets for Samurai Kembu Theater Sword Performance Show
description:
Check out this showcase of the samurai art of kembu. The powerful sword dance will have you marvelling at the skill of the masters as they perform this unique Japanese art.
The brave samurai are icons of Japanese culture. This is your chance to see them in action in an exciting, kid-friendly performance in Kyoto! Samurai kembu is a traditional performing art done with a Japanese katana and fan. The word kembu means sword dance. It was used by samurai to give themselves courage or to achieve mental concentration before battle. In the movie "The Last Samurai" you can see actors performing kembu before battle. Usually samurai kembu artists perform to background music, creating a beautiful moving performance.

title: Private One Day Tour of Buddhist Zen Temples in Kyoto
description:
Clear your mind with a peaceful tour of Zen temples in Kyoto. You can join a zazen meditation course at Myoshinji Temple and practice the art yourself.
Capture the feeling of serenity during this quiet tour of Buddhist Zen temples in Kyoto. Your guide will take you on a private tour of Myoshinji, Ninnaji, and Kozanji Temples, each a peaceful place dedicated to meditation and study, but still graced with beautiful gardens and sights. Experience for yourself the gentle atmosphere that comes from being surrounded by nature far from the city center, then head back into the world with a visit to Nishiki Market, the place to shop for many residents of Kyoto.

title: Kimono Dress-up and Kiyomizudera Temple Private Walking Tour in Kyoto
description:
Dress in a traditional kimono and walk the historic streets of Kyoto. Visit Kiyomizudera Temple and then stroll through quiet Sannenzaka in your kimono.
Feel as if you have stepped back in time as you stroll through Kiyomizudera Temple and the historic streets of Kyoto while dressed in a traditional kimono. Join the long history of travelers and visitors to the temple, and drink the waters rumored to make wishes come true! Enjoy learning all about the area as you walk, thanks to a knowledgeable private guide.

title: Home-style Sushi and Tempura Japanese Cooking Lesson
description:
Get a taste of Kyoto as you learn to prepare two of Japan's most popular dishes, sushi and tempura!  This is a fun hands-on class with a very tasty ending. 
Enjoy a delightful hands-on class which offers the opportunity to learn Japanese cooking!  Held in an intimate, homey atmosphere, your English-speaking instructor will give you step-by-step instructions on how to prepare famous Japanese dishes!

Get acquainted with Japan's traditional ingredients, such as miso (bean paste), sake (rice wine) and dashi (soup stock).  Whether you love to cook or just love to eat, this is a great tour for solo travelers and groups alike.

Don't forget to take the recipes home with you so you can wow dinner guests back home with your new skills.

title: Make Fresh Soba the Traditional Way in Gion
description:
Learn to make soba noodles the retro way, just a few minutes from Kiyomizudera Temple. Do it all, from prepping, mixing, rolling, and cutting the dough, then eat your freshly made noodles.
Stroll through classic Gion, home of geisha and maiko, then continue your way into the past as you learn the secrets behind making tasty soba noodles. This fun and filling class will show you how to grind the buckwheat, mix the dough, and even the best way to cut the noodles for flavor. After working up your appetite, it's time to eat the freshest noodles around, the ones you just made!

title: Ninja Kyoto Restaurant and Show Reservations in Kyoto
description:
Step into the world of the Ninja with an evening of delicious food, drinks and spectacular entertainment. Enjoy acrobatic dances, thrilling combat and more!
Get ready for an out of this world adventure as the ninja of Kyoto put on a stunning show that combines magical images created using projection mapping along with high flying acrobatics, fire performances and dynamic wire-stunt battle action. Created by art director of the Ramen Museum, the Little Prince Museum, you are in for a top-notch show as the cast of performers and ninja artists take you into the magical world of "ninjutsu", an iconic part of Japanese culture. This brand new Ninja entertainment is a dramatic mix of traditional and modern, and will leave you breathless!

title: Akihabara Otaku Culture Tour with a Maid Guide (6 Languages Available)
description: Venture into the heart of Akihabara with your friendly maid guide. Discover spots not covered by guidebooks、check out cool only-in-Japan shops and finish your tour with a visit to a maid cafe'!

title: Special Geisha Performance and Dinner in Central Tokyo
description:
Enjoy a geisha performance of songs and dances accompanied by traditional instruments. Play games and take photos with the geisha, then enjoy a high quality dinner at the restaurant of your choice.
Watch a beautiful performance by skilled geisha who display their grace through songs, dances and traditional instruments. After enjoying their performances, the geisha will teach you to play some traditional Japanese games! Feel free to take photos of and with the geisha during this activity. Once it has finished, enjoy a high-quality dinner at one of four fantastic restaurants.

title: WiFi Router Rental with Easy Pick-up at Narita Airport (2-Day to 30-Day Plans)
description:
Stay connected at all times during your trip to Japan with a portable wifi router you can pick up and drop off at Narita Airport. Choose from a range of plans, great for both work and vacations.
Get high speed, mobile broadband for your iPad, laptop and smartphone anytime and anywhere in Japan. The Pocket Wifi can quickly create group internet access and individual WiFi hotspots; connect wirelessly to many devices such as iPads, laptops, digital cameras, iPhones, Android phones and game devices to let you play games online, transfer pictures and keep in touch.

Visit one of the QL Liner counters in the arrival lobby or the North Wing arrival counter of Terminal 1
or the arrival lobby of Terminal 2 for pick-up.

title: Smartphone 3GB or 5GB SIM Card with Airport, Hotel or Pre-Departure Delivery
description:
Navigate around Japan with your own smartphone by installing a handy Japanese SIM card. Have the SIM card conveniently sent to your arrival airport, hotel in Japan or your own doorstep!
Install a pre-paid SIM card into your smartphone and enjoy 10 days of hassle-free wifi connections as you tour around Japan with ease. Have your SIM card delivered to the airport you are arriving at, your hotel in Japan or even your own home outside of Japan for the ultimate in convenience!

With pre-paid card you don't have to worry about going over your data limit, and it only takes a few minutes to register the SIM so that you can start using it immediately, with no time-consuming contracts. You can even tether your laptop or tablet so that you can use them simultaneously, great for business travelers.

If you have any issues or questions English, Chinese and Japanese speaking customer support staff are available to assist you.

title: Origami Paper Folding Class in Traditional Asakusa
description: Learn the traditional Japanese paper craft of origami in the friendly atmosphere of Asakusa! Create tiny paper cranes, seasonal flowers and more, with help from your expert instructor.

title: Stylish Kimono Dressing and Free Time Walking in Asakusa
description: Change out of the everyday and see Tokyo in a new style. Dress up in a fashion forward kimono and explore the town with friends or as a couple.

title: Three Day Swim with Dolphins Tour on Mikurajima Island from Takeshiba Pier
description: Wild dolphins inhabit in the sea of Mikurajima, one of the Izu Islands. The dolphins are curious and may come to see you. Let's swim with dolphins!

title: Overnight Universal Studios Japan Bullet Train and Hotel Package from Tokyo
description:
A great bargain plan that includes return Tokyo-Osaka bullet train tickets, a 1 Day Pass for Universal Studios Japan and your choice of accommodation in Osaka.
Enjoy a variety of exciting theme rides and shows inspired by world famous movies, animations and comic series spread out among nine distinctly designed areas offering unique experiences.In addition to the main attractions there are numerous restaurants, shops and even street performances waiting for you at Universal Studios Japan. For children and grownups alike, the entire parks is filled with wonder and allows you to experience the thrill and excitement of the fantastically imaginative worlds of famous blockbuster movies.

title: Half Day Hike of the "Eastern Galapagos" of Ogawasara
description: Hike and visit a number of islands with many different ecosystems. Each tour is personalized for the day, creating a truly unique experience.

title: Japanese Vegetarian Cooking Class and Lunch in Tokyo at TJT Studio
description:
Learn how to make shojin-ryori, the vegetarian/vegan cuisine of Buddhist monks. After the lesson, enjoy the veggie feast you made with your very hands!
Shojin-ryori is an elegant style of vegetarian/vegan cuisine created by Buddhist monks, who strictly follow the Buddhist teachings which prohibit killing live beings. Unusually for Japan, this meal does not include any meat or fish (and thus is also halal).

During this unique class learn how to make this delicate, healthy cuisine with the help of our instructors, and bring back this knowledge as a memento of Japan.

After the class, sit down to enjoy the delicious meal you created!

title: Afternoon Tour of Tokyo's Famous Sights
description:
This half-day afternoon tour gives you a fun introduction to Tokyo's most famous sights. Stroll through the serene Hama-Rikyu Gardens, enjoy a river cruise and experience the charm of Asakusa!
Fusing together the traditional and the modern, Tokyo has become one of the most popular places to visit in the world!

Visit the famous Asakusa Kannon Temple, where guests can pass under the imposing Kaminarimon (Thunder Gate), before spending time browsing the quaint shops and restaurants lining Nakamise Shopping Street. One feature of old Tokyo was the division of the city into machi (towns), according to the profession of its inhabitants. Stops in Akihabara and Kappabashi, two of the most well-known machi, will give guests a glimpse at how ancient Edo was divided.

title: Hitachi Seaside Park and Ashikaga Flower Park Spring Garden Tour from Tokyo
description:
Wander through a field of blue flowers that touch the sky at Hitachi Seaside Park. Let the curtains of wisteria welcome you at Ashikaga Flower Park for an unforgettable spring scenery in Japan!
Fields of Nemophila, or baby blue eyes flowers, spread over a sprawling field, leaving all in sight a clear blue, nearly the same shade as an unclouded sky, or the nearby sea. Walk through the fields and imagine yourself walking on air, as everything around is the same color.
After savoring an all-you-can-in yakiniku barbecue lunch, continue to a magnificent curtain terrace of wisteria flowers. Go through the colorful tunnels to find yourself in a floral paradise.

title: Full Day Mt. Fuji and Hakone Tour with Return to Tokyo by Shinkansen
description: Visit the World Heritage Mt. Fuji and Hakone area.After visiting the 5th Station, cruise on Lake Ashi and take a ride up Komagatake Ropeway. End your day with a ride back to Tokyo on the bullet train!

title: Evening Food Tour of Golden Gai in Shinjuku
description:
See the nostalgic side of Shinjuku with this food tour. Stroll through Omoide Yokocho (memory lane) for some kushikatsu meat skewers, then taste various Japanese dishes in Kabuchicho and Golden Gai.
This foodie walking tour of three Shinjuku neighborhoods will allow you to get a glimpse into the Showa Era. Many pubs, izakaya’s and eateries in Omoide Yokocho (literally meaning "memory lane" in English) and Golden Gai are just as they were in the 1950s in both atmosphere and menu style. You'll also get a look at the bustling world of Kabukicho at night and have the chance to try food from a local eatery famous for its southern Japan-style dishes.

title: Private Airport Transfers between Narita Airport and Central Tokyo
description: Enjoy a comfortable ride to and from Narita Airport on board a spacious van that can accommodate up to 9 guests. Perfect for family getaways, the vehicle has enough room for luggage.

title: Tokyo's Traditional 'Old City' and Historic Shops Discovery Tour
description:
Discover the hidden heart of Tokyo with a friendly guide. Get to know the rich history of Ningyocho as you visit local shops, and sample lots of yummy treats on the way, for a real taste of  Edo!
See a side of Tokyo that contrasts with the usual buzzing, urban image. On this tour you can discover several hidden family-run shops specializing in all kinds of trades, some built over a century ago! Taste the flavors of Meiji-era sweets and Showa-era candy for a truly sweet way to spend your day.

title: Reservations to Meet Adorable Bunnies at a Rabbit Cafe' in Tokyo
description:
While in Tokyo experience one of Japan's famous themed cafes at this cute bunny cafe' located in Ikebukuro. Pet fluffy rabbits and feed them veggies, a perfect short break from sightseeing.
Only available by reservation, meet some of Tokyo's cutest rabbits at this cozy bunny cafe'. Located in the sightseeing and shopping haven of Ikebukuro, rest your feet and relax in the company of new furry friends.

title: Chartered Mt. Fuji Shore Excursion Tours from Yokohama Port or Tokyo Port
description:
Visit grand Mt. Fuji and the surrounding areas when travelling to Japan on board a cruise! See the symbol of Japan for yourself with convenient transfers from Yokohama or Tokyo Port. 
You will be whisked to Mt. Fuji in a private mini-van, which will provide pick-ups and drop-offs from Yokohama or Tokyo Port. A Japanese, English and French-speaking multilingual guide will be on board to assist you along the way. A Chinese-speaking guide is also available upon request. Select the course of your choice according to the length of your stay in Japan.

title: Sake Tasting with 100 Different Kinds of Local Sake at a Bar in Ueno
description: Dive into Sake with more than 100 types to try! Bring your own snacks and have fun with no time limit and free re-entry. Located right by the Ueno Station, don't wait, book today.

title: Best of Japan Gourmet Tasting Tour in Nihonbashi
description:
Sample foods from all over Japan and experience  travelling across the nation in only 90 minutes! Take a peek into the history & culture of Japan through various unique flavors and regional styles.
Taste foods from all over Japan and experience travelling across the nation in only 90 minutes! Take a peek into the history and culture of Japan through various unique flavors, regional souvenirs, and hands-on activities. Includes stops at nine different cuisine-related shops inside the COREDO Muromachi shopping complex in the historical Nihonbashi district.

*This tour is also available in "With Lunch," "With Dinner," and "With Cooking Lesson" options. Please refer to the recommended activities below.

title: Full Day Mt. Fuji and Hakone Bus Tour from Tokyo with Bullet Train Return
description: Discover the beauty of Japan’s highest mountain on this full day sightseeing tour of Mount Fuji and Hakone via a comfortable bus out and a speedy Shinkansen bullet train return.

title: Customizable Two Hour Tour of Akihabara with Otaku Guide
description:
Get an in-depth experience of the otaku subculture paradise, Akihabara. See the famous landmarks like Electric Town, then visit a maid cafe or Nadeshiko Sushi, the first all-female sushi bar.
Customize the way you see Akihabara and its famous spots and subcultures. Your guide will help you as you make your way through the electronics mecca. Learn about the history of Akihabara Electric Town, take photos with a robot, view the major landmarks and browse at a figurine shop. If you'd like to visit other places in Akihabara during your two hours, feel free to name those spots when booking.
All tour options come with a choice of a visit to a maid cafe (one drink included) or a lunch at Nadeshiko Sushi.

title: Late Night Haneda Airport Shuttle for Domestic and International Flights
description:
Conveniently travel between your hotel in central Tokyo and Haneda Airport on a comfortable shuttle. Great for travelers arriving or departing late in the evening. 
Pre-arrange a hassle-free shuttle service that lets you travel between Haneda Airport and your hotel in Maihama or central Tokyo. You won't have to worry about limited public transportation late in the evening. With this shuttle, you can comfortably make your way to your destination, worry-free. Great for families, large groups or even solo travelers!

title: TOKYO SKYTREE® Fixed Day Tickets (Special Review Rebate Campaign)
description:
Visit the world's tallest tower and see the city from 350 or 450 meters above the ground! Book your tickets in advance to avoid waiting in line, for a seamless ride up into the clouds.
Choose between a ticket up to TOKYO SKYTREE's Tembo Deck (350 meters above ground) or go to the very top and take in the view from the Tembo Galleria, at 450 meters up! 

This fixed day ticket allows you to skip the long waiting times, and get whisked up to the top in no time.

title: Fantasy Kimono Photo Shoot and Makeover Experience in Tokyo
description:
Transform yourself with a traditional formal furisode kimono or an elaborate oiran style kimono for a gorgeous,  dress-up and photo session you can only do in Japan.
Open to men, women and non-binary guests, this photo studio welcomes everyone!
Transform yourself with a kimono of your choice for an out-of-the-ordinary photo shoot in a professional studio. Select from Japanese-style Oiran-style outfits, furisode formal wear and more!

title: Reservations for an Owl Cafe' in Harajuku
description:
Visit one of Japan's famous owl cafes while in Tokyo! Located near Harajuku Station, you can take pictures with cute owls while they perch on your arm. Experience a real animal cafe!
The staff will introduce you to various owls of all sizes! They can perch on your arm or you can pet them and take pictures. Please be sure to turn the flash off when taking photos, and have fun making new feathery friends!

title: Half Day Handmade Light with Japanese Paper Workshop in Tokyo
description: Create your own little lamp for use at home. Smile and relax at the happy and comfortable sight of your work. Put your favorite light at home and make your life more happy!

title: Meditative Shakyo Sutra Writing Lesson in Trendy Daikanyama
description:
Shakyo is the traditional practice of transcribing sutras. By concentrating on the letters of sutras, you can relax your mind as you work. Take your writing brush home as a souvenir, too.
What is Tera Cafe?
We aim at making Buddhism more familiar to everyone.
To fulfill that aim, we bring the temple to the city, and create a gentle cafe refuge for people living in modern society.

If you cannot find anyone to talk about your troubles, or if it is a bit difficult for you to come to a temple for you do not know much about Buddhist temples, or have never been to one before, then we will go and meet you!

That is our concept.

title: Swim with Dolphins on a Half Day Tour of the Ogasawara Islands
description: Join dolphins swimming gracefully in the beautiful sea and experience the unique joy of meeting these intelligent creatures in their natural habitat.

title: Tokyo Morning Tour to Meiji Jingu Shrine, Imperial Palace, and Sensoji Temple
description:
Start your day with this short tour of Tokyo’s most famous spots. Spend your morning exploring three of the most spectacular sights of Japan’s capital! The tour ends in Ginza, a great shopping spot. 
This morning tour allows visitors a glimpse of Tokyo’s most famous temples and sights, with the afternoon free to explore Japan’s bustling capital. The trip begins at the tranquil Meiji Shrine, a Shinto shrine dedicated to the Emperor Meiji and Empress Shoken.

Pass by the National Diet Building en route to the Imperial Palace Gardens. Head next to Sensoji Temple, famous for the imposing Kaminarimon ("Thunder Gate") and visit the numerous shops in the Nakamise Shopping Arcade. This tour ends in Ginza, famous for its upscale shopping, dining and entertainment options.

title: Mount Fuji Tour and Hakone Sightseeing from Tokyo (Bullet Train or Bus Return)
description:
Get up close with Japan’s iconic mountain on this full day tour of Mt. Fuji and Hakone. Cruise Lake Ashi and ride the Komagatake Ropeway before heading back to Tokyo by bus or shinkansen.
Begin with convenient hotel pick-up from select hotels in Tokyo before setting out aboard a comfortable coach. From the bustling city center, watch as the buildings fall away and reveal the majestic Mount Fuji. Continue along until you are 2,300 meters above the ground at the 5th Station of the mountain. The afternoon is then filled with photo opportunities featuring Mount Fuji as the perfect backdrop! Take a leisurely boat ride on Lake Ashi before riding up Mount Komagatake on the Hakone Ropeway. Your way back to Tokyo is by motor coach or the famous Shinkansen bullet train, or you can even disembark in Hakone and continue your explorations there.

Chinese and Spanish audio guides are available upon request.

title: Afternoon Walking Tour of Kagurazaka and Street Food Tasting in Tokyo
description:
Explore Tokyo's elegant Kagurazaka neighborhood on this guided tour. Stroll the cobblestone alleyways lined with shops, restaurants and shrines!
Spend your afternoon exploring one of Tokyo’s most renowned neighborhoods, a former geisha district.

Your tour begins along the famous Kagurazaka Street, a 1-kilometer slope lined with traditional Japanese architecture mixed in with modern, fashionable cafes and restaurants. Pass by shrines, temples, and historical buildings that are mixed in with geisha houses and restaurants, juxtaposing modern Tokyo with classic Japan. A popular destination for Tokyo residents and tourists alike, walking along the cobblestone streets of Kagurazaka is sure to be an unforgettable journey!

title: Custom-Made Tokyo Tour by Private Car with Transfers to/from Haneda Airport
description: Make the most of your time in Tokyo on this private tour, which includes a transfer to or from Haneda Airport. See the spots you want, like Tsukiji, Tokyo Tower, Imperial Palace & more.

title: Mt. Fuji Tour and Hakone Private Charter Sightseeing from Tokyo  (10 Hours)
description:
Set out on a private tour of Hakone or the foothills of Mt. Fuji by exclusive car with an English speaking driver and guide. See the sights you want to see and do what you want to do in Japan.
Explore the scenic beauty of Japan than with a private tour tailored to your tastes and interests. Everything will be taken care of, as your English speaking driver/guide picks you up at your hotel in Tokyo to start off the tour. Then relax in the car as they whisk you to your choice of locations, anywhere from magnificent Mt. Fuji itself to the sprawling shores of Lake Kawaguchi.
Check out the scenic ropeway and mountain top views in Hakone, or take your time enjoying a hidden gem for lunch before shopping in the massive Gotemba Premium Outlets!
Since this is a completely private charter, this tour goes at your pace, with you and your group in mind.

title: Classic Tea Ceremony with Full Cha-Kaiseki Cuisine and Matcha Green Tea in Tokyo
description:
Step into an exclusive oasis, generally closed to the public, just minutes away from the heart of Tokyo. Enjoy the elegant ceremony from a penthouse, with the Tama River far below.
A pine tree adorned screen and other seasonal decorations create a unique space just for the tea ceremony. Gentle lighting and historic items such as a bowl from the BCE Persian Empire, a teakettle from the Momoyama Period (1573 - 1615 A.D.) of Japan, and more combine to make it feel as though you have walked into a peaceful daydream, and a part of history. After the tea ceremony, the master will sweep away the surrounding items, suddenly returning you to the real world, where a Cha-Kaiseki meal awaits. Prepared by a specialist in Washoku Japanese Cuisine, the meal is a gem in and of itself. Dine overlooking the cityscape of Tokyo and the nearby Tamagawa River.

title: Traditional Japanese Home-Style Cooking Lesson in Tokyo
description: Experience a casual cooking lesson in either French or English at a local Japanese home. Get in touch with the culture through cooking and learning more about the cuisine.

title: Private Rickshaw Tours of Asakusa (1 Hour Plans)
description: Choose from 4 different courses, and enjoy an hour long tour of traditional Asakusa in comfort and style on a Japanese rickshaw! An only-in-Japan experience.

title: Wakeboarding Experience on Ogasawara Island (Morning or Sunset)
description: Try out wakeboarding near Chichijima, the largest of the Bonin Islands! Enjoy the subtropical paradise and the rush of adrenaline with this fun water sport.

title: Rickshaw Tour of Asakusa's Best Sightseeing Spots in English
description:
Explore Asakusa and feel the atmosphere of historic Tokyo as you ride in a rickshaw. Your driver will take you to the hidden gems of Edo era Tokyo. English-speaking drivers are available.
Experience historic Tokyo in the historic neighborhood of Asakusa. Hop on a comfy rickshaw and visit some of the lesser-known spots. English-speaking drivers are available and will happily provide you with plenty of interesting information about the area. Feel free to customize your tour by letting your driver know what you'd like to see in Asakusa. Then, enjoy the feeling of the Edo era as you ride along comfortably and get to know old Tokyo.

title: Private Sushi and Tempura Cooking Lesson at Tokyo Koishikawa Koryuan
description:
Learn how to make two of Japan's most famous dishes- tempura and sushi! After cooking up a storm, sit down to enjoy the delicacies you created.
During this hands-on program guests will learn how to make several kinds of sushi. Impress your friends with your sushi making skills – the perfect Japanese souvenir! We offer ingredients besides raw fish, such as meats or vegetables, so that anyone can enjoy this experience. 

Our instructors will also teach you how to fry the perfect tempura, keeping the fresh ingredients crispy and light!

Once all the dishes are complete, enjoy sampling the fruits of your labor.

title: Private Tea Ceremony at Tokyo Koishikawa Koryuan
description:
Learn about the traditional Japanese art of tea, explained by professional tea masters. Enjoy a cup of matcha tea and sweets in a serene tatami tea room.
Founded in the 16th century and preserved until the modern day, experience a peaceful tea ceremony. It is regarded as a comprehensive Japanese art as the arrangement of scrolls, flowers, tea instruments and even clothing all come together to create a unique, seasonal atmosphere.

At Koishikawa Koryuan we offer the opportunity for visitors to experience a traditional tea ceremony with explanations in English (or other languages), to allow participants a deeper look into the art.

title: Fun Weekday Wagashi Japanese Sweets Cooking Class in Tokyo
description:
Sweeten your time in Japan with a fun sweets making lesson. Create cute nerikiri wagashi and tasty taiyaki, two types of wagashi popular all year round.
Jump right in and make two kinds of traditional Japanese sweets. Start with the traditional nerikiri, which has a delicate sweetness that dissolves in the mouth. Each one is made to delight the eyes and taste buds with seasonal shapes. This means many different types get made all year. Basically always made by hand, nerikiri are also the sweets used in the lovely tea ceremony, with the exquisite creations being pieces of "edible art".

Then learn to make taiyaki, a common sight at festivals and a much loved treat. They start with a sweet batter, like pancakes, and then get stuffed with sweet bean paste or a range of other fillings. Of course, no cooking lesson is complete without a tasting, so get ready to eat up.

title: 【關西必買票券】六甲山觀光套票 Tourist Pass
description: 六甲山觀光套票 Tourist Pass 包含了往返六甲山的巴士、纜車、及無限次搭乘的山上巴士券，除此之外還可享有山上各大設施如音樂盒美術館、六甲山嬉雪公園、自然體感展望台等特別入場優惠！持有本套票，讓您一次飽覽六甲山的自然風光。

title: Tokyo Kamakura and Yokohama Day Tour
description: Come and learn more about Tokyo by visiting Kamakura, one of the three ancient capitals of Tokyo. Experience the beauty of Japanese traditional culture, and relive the classic scenes of the comic book, "Dunk Master" at the island of Jiang. Finally, end the day at Yokohama Port. Let KKday bring you the most classic day tour.

title: 《日產》北海道NISSAN租車・RV0休旅5人座
description: NISSAN日產租車線上預約！KKday為您提供最優質的租車服務。安心・舒適・整潔。不管是朋友、情侶還是家族旅遊都適合。行程不受限，盡情暢遊美麗北海道！

title: Day Tour from Tokyo: Lake Kawaguchi, Oshino Hakkai, Narusawa Ice Cave
description: Visit Lake Kawaguchi and experience the natural beauty of Mt. Fuji in the Fuji Five Lakes area. Take in the Narusawa Ice Cave’s beautiful pillars of ice. Stroll around the beautiful ponds of Oshino Hokkai.

title: 【Hokkaido】Sledding experience ・ Otaru Canal area ・ glass craft shop
description: Stroll around the famous Otaru Canal area in Hokkaido!and take you to the glass craft shop which is very popular within foreign tourists! Sledding experience at the authentic ski resort in Hokkaido!

title: 【Tokyo Sakura Sightseeing Tour Bus】Hitachi Seaside Park・Ashikaga Flower Park・Buffet Lunch
description: Enjoy a 1-Day tour bus to beautiful and romantic trip with your other half or love ones! This includes a dreamlike baby-blue fantasy, a “world dream destination” selected by CNN.com, as well as a romantic white wisteria tunnel!

title: 【新手滑雪教練】東京富士山二合目 Yeti 滑雪場一日體驗
description: 東京新宿出發！由專員載您到初學者都愛的富士山"Yeti"滑雪場，邊學滑雪邊享受富士山美景,從初級到高級雪道，另配有華語或廣東話教練，每日限額20人，精緻小團，讓您一次就上手！

title: Okinawa Night Cruise with Dinner
description: Enjoy the perfect end to the day with a romantic nighttime Okinawa cruise accompanied by a delicious dinner and live music.

title: 【東京親子景點】台場樂高樂園門票LEGOLAND（香港旅客專屬頁面）
description: 東京台場樂高樂園是擁有300多萬個樂高積木的室內主題樂園，園內可參觀到樂高積木工廠、用樂高積木重現的東京街景，還可以玩射擊遊戲跟生動有趣的4D劇場，不論大人小孩都可能盡情體驗充滿創意的樂高世界！

title: OKONOIMYAKI & Teppanyaki (Iron Grill) Cuisine experience
description: You can enjoy cooking and tasting Okonomiyaki which is popular to common Japanese people in our specialized restaurant.  We have specially big  teppan grills, so you can enjoy cooking  Okonomiyaki, Monjayaki, Yakisoba etc. on the grill by yourself.

title: JR Kansai-Hiroshima Area Pass
description: Book your JR Kansai-Hiroshima Area Pass now and explore this culturally rich part of Japan from Hiroshima in the south to Osaka, Kyoto, Kobe, and Nara further north.

title: JR Kansai Wide Area Pass
description: Pick up your JR Kansai Wide Area Pass and explore bustling Osaka, and ancient Kobe and Nara. Start your trip at Kansai Airport and explore the Osaka Bay region today!

title: 【八丈島潛水】初學者大推薦・東京秘境八丈島體驗潛水
description: 八丈島是日本伊豆群島中的一個島嶼，隸屬於東京都管轄，從羽田機場出發不用一個小時就可以抵達。來到八丈島，除了可以用眼睛欣賞海洋的美，還可以用全身來體會它的魅力！八丈島海域有機會看見海龜、熱帶魚群及大型洄游魚類

title: 【Tokyo Classic tour】Picking Seasonal Fruits ・Mt. Fuji 5th Station・Ropeway・Flower Watching
description: KKday has introduced a brand-new seasonal fruit picking experience! Japanese fruits are known to be deliciously juicy with highly nutritious vitamins and minerals. Spend a day surrounded by the natural environment and pick your own freshest fruits as well as the overlooking at the stunningFuji Subaru Line 5th and relaxing lunch at Lake Kawaguchi and Watch seasonal flowers at Oishi Park !

title: 【日本JR PASS】關西廣域鐵路周遊券・午前訂購隔日收到（立即使用免排隊換票）
description: 在KKday午前預訂隔日即可收到實體票券！JR關西廣域周遊券幾乎是每位造訪京阪的旅人必備交通票券，現在更是升級！實體票券到日本直接搭車，省去惱人排隊換票的寶貴時間！

title: 【日產】北海道NISSAN租車・P3輕型5人座
description: NISSAN日產租車線上預約！KKday為您提供最優質的租車服務。安心・舒適・整潔。不管是朋友、情侶還是家族旅遊都適合。行程不受限，盡情暢遊美麗北海道！

title: 【Night Sightseeing Bus】Traditional Kyoto Feast & Maiko Performances in one go!
description: Begin an old-style Kyoto journey with the opportunity to enjoy Gion Maiko performances as well as experiencing a traditional Kyoto feast!

title: Half Day Scarf Hand Weaving Workshop in Trendy Kichijoji
description: Ride a train about 20 minutes from Shinjuku or Shibuya and try traditional saori Japanese weaving. Even if it your first time, you can create a unique and colorful scarf.

title: Make Your Own Silver Promise Rings or Wedding Rings in Tokyo
description: With the help of jewelry designer Noriko Hasegawa, make your own silver rings. A lovely unique souvenir of your visit to Tokyo, or a heartfelt way to celebrate your engagement or marriage.

title: Half Day Edo Kiriko Glass Soy Sauce Bottle Making Lesson in Tokyo
description: Lesson to make a chic and practical soy sauce bottle out of glass. It is very easy to make even for children, making this an educational and active family friendly tour.

title: Ceramic Wedding Gift Making Course in Tokyo
description: Perfect as decor or personalized favors, create unique piece of pottery art to celebrate your special day! Our staff will be happy to help you.

title: Genuine Persian Tile Making Course in Tokyo
description: Learn traditional patterns and make your own custom tiles in this unique ceramics class! This beautiful craft brings intricate art and culture to life.

title: Tokyo by Night Panoramic Tour and Dinner at Kagaya with English-Speaking Guide
description:
Cross Tokyo Bay's Rainbow Bridge, enjoy a meal of traditional Japanese cuisine and gaze at the bright city lights from an observation deck in Roppongi Hills.
This is a fantastic tour for those who want to experience Tokyo's sparkling night views.
For dinner, participants will head to the Kagaya restaurant,  run by Kagaya Ryokan, a traditional Japanese-style inn at Wakura Onsen in Noto. Their aim is to provide visitors with authentic Japanese cuisine in an atmosphere similar to their inn. Experience heartwarming hospitality and enjoy a mouthwatering Japanese set meal!

title: TOKYO SKYTREE® Observation Deck and Asakusa Tour
description:
Get right up to the observation deck of Tokyo Skytree without waiting in line, thanks to special reserved entrance tickets! Stroll through traditional Asakusa and Sensoji Temple too.
Take in all of Tokyo at once, with the best view of the city from the 350 meter Observation Deck. On a clear day, you can even see Mt. Fuji rising far off in the distance! Step from the ultra modern tower back into Japan's long past as you head into Asakusa. Stroll down the Nakamise Shopping Street, filled with cute little crafts and tasty treats, until you reach Sensoji Temple. This Buddhist temple has over 1,300 years of history, and has long been the cultural heart of the region.

title: Full Day Hakone & Mt. Fuji View Tour with Gotemba Outlet Shopping from Tokyo
description:
Get away from Tokyo and out to Mount Fuji on this convenient tour. Cruise Lake Ashi and ride an aerial tram before a hearty yakiniku buffet lunch, then go shopping at the Gotemba Outlets!
This full day tour with English and Chinese assistance boasts something for everyone! Start with great views of Mt. Fuji aboard a pirate ship lake cruise before heading off to the Hakone Ropeway and exploring Owakudani Valley, a volcanic valley with active sulphur vents. Next, stop for a lunch of all-you-can-eat yakiniku (grilled meat), sushi, desserts and many other tasty dishes. After lunch, shop until you drop at Gotemba Premium Outlets, where you can find both local and international brands at great prices.
All participants will receive a free folding shopping bag, and there will be raffles in the bus!

title: Grand Tour of Tokyo Highlights with English Guide
description:
You will be whisked away away to the best of Tokyo on a grand tour of the city. Ride in comfort, and experience both the new and ancient, all with an English speaking guide.
Hop aboard the bus for a full day tour of Tokyo and discover the many different sides of this amazing city. Your tour kicks off with panoramic views from Tokyo Tower where you can snap fantastic pictures of this vast city.  Stop at Sensoji Temple, Meiji Shrine, and the Imperial Palace for a taste of old Japan, then cruise down the Sumida River for a moment of bliss among the city of millions. This full tour takes you from the old to the new and all across town, from Ginza to Ueno, and even Akihabara.

title: Nikko Autumn Leaves and World Heritage Sights Tour from Tokyo
description: Discover the beautiful autumn colors of  Nikko! Visit two World Heritage Sites, navigate through the famous Irohazaka road, dine by the pristine waters of Chuzenji lake and much more!

title: Traditional Shamisen Performance at Tokyo National Museum (November 18th 2017)
description: Enjoy a beautiful Japanese shamisen performance at a venue in the Tokyo National Museum. Adorned with ikebana flower arrangements, the young performers play in the perfect traditional setting.

title: Authentic Sumo Wrestler Morning Practice Viewing in Tokyo
description:
Watch professional sumo wrestlers during their morning practice in the famous sumo stables of Ryogoku. Experience the power of a sumo match up close.
Ever wonder what sumo wrestlers do to get ready for their big tournament matches? Start your morning in Tokyo by watching professional wrestlers get prepared for their upcoming tournaments. 
You will be guided to the sump stables and get to see what goes on behind the scenes. Feel the energy of the intense training process these giant athletes go through! Your friendly guide can explain about life as a sumo wrestler, and the significance behind the ancient tradition.

title: Gourmet Dining Lunch Cruise on Tokyo Bay
description: Step on board for a cruise around Tokyo Bay while enjoying an elegant lunch, and leave daily life behind for a relaxing and luxurious time.

title: Canyoning Adventure Tour in the Okutama Region of Tokyo (July~October)
description: Adventure with easy access from Central Tokyo! In Okutama we have a canyoning course even beginners can enjoy. BBQ and burger lunch plans are available, too.

title: Traditional and Modern Tokyo Discovery Tour
description: See the contrasts of Tokyo in one day! Explore the traditional farmhouses of the Japan Open-Air Folk Museum, see Shibuya's famous Scramble Crossing, then head to Odaiba to shop at Palette Town.

title: Romantic Gourmet Dinner Cruise on Tokyo Bay
description:
Set sail for romance with a night time cruise on the glimmering waters of Tokyo Bay. Feast your eyes on the sights while enjoying a gourmet meal aboard ship.
Board the ship and leave the everyday world behind on a delightful cruise of scenic Tokyo Bay. This leisurely cruise features sweeping panoramic views and a carefully crafted gourmet meal while the sparkling lights of Tokyo shine in the distance. Rainbow Bridge, Sky Tree, and the planes of Haneda Airport can all be seen glittering in the night sky when the weather is clear. Indulge in an evening of comfort and class aboard our ship.

title: Hitachi Seaside Park and Ami Premium Outlet Shopping Tour from Tokyo
description:
See the beauty of Hitachi Seaside Park as you walk through a field of red kochia bushes! Get your hands on fresh strawberries as you visit a local farm before making your way to Ami Outlet. 
Fields of Kochia, or also known as Burning Bush, spread over and coat the vast 30-acre fields of Hitachi Seaside Park a vibrant purple and pink hue during autumn. Walk through a blooming field of beautiful flowers as far as the eye can see before indulging your palette in an all-you-can-eat lunch and strawberry picking. Cap off your day at the Ami Outlet Shopping Center, with more than 150 luxury brand stores from around the world.

title: One Day Okhotsk Guided Nature Trek Tour
description: Stroll around in the rich nature of Okhotsk,  one of the best spots to be found in Hokkaido during summertime. Enjoy the outdoors with an experienced guide.

title: Early Morning Bird Watching and Walking Tour
description: Abashiri is a place of wondrous sights where you can enjoy the views of mountains, rivers, and ocean. Every season boasts different highlights to see.

title: Guided Hiking Tour of Lake Rausu in Shiretoko from May to October
description:
Set out on a guided trekking tour to the largest lake in Shiretoko, Rausu. The peak of Mt. Rausu is just beyond the lake, creating a picture perfect scene.
Mt. Rausu usually has snow remaining on the slopes through most of August, but that only enhances the beauty of the wide fields of trees and flowers you will see on your hike up to the lake! Rausu Lake is the largest body of freshwater in the Shiretoko Peninsula and makes for a postcard perfect photograph thanks to the contrast between the blue waters, green fields, and craggy mountain peak rising in the distance. Take this chance to enjoy a guided hike up and down the mountain path and treasure the time in Shiretoko's hidden gem!

title: Lake Shikotsu, Lake Toya and Mt.Usu Tour from Sapporo with Audio Guide)
description:
Visit two of the most famous lakes in Hokkaido, Lake Shikotsu and Lake Toya, and get in touch with the wild nature of this northern island. Get great views from Mt. Usu and enjoy lunch by the lake.
Spend a full day exploring the scenic vistas of northern Japan’s most famous lakes, with audio guides in English, Chinese, or Korean. First up is Lake Shikotsu, well known for the crystal clear clarity of its water. You can enjoy an optional cruise over the shining waters here. Next up is Lake Toya, a caldera lake formed by a large volcanic eruption over 100,000 years ago. Its water is rich in minerals. This bountiful nature makes it home to a wide variety of flora and fauna. Gaze at the glass-like surface of the lake as you enjoy lunch at Toyako Manseikaku. Mt. Usu, the first designated UNESCO Global Geopark  in Japan, is on the way, and once at the summit you can get amazing views in the fresh air. Snap photos of the other mountains and the open ranges.

title: Overnight Tour to Mt. Fuji and the Tokaido Route by Bullet Train from Tokyo
description: See iconic Mt. Fuji, tea plantations, a post town along the Tokaido Road, ukiyo-e art, and savor fresh sushi! Stay at the Nippondaira Hotel, in a room with stunning views of Mount Fuji.

title: Canoe Inflatable Kayak Tour and Mt. Youtei Viewing in Niseko
description: Ducky is a rubber boat like a canoe that brings you closer to the water as you paddle. Have fun on a clear river with fantastic mountain views.

title: Relaxing Balinese-Style Body and Facial Treatment Spa Menu in Hakodate
description: While in Hakodate enjoy a relaxing spa program of your choice, a perfect treat for skin in Hokkaido's snowy winters or as a short break during summer sightseeing.

title: Hiking Tour of Shiretoko Goko Five Lakes
description:
The Shiretoko Goko Lakes are one of the top sightseeing areas in Shiretoko. Visit all five mystical lakes which dot the untouched forest landscape.
Enjoy the quiet forests of this beautiful World Heritage Site, where you will be able to see the Shiretoko mountain range reflecting on the surface of the still, clear lakes. Between May 10 to July 31, there will be brown bear activity therefore only guests accompanied by a certified guide will be allowed to visit the Shiretoko Goko Lakes.

title: Half Day Canoeing Tour in Minakami
description:
Paddle around the calm lakes of Minakami while enjoying relaxing scenery. Children from 3 years and up can join for a full family trip!
Possible venues include Lake Namarata, Fujiwara Dam and Sudagai Dam. The exact venue will be decided on the day of the tour.

title: Exciting Canyoning Experience in Minakami
description: Get in touch with nature and enjoy canyoning in beautiful Minakami! Jump into the basins of waterfalls, explore streams and feel the adrenaline rush.

title: Nagano Scenic Hiking Tour with Togakushi Shrine and Ninja Museum Visit
description: Hike along a forest trail with scenic views of the mountains. Visit the Togakushi Shrine and walk beside giant Japanese cedar trees before heading to the Ninja Museum and learn the ways of the ninja.

title: Fox Canyon Adventure Canyoning Tour in Minakami with Transfers
description: Waterfall slides, basin jumps and more are waiting for you in Fox Canyon. The most popular course in Minakami, perfect for beginners. No long hikes make it easy for everyone to join.

title: Flower Viewing and Trekking Tour of Mt. Yubari
description: Enjoy a personalized hike as you trek the rugged trails of Mt. Yubari, where the challenge is matched by the beauty of the alpine flowers and scenic vistas.

title: Sightseeing Cruise Around Otamoi or Shukutsu near Otaru (April to Oct)
description: Tour around the scenic cliffs of Niseko Shakotan Coast on a comfortable sightseeing boat. Or take the water route to visit the Otaru Aquarium or Nishin Goten during your stay in Otaru.

title: Kushiro Shitsugen National Park Private Taxi Tour (5 hours)
description:
