Pass right under the famous signs of Dotombori, by the busy little island of Nakanoshima, past the Meiji-era Public Hall and under lots of cool bridges. 
The guides for these unique cruises are rakugo (traditional Japanese comedy) artists, so you can expect a light and relaxed atmosphere on-board. Get laughing with the trademark Osaka sense of humor and wit.

title: Afternoon Walking Tour of Osaka with Aqua Liner Cruise
description:
Spend an afternoon visiting Osaka, by foot and boat! The tour includes a guided visit to Osaka Castle followed by a scenic cruise to see historical spots of the city from the river.
From 683 to 745, Osaka was the capital of Japan, and even after the capital moved it still remained an important hub for land, sea, and river-canal transportation. 

Visit the famed Osaka Castle and surrounding Nishinomaru Garden, a symbol of this powerful Japanese city! Located on the castle grounds are over 4,000 cherry trees, a must-see in spring. After visiting the imposing Castle, the visitors will board Aqua Liner. This river cruise offers views of Osaka Castle, Twin Towers, Nakanoshima Island, and much more.

title: Reservations for a Cute Animal Cafe with One Drink in Sapporo
description: Spend some quality time with adorable owls, hedgehogs, prairie dogs, cats, and more! Enjoy a drink while bonding and taking photos with these gentle creatures right by the Tanuki Koji shopping arcade.

title: Horseback Riding Experience for Riders of All Levels near Sapporo
description: Feel the refreshing wind as you go on an adventure on top of a horse. Experience a journey through the trails along the beautiful mountains of Hokkaido.

title: Sapporo Morning Tour to Shiroi Koibito Park and Central Wholesale Market
description:
View beautiful Sapporo by bus. Visit some famous locations including Shiroi Koibito Park and Hokkaido Shrine and enjoy a fresh seafood lunch. English, Korean or Chinese audio guidance is available.
Established in 1868, Sapporo is one of the youngest cities in Japan, renowned for its culinary prowess and incredible wintery scenery.

Be inspired by the intricate architecture of the ancient Hokkaido Shrine, surrounded by thick forests. Then, indulge your sweet tooth at Shiroi Koibito Park. Follow up with a visit to the Sapporo Central Wholesale Market, where you can have some of the freshest seafood in the country for lunch.

title: Half Day Lake Shikotsu National Park Snorkeling Tour
description: Wear a dry suit and have fun seeing fish through bright, clear water. If you can not swim, the instructor will help you with a swimming ring, so relax and have fun!

title: Convenient Car Rental Service in Sapporo Area from Shin Chitose Airport
description: Tour the vast landscapes of Hokkaido at ease for a full day with this convenient car rental car. Transfers from Shin Chitose Airport, English GPS and helpful 24-hour support are all included!

title: Car Rental in Hokkaido with English GPS from Sapporo Station
description: Cruise around the streets of Sapporo or go on an excursion out to popular Furano and Biei with a convenient car. Drive around hassle-free with an English GPS and 24 hour road support!

title: Kintetsu Rail Pass Reservations
description: A bargain for visitors, the convenient KINTETSU RAIL PASS is available in four varieties, and allows you to explore Kyoto, Osaka, Nara, Mie, Iseshima, Nagoya and more for a special discounted price!

title: Historical Walking Tour of Osaka in English
description: Visit the Osaka Museum of History, then explore the Otemon Gate of Osaka Castle, Houkoku Shrine and Castle Tower on this walking tour of the city's best-known sight!

title: Full Day Car Rental Service with Sightseeing Tickets from Naha Airport
description:
This inclusive rental plan includes discount coupons and free entry to hot locations all over Okinawa. Savor pineapples at Nago Pineapple Park or see culture brought to life at Okinawa World.
This car rental agent has the following insurance or compensations to cover the damages or responsibilities of the accidents. However, if it goes over the covered amount, the extra charges will be held by the customer.

The following insurance compensation system is included in the charge:
Interpersonal (per person): Unlimited
Belongings and vehicle (per accident): Unlimited (immunity from responsibility JPY 50,000)
Personal injury compensation in case of death: JPY 30 million per person (to the maximum amount of passengers)

title: Blue Cave Snorkeling and Trial Diving Combo Tour from Motobu
description: Set off for the fabulous Blue Cave and enjoy both snorkeling and diving in an exciting and tropical course. Feed fish while diving and see a school up close!Fish bait is included.

title: Original Metallic Bangle Making Lesson in Naha
description: Take a metallic strip and shape it into a stylish bangle of your original design using hammers and pliers. Make a perfect gift or souvenir during your stay in Okinawa.

title: Southern Okinawa Cultural Bus Tour with Optional Naha Airport Drop-Off
description:
Explore the south of Okinawa before your afternoon flight on this convenient morning bus tour. Visit Okinawa World or stroll on Mibaru Beach, check out sacred Sefa Utaki and the Himeyuri Monument.
See a more authentic, rural side of Okinawa on this tour of the southern area of the island. Visit the sacred Sefa-Utaki, a place of worship for the native Ryukyu religion. Then, choose between exploring the emerald Mibaru beach or learning about Okinawan culture and exploring caves at Okinawa World. Finally stop by the Himeyuri Memorial, established in memory of the war nurses who perished during the Battle of Okinawa.
You can then be dropped off at Naha Airport or back in town. This easy half-day tour is a great way to explore further afield or see a bit more of Okinawa before flying out!

title: Naha Starlight Evening Dinner Cruise Reservations
description:
Take a romantic cruise under the twinkling stars, while enjoying an elegant dinner and live music on board. Departing from Naha Port, sail the waters of Okinawa for an unforgettable night!
Gaze at the heavens and the lights of the city, as you cruise the calm waters of the East China sea, feeling the sea breeze in your hair while strolling the open deck. Great for families, groups of friends or couples celebrating a special occasion, share this experience with the ones you love.

You can choose from a menu of Continental cuisine or Okinawan-influenced dishes, to best fit your preferences. While dinner is served you shall be serenaded by a local musician.

Guests celebrating a special occasion can order special cakes or bouquets of flowers for a happy surprise!

title: Half Day Okinawan Craft Workshop with Coral and Seashells in Nakijin
description: Remember Okinawa forever with a personal craft made of local coral and seashells. Make either a photo frame or a seashell shiisa and keep them at home.

title: Churaumi Aquarium and Okinawa Special Value 5 Ticket Pass
description:
Have fun and save money with a special value pass that includes entry to the Churaumi Aquarium and your choice of 4 more amazing spots in Okinawa!
Create your own personal trip around Okinawa with the Value 5 Pass. A trip to the Churaumi Aquarium, home to amazing whale sharks, is normally  1,850 JPY per person, and when you combine that 4 other places to visit, you can enjoy a treat for your senses and your budget!

Sample Value Course:
Churaumi Aquarium (1,850 JPY) + Daisekirinzan (820 JPY) + Okinawa Fruits Land (1,000 JPY) + Ryukyu Mura (1,200 JPY) + Okinawa World (620 JPY). Normally visiting all these wonderful Okinawan locations is a total of 5,490 JPY, but with the Value 5 Pass, it is only 3,200 JPY!

title: Full Day Scuba Diving Tours for Licensed Divers with Naha Pick-up
description: Select your preferred region to dive, and let us show you the beautiful ocean, amazing fish, or fantastic shipwreck spots of the islands.

title: Full Day Car Rental Service with Pick-up from Naha Airport
description:
Enjoy easy pick-up from Naha Airport and smooth rental with all the features you need for fun and easy sightseeing, including GPS navigation.
This car rental agent has the following insurance or compensations to cover the damages or responsibilities of the accidents. However, if it goes over the covered amount, the extra charges will be held by the customer.

The following insurance compensation system is included in the charge:
Interpersonal (per person): Unlimited
Belongings and vehicle (per accident): Unlimited (immunity from responsibility JPY 50,000)
Personal injury compensation in case of death: JPY 30 million per person (to the maximum amount of passengers)

title: Beach/Boat Diving Tours for Licensed Divers with Transportation Service in Naha
description: Step from the beach or off the boat into the warm blue waters of Okinawa on a fun and relaxing diving tour. Whether swimming or photographing you can find all new sights underwater.

title: Colorful Okinawan Kimono Rental and Dressing in Central Naha
description: Walk Kokusai Street in real Ryukyu dress! Choose the dress and original wig you like, to turn into a OKinawan beauty! You are then free to explore the Kokusai Street area at your leisure for 2 hours.

title: Snorkeling and Marine Walking Combo Tour with Blue Cave Visit from Onna
description:
Splash around with a family friendly snorkel adventure. Float through the Blue Cave then go meet cute fish up close with an underwater marine walk.
Play away with everything you need for a cute marine walk where you get to meet tons of tiny tropical fish up close! You can also explore the Blue Cave and take tons of pictures with a waterproof camera, making sure all those unique memories are preserved. Book today for a great kid friendly tour and check out the beauty of Okinawa for yourself.

title: Ocean Parasailing Adventure from Yakena Port
description: Lift off for a fun parasailing experience and thrill to the superb views of the Pacific Ocean.You may even be able to see submarines or ships from high above!

title: Churaumi Aquarium, Manza Cape and Ryukyu Village Tour from Naha
description:
Experience Okinawa's tropical nature! Visit a traditional Ryukyu village, see the whale sharks at Churaumi Aquarium, enjoy delicious tropical fruits and gaze over Cape Manza on this full day tour. 
Spend the day at some of Okinawa's best spots, and get a true taste of this lovely tropical island.

First visit Ryukyu Mura, where you can wander among traditional houses, see water buffalo, habu snakes and local dance performances! Then head towards the ocean, for views from the vast Manza Cape. After lunch at Okashi Goden, head to the famous Churaumi Aquarium, to see the majestic whale sharks, manta rays, dolphins and other sea creatures. 

Finally, end your day on a sweet note, at Nago Pineapple Park or Okinawa Fruits Land to taste the sweet local pineapples and other treats.

title: Best of Kyoto Day Tour with Chanko Hot Pot Lunch or Maiko Performance
description:
See the wondrous district of Gion. Have your photo taken with a maiko. Walk through the gates of Fushimi Inari-taisha Shrine and see a striking view of Kyoto's seasonal beauty from Arashiyama.
This tour takes you to three of Kyoto's top sights: Gion, Fushimi Inari-taisha Shrine and Arashiyama. For lunch, you can choose to have unlimited chanko hot pot and have a group photo with a maiko or geisha. Alternatively, you can choose to delight in the traditional flavors of Kyoto cuisine, see a maiko dance, then have a photo op with the maiko.

title: Convenient Car Rental Service From Kyoto Bullet Train Station
description: Explore the Kansai region with ease upon your arrival to Kyoto via bullet train. Visit temples and shrines or even extend your trip out to Nara or Osaka in a comfortable car.

title: Half Day Small Group Origami Lesson at a Local Home in Kyoto
description: Turn ordinary paper into animals, flowers, and more through the traditional art of origami. No tools are used, just folding, but you can create an amazing souvenir to take home.

title: Family-Friendly Ninja Star or Blowgun Experience in a Ninja Dojo in Kyoto
description: Enter the ninja house, and discover its many tricks emergency escape exits. Discover the skills of the ninja, and hearn how to throw shuriken (ninja stars) or use a blowgun!

title: Maiko Transformation Photo Shoot in Kyoto
description: Change into an elegant Maiko by the hands of professional kimono dressers and make-up artists. Take photos in studios near Kyoto Station, Gion, Kiyomizudera Temple, or Arashiyama!

title: Make a Geisha Hana Kanzashi Flower Hair Ornament in Kyoto
description: Fold, twist and transform fabric to create a unique kanzashi hair ornament, the same type that is used by Kyoto geisha. You can learn this amazing art and make a one of a kind souvenir.

title: Wi-Fi Router Rental Service with Unlimited Data in Kyoto
description:
Stay connected anytime and anywhere with a portable Wi-Fi router! Update your status on Facebook or tweet from anywhere during your trip to Kyoto!
Receiving and returning the Wi-Fi router is extremely simple. The reserved Wi-Fi router will be waiting for you at your hotel reception desk on the date of your arrival in Japan.To use the Wi-Fi router, follow instructions provided in the kit and make simple adjustments to your device.
To return it, simply place the Wi-Fi router and accessories in the provided return envelope and ask the hotel receptionist to post it for you, or drop the pre-addressed package into any Japan Post.
Connection is available for smartphones and laptops, for up to 10 devices simultaneously, letting you and your group all enjoy simple and easy access.

title: Okinawa Nature and Culture Shore Excursion from Naha Port
description: Get picked up from Naha Port to explore the highlights of Okinawa on this shore excursion. Stop by the Shuri Castle, Gyokusendo Cave and Chinen Misaki Park for historical and scenic views around Naha.

title: Blue Cave Snorkeling and SUP Experience in Yomitan
description: Enjoy two water activities at once in the beautiful sea of Okinawa. Take a peek with a snorkel in the Blue Cave, then venture out into the vast ocean on a stand up paddleboard.

title: Plaster Shisa Lion Dog Painting Experience in Okinawa World
description: Enjoy a memorable time at Okinawa's largest amusement park, Okinawa World! Get in touch with the culture by painting your very own Shisa Lion Dog to take home!

title: Hand Made Clay Okinawan Lion Dog Shisa to Take Home
description: Enjoy making your very own guardian lion-dog out of clay. Upon completion, relax at the beach with a complimentary drink while you wait for your Shisa to finish!

title: Blue Cave Diving with Private Guide from Onna
description:
Enjoy a dive into the blue waters of Okinawa. With a small group size and private instructor, even beginners can join in exploring under the waves.
Family, friends, couples, or anyone at all can ride out to the glittering Bue Cave, then head into the water with the guide, to explore the beautiful tropical waters. Including everything you need to dive, food to feed cute tropical fish, a waterproof camera to capture unique memories, and much more, this is a great way to feel the joy of diving for your very own.

title: Ryukyu Dance and Okinawan Dinner Show at Urashima in Naha
description:
Treat yourself with your choice of fabulous dinner sets and the amazing Okinawan dance show. Perfect for a night out in Naha, dive right into a fabulous evening.
Ryukyu dancers perform 10 different dances each evening, from traditional court dances to energetic folk styles. All the dancers are award winning performers, so you can see top-level talent while enjoying dinner. As the dances change daily, an English-language pamphlet is provided to explain the meaning of the various pieces. Shows start at 19:00 and 20:00.
Established in 1974, Urashima has been providing the best in Okinawan cuisine to guests ever since. Their rafute glazed pork belly is a particular treat, and the refined take on Okinawan cuisine has gained many fans. Delight yourself with both dinner and dancing, and fall in love with Okinawa.

title: Clear Kayak Tour with Snorkeling and Visit to a Desert Island from Onna
description:
Join the only clear kayak tour in Onna for a day of adventure! Watch the fish and coral pass below you, then visit a desert island inhabited by cute crabs and go snorkeling is the clear blue waters.
Float on a clear-bottomed kayak that will allow you to be surrounded by Onna's stunning seascapes from all angles. See the colorful fish, blue-green water, bright coral and white sand right beneath your feet. 

Explore Yadokari Island, named for the little hermit crabs that inhabit it. Snorkel among forests of coral (you may even see clownfish!). Dive off of rocks into the sparkling Okinawan waters.

As this is a popular activity, please write at least 3 choices for times and dates.

title: Kayaking, Snorkeling, and Trial Diving in Okinawa's Blue Cave from Onna
description: Love the sea? Enjoy a whole day of marine activities as you go kayaking, snorkeling and trial diving on this tour! Have fun exploring Okinawa's waters and get the most out of your stay.

title: Cute Shisa Lion Dog Painting Class in Nago
description: Mix and match colors to decorate your very own Shisa lion dog. Paint a cute design on the adorable ceramic piece to bring back home as a gift or souvenir from Okinawa.

title: Minnajima or Sesokojima Island Snorkel and Marine Activity Combos
description: Witness the world under the clear waters of Okinawa with your snorkel. Swim with schools of tropical fish in a garden of corals, then have fun on a banana boat, jet ski and more!

title: Trial Diving and Marine Activity Value Pack Plan in Sesokojima Island
description: Spend a day of fun encountering tropical fish and exploring the gardens of beautiful coral. Take a dive under the sea of Okinawa then enjoy parasailing ,wake boarding and more!

title: Tropical Okinawan Parasailing Outdoor Adventure from Motobu
description: See the blue and turquoise green ocean from the sky while parasailing. Great for having fun with your family or friends or for adventurous individuals.

title: Blue Cave Snorkeling Adventure from Cape Maeda
description: Swim with tropical marine life in the mystical Blue Cave with your own eyes during your snorkeling adventure by dramatic Cape Maeda. Enjoy feeding fish and other sea creatures in Okinawa's clear seas.

title: Full Day Kouri Island and Okinawa Ryukyu Village Sightseeing Bus Tour from Naha
description:
Relax at the sea of Kouri Island and enjoy the beautiful orchids in the Ocean Expo Park. Discover the culture and history in the Ryukyu Village for a full Okinawa experience.
Explore the tropical island of Okinawa on this special one day tour on a comfortable sightseeing bus. Witness many picture perfect landscapes as you stop by the main highlights of the popular island. 
Transport yourself into a jungle paradise as you begin the tour at the "Tropical Dream Center". Filled with over 2,000 orchids and other colorful flowers, come discover the wildlife of the island up close! Continue on to the gorgeous emerald green beaches of Kourijima Island that was featured in the Japan Airlines commercial. Take a stroll on the white sandy beaches and cross the bridge extending out to the middle of the glittering sea. Wrap up the day by learning about the ancient Ryukyu Okinawan culture while listening to traditional music for a fascinating and unforgettable experience.

title: Classic Indigo Blue Tie-dye Aizome Experience in Okinawa World
description: Learn the traditional method of blue tie-dyeing known as Aizome. Create and design your own handkerchief using the natural indigo dye obtained from plants.

title: Okinawa World Fruit Farm Segway Tour
description: Cruise through the open fields and the orchard on a segway and see how tropical fruit are grown! Stop by the Ryukyu kingdom village for a great cultural experience!

title: Yadokari Island Sea Kayak and Snorkeling Tour from Onna
description:
Paddle the clear blue seas of Okinawa and head for an uninhabited island where you can see tropical fish while snorkeling in the warm waters.
Begin on land, where your guide will teach you how to kayak, then head out onto the ocean. The water is clear enough to make the sea bed seem near, letting you enjoy the sights of coral reefs as you paddle. Your guide may lead you to a hidden cave, or off to Yadokari Island for the next part of the adventure, snorkeling! With a life jacket on, even non-swimmers can join in and watch the schools of bright tropical fish that dart through the reefs and waters near the island.

title: Marine Sports Thrill Ride Package in Nago
description:
Blast off into excitement with a thrill ride package of popular marine sports. Bounce and roar over the waves as you experience the fun of a banana boat and other types of towing tubes!
Great for children and adults, marine sports are high speed thrill rides that are simultaneously very safe, letting children as young as 3 join in on the fun! Remember to hang on tight to the banana boat as it blasts straight through the water, sending spray everywhere.

title: Iroetsuke Lacquerware Traditional Art Lesson with Colored Lacquer in Kyoto
description: Learn traditional techniques of Kashoku, ways of decorating lacquerware handed down in Kyoto. Iroetsuke is a technique of painting pictures with colored Urushi lacquer.

title: Fun Ceramics Painting Experience in Central Kyoto
description: Choose from among 10 types of unglazed earthen ware, such as Japanese tea cups, mugs, rice bowls and more! Have fun painting with 2 or 5 colors, and see how the colors change after firing!

title: Half-Day Fresh Tofu Making Cooking Course in Kyoto
description: Begin cooking from soy beans, then taste the difference of each stage of tofu. Experience this rare opportunity to taste the difference of freshly made tofu.

title: Traditional Japanese Sweets Making Lessons in Kyoto
description: Bring your family and friends for a delicious experience in Kyoto. Use traditional methods to make different kinds of decorative confectionery and taste it on the spot.

title: Cute Kimono Rental for Couples in Kyoto
description:
Spend a modern yet elegant day together in Kyoto with that special someone. Dressing up in traditional kimono and yukata and set off around town together.
Even if your requested time is full, there may be availability before or after your desired time. Please select a second or third choice of your preference.

title: Half Day Special Haregi Kimono Dressing Experience at a Local Home in Kyoto
description: Do more than wear a kimono, learn about the different types and the traditional rules that determine what type of kimono to be worn on what occasion. Bring your own camera and take many pictures too.

title: Ninja Costume Experience in at Ninja Dojo in Kyoto
description: Wear a cool ninja costume, and have fun taking pictures around the Ninja Yashiki House! A great short break from sightseeing in Kyoto, and ideal for groups with kids.

title: Pottery Experience with Cafe Lunch in Kyoto
description: Spend a relaxing session at a cafe making an original piece of ceramic to use at home. Then treat yourself to an afternoon session with coffee, green tea or lunch after a day of work.

title: Budget Friendly Kimono Rental and Dressing in Central Kyoto
description:
Spice up a trip to Kyoto with this special set plan including kimono, sash, bag and sandals. Choose from a variety of patterns and fabrics to fit your style.
Even if your requested time is full, there may be an open time slot before or after your desired time. Please select a second or third choice of your preference.

title: Kimono Dressing and Walking Tour of Gion in Kyoto
description:
Dress in a traditional Japanese kimono, have your hair styled and then explore Gion with a guide, for a perfect memory of your visit to Kyoto and fabulous photos!
Looking for a unique memento of your time in Kyoto? Why not explore Gion dressed in a kimono?

With 200 colors and patterns to choose from, and a professional stylist on hand to arrange your hair, you will look your very best in pictures taken around the geisha district of Gion. Learn more about this traditional area, and feel like a local dressed in their best kimono.

Both women and men are welcome to join this fun tour!

title: Japanese Style Wedding at a Traditional Machiya
description:
The machiya of Kyoto are the perfect setting to begin your new life together as husband and wife. Experience a traditional Japanese wedding!
A National Cultural Asset, the Tondaya machiya is an unforgettable place to hold a traditional Japanese wedding ceremony. 

Wearing a shiromuku (traditional bridal kimono) and a montsuki-hakama (men's formal dress kimono) the couple will take part in the San-San-Kudo, where the bride and groom take turns sipping sake three times from three different cups, totaling nine sips. As three symbolizes happiness, nine (three times three) is the ultimate lucky number!

title: Japanese Shibori Hand-Dyeing Experience in Kyoto
description: Select either a pair of jeans or T-shirt to dye your original design. Use colors of your choice and traditional shibori tye-die methods to make a perfect gift or souvenir from Kyoto.

title: Handmade Pottery Experience using a Potter's Wheel near Kiyomizudera Temple
description: Learn hand forming techniques and make a mug, rice bowl, or plate! Just a stone's throw from one of Kyoto's most famous temples, take a creative break from sightseeing.

title: Half Day Chopstick Making and Kyoyuzen Dyed Chopstick Case in Kyoto
description: Use soft, comfortable and fragrant Kitayama Cedar to make your own chopsticks. Create a personal carrying case colored by Kyoto Yuzen dyeing as a finishing touch.

title: Authentic Ninja Training Experience at Ninja Dojo in Kyoto
description: Led by a genuine ninja who trained in Iga, the homeland of ninjas. Learn the tricks and stealthy moves of these iconic spies. Participants will receive a Ninja License after the course!

title: Shakyo (Sutra Copying) at Bishamondo Shourinji Temple
description:
While in Kyoto, take a moment to calm your mind through the practice of shakyo at Shourinji Temple. Open to beginners, no Japanese knowledge required. 
Copying sutras is considered a form of 'writing meditation', to align the body and mind with the sutras the practitioner writes out. It is considered a meritorious practice, dating back to the times before the printing press, when the only way to pass on knowledge was by hand-copying.

Trace over the characters within the quiet tatami halls and garden-facing porches of the temple, guided by the monks of Shourinji. 

Shourinji Temple was built in 1550, and the Heian-era statue of Bishamonten which graces the altar was originally found hidden in the ceiling of Tofukuji Temple.

title: Kyoto One Day Free Pass for the Randen Tram and Bus
description:
Ride the retro Randen trams and Kyoto buses all day for only 700 yen! Discover the hidden gems of the ancient capital and enjoy discounts at select shops too.
The Randen Tram Line connects scenic Arashiyama in western Kyoto with Shijo-Omiya, in the middle of the city. Dotted along the tram line are UNESCO World Heritage sites, tranquil zen gardens and spiritual temples. As this pass also includes Kyoto buses, you can now start your journey from Kyoto station bus terminal! This 1-day pass costs just 700 yen, but lets you ride trams and buses all day! Visiting the best of Kyoto at your pace, all with no fuss and no hassle.
We recommend visiting Tenryuji, Ryoanji and Ninnaji Temples, each one an amazing sight!

title: Cultural Walking Tour of Kyoto's Shrines and Gion Geisha District
description:
Experience Japan's culture capital of Kyoto. Spend a calm afternoon in Tofukuji's Zen garden, go through the beautiful torii gates of Fushimi Inari Shrine and visit the famous geisha district of Gion.
Your English-speaking guide will take you on a relaxing walk around Kyoto, the culture capital of Japan! Start the tour with a visit to Tofukuji Temple where you can see its beautiful Zen garden. Then walk through a local neighborhood to reach Fushimi Inari Shrine and its famous red gates. As the sun sets, your guide will bring you to the geisha neighborhood of Gion, which comes alive at night through geisha entertainment in its various historic tea houses.

title: Half Day Ikebana Flower Arrangement Lesson at a Local Home in Kyoto
description: Visit an Ikebana instructor’s house to learn the graceful art of Japanese flower arrangement in an intimate lesson. With full English interpretation, no need to worry about the language barrier.

title: Traditional Bamboo Basket Weaving Experience
description: Get hands on as you learn the traditional methods of weaving bamboo baskets. With your choice of three styles, the whole family can join and make unique souvenirs.

title: Unique Shibori Cloth Dyeing Experience in Kyoto
description:
Create a scarf or furoshiki cloth wrapper using traditional shibori dyeing techniques and take home a wearable souvenir of your visit to Kyoto.
Located near Nijo Castle, the Kyoto Shibori Museum is dedicated to preserving this thousand-year old cloth dyeing tradition. Often used as a decorative technique for kimono and traditional Japanese accessories, the patterns are different every time.

title: Full Day Top Class Bicycle Rentals in Kyoto
description:
Bike through Kyoto at your own pace with handy bikes, specially created to be safe and comfortable for riders of all ability levels! Take a tour around temples and shrines at ease!
Want to explore Kyoto at your own pace? Then hop on one of the high-quality bikes and discover this beautiful city on two wheels!

With easy returns, full insurance, emergency support services and friendly English-speaking bike pros, this is a great option for adventurous travelers.

Our top-of-the-range bikes (including their very own special Ginrin bike, specially made for biking around Kyoto) are lightweight but sturdy, the perfect travel companions. Choose from the comfy Ginrin, swift professional mountain bikes or even folding bikes.

Rainy day cancellations are free too!

title: Traditional Tea Ceremony in English near Kiyomizu Temple in Kyoto
description:
Take a taste of true Japanese hospitality with an English-language tea ceremony conducted by a friendly tea master. Located just minutes from Kiyomizu Temple, a perfect addition to any trip.
Located in a traditional Japanese house on a beautiful historical street near Kiyomizu Temple, one of Kyoto's most famous sights, join Camellia for a serene tea ceremony.
The Japanese tea ceremony, also called sado or cha-no-yu, has over 400 years of history. Take time to enjoy this once-in-a-lifetime moment in a beautifully decorated tea room. The tea master will demonstrate the tea ceremony, and then teach you the basics of making the perfect bowl of matcha tea.
Experience the best of Japanese hospitality with an English-speaking tea master!

title: Pocket WiFi Router Rental with Kyoto Hotel Delivery (2-Day to 30-Day Plans)
description:
Stay connected at all times during your stay in Japan with a pocket wifi router! Great for both work and vacations, this is an easy way to make sure you have wifi wherever you go in Kyoto.
Get high speed, mobile broadband for your iPad, laptop and smartphone anytime and anywhere in Japan. The Pocket Wifi can quickly create group internet access and individual WiFi hotspots; connect wirelessly to many devices such as iPads, laptops, digital cameras, iPhones, Android phones and game devices to let you play games online, transfer pictures and keep in touch.

Returning the WiFi is easy, with a premade postal form included in the package. All you have to do is take your pocket WiFi and its components, along with the postal form, to the nearest convenience store. You can also drop it off at Yamato Transport Services at major airports, as well as from various spots in the city.
(Please be advised that not all convenience stores will be able to accept the package.)

title: Maiko Evening Performance with Unlimited Drinks in Kyoto
description:
Take a big step into the magical world of geisha and maiko with an amazing evening. Enjoy drinking while the maiko performs, then take the chance to chat in English and even take pictures!
Enjoy a magical evening of entertainment. The graceful and elegant Geisha and Maiko of Kyoto are amazingly skilled entertainers, each able to play multiple instruments, sing, dance, and more.
Normally Ochaya, where Geisha and Maiko perform, will not receive new customers without a recommendation from a regular client. However the Tomikiku tea house in Gion offers this once in a lifetime opportunity. Sip on free-flowing sake, beer or wine, watch the geisha and maiko perform a graceful dance, then play traditional Japanese games with them. After that, feel free to chat and ask questions, or even take pictures.

Your start time between 20:00 and 21:30 will be confirmed after booking.

title: The Ancient City of Kyoto Tour (Full-Day, Morning or Afternoon)
description:
Explore the ancient city of Kyoto with expert guides! See Kinkakuji Temple, the Imperial Palace, Sanjusangendo, Kiyomizu Temple and more. Choose your course!
Full Day and Morning tours begin at Kyoto's famous Nijo Castle. Next visit  gold-clad Kinkakuji Temple and the Kyoto Imperial Palace, the residence of Japan's emperor before 1869. The morning tour portion concludes at Kyoto Station.

After lunch the Full Day adventure continues and the Afternoon Tour begins at the stunning Heian Shrine, before heading to the halls of Sanjusangendo to see 1,000 impressive life-sized Kannon statues. Kiyomizu-dera Temple is your final destination, where the vistas of Kyoto are a perfect wrap-up to the day.

title: Half-Day Tokyo Tsukiji Fish Market Tour with Sushi Lunch (English Guided)
description: Explore one of the largest seafood marketplaces in the world! Let your taste buds go on an adventure as you savor fresh delicacies followed by a tasty serving of sushi and sake in a local restaurant.

title: Car or Minivan Rental Service from Tokyo Station, Shinjuku or Shibuya
description: Depart from central Tokyo to casually tour around the busy city or venture out to Mt. Takao, Yokohama, Hakone and more. Travel hassle-free with your group to the highlights of Japan by car.

title: Samurai Armor Photo Shoot in Central Shibuya
description:
Don the dramatic armor of a samurai warlord. Pick from a selection of perfect replicas, take awesome photos in a studio then head out to the streets of Shibuya to show off your awesome armor!
Enjoy an exceptional armor experience wearing the distinctive armor of former warlords of the Sengoku period! Select your favorite warlord's armor and get helpful assistance from professional dressers. Strike a pose in the specially prepared studio and take photos home with you on the day. Then go out to enjoy a stroll through the busy streets of Shibuya in the armor for memorable photos right in the heart of Tokyo.
Armor for children is also available!

title: All You Can Drink Fruit Wines at a Standing Bar in Shibuya
description: Sip on the tastiest fruits, no matter the season, right here in central Shibuya. With no time limit, free re-entry, and vanilla ice cream, this delightful little getaway is sure to please.

title: 100 Types of Sake All-You-Can-Drink Tasting at a Local Bar in Ikebukuro
description: Dive into Sake with more than 100 types to try! Bring your own snacks and have fun with no time limit and free re-entry. Pick up something tasty at the station before you arrive.

title: Japanese Home-Style Cooking Lesson in Tokyo in English (Morning or Evening)
description:
Join a fun cooking class and learn all about not just traditional homemade food but also Japanese takes on Western dishes, snacks, spicy food, and much more.
Get to know Japan through its cuisine. Choose from an exciting array of dishes and whip out

title: Kimono Rental and Tea Ceremony in Elegant Ginza in English or Chinese
description: Step into the tranquil calm of the traditional tea ceremony while wearing an elegant kimono, then set out on a stroll of the gleaming and modern Ginza district.

title: Glass Engraving with Sand Blasting Lesson in Ichigaya
description: Experience a special sandblasting session where you engrave cute designs on your selected piece of glassware. Great for gifts, souvenirs or for every day use at home.

title: Robot Restaurant Tickets for the Live Neo-Futuristic Show in Shinjuku
description:
Grab your tickets and get ready for the unique live music, dancers, parade of robots and lasers galore! Book now and watch the world-famous show and enjoy a real only-in-Japan experience!
Reserve your tickets for the hit show that is an out of this world barrage of lights, sounds, robots and dance! Incredibly popular with audiences in Kabukicho, the heart of Shinjuku, this show is a sensory overload in the greatest way. Once you enter the Robot Restaurant you will be transported to a different world filled with a mix of futuristic robots walking and dancing to the music along with the "Josen", an army of gorgeous warriors who play traditional Japanese wadaiko drums. Get ready for their battle against dinosaurs and samurai, and so much more in a frenetic performance that will leave you stunned. This is one performance you will never forget! After the show, take pictures with the cool robots to show off back home.

title: Nikko and Kegon Falls World Heritage Day Tour From Tokyo
description:
Set out to the charming mountain town of Nikko and discover some of its most amazing sites, like the historic Toshogu Shrine and beautiful Kegon Falls, all with an English speaking guide.
A small town with a deep cultural and religious history, Nikko is a perfect day trip from Tokyo. Start your day with a relaxing drive to this mountain town, passing through Japan’s scenic countryside. Guests will visit the Toshogu Shrine, the temple and mausoleum of Tokugawa Ieyasu, the founder of the mighty Tokugawa Shogunate. Gaze over the beautiful Chuzenji Lake and finish with a visit to Kegon Falls, one of Nikko's most impressive waterfalls.

title: Traditional Yakatabune Cruise on Tokyo Bay (Cherry Blossom Season Special)
description:
Relax aboard a luxurious yakatabune as you watch the bright lights of Tokyo from the calm waters of the Sumida River and Tokyo Bay while dining on finely prepared cuisine and free-flowing drinks.
Take a cruise on this traditional and luxurious yakatabune pleasure boat. Ever since the Edo Period, the lords of the region would relax aboard their private boats, a pastime that is popular with everyone today. Relax as the boat cruises the Sumida River and you savor a delicious kaiseki style meal, consisting of tempura, fresh sashimi, and other seasonal delicacies along with drinks of your choice. This Japanese style dinner sailing boasts exceptional views from the colorful cruiser, along with fantastic 360-degree views of the lights and sights of Tokyo from the open air sky decks.

title: Private Shore Excursion to Tokyo from Yokohama Port
description: Tour around Tokyo's famous landmarks such as Shibuya, Harajuku and Asakusa by private car. Get whisked from the cruise port to the city with a helpful English, French or Chinese guide!

title: Nikko City Area Rail Pass: Visit Nikko and Kinugawa Onsen
description:
This special train pass makes visiting Nikko easy! See the many World Heritage shrines and temples like Toshogu or enjoy the Kinugawa Onsen area. The pass is valid for 1 night and 2 days.
Enjoy the perks of the Nikko City Area Pass and organize your own self-guided tour. Hop on the train in Asakusa, then spend your time in Nikko or Kinugawa Onsen enjoying the many World Heritage sites in the area along the route between Asakusa and the unlimited ride zone. During your trips to shrines and temples like Toshogu Shrine, Rinnoji and Futarasan, receive discounts on souvenirs, restaurants and many tourist facilities and rides.

title: Stylish Nail Art Experience near Haneda Airport with English Support
description: Decorate your fingertips while learning how to make your very own nail chips. Find your favorite base manicure, add rhinestones and pretty designs to make your personalized nail chips to take home.

title: Private Chartered Taxi Transfers between Tokyo Disney Resort and Central Tokyo
description:
Hop on a stylish taxi with convenient pick-up and drop-off services between Disneyland or Disney Sea and central Tokyo. Great for large families or those traveling in groups, have a perfect day!
Skip the hassle of trains and buses, and arrive at Disney in style via a private chartered taxi! Tired after a long day of fun rides and exploring the Magic Kingdom? This service assures you will be able to get a seat (and maybe even a quick snooze!) on your way back to your Tokyo hotel!

title: Private Custom Tour of Tokyo with Optional Transfers to/from Narita Airport
description: Visit some of the best attractions in Tokyo, including Shibuya, SKYTREE and Tokyo Tower on this custom chartered tour. Leave your luggage in the car while exploring.

title: Private Transfer between Narita Airport and Hakuba or Nozawa Ski Resorts
description:
Take your ski wear and travel hassle free from Narita Airport right to Hakuba or Nozawa Ski Resorts. Great for large groups or families traveling with small children in the winter!
This all-inclusive service makes traveling between Narita Airport and Hakuba or Nozawa Ski Resort a breeze! Highway tolls, parking fees and Meet & Greet fees are all included. From solo travelers to groups of 60, we have you covered!

title: Private English Guided Mt. Fuji and Gotemba Outlet Shopping Tour from Tokyo
description:
Visit Mt. Fuji and nearby sights on this private tour which includes time to shop at a popular outlet mall. Enjoy a yummy lunch and relax in the hot springs for an unforgettable day by Mt.Fuji.
Enjoy a hassle-free tour to Mt.Fuji on board a convenient mini-van taking you and your group directly from your hotel to Japan's famous mountain. A Japanese, English and French-speaking multilingual guide will be on board to assist you along the way. A Chinese-speaking guide is also available upon request. See Mt. Fuji up close, shop to your heart's content and enjoy a panoramic view of the grand mountain from the hot springs for a memorable time in Japan.

title: Private Custom Taxi Tour of Tokyo with an English-Speaking Guide
description:
This special private tour around Tokyo allows you to customize your itinerary! With an English-speaking guide by your side, navigate the sights with confidence and see the city your way.
Get around the language barrier and tour around Tokyo's best sights with your very own private English-speaking guide. Visit places only locals know or let your guide create a unique itinerary of places that fir you and your group's interests!

title: Full-Day Private Tokyo Tour for Large Groups from Yokohama Port
description: Catering up to 60 people, groups looking for a fun shore excursion can enjoy touring around popular spots of Tokyo in a private vehicle, all with an English speaking driver.

title: Japanese Indigo Dyeing or Batik Traditional Dyeing Workshop in Asakusa
description: Choose from washcloths, handkerchiefs, T-shirts and more to stencil and dye in a traditional style. Give the classic art of batik a try and carefully lay out your design.

title: 11 Day Cherry Blossom and World Heritage Tour of Japan from Tokyo
description:
Sample the best of Japan and visit to the most popular local highlights in its major cities. Starting from Tokyo, tour all the way down to Osaka, Kyoto, Hiroshima and more with an English guide.
Choose from two options:

1. March Departure - March 25th to April 4th
2. April Departure - April 1st to April 11th

title: English Walking Tour with a Sumo Wrestler in Ryogoku and Asakusa
description:
Stroll through the historic districts of Tokyo with a sumo wrestler and an English guide to take you around. Discover Asakusa and Ryogoku in this memorable walking tour.
Walk along the local streets of Asakusa and Ryogoku with a  sumo wrestler guide and an English translator. Learn about the locations related to sumo wrestling, such as Ryogoku Sumo stadium or the sumo stables where daily practices are held. Make way to the popular area of Asakusa and discover the cultural side of Japan at the Sensouji temple. A great opportunity a look at a side of Tokyo through the eyes of a Sumo wrestler.

title: Beginner Friendly Spanish-Style Tile Painting Experience in Tokyo
description: Paint on original designs influenced by Spanish art onto ceramic tiles to create colorful home decor, such as clocks and name plaques to decorate your room.

title: Stylish Kimono Rental and Dressing in Elegant Ginza
description: Dress up in an elegant kimono and experience Japanese kimono fashion while in Tokyo. Visit the Imperial Palace Gardens, Tokyo Station, Tsukiji, Kabukiza and other nearby top sights!

title: Private Shinjuku Night Tour with Robot Restaurant or Magic Bar Cuore Dinner
description:
Take a stroll through the entertainment district and discover the wild side of Tokyo! Enjoy both a dinner and a show for a fun night in Japan.
As the sun sets in the business district, the night transforms the city into a fun filled area of entertainment. Walk through the main streets of Shinjuku surrounded with neon lights and shop at some of the most popular department stores. 
Then dip into the back alleys of the fancy streets and discover the nostalgic side with tiny bars and local foods in Omoide Yokocho. After some shopping and walking, enjoy a dinner and a surprising performance at either the famous Robot Restaurant or Magic Bar Cuore!

title: Private Rickshaw Tours of Asakusa (30 Minute Plans)
description: Choose from 4 different courses, and enjoy a tour of traditional Asakusa in comfort and style on a Japanese rickshaw! An only-in-Japan experience.

title: Elegant Tea Ceremony at Warakuan Teahouse in Tokyo
description:
Experience the heart of sado, the Way of Tea, in this hidden teahouse near central Shibuya. Take in the serene atmosphere, and savor a quiet bowl of matcha prepared by a tea master.
Visit the home of a tea master of the Koborienshu school of tea, who will warmly welcome you into this traditional world.  From sado enthusiasts from overseas to first-timers, experience the serenity of this intimate tea room and sip the perfectly prepared matcha tea.

The tea master will not only prepare tea, but also create a seasonally unique atmosphere using decor, incense and appropriate tea ceremony accouterments. Tea ceremonies are a chance to take a break from the outside world, and experience a moment of peace and calm.

title: Private Yukata Lesson in Tokyo with Casual Kimono To Take Home!
description:
Learn how to properly tie a yukata (light cotton kimono) and obi sash, perfect for summer festivals! After taking pictures, you will take your yukata home!
This unique activity allows guests to select and wear a colorful yukata (a light cotton kimono) with an obi sash. Assisted by the instructor, you will learn how to dress yourself in a yukata. Less complex and lighter than normal kimono, in the summer you will often see people walking around the city in this traditional Japanese garb.

Then we will help you take photos in our Japanese-style rooms or in the garden. The best part is that you can take the yukata home with you, as a souvenir of your visit to Japan!

title: Bento Making Class at Tokyo TJT Studio
description:
Learn how to make the famous Japanese bento meals! Choose between an elegant or cute character style bento, then enjoy your handmade dishes for lunch.
Japan's artistic bento box lunches have become famous worldwide, and now you too can learn how to create one from scratch.

First learn how to make the small dishes traditionally associated with bento, then arrange them in either an elegant 'shokado' box or a cute character bento box. You can even learn how to make the rice balls shaped like animals or anime characters!

Then enjoy the fruits of your labor, and sit down to a lunch of your very own handmade bento.

title: Kyoto & Nara Two Day Special Sightseeing Roundtrip Tour from Tokyo
description:
Hop in on a two day guided tour of both Kyoto and Nara. Round trip bullet train tickets and lovely hotel accommodations meet top class guiding for a fun and informative adventure.
Hop on the swift Nozomi bullet train, and reach Kyoto in about 2 hours, then dive right into temples and shrines. Check out Nara, home to huge Todaiji Temple, where the world's largest bronze Buddha statue sits. Play with the 1,200 deer at the Nara Deer Park, said to be the celestial messengers of the gods, then follow the path through gardens to the Kasuga Grand Shrine. After a full day of sightseeing relax at your Kyoto hotel. The next morning begins at Nijo Castle, continues at stunning Kinkakuji Golden Pavilion, and even takes you to the famous Kyoto Imperial Palace. After a refreshing lunch, continue on to the Heian Shrine and other sights!

title: Convenient Narita Airport Shuttle Service To or From Tokyo Hotels
description:
You will enjoy easy and convenient door-to-door shuttle service between Narita International Airport and central Tokyo. This great option is for both solo travelers and groups.
Book simple and stress free transportation to and from Narita International Airport (NRT) to enjoy a comfortable, hassle-free shuttle service. Available to and from hotels or Japanese ryokan inns in central Tokyo, anywhere within the designated 15 wards of Tokyo and even Maihama! No additional charges for early morning or late flights, meaning what you see is what you get. Perfect for both solo travelers looking for a great rate and larger groups seeking private transportation.
If taking the shuttle from Narita, after you exit the baggage claim, the driver will meet you with a sign. For pick-ups at hotels, the driver will meet you at the front desk.

title: Tsukiji Fish Market Morning Tour with Breakfast
description: Visit the largest fish market in Tokyo! Enjoy a seafood breakfast before touring the market for more local treats. Check out Japanese knives as well as other local goods. A must for seafood lovers!

title: Tastes of Tradition: Asakusa Half Day Food Tour with Lunch
description:
Explore the alleyways of the nostalgic wonder that is Asakusa. Munch on regional snacks like rice crackers and pickles. Enjoy Japanese cuisine for lunch and wash it down with green tea. Yum, yum! 
Among the busy crossings and modern skyscrapers of Tokyo lies Asakusa, a district brimming with tradition and nostalgia. This tour takes you through its charming streets as you sample Japan's seasonal and regional flavors. From local favorites such as hand-grilled rice crackers and melon bread, to dishes of international fame such as sashimi, sink your teeth into the exciting tastes of Japanese cuisine!

title: Reserved Tickets for LEGOLAND® Discovery Center Tokyo
description:
Experience how much fun LEGO® bricks can be in this theme park full of hands-on attractions! Tour a LEGO® brick factory, attend a LEGO® class, and see a diorama of Tokyo created using LEGO® bricks.
LEGOLAND Discovery Center Tokyo is an indoor LEGO® theme park where visitors are surrounded by over 3 million LEGO® bricks.
There are a number of attractions visitors can enjoy with their families, such as touring a LEGO® brick factory, attending a LEGO class to learn how to make special LEGO® creations, an enormous diorama of the city of Tokyo created using LEGO® bricks, and a Duplo® playground where even babies can play safely.
Come and experience a variety of games that stimulate the imagination including the LEGO® Ninjago City Adventure, where you can train to become the most powerful ninja, 4D cinema with special-effects that will make you jump out of your skin in surprise, and the shooting ride to rescue the captured princess.

title: Camper Van Rental in Central Tokyo
description:
Rent a camper van from an easily accessible location in Tokyo. Choose from an array of van styles and enjoy the freedom of driving, sightseeing and resting in your comfortable camper.
Rent your camper from a convenient location near Ebisu Station in central Tokyo. You can choose from 3 classes of vehicles - high class for the ultimate luxurious camping experience, standard for those who prefer a comfortable but not too complicated excursion and finally economy, for travelers who don't need extra frills. Pick the van which is right for you and your friends and family.

title: Tokyo's Best Evening Foodie Walking Tour from Yurakucho (English-Speaking Guide)
description: Eat just like the locals during this tasty walking tour around the heart of Tokyo. Savor popular dishes, drinks and desserts at restaurants, izakayas and shops while viewing Tokyo's famous landmarks.

title: Fun Sumie Ink Painting Lesson in Tokyo with English Speaking Instructor
description:
Put brush to paper and watch magnificent drawings take shape. Learn the basics of Japanese Sumie painting in a fun lesson with a friendly English speaking teacher, in the heart of Tokyo.
The teacher's motto for sumie ink painting is 'there are no mistakes', as each stroke adds your own character to the painting! Located in Tokyo's famous book district of Jimbocho, have a blast learning the basics of black ink art.

title: Day Time Aerial Helicopter Sightseeing Sky Cruise of Tokyo
description: Lift off over Tokyo and check out the best tourist spots. Take a cruise around the popular spots such as SKYTREE and Tokyo Tower from above for an exclusive view.

title: Ogasawara Island Nature Sightseeing and Ocean Nature Adventure
description: You will play on the tropical Minamijima Island and swim through beautiful waters while snorkeling. If you're lucky, you may meet wild dolphins or even whales in this Eastern paradise.

title: Japanese Wagashi Sweets Making with Matcha Green Tea in Tokyo
description: Discover the harmony between traditional Japanese sweets and authentic Matcha Green Tea from Kyoto. Make your own wagashi sweets with an English instructor in this delicious opportunity.

title: Kimono Rental, Dressing and Instructor Workshops in Asakusa
description: Discover kimono in classic Asakusa, from a kimono rental and stroll around town to an Instructor training course. Beginners are welcome, so learn how to wear kimono today.

title: Reservations for Magic Show Bar and Drinks in Shinjuku, Tokyo
description: Get up close to the magicians and watch a variety of amazing illusions and tricks. This is a magical time great for all ages or as an after work relaxing party!

title: Half Day Scarf Hand Weaving Workshop in Jiyugaoka, Tokyo
description: Create a woven scarf in 4 hours while working with your favorite color and learning traditional Japanese crafts. Take your time and create a uniquely you wearable souvenir.

title: Kamakura and Enoshima Bay One Day Tour from Tokyo
description: Discover historic Kamakura, where a Great Buddha statue stands. Hasedera Temple is a must-see too, before you head to Enoshima Island to see a panoramic view of Mt. Fuji in the distance.

title: Tokyo Robot Cabaret Show Including Kobe Beef Dinner at Yakiniku Motoyama
description:
Enjoy this Robot show dinner package which includes a delicious Kobe beef dinner at Yakiniku Motoyama restaurant. Discover the out-of-this-world magic of a robot entertainment show with flashy neon lights and dance music; and afterwards enjoy a high-quality rare beef dinner.This package includes access to a show at the Robot Restaurant and a Kobe beef dinner at Yakiniku Motoyama restaurant. You can first go for dinner and then see the show, or vice-versa (depending on the option you select at the booking - please see the Important Info tab for details on these options). The two venues are less than ten minutes apart on foot. 
Show at the Robot Restaurant 
The Robot Restaurant in Kabuki-cho in Shinjuku is one of the most famous entertainment venues in Tokyo, offering a fusion of Japanese culture and robots. This unique, futuristic and loud show will target all your senses and is definitely something worth experiencing. The music, dancing and state-of-the-art technology will leave you impressed. 

Dinner at Yakiniku Motoyama Restaurant
After the extraordinary show, your delicious dinner is a short ten-minute walk away. At the restaurant, enjoy rare high-quality Japanese Kobe beef from a well known local farm. The cuts will be in an easy-to-eat size, the quality score of the beef will be a 5 and will offer a high marbling ratio. 
Please choose your meal option from below: 

【Dinner Menu A】
- Assorted Kimichi
- 6 flavor Namul
- Wagyuu Sushi
- Salad
- Deluxe Salty Beef Tongue
- Premium Pork Boneless Short Rib
- Premium Pork Neck
- Assorted Vegetables
- Kobe Beef Boneless Short Rib
- Kobe Beef Loin 
- Kobe beef Skirt Steak 
- Today Specialty 3 Assorted Hormone 

【Dinner Menu B】
- Today's rare region
- Assorted specialty region (Misuji (shoulder tender), Tougarashi (shoulder to arm), Sankaku (short rib))
- Special tongue
- Marinated pork 
- Pork neck
- Special skirt steak
- Marinated Kobe beef
- Fresh organ
- Wagyu nigiri
- Assorted Kimchi
- 6 kinds of namul (seasoned vegetables)
- Lettuce
- Assorted vegetables
- Korean

title: Tokyo Robot Cabaret Show Including Dinner at 'Alice in Wonderland' Themed Restaurant
description:
Catch the famous Robot Cabaret Show and dinner at Alice in a Labyrinth restaurant. Discover the excitement of a robot entertainment show with neon lights and catchy dance music. Enjoy a delicious meal before or after your show.Choose to either have dinner before or after the famous Robot Cabaret Show in Tokyo. Dine at Lewis Carol's Alice in Wonderland themed fantasy restaurant. Enjoy one of four menu options. 

Plan A:
Assorted appetizer
Citrus flavored green salad with walnut and Parmesan cheese
French fries with herb butter flavor
Aged pork with herb and roasted vegetables
Seasonal mousse

Plan B: 
Assorted appetizer
Citrus flavored green salad with walnut and Parmesan cheese
Pizza styled yeast bread with quatro cheese
Aged pork with herb and roasted vegetables
Seasonal mousse

Plan C:
Assorted appetizer
Caesar salad with whey pork bacon and romaine lettuce
Pizza styled yeast bread with quatro cheese
Aged pork with roasted vegetables and steak frit
Truffle flavored soup risotto
Assorted desserts

*Menu is subjected to change by season.
*The course includes one drink. (beer, wine, or non-alcoholic)

title: Tokyo Robot Cabaret Show Including Wagyu Beef and Tofu Dinner
description:
An exclusive package with a Robot Cabaret show ticket and high-quality brand wagyu beef with tofu dinner at an authentic Japanese restaurant in Shinjuku. 
Enjoy the magic of a robot entertainment show with flashy neon lights and exciting dance music. Dine on wagyu beef or tofu at an authentic Japanese restaurant.This package includes access to the famous and popular Robot show and includes a Wagyu beef and tofu dinner at restaurant Kissho. You have a choice of either dinner or show first (depending on the option you select at booking). The two venues are about ten minutes apart on foot. 

Kuroge (black) Wagyu Sukiyaki
- Cold tofu
- Fried tofu with miso paste
- Sashimi (Tuna and yuba)
- Tempura
- Kuroge wagyu sukiyaki
- Assorted vegetables
- Rice
- Dessert
*Beverage is available for an additional fee.

About Tofu cuisine Kissho
They provide Nikko tofu made from the soy beans grown in Japan, the crystal clear water from Nikko, and Kissho's professionals' heart and soul. In addition, you will have a chance to eat sukiyaki with selected black beef wagyu beef with special sauce. 
In Kissho, the quintessence of Japanese hospitality or ,Omotenashi, can be felt in every small detail. 

*Vegetarian menu available. Please inform tour operator of any food allergies in advance.

About Robot Restaurant 
Kabuki-cho in Shinjuku is one of the most famous entertainment town in Tokyo.The Robot restaurant is located in the heart of Kabuki-cho.
Over 8 million dollars (10 billion yen) in construction costs, this is an extraordinary live show where robots walk around. It's a fusion of Japanese culture and robots, and a new sensory experience that no one has ever seen before.There is music, dance, and technology fused into one show. Truly one-of-a-kind entertainment.

Travelers from all over the world visit The Robot Restaurant. This is a Japanese attraction that leaves tourists impressed.

title: Evening Food and Drink Tour in Osaka
description:
Join us for a just slightly offbeat, fully all-inclusive night tour of Tenma and Kyobashi, two of Osaka's most well-known local food and drink areas! You'll get to eat typical Osaka food, have a few drinks, frolic with the locals, and have all sorts of fun along the way! Your guide will be a native English speaker with the fluent Japanese to take you deep into the local scene. This small group tour (6 guests or less -- and it usually is less), combines history with adventure, as you explore the nooks and crannies of these very old parts of this awesome city. You're sure to have a great time getting to know the REAL Osaka.Just around sunset, we'll meet at Tenma Station (on the JR loop line, just one stop from Osaka Station/Umeda), which puts us right in the middle of a very old part of Osaka. First, we'll head to neighboring Ogimachi Park, taking in the views and getting oriented. Then it's time to dive in to Tenma proper! While walking around, your guide will explain the history and context of the area, and all about the culture that thrives here today.

After about 45 minutes of walking around, we'll stop for our first drink and bit of food for the night, in the heart of Tenma. Food will vary by restaurant and your tastes over the course of the evening, but typical dishes include "kushi katsu" (fried food on sticks), "dote nikomi" (slow cooked beef... parts), "tonpei yaki" (a grilled pork and egg dish), and some healthier things as well -- promise! A bit more walking around Tenma brings us to another great eating and drinking spot, quite different from the first one.

After we've thoroughly surveyed Tenma, we'll hop on a train for the short ride to Kyobashi, where the vibe is a bit more raucous, but equally fun! It's an old area, filled to the brim with character. In Kyobashi, we'll walk around about 10 minutes before stopping at a final "standing bar" for more food and drink. 

Osaka is famous for its food, and you're going to see it all tonight! Except takoyaki and okonomiyaki, because you can eat those on you

title: Ice Fishing on Barato River from Sapporo
description:
Participate in one of Hokkaidos most popular winter activities: ice fishing for smelt on the frozen Barato River. This seasonal half-day tour includes a fishing guide who provides your equipment (just bring your winter clothes) and then prepares your catch into tasty tempura. After a restaurant lunch (morning tour only) you have the option to be dropped off at a nearby onsen (hot spring) or return to Sapporo station by coach.

Please note: This tour is seasonal and runs yearly between January and March. The date is subject to change.Choose from a morning or afternoon tour. After your coach picks you up from Sapporo station, its just a 30-minute drive to the Barato River, which freezes into a sizable snowfield in winter. When you arrive, join in on this favorite Hokkaido pastime for more than two hours of fun. 

Follow your guide across the frozen river and into a fishing tent to receive instructions on how to catch as many smelt as you can. Pull up a stool, carve a hole through the ice, drop your fishing line into the water. Once you reel in some of the tiny fish, pop them in a pan to deep fry  Japanese style. Your guide takes over, preparing wakasagi (tempura) for you to sample right out of the hot oil. 

If you selected the morning tour, you're then accompanied to a restaurant for a lunch of local foods. 
Your half-day tour ends with drop-off at Sapporo station. Alternatively, you can be taken to Gateaux Kingdom Sapporo Hotel and Spa Resort (own expense). This luxurious onsen includes salt saunas and your choice of nine baths of various sizes, including an open-air, natural hot-spring bath. If you go, make use of a complimentary shuttle service that transfers you from the facility to Sapporo station.
Click on "View Additional Info" for the meeting location.

title: Private Cherry Blossoms in Takayama with Shopping and Cookery Lesson
description:
Celebrate spring and sakura season in Japan with a special private culinary experience in Takayama.

Start your day at 9:30am by taking a stroll with your host Midori along the scenic river in the town of Takayama and take in the sights and fragrances of the blooming cherry blossoms. Make your way to the morning Miyagawa Market where you will shop for seasonal spring produce. Return to the cooking studio and learn about the special cuisine of this region of Japan. Midori will teach you how to make a seasonal meal that features fresh spring vegetables and delicate sakura (cherry blossoms). You'll enjoy the meal together in her charming dining area. This is a wonderful opportunity to get to know a local cook in a private setting and learn to create a beautiful spring menu.Meet Midori in her beautiful cooking studio, which is set up in a historic Takayama building. From here you walk to the Miyagawa morning market to source fresh vegetables and edible wild plants. The Miyagawa River is lined with blooming trees and your host Midori will introduces you to the Japanese practice of hanami (celebrating and viewing flowering cherry blossom trees). She will show you how to select fresh, ripe produce and introduce you to local ingredients you may not be familiar with. Midori strongly believes that nothing is more precious and luxurious than using seasonal and fresh vegetables and is excited to share her culture and cuisine during your market visit and meal preparation.

Keeping in theme with the historic setting, all of the tools and utensils used in the kitchen and dining area are part of Midoris prized collection of antique cooking equipment, with many of the pieces over 100 years old.

After the market visit you will walk back to Midori's cooking studio to join Midori in the kitchen to cook a Japanese meal that celebrates sakura season and springtime. You will start your experience with a taste test of various miso pastes made in different regions around Japan. You will then go on to make your own miso soup, a staple i

title: 【Bus day tour】Kyoto＋Nara＋Kobe Including Lunch&Dinner
description: Depart from Umeda/Namba, head to the most popular point in Kobe!! Feel free to get on our comfortable bus, then your schedule for today 0% 100%

title: 【八丈島浮潛】東京秘境八丈島浮潛・初學者大推薦！
description: 八丈島是日本伊豆群島中的一個島嶼，隸屬於東京都管轄，從羽田機場出發不用一個小時就可以抵達。來到八丈島，浮潛是非常適合初學者的體驗，5歲以上就可以參加，不會游泳也沒關係，在經驗豐富的教練的指導之下，您可以放鬆飽覽美麗的海底世界！

title: JR Kansai-Hiroshima Area Pass
description: Book your JR Kansai-Hiroshima Area Pass now and explore this culturally rich part of Japan from Hiroshima in the south to Osaka, Kyoto, Kobe, and Nara further north.

title: 【廣島特色體驗】茶道體驗・英文對應
description: 在大本山大聖院內享受日本傳統茶道體驗！著名的宮島彌山有著美麗的大自然景致，更有親切的老師示範帶領，在幽靜的花園內學習茶道文化，一起度過美好的時光吧！

title: JR Takayama Hokuriku Area Pass - Philippines Post
description: Discover the Takayama and Hokuriku regions of Japan with the JR Takayama Hokuriku Area Pass and get 5 consecutive days unlimited travel on designated JR Rail trains and buses.

title: Fushimi Inari Shrine, Gion, Kiyomizudera Temple and the Maiko dance
description: Visit the classic sites of Fushimi Inari Shrine, Kiyomizudera Temple, Gion and enjoy Chankonabe hot pot and Maiko performers dance for a complete Kyoto experience.

title: 【大阪特色體驗】大阪夜間漫步之旅
description: 當地導遊才知道的當地旅遊！由導遊在一小時的時間內帶領著你，進行大阪的夜間漫步！沿途有美味的食物和當地有趣的人事物，還能在道頓堀和固力果經典合照！夜晚漫步在熱鬧的大阪，感受大阪的魅力所在！

title: Half-Day Tour from Naha, Okinawa: Snorkeling in Kerama Islands
description: Discover the white sands and blue water of the Kerama Islands on a half-day snorkeling tour. Head out from Naha City, Okinawa and explore the coral reefs.

title: Tokyo Disneyland or DisneySea Ticket
description: Discover Tokyo's wonderful world of Disneyland or DisneySea. Experience thrilling rides or watch enchanting live shows featuring your favorite Disney characters.

title: 【東京美食】外苑前/青山一丁目鄉土菜餚餐廳・海華月
description: 位於東京都外苑前/青山一丁目當地的鄉土菜餚餐廳－海華月。每份套餐贈飲品⼀杯，通過KKday 預訂才能享受到的福利哦。

title: Japan Tokyo Cosplay!
description: Come to Japan Tokyo cosplay and get a professional cartoon transfiguration. Take beautiful pictures and enjoy the Koyo experience. Don't miss the opportunity to experience the transformation of your famous Japanese cartoons.

title: (24hr Service) Japan 4G Pocket WiFi
description: Have access to high-quality portable WiFi while traveling in Japan. Check into nice attraction spots with the ease of our portable WiFi.

title: 《Kansai Transport》ICOCA smart card（included domestic / overseas postage）
description: A smart card, issued by JR-West, may be your best traveling assistant. You can use it in eastern area, Tokai area, Kansai area and also the buses attached a ICOCA sticker!!

title: 《日產》北海道NISSAN租車・P1輕型5人座
description: NISSAN日產租車線上預約！KKday為您提供最優質的租車服務。安心・舒適・整潔。不管是朋友、情侶還是家族旅遊都適合。行程不受限，盡情暢遊美麗北海道！

title: Japan Unlimited 4G Portable Wi-Fi Rental
description: Get your 4G Portable Wi-Fi Rental to access unlimited high-speed internet while traveling in Japan.

title: Nagano Day Tour: Jigokudani Monkey Park, Zenkoji Temple
description: Adventure to Nagano, Japan on a day tour. Visit Jigokudani Monkey Park to see adorable monkeys enjoying the hot spring. Witness Zenkoji Temple, founded in 642 A.D.

title: Bike Tour of Tokyo's Top Spots with a Local English-Speaking Guide
description: Discover Tokyo off the beaten track with a fun English-guided cycling tour. Choose from 3 different courses, and combine a workout with sightseeing, from the quiet Shitamachi to Odaiba or even Disney!

title: Traditional Taiko Drum Performance Experience in Tokyo
description:
Experience the fun and power of Japan's traditional taiko drums during this beginner-friendly lesson. Great for families and groups, learn how to perform a lively taiko piece!
Besides the friendly instructors, you can opt to also have a English-speaking guide (choose from the Add-ons when booking) for an even more in-depth experience!

title: Glass Kanzashi Hair Ornament Making Class in Trendy Kichijoji
description: From creating the colorful Venetian glass-style bead to securing it to the cherry or ebony hair pin, create a unique kanzashi accessory! Beautiful with kimono or as a souvenir you can use everyday.

title: Special Romantic Cruise For Two from Tokyo
description: For an anniversary, celebration or any special day, charter a cruiser and indulge in a romantic time for two. Add dinner to create a floating night in paradise.

title: Modern Kyogen (Noh) Comedy Performance in Shibuya
description:
Stop in for a comedic Kyogen play, similar to Noh theater, presented with a modern twist. Set on a dramatic traditional stage, this is a perfect introduction to the funny and historic art form.
Enjoy Kyogen while having fun is the theme around which the Kyogen Lounge was founded. Designed to spread the wry humor and witty play of Kyogen to a wide audience, we combine traditional performances with modern live events like DJs.

We know traditional Japanese performances and theater can be difficult to understand, so we have beginner-friendly explanations of the performances, etiquette, and shows, so everyone can join in and have fun.

The lounge space will also feature modern apparel and cosmetics, a standing bar, and a kimono clad DJ bringing you live music as you step into a fun filled evening.

title: Japanese Calligraphy Lesson with Professional Shodo Artist in Tokyo
description:
Learn to write your name in traditional Japanese characters. Discover the art and beauty of Japanese writing through a calligraphy lesson given by a famous shodo artist, with English assistance.
Discover the beauty of writing through Japanese brush calligraphy. Learn basic techniques by writing your favorite words or your name in Japanese kanji characters with your instructor, Yuriko Hoshino. She is a famous calligraphy designer with works on video game packages, packages and logos.

title: Keikyu Misaki Maguro Pass Tickets (2 Day Keikyu Line Pass and Delicious Tuna)
description:
This special two day pass reserved for international visitors allows you unlimited rides on Keikyu train and bus lines, a tuna cuisine meal and  leisure facilities. You can even visit Kamakura!
Pick up your Pass at Haneda Airport or Shinagawa Station, then enjoy 2 days of free rides on all Keikyu train and bus lines, a ticket for a tuna meal (1 time only) which can be used at any of 24 restaurants, and 2 leisure facility use tickets to nearby leisure facilities such as hot springs or sightseeing spots. 

[Applicable Sections & Facilities] 
Train: All Keikyu train lines
Bus: Keikyu route buses in Miura Peninsula and Kamakura areas
Tuna restaurants: 24 restaurants in the Miura Peninsula
Facilities: Jogashima Keikyu Hotel, Hotel Keikyu Aburatsubo Kanchosou, Keikyu Aburatsubo Marine Park, Hotel Miura Maholova Minds, Misaki Port Direct Sales Center Urari 

To commemorate the release of this pass, the first 100 customers will receive a pair of original chopsticks. Show the pass at the Misakiguchi Station tourist information center to claim the chopsticks.

title: Private Rickshaw Tours of Asakusa (90 Minute Charter)
description: Choose from 2 different courses, and enjoy a 1.5 hour tour of Asakusa in comfort and style on a Japanese rickshaw! An only-in-Japan experience.

title: Half Day Ogasawara Island and Minamijima Island Tour
description: Tour Minamijima Island, an uninhabited island located southwest of Chichijima Island on a special tour that takes you far from the daily city life.

title: Morning or Afternoon Snorkeling Adventure in Ogasawara
description: From Ogasawara's white beach, go snorkeling to see beautiful coral, colorful fish, a sunken ship and more! Your snorkeling instructor will be right by your side.

title: WiFi Router Rental with Tokyo Hotel Delivery Included (2-Day to 30-Day Plans)
description:
Stay connected at all times during your trip to Japan with a portable wifi router. Delivered directly to your hotel or residence, choose from a range of plans, great for both work and vacations.
Get high speed, mobile broadband for your iPad, laptop and smartphone anytime and anywhere in Japan. The Pocket Wifi can quickly create group internet access and individual WiFi hotspots; connect wirelessly to many devices such as iPads, laptops, digital cameras, iPhones, Android phones and game devices to let you play games online, transfer pictures and keep in touch.

Returning the WiFi is easy, with a premade postal form included in the package. All you have to do is take your pocket WiFi and its components, along with the postal form, to the nearest convenience store. You can also drop it off at Yamato Transport Services at major airports, as well as from various spots in the city.
(Please be advised that not all convenience stores will be able to accept the package.)

title: Full Day Tour of Mount Fuji, Forest of Spirits and Caving Adventure from Tokyo
description:
Discover iconic Mount Fuji in a brand new way as you explore the mysterious Aokigahara Forest around the base and check out the Narusawa Ice Cave after driving up to the 5th station.
Known as one of the 'Three Holy Mountains', Mt Fuji is a revered cultural and religious icon in Japan. Following a scenic drive through the countryside, you will head up to Mt Fuji’s 5th Station, to gaze down on Japan from 2300 meters above sea level! After lunch, visit the mysterious Aokigahara Forest, an untouched natural forest known for the dense woods and lava trails. Folk tales and legends tell of ghosts and goblins haunting the forest. In addition, the wind-blocking density of the trees and absence of wildlife makes this an eerie experience. You will also join a professional cave guide as you head into one of the lava caves of the mountain, exploring the underground wonders that await.

title: Gourmet Dining Twilight Cruise on Tokyo Bay
description:
Step into a magical time as you enjoy gourmet dining while the shimmering sun sinks into the sea at twilight during your scenic cruise on Tokyo Bay.
Forget the ordinary as you board for a leisurely cruise of Tokyo Bay, sweeping panoramic views, and a carefully crafted gourmet meal, all against the backdrop of the sun slowly setting beyond the waves. You may be able to see Tokyo Tower beyond Rainbow Bridge, and the lights of Sky Tree as the sun sets.

title: Fugu (Pufferfish) Lunch or Dinner Course in Kagurazaka
description:
Try pufferfish at the famous restaurant Genpin Fugu in Kagurazaka! Enjoy top-class fugu, the perfect only-in-Japan experience for adventurous eaters!
Carefully prepared by licensed chefs, come taste the infamous but tasty fugu pufferfish! Take the hassle out of ordering in Japanese with the set course of your choice, and impress friends back home! A glass of beer or a soft drink is included in the plan.

title: Private Taxi Tour to Areas Related to the Last Shogunate in Hakodate
description: Trace the history and the battles between the last Shogunate and the Meiji government from the late 1800s. Learn about notable samurais in Japanese history on a charter taxi.

title: Shiretoko Five Lakes Walking Tour
description: Tour around the five lakes of Shiretoko on a 3 km course. The relaxed pace and gentle path make for a relaxing time  with the magnificent scenery of Shiretoko.

title: One-Day Stand up Paddleboard Rental in Wakayama City
description: Come rent a Stand Up Paddleboard to use on the spot. Just bring yourself and your swim gear to enjoy leisurely sailing around on the beautiful sea.

title: Flying Squirrel Watching Tour in Karuizawa
description: Let's watch flying squirrels in the evening! After the lecture on how to find them, explore the forest and look around. Watch as they glide through the air!

title: Hakodate City Night View Sightseeing Bus Tour with Ropeway Ticket Included
description: Tour up to the top of Mt. Hakodate to see the beautifully illuminated city from above. Soar up on a ropeway to the peak for a romantic evening in Hokkaido, and get dropped off at convenient locations!

title: Shiga Highlands and Shibu Onsen Tour with Snow Monkey Park Entry in Nagano
description: Meet the famous snow monkeys in their natural habitat. Head up by a ski lift and enjoy panoramic views of the Shiga Highlands followed by a visit to a hot spring village with a 1,300 year old history.

title: Marine Sports Thrill Ride Half Day Adventure on Ishigaki Island
description: Jet ski, ocean thrill rides, sea kayaking and more! This unlimited ride plan features a all the thrills and adventure you could want in the beautiful beaches of Ishigaki island.

title: Guided Shiretoko Peninsula Trek with Ocean Views (April ~ November)
description:
Enjoy the varied sights of the untouched Shiretoko World Heritage Site as you follow an experienced guide through virgin forest and see a mighty waterfall.
Head into the untouched forests of Shiretoko, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and discover the joy of the wilderness on a 4 kilometer tour.
