Led by an experienced and passionate guide, this is your chance to see the stunning beauty of spring, summer, or autumn in Hokkaido's true outdoor paradise. With forests, mountains, and waterfalls that have never seen the touch of human construction, Japan's natural beauty shines. Make sure to check out the sight of a 100 meter waterfall that spills directly into the ocean!

title: Japanese Washi Paper Making Experience in Minakami
description: Experience making Japanese paper with natural materials, and adding a personal touch with leaves, bits of ribbon, string and more. Great for both children and paper craft lovers.

title: Half Day Traditional Konjac Jelly Cooking Workshop in Minakami
description: Head to Gunma, the home of konjac, and create fresh "konnyaku", a filling addition to any stew. From grating to mixing and boiling, you get to learn everything.

title: Beginner Friendly Kayak and Canoeing on the Ketagawa River
description: Ride along in the waters of the Ketagawa River, one of the clearest streams in Japan! With your choice of boat style you can enjoy the river just as you like.

title: Family Friendly Ketagawa River Rafting Adventure
description: Let's play in the clear river floating, jumping, and smiling with your family and friends. Enjoy outdoor relaxation in the river with experienced guides.

title: Iriomote Canoe Tour of Pinaisara Waterfall and Star Sand Beach
description: Visit the Pinaisara Waterfall and Star Sand Beach on a beginner friendly canoe tour in the tropical paradise of Okinawa. Perfect for children too!

title: Full Day Water Fun Adventure Rafting & Hydrospeed Tour in Minakami
description: Play all day in the shimmering Tone River with a fun group rafting adventure and an exciting hydrospeed tour. Look forward to the day's special lunch to charge up, too.

title: Half Day Long Canoeing Tour on the Kushiro River from Kushiro City
description: Try a long canoeing course for a full day on the river. Make your way up to Hosooka, take a break, then head 6 more km down along the Kushiro River.

title: Cafe Time and Photos with Friendly Owls Just 30 Minutes from Yokohama
description: Get up close to various owls and spend time in a cozy cafe while getting to know the adorable fluffy creatures. Relax with a drink and take many memorable photos with the cute owls.

title: Relaxing Beach Yoga Session in Zushi (with One Cafe' Drink Included)
description: Stretch and get in touch with your breath during this relaxed beach yoga session in Zushi. Feel the soft sand and sea breeze, then have a drink at the cafe'!

title: Autumn Flower Garden, Blue Pond, and Biei Tour from Sapporo
description: Stroll through a field of vibrant Autumn flowers extending across the hills of Shikisai no Oka. Enjoy the best of Biei with visits to the mystical Blue Pond all on a convenient bus.

title: One Day Shiratani Unsuikyo and Taikoiwa Trekking Course
description: Trek the easy trails around the Shiratani River, and head for the massive Taikoiwa or Drum Rock, on a full day trek through the soft greens of the forest.

title: Reservations for a Cute Cat Cafe' in Central Osaka
description: Join adorable cats at Neko Café Tenten, an at-home style cat cafe run by and for cat lovers. Make yourself at home drinking tea, eating sweets, reading books or even dozing with cats as you relax.

title: Kushiro Sightseeing Taxi Tour of Kikou Mozuna Buildings (1 hour)
description:
Visit the remarkable buildings designed by the famous Japanese architect Mozun! A perfect quick tour for fans of design and architecture.
Check out the  Kushiro Century Castle Hotel, NTT Docomo Building, Kushiro City Museum and others.

title: Full Day Mountain Climbing Tours of Yakushima Island
description: Take your pick of full day courses and explore the summits of Yakushima. From the huge Jomon Cedar to the Kuromidake or Tachudake peaks, beginners and experienced hikers can enjoy the views.

title: Airport Drop Off Service from Osaka Hotels to Kansai Airport with Staff Escort
description: English speaking staff will meet you at your hotel in Kyoto and escort you to the Airport Bus by taxi. Hop on the bus for a smooth ride to Kansai Airport.

title: Private Taxi Transfers from Kansai Airport to Osaka Hotels with Staff Assistance
description: An English assistant will ride with you in a private car from Kansai Airport to designated hotels in Osaka, making your airport transfer effortless!

title: Ishikari Plains Beginner Cycling Tour with Hot Spring and Lunch from Sapporo
description: This super flat course has less than 50 cm of elevation, letting you see the horizon as you bike. Enjoy the wide fields of Hokkaido as you cycle.

title: Rural Scenery Cycling Tour from Sapporo
description: Enjoy the open scenery around Sapporo on a bike tour of the outdoors that takes you through pastoral locations and off main roads as you explore the area.

title: Beginner Friendly Scuba Diving with Private English Guide in the Blue Cave
description: Set out from Cape Maeda to go on an underwater adventure scuba in the famous Blue Cave! First-time divers are welcome to join, as the friendly English-speaking guide will teach you the ropes.

title: Romantic Sunset Kayak Tour from Onna
description: During the sunset enjoy the sky as it turns red, orange, and even purple. Kayak through the magical time as  you listen to the wind and feel the waves.

title: Kayak to an Uninhabited Island and Snorkel from Onna
description: Set sail from Okinawa to an inhabited southern island with white sandy beaches and emerald green sea. Play with the colorful fish and explore the beautiful reefs.

title: Pick-up/Drop-off Service with Bullet Train Tickets from Kyoto to Tokyo
description:
For total ease, get picked up at your hotel in Kyoto, escorted to the bullet train, then dropped off at your hotel in Tokyo! Bullet train tickets included.
With this convenient transportation package, you will have an English-speaking assistant take you from your hotel in Kyoto to Kyoto Station, including a baggage delivery service and an one-way shinkansen (bullet train) ticket from Kyoto to Tokyo, which only takes 140 minutes! After arriving at Tokyo Station,  a drop-off service from Tokyo Station in Tokyo to your hotel is also included. Save time and stress!

title: Fall Leaves Viewing with Lunch at Bishamondo Temple  in Kyoto (Nov 18 - Dec 3)
description: Walk through the path of Autumn colors and make your way to the famous Bishamondo temple. Pay a visit to the seven deities of good luck while tasting a Kyoto-style lunch.

title: Kyoto-Style Confectionery Making and Green Tea with a Maiko
description: Enjoy a unique experience with a Maiko and learn to make the Yatsuhashi confectionery. Watch performances and let the Maiko make you a nice bowl of matcha green tea to accompany your treat.

title: Children's Maiko Photo Shoot and Kyoto Stroll Experience
description:
Transform your little girl into a Japanese Maiko with a full kimono outfit and make-up. Take photos in the studio then go out for a walk to the streets of Kyoto.
Receive 20 shots with different poses with four 2L-sized photos and 1 photo card.

title: Bus Transfer from Itami Airport to Kyoto Hotels with Staff Assistance
description: This pick-up and drop-off service will whisk you from Itami Airport to a hotel in Kyoto. A staff member will ride with you to make sure you don't get lost.

title: Fresh Pasta and Sauce Making Experience in Echizen
description: Learn the secrets of making light and delicious fresh pasta from scratch, and cook up a yummy sauce too. Great for kids and groups, enjoy your pasta for lunch!

title: Full Day Chartered Sightseeing Taxi Tour on the Nihonkai Ororon Line
description: Set off along the coastline of the Sea of Japan and visit Kamui Misaki, Soya Misaki, or many other natural sights. You might see Rishiri Fuji if the weather is fine.

title: Tandem Paragliding Flight in Katsuyama
description: Enjoy the view from on high during this sightseeing tandem flight with an experienced pilot. The 10 minute flight will take you through a 340 meter altitude change, for a awesome adrenaline rush!

title: Salon Treatment with Pearl Powder at Kiya Ryokan in Uwajima
description: Relax and treat yourself to a lovely massage treatment, while pampering your skin with the finest pearl powder from Uwajima. Your skin will shine and glow with vitality!

title: Exciting Hoverboard and Fly Board Experience in Lake Biwa (April to Oct)
description: Jet across the cool waters of Lake Biwa on a fly board or hoverboard. Feel the power of the water jet as you glide across the refreshing waters for an awesome experience.

title: Half Day Private Historical Myths and Takachiho Sightseeing Taxi Tour
description: The town of Takachiho is famous as a spot of Japanese myths and legends. Visit this magical region and indulge in touring by private sightseeing taxi.

title: Sunrise Kunimigaoka Private Charter Sightseeing Taxi Tour from Takachiho
description: Wake up a little early and see the beautiful sea of clouds and the sunrise. The magnificent view from Kunimigaoka, with mountain peaks rising through clouds, makes it feel like the sky never ends.

title: Original Ceramics Crafting Experience in Toyama
description: Learn how to use the electric potter's wheel or hand twist your very own ceramic kitchenware to use on an every day. Use this opportunity to make something for yourself or as a gift.

title: Picture Perfect Hakodate Sightseeing on a Private Taxi
description: Enjoy a quick tour of the popular locations of Hakodate such as the Goryokaku Park, Tachimachi cape with a view of Shimokita Penninsula for picture perfect photos.

title: Private Taxi Drive Through Slopes of Hakodate
description: Drive up and down the slopes of Hakodate, extending from Motomachi to Mt. Hakodate. Witness some famous spots that frequently appear in movies and commercials.

title: Northern Hot Springs Sightseeing Tour with Chartered Taxi from Tazawako Station
description: Tour the seven hot springs of Tohoku, including the Nyuto hot springs, and experience the differences of each one. This sightseeing tour brings relaxation with nice long soaks.

title: Half Day Koboke Rafting on the Yoshino River in Miyoshi
description: Hop aboard a half day rafting tour and race down the torrents of the Yoshino River! This full thrill course is great for guests who have never rafted before, too!

title: Half Day Canoeing Adventure from Wakayama City
description: Set out with an experienced guide and glide over the Wakanoura Sea. The canoe may rock at first, but you will soon be smoothly sailing over the water.

title: Seasonal Potato and Sweet Potato Harvest in Saga City
description: Get a grip of the potato vines and dig up a row of potatoes. Depending on the season you can experience sweet potato harvest as well. Make sure to take some home to taste.

title: Private Taxi Tour from Love to Happiness in Obihiro
description: Journey around the areas named after love and happiness in Obihiro on a private taxi. Many locations are a special spot for many lovers to make memories.

title: Full Day Rafting on the Yoshino River in Miyoshi
description:
Raft the mighty Yoshino River! Beginners can enjoy with our guides, so all levels can feel the rush of the river as they ride waves and rapids!
We also offer free photo and video service! No need to worry about keeping or copying a DVD, we upload the data straight to a special website, and provide participants with access to their tour's photos and pictures. You can download them at your convenience!

title: Hourly Stand-Up Paddleboard Rental in Wakayama City
description: Spend a few hours paddling across the sea on a stand-up paddle. Just bring your swim wear and yourself to enjoy exploring the sea of Wakayama.

title: Two Day Mt. Koya Tour and Buddhist Temple Stay With English Speaking Guide
description:
Visit Mt. Koya, one of the UNESCO World Heritage Sites, with an included overnight stay at the temple, and a chance to join the monks for morning prayers.
Head out to Mt. Koya, home to the Okunoin Temple, and part of a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Learn about the practices of the monks with an English-speaking guide, then check in to accommodations within the temple grounds. Enjoy a stay at a temple lodging and dine on authentic Buddhist vegetarian cuisine. The second day is entirely self-guided, letting you take as much time as you like to stroll the area and experience a side of quiet Japan.

title: Two Day Hakone Bullet Train & Hotel Package from Tokyo
description:
Enjoy a special bargain travel package to Hakone, one of Japan's top resorts with round trip Shinkansen tickets and a hotel with an onsen hot spring.
When you're not out and about sightseeing in Hakone, you can have a relaxing soak in your hotel's natural hot springs. Enjoy the many parks, shrines, hot springs, and other delights Hakone has to offer. The clear weather views of Mt. Fuji are also a wonderful sight to see.

title: Downstream Mogami River Seasonal Cruise in Murayama
description: The Mogami River downstream cruise started in the Heian Era, and is even now a lovely way to admire the seasonal beauty of the river and the banks with family or friends.

title: Bridal Kimono or Engagement Photography  Experience in Fukuoka
description: Commemorate a special moment in your life with this special bridal photo shoot! Wear a Japanese kimono, and enjoy a special moment with your partner.

title: Seasonal Highlight Tour of Southern Hokkaido on a Private Taxi from Hakodate
description: From cherry blossoms, fall foliage to a winter wonderland. Enjoy the beautiful views of Sapporo and Hakodate on a convenient taxi. A special view is available for every season.

title: White Water River Rafting Adventure in Gifu with English-Speaking Guides
description: Grab your paddles and hop on a raft to slip and slide down a thrilling natural water coaster. Beginners are welcome to enjoy with an experienced English speaking guide.

title: Private Taxi Tour of Otaru (4, 6 or 8 hours)
description:
Visit all the sights in Otaru, which used to be a major port. Stroll down the canal, check out the lovely retro Meiji era buildings and try fresh seafood!
Our licensed taxi guides look forward to introducing you to the historical sights of Otaru. Discover the city at your own pace on this private charter tour, ideal for groups!

title: Private Taxi Tour of Furano and Biei from Obihiro
description: Go around visiting major highlights of Furano, Biei and Asahikawa. Witness the different flowers in bloom at various seasons from the window of your taxi.

title: Hundred Year Koiwai Forest Tour on a Tractor Bus with Entry Ticket
description: Hop on a bus drawn by a tractor to start your adventure into the hundred year forest. Let an experienced driver and a nature loving guide take you to thebest spots of Koiwai Farm.

title: Full Day Kimono Rental and Open Stroll for All Ages in Nagoya
description: With women's, men's, and children's kimono available, the whole family can dress up and stroll the scenic streets and gardens and even try a delicious Nagoya-style meal!

title: Half Day Ocean Kiteboarding Lesson in Aohori
description: Catch the wind in the kite and race over the water. Attentive instructors will teach you about the gear and get your riding, then give you tips for smoother runs.

title: Best Sights of Hiroshima Half Day Chartered Taxi Sightseeing Tour
description: Get all the highlights of Hiroshima in a day as you visit Myojoin and Fudo Temples, Hiroshima Castle, the Peace Memorial Park, Peace Boulevard and Hijiyama Park with a private taxi charter.

title: Two Day Hiroshima Bullet Train and Hotel Package (Departing from Osaka)
description:
Visit Hiroshima from the lively city of Osaka! With bullet train tickets and one night in a hotel included, let us take the hassle out of traveling!
This two day, unguided free plan package includes heavily discounted round-trip bullet train tickets from Osaka to Hiroshima with one night's accommodation in your choice of hotel in Hiroshima. See the floating torii of Miyajima, taste the delicious local okonomiyaki or visit the Atomic Dome, this package allows you to enjoy Hiroshima at your own pace.

title: Full Day Barasu Snorkeling and Waterfall Jungle Trek Tour from Iriomote
description: Play in the ocean, mountain, rivers, and waterfalls of Iriomote on a full day tour that combines snorkeling and trekking in a fun and relaxing adventure.

title: Full Day Izu Peninsula Sightseeing Tour with Chartered Taxi from Mishima City
description: Drive through the mountains of Izu and enjoy both ocean and mountain views, then discover wildlife and plants at the Shaboten Cactus Park.

title: One Day Glass Accessory Making Class in Shimoda
description: Experience making a fused glass accessory at a glass workshop in Minamiizucho. Create a one-of-a-kind piece of wearable glass art as a memento of your visit to Izu.

title: Canyoning Adventure Tour in Shizuoka
description: Descend a mountain stream in the valley close to the source of the river. Natural water slides and diving into a waterfall basin are only part of the fun!

title: Furoshiki Cloth Wrapping Class in Tokyo at TJT Studio
description:
Furoshiki are a type of Japanese wrapping cloth traditionally used to transport clothes and gifts, even water bottles. Combine practicality and style!
These clothes can range in size from just big enough to hold a few coins to the size of bed sheets (used to transport futon). From silk to rayon, there is a furoshiki for every occasion. Learn how to turn the cloth into a carrying bag, and use it to transport goods elegantly.

title: Casual English Tea Ceremony and Yukata Wearing in Central Tokyo
description:
Dress up and learn to wear a light cotton yukata and obi sash, then join a Japanese tea ceremony. Afterwards take pictures in the tearoom or garden! English speaking guides mean no language barrier.
Get yourself into a colorful yukata of your choice and tie the cute obi sash. A kimono dressing instructor will help you learn how to dress yourself in yukata. Once fully dressed, it's time to join a professional tea master for a tea ceremony, which is connected to Zen Buddhism. Discover your own sense of peace as you watch the tea master create a perfect bowl of matcha tea. Sip the frothy brew and enjoy a traditional Japanese sweet. Afterwards take pictures in your yukata, a fun memento of your visit to Japan!

title: Ikebana Flower Arranging Class in Central Tokyo
description:
Find the perfect balance of flowers and space which characterizes Japanese flower arrangements, and feel the beauty of the seasons during this fun class.
Known as Ikebana, Japanese flower arranging seeks to reach the pinnacle of simplicity and sophistication. The style and color of the arrangements change with the seasons, using seasonal flowers and foliage to express an idea or feeling. Even the space between flowers is regarded as an aesthetic feature in Japanese floral arrangements!

Get hands-on experience arranging flowers, following the instructor's demonstration and advice. If you want to continue this art back home, or already have some experience, the licensed instructor will even give you feedback on how to improve.

title: Homestyle Cooking and Seasonal Local Seafood with Boat Ride from Toba
description: Toshi Island is a land of fishermen a 30 minute boat ride from Toba. Enjoy seasonal local specialty seafood at a home-cooking restaurant on the island.

title: Deep Sea Scuba Diving for Advanced Divers in Amamioshima
description: Take a dive in the mystical southern sea. Go under the waves and explore the secret areas of the quiet, tropical island where only certified divers can go!

title: Udon Tasting Taxi Tour in Kagawa
description:
Hop on a private taxi and our knowledgable drivers will take you to all the best, secret udon restaurants around the Chusan area! Try Kagawa's famous noodles.
The pick-up and drop-off service is limited to the Chusan area (Sakaide, Marugame, Zentsuji, Kotohira, Mannou, Tadotsu and Utazu districts). It is said that Kukai (Kobo Daishi) brought udon from China, and introduced it to Japan in the area currently known as Kotohira. There are many, many udon shops in this area,which serve delicious udon!

title: Full Day Personalized Kayaking Tour with Lunch in Hachinohe
description: Enjoy a full day on the water with a course tailored for your group, and an included lunch to help give you the energy to keep you moving.

title: Licenced Night Diving Adventure in the Sea of Miyazaki
description: Capture another side of the sea at night and see creatures that are normally active after dark. Bring your C-card and enjoy diving in a different environment.

title: Narita Airport Layover Tour with a Local Guide (Various Languages Available)
description:
Have a long transit at Narita airport, but not enough time to explore Tokyo? Experience Japanese culture at Narita-san, where you can visit a traditional temple, check out shops, pagodas and more.
Explore the Omotesando (main road) to Narita Temple for a great introduction to Japan during your layover at Narita Airport or your stay in Chiba. Walk through the many traditional shops that sell souvenirs and restaurants with local dishes. Stop by the three storied pagoda that was built in the Edo Era and learn more about the Japanese culture with your English, French, Chinese or Dutch-speaking guide.

title: All Season Artificial Slope Ski and Snowboard Practice in Mito City
description: No matter the season, you can still enjoy skiing and boarding on a special artificial ski slope in a vast forest. Keep your skills ready for when the snow comes down.

title: Half-Day Private Taxi Nature Tour of Kushimoto from Shirahama
description: Drive down the coastal road running through the Kii peninsula for a view of the Pacific ocean. See the magnificent nature panorama along the shores of Kushimoto.

title: Full Day Chartered Sightseeing Taxi Tour of Shrines and Munakata
description: Visit the temples and shrines of the three goddesses of Munakata and enjoy a panoramic view of the cities of Kitakyushu and Fukuoka from an observatory.

title: Nagaoka Expedition on a Private Chartered Taxi
description: Take in the history and culture of Nagaoka by visiting the highlights of the city on a comfortable taxi. Explore the museums, galleries and outdoor activities!

title: Traditional Dojousukui Dance Lesson in Yasugi
description:
Have fun learning the Dojousukui dance accompanied by Yasugibushi folk music in Shimane prefecture. This funny dance always makes for a good laugh!
Place a Japanese Ichimon coin on top of your nose, wear a spotted patterned Japanese towel over your head and cheeks, carry a fish basket on your waist, and hold a bamboo colander. The Dojousukui dance is a humorous depiction of loach fishing, and is hilarious for guests of all ages!

title: Rent a Kimono and Stroll Around Kanazawa
description:
Walk around the city of the retro looking town of Kanazawa in a beautiful kimono. Explore the city while taking memorable photos of yourself in Japan.
Kirara Kimono Plan
All the items for the kimono are included.
Items included: Inner wear / long kimono inner wear / obi sash / zori sandals /small articles for dressing / bag / covers for zori sandals / rain coat / umbrella (one that is suitable for a kimono
- Add-on items are available.
- Choose among more than 100 sets of kimonos selected by professionals.
- Beginners are welcome. If you have your own kimono, you may bring your own.
- Furisode (long-sleeved kimono) and Tomesode (formal kimono) are not available.

Overnight Plan
Enjoy the night in Kanazawa in the kimono and return the kimono to the hotel front the next morning. 

The shop is located close to Higashi Chayamachi, in Kanazawa.
Cleaning fee included in the price, but insurance for extreme damages and lost kimonos are available.
Mud splashes in rain or snow or food stains can be covered by the activity price.

title: Special Japanese and Western Cuisine Lunch Buffet at Sansuikan in Yufuin
description: Enjoy a popular buffet with more than 30 dishes featuring seasonal ingredients. A hot spring entry plan is available, featuring views of Mt. Yufu from the baths.

title: Full-day Shirakawago and Gokayama Rural Japan Bus Tour from Kanazawa Station
description:
Visit two World Heritage sites on a comfortable bus. Explore  Shirakawago and Gokayama with their historic thatched roof houses and beautiful scenery. Get to know the local lifestyle along the way.
Venture into the Japanese countryside from Kanazawa for a day of exploring two UNESCO World Heritage Sites, Shirakawago and Gokayama. These two villages are well-known for their thatched roof houses, beautiful scenery and local traditions. After enjoying the beautiful scenery and villages, ride comfortably back to Kanazawa station.

title: Taxi Transfer to/from Ureshino Hot Springs and Fukuoka
description: Cruise around the city of Fukuoka before making your way to the Fukuoka airport or Ureshino hot springs. Customize your route of your preference on a comfortably taxi.

title: Adorable Owl Cafe and Owl Photography in Kobe
description: Meet cute and fluffy owls in Kobe. Every owl has their own personality, from quiet to friendly and active. Have fun getting to know them, and take lots of pictures.

title: Chichibu Three Shrine Pilgrimage Tour by Private Sightseeing Taxi
description: Visit Mitsumine Shrine, Chichibu Shrine, and Hodosan Shrine, known as places of healing. Also, ride downstream on the Ara River in Nagatoro for a cooling interlude.

title: Full Day Tour of Kagoshima and Sakurajima's Best Sights
description:
Get to know Kagoshima on this fun one day tour. Take a ferry ride over to Sakurajima, stroll though the Senganen Gardens and get a feel for the local history!
Get great views of the volcano, visit the splendid Senganen Gardens, catch a glimpse of the Tsurumaru Castle and see the statue of Saigo Takamori. Lots of convenient pick up spots around the city make this a great way to make the most of your time in Kagoshima!

Tour time: 6 hours 35 minutes

title: Private Taxi Tour of Special Sights in Hiroshima
description: Besides the famous  Hiroshima Castle, Shukkeien and Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park, visit a couple lesser known gems on this private charter tour!

title: Best Sights of Hiroshima and Miyajima Day Tour from Central Hiroshima
description:
Check out the World Heritage Sites of Itsukushima Shrine in Miyajima and the Hiroshima Peace Park as you are comfortably led by an English speaking guide.
Get into the history and nature of Hiroshima on a one day tour that includes the UNESCO World Heritage Site, the Atomic Bomb Dome. Head out from the city and look forward to seeing wild deer in the abundant nature of Miyajima.
This course is recommended for customers who have a Japan Rail Pass.

title: Private Charter Shirakawago Village Taxi Tour from Hida Takayama
description:
Take a tour on a chartered taxi to witness the unique thatched-roof houses of Shirakawago. Stroll through the village for an up close view and then enjoy from above at the Shiroyama Observatory.
Skip the hassle of figuring out bus schedules, and let our experienced drivers whisk you off to see the World Heritage site of Shirakawago, a trip back in time to the Japan of yore!

title: Family Friendly Handcraft Workshop in Kawagoe
description: Design and set up an original item, choosing from a cute yarn ball, a photo frame, or a stained glass style candle holder. These classes are great for all ages.

title: Quick Candle Making Experience in Kawagoe
description: Choose your shape, then create a little scene inside the candle for a one-of-a-kind piece of usable art. The candle sets quickly, so you can take it home.

title: Full Day Kayak Rescue Skills and Training Workshop in Suhara
description: Designed for people with some kayak experience, this course teaches you self-rescue and water rescue kayak techniques, so you can further enjoy the sport.

title: Private Taxi Charter Around the Mogami River
description: Weave through the streets on a taxi as you discover the lifestyle of the people who lived around the Mogami River. Then leisurely cruise down the river for a relaxing experience.

title: Three Michelin Star Beppu Hyotan Onsen Hot Spring Bath Entry Ticket
description:
Bathe in the natural hot spring waters of Beppu, at Japan's only 3 Michelin starred onsen resort! A variety of baths are waiting to whisk away your stress.
Hyotan Hot Springs are the only hot springs in Japan with a three star Michelin rating, famous not just for the dozens of baths, but also for the communal area where visitors can relax in traditional Japanese yukata. Private indoor and outdoor baths are also available for rental, and you can even slide into a rare sand bath for a head to toe refreshing experience.

title: Oboke and Iya Valley Private Taxi Charter Full Day Tour
description: Discover the best sights of the Oboke and Iya Valley with a convenient sightseeing taxi on this one day charter. Enjoy the beautiful natural scenery in this hidden corner of Shikoku.

title: Kids Surf School in Ichikawa
description: All ages can enjoy the fun of riding the waves with attentive lessons from professional instructors. Get your kids riding create memorable days on the beach.

title: Sea Kayaking Adventure on the Pacific Ocean in Minami
description: Go sea kayaking between Hiwasa and Mugi, exploring caves made by waves and even a secret beach. Enjoy the lovely marine scenery of Tokushima!

title: Private Tour of Kanazawa with Kimono Rental Included
description: Tour around the historic city of Kanazawa in a stylish kimono with your English-speaking guide. Discover the best scenic spots, learn about the samurai area's history and take lots of photos!

title: Private Charter Tour of Kanazawa and Kenrokuen Garden
description: Explore Kanazawa and stop by the famous castle, Kenrokuen garden and samurai streets on a comfortable taxi. Shop in the Omicho Market to get a taste of local delicacies as well.

title: Full-Day Chartered Kobe Shore Excursion from Kobe Port
description: Discover the classic city of Kobe on a private taxi with an English speaking driver. Stop by the scenic Sourakuen Japanese garden and the popular Chinatown with convenient round trip transfers.

title: Professional Kimono Photo Shoot in Kanazawa
description:
Let a professional photographer take memorable photos of your trip to Kanazawa in a kimono. Visit popular tourist spots and learn about the city as well.
Photos in Kanazawa.
All plans come with a data CD and 2 slideshow DVDs.
- Data CD will have all the photos in JPEG format at 3840 x 2560 pixels that will be great for postcards or an A3 size photo print.
- Slideshow DVD will have a video clip of your photos with music added to watch on a DVD player.

Depending on the status of reservations, extensions in time may not be possible. Please confirm with your photographer on the day of your tour.

Add-ons:
Photos can be printed on a professional printer. There is a workshop on the second floor of Kanazawa Kirara and select the photo you would like to print along with the type of album you would like. The album with your photos will be mailed to you in about a week. This will be available as an add-on when booking for the tour.

title: Overnight River Rafting and Barbecue Experience in Kumagawa from Hitoyoshi
description: Weave through the refreshing whitewater rapids on a raft down the Kuma river. Enjoy the thrilling ride with a barbecue and hot springs experience overnight!

title: Cute Glass Animal Bead Making Experience in Otaru
description: Make adorable animal-shaped glass beads as a charming souvenir of Otaru. Learn the basics of glass fusing in this fun activity for visitors of all ages!

title: Wakayama Temple Visits on Private Sightseeing Taxi from Shirahama
description: Easily accessible from the Kansai International Airport, take a trip out to Wakayama on a private taxi. Drive through the Kumano Kodo and visit the many famous temples of the area.

title: Special Sanshien and Lake Daijyu Sightseeing Taxi Tour with Airport Transfers
description:
This is the tour for anyone staying at Lake Daijyu or Sanshien, with convenient Tottori Airport pick-up or drop-off available, as well as fantastic natural sights.
Some of the highlights of this course include the Tottori Dunes, the largest sand dune in all Japan. Formed over 100,000 years as the Chiyo River and winds pile and arrange sand, this is a sandy beach dune on an unbelievable scale.

Aoyakamijichi ruins traces of a village from the Yayoi Era, a prehistoric time. Many items used for daily life in the period were found here, including the remains of an ancient structure, giving this the name of "the Yayoi Museum."

The ruins of Shikano Castle are now home to cherry trees that bloom elegantly in spring. Relax as you stroll through the quiet and peaceful town of Shikano, where many historic buildings still remain.

Karoichi Market is where the fresh seafood unloaded from the Karo fishing port is sold. You can enjoy fresh seafood from the Sea of Japan in the restaurants and stalls, or get some tasty treats to take home.

title: Private Taxi Transfers from Ureshino Hot Springs and Nagasaki
description: Enjoy a convenient transportation service between Ureshino Hot Springs and the Nagasaki area. Hassle-free traveling method for groups or those traveling with family.

title: Full Day Fishing on a Bay Cruiser in Katsuura
description:
Cast your line for some real fishing with your friends or family. Beginners welcome as all the equipment you need is here already along with helpful staff.
There are many fish in the abundant seas around Katsuura. All year you can aim for horse mackerel, flounder, snapper and whiting. August to December brings big challenges with big fish like amberjack, kingfish, yellowtail, and Japanese bonito! January through July sees the water teeming with squid, grunt, and snapper.

title: One-Day Original Shoe Making Lesson in Aichi
description: Experience making your very own pair of shoes or boots with your original design in a day. Learn the step by step process from the selection of leather to shaping your shoes to comfortably fit you.

title: Ticket for KABA Amphibious Bus Tour Around Mt. Fuji and Lake Yamanaka
description:
Gear up for a big adventure on Lake Yamanaka's amphibious bus, KABA. Enjoy a drive through the forest and then dive into the lake for the perfect 360-degree view of Mt. Fuji.

Enjoy Mt. Fuji and Lake Yamanaka with an adventure on the KABA amphibious bus. Before your departure, have a free photo taken of your and your group. When you board the bus, you'll go through a scenic drive in the forest around the lake shore and learn about the nature and history of the area with your multilingual audio guide. Finally, dive into lake Yamanaka for a cruise with an amazing view of Mt. Fuji. A card-size version of the photo you took will be ready for you once you return.

title: Yatsugatake Mountain Horseback Riding with Tea or Dessert
description: Spend a relaxing moment through the trails of Yatsugatake in Yamanashi while riding a horse. Enjoy the seasonal scenery then treat yourself to some tea or ice cream.

title: Yokohama Minatomirai Night Cruise with One Drink Included
description:
Enjoy a 50 minute cruise around Yokohama Bay, and gaze at colorful night views while sipping a cocktail or cold beer. Have a great night out in Yokohama!
Hop on the boat near Yokohama Minatomirai Port, and get whisked off for 50 minutes of stunning night views. The perfect way to end a day of sightseeing. Unwind with a glass of your drink of choice, and toast under the glow of the brightly lit up ferris wheel!

title: Family Friendly Paragliding Experience at Tottori Sand Dunes
description: Fly through the skies over the sand dunes of Tottori with your family. With the help of friendly instructors, small children or the elderly can also discover the joys of paragliding with you!

title: Half-Day Paragliding Adventure over the Sand Dunes of Tottori
description: Soar above the massive sand dunes on a paraglider to witness the grand desert-like panorama spread before your eyes. Challenge yourself to an unforgettable sky adventure.

title: Private Full Day Sand Dunes and Castle Town Taxi Sightseeing Tour from Yonago
description: Set out on a full day tour in a comfortable sightseeing taxi and see the Tottori Sand Dunes and sand sculptures at the Sand Museum before checking out historic castles in the city.

title: Hanakairou Flower Park and K-Drama Athena Filming Site Tour by Sightseeing Taxi
description: Visit Japan's largest flower park,Hanakairo, where you can enjoy seasonal flowers no matter the weather. Discover the natural beauty of Tottori.

title: Half-Day Tottori Nature and Culture Tour on Private Taxi
description: Enjoy a relaxing journey on a taxi to visit locations where you can take your time to tour around. Indulge in forests or sand dunes or stop by historical sites to learn more about Tottori.

title: Half Day Horseback Riding Experience for New Riders in Munakata
description: Ride along a sandy beach while enjoying the view from horseback or set out on a guided gentle strolling excursion and get to know how to ride in an easy lesson.

title: Nature Tour of Hachimantai and Towada on a Jumbo Taxi
description: Cruise through the roads on a Jumbo taxi and take yourself to the picture perfect areas in the Hachimantai area. Enjoy the view at Lake Towada for another scenic experience!

title: Iya Valley and Oboke Valley Private Taxi Tour from Kochi
description: See the best sights f the hidden Iya Valley, sunch as Oboke, Koboke and the Kazura Bridge. Explore the Heike house, and keep an eye out for the odd statue on the cliff!

title: Custom Tour of Nagoya with Private English Speaking Guide
description:
Venture out into the streets of Nagoya to explore the history and tradition of the popular port city. Select places you want to visit and customize your tour with your local English guide.
Take this great opportunity to visit the popular areas of the third largest city of Japan. Explore the busy city with your English speaking guide to visit the spots you've always wanted or find new locations that match your interests. Customize your own tour or let your guide recommend you locations to help you discover a side of Nagoya that you have yet to see! Tours start from 4 hours, giving you time to see a lot or go in-depth as you like.

title: Two Day Unlimited Izu Hakone Bus Pass (for Atami, Hakone, Odawara and Yugawara)
description:
Enjoy two days of unlimited usage on a variety of vehicles operated by the Izu Hakone Group. This open pass lets you create an itinerary to suit your interests!
From the seaside mountains of Atami, to gorgeous Hakone, or the convenient Odawara Station, this pass lets you ride unlimited buses throughout the entire area, to conveniently explore at your pace. With two days of use, create your own ideal plan. The pass even includes rides on the Jikkoku Mountain Cable Car and a popular boat cruise on Lake Ashi! Get discounts at museums, hot springs, gardens, restaurants and more.

title: Kimono Rental and Dress Up in Kamakura
description:
Choose from over 3000 kimono including many traditional, modern and colorful styles. Take some commemorative photos in the studio before venturing out to the famous sights of Kamakura.
Even if your requested time is full, there may be availability before or after your desired time. Please select a second or third choice of your preference.

title: Sunset Stand Up Paddleboard Cruising in Miyako Island
description: Enjoy the fun of stand up paddleboarding while watching the sun set into the blue waters off of Miyako Island for a sight like nowhere else.

title: Three Day Guided Cheese and Dairy Eco Tour in Tokachi
description:
Visit Tokachi, otherwise known as the land of cheese. Producing about 60% of Japan's cheeses, learn about the history and production of dairy in the area.
Discover the culture, history, and the natural environment during your stay in Hokkaido. An Eco Tour is a customized tour with a collection of hand selected activities by the local guides and staff for a great learning experience.

Detailed contents of the tour will be decided after your reservation is made. English speaking staff will be available to assist you when preparing your itinerary.

title: Private Sightseeing Taxi Tour of Shimabara and Unzen
description: Leisurely explore the city of Shimabara and Unzen on a private taxi. Stop by popular spots like the Yutoku Inari shrine or even watch dolphins depending on season.

title: Private Sightseeing Tour of Hanamaki's Treats or Crafts by Jumbo Taxi
description: See all the best sights of charming Hanamaki while also learning about local crafts and delicacies! Great for groups or visitors with limited time to explore.

title: Hanamaki Private Taxi Tour with Wanko Soba Experience
description: Visit all the best sights in beautiful Hanamaki, in Iwate! Enjoy a private taxi charter around the city, then try the local wanko soba, a mix between lunch and a game!

title: Private Kotaro Takamura-Themed Tour of Hanamaki by Sightseeing Taxi
description: See all the best sights of Hanamaki and learn about the life of Kotaro Takamura on this private tour. Visit the Takamura mountain house and Kiyomizu Temple!

title: Half-Day Sightseeing Taxi Tour of Popular Must-Go Locations in Hakodate
description: Tour around the highlights of Hakodate on a comfortable taxi. Have a local driver take you to the historical sites, shopping areas and plenty of scenic locations for great memories and photos.

title: Beginner Friendly Horseback Riding in the Mountains of Yamanashi
description: Learn the basics of horse riding from an experienced instructor before going on a mini-trek into the beautiful forests of Yatsugatake Mountains. Great for children or first time riders.

title: Half Day Whitewater Rafting in Kuma River with Hotel in Hitoyoshi
description: Take a thrilling ride down one of Japan's top three fastest rivers! Enjoy rafting down thr river then leisurely explore the wildlife surrounding the river!

title: Private Tour of Hiraizumi by Jumbo Sightseeing Taxi
description: See all the sights of Hiraizumi and sample the delicious traditional Japanese sweets at Genbikei during this private chartered taxi tour. Great for groups!

title: Private Taxi Tour of Matsushima from Hanamaki
description: Departing from Hanamaki, visit beautiful Matsushima on this private chartered taxi tour in Iwate. Great for groups of family or friends!

title: Full Day Taxi Charter in Hakodate
description:
Great for both visitors and those on business trips, tour Hakodate your way with a private taxi! See Goryoukaku Park, Kanamori Warehouses and more!
Enjoy visiting the best sights of Hakodate at your own pace, a great way for groups and families to sight-see in comfort and style. This full day private charter is also recommended for those who wish to visit a distant destination such as Lake Toya or Noboribetsu.

title: Private Jumbo Taxi Tour of Local Areas of Tono
description: Visit the local and beautiful areas of Tono. Depart from Hanamaki city on a comfortable jumbo taxi to explore places such as  Gohyakurakan and Suikouen.

title: Famous Hanamaki Residents Private Tour by Taxi
description: See all the best sights of Hanamaki, and learn about the lives of Kenji Miyazawa, Kotaro Takamura, and Inazo Nitobe on this private chartered taxi tour.

title: 1 Day Pottery Lesson in Kanagawa
description: Enjoy making your personal creation with clay in a pottery class for people of all ages. Get creative and learn to make your custom shaped ceramic piece.

title: Private Sightseeing Taxi Tour of Yokohama's Best Sights (3 hours)
description: Tour the historical buildings, China Town and markets of charming Yokohama in style on this private taxi tour. Choose from 3 courses to suit your interests.

title: Luxury Private Taxi Tour of Yokohama's Best Sights
description: Hop onto one of our top-of-the-line taxis, and enjoy a 3 hour tour of all of Yokohama's best sights of this premium private charter tour.

title: Japanese Kimono Dressing and Rental in Hakodate
description: Get dressed in a beautiful kimono then go explore the port city, Bay Area, churches, and red brick warehouses of Motomachi! Experience the beauty of Hakodate and take lots of pictures in kimono.

title: Friendly Handmade Pottery Working Lesson in Hakodate
description: Perfect for ages 3 and up, gets your hands dirty and create a special souvenir. Housed in a building from 1935, the retro atmosphere will get your creative juices flowing.

title: Private Taxi Charter Around Matsumoto Castle and Matsumoto City
description: Avoid the crowds and make way to the Matsumoto Castle on a comfortable taxi. Explore the iconic "Crow Castle" and tour through the city to learn more about the historic area.

title: Glass Craft Experience in Otaru
description: You can try your hand at sandblasting, fusing, or routing, to create a unique glass souvenir of your trip to Otaru. Children welcome to join too!

title: Romantic Night Cruise on the Otaru Canal
description: Cruise down this charming canal after dark, with the retro buildings beautifully lit up. See a different side of Otaru and enjoy the romantic scenery.

title: Make Your Own Gel Candle and Glass Art in Otaru
description: Design and prepare a unique candle starting from colorful sand. Use cute glass pieces to make unique 3D art inside the gel of your own candle.

title: Half Day Tour of Nara's World Heritage Sites and Mountain Views
description: Visit 3 of Nara's World Heritage sites: Todaiji Temple, home to the Great Buddha Statue, Kasuga Taisha Shrine, and Kofukuji Temple. Enjoy views of Wakakusayama and forest of Kasuga from the bus.

title: Full Day Saigoku 33 Kannon Pilgrimage Course by Sightseeing Taxi from Nara
description: The Saigoku 33 Kannon Pilgrimage is the oldest such route in Japan. Travel part of the historic route in a comfortable taxi and visit Tsubosakadera, Okadera, Hasedera, Hokiin, and Nanendo Temples.

title: Morning Heijokyu Castle Ruins and World Heritage Sites by Taxi in Nara
description: See the ancient castle grounds of Nara, where the capital was once located. On this relaxing taxi tour, the professional driver whisks you around historic sites.

title: Float in the Sky on a Half Day Paragliding Adventure
description: Take your first step into flight with a kind instructor who explains how to lift-off. From a gentle slope practice takeoff and then rise into the sky.

title: Heian Era Pilgrim Costume Dressing and Rental on the Kumano Kodo Road
description: Step back in time and experience wearing the elegant clothes of Heian Era pilgrims. Take pictures against the backdrop of the Kumano Kodo Road. Costumes for men and children are also available!

title: Full Day Charter Taxi Kumano Hongu Taisha Shrine Area Tour from Shirahama
description: Spend a day exploring the historical area of the Kumano Hongu Taisha Shrine. Relax in the hot springs or enjoy the scenic Nachi waterfalls during your personalized tour.

title: Chartered Taxi Nature Tour of Kamikochi from Matsumoto Station
description: Feel the cool breeze in the summer or witness the panoramic views of snow in the winter. Enjoy the seasonal views of the Japanese Alps, Kamikochi and the surrounding areas on a taxi.

title: Relaxing Massage Treatment Plans at Cloud Nine Spa in Ishigaki
description:
Choose the perfect plan for your needs from a huge variety of relaxing treatments. From a short treat to 130 minutes of indulgence, feel your cares melt away. Experience true Ryukyu hospitality!

Please refer to the following as a reference , since details in the description are often abbreviated.

Abbreviation
Aroma oil treatment → Aroma
Ryukyu Facial → Facial
Traditional Thai massage → Thai
Foot reflexology → Reflation
Head Treatment → Head
Hand Treatment → Hand

title: Half Day Coral Snorkeling on Barasu Island from Iriomote Island
description: Swim in the clear blue waters off the white coral beach of Barasu Island, and discover the fish living in the reefs on this half day snorkeling adventure.

title: Sunset Yacht Cruise from Ishigaki with English-Speaking Captain
description:
Set sail across the waves of the East China Sea! Sip a glass of wine while you watch the sun go down over the islands, with the wind ruffling your hair.

The rush of the wind and waves will be the only sounds you hear on this sunset cruise. Thanks to the yacht's quick progress and stability, this is the perfect cruise for those who fear seasickness. The Hanalee's captain has been sailing across Asia for over 30 years, so you know you are in safe hands. You can even take a turn at the wheel!

Okinawa's sunsets are famous for their brilliance and beauty, a truly unforgettable sight. If you are lucky, you may even get to see the Green Flash phenomenon, said to bring happiness to those who witness it.

Join us on the open seas!

title: Ishigaki Island Car Rental Service with Airport Transfers and Multilingual GPS
description: Spend a day driving around the tropical Ishigaki Island on a convenient compact car. With 24-hour road service and a helpful English GPS, explore the paradise island with ease.

title: One Day Nara Premium Tour with Lunch and Sake Tasting from Kyoto
description: Visit majestic Todaiji Temple, Kofukuji Temple, and Kasuga Taisha Shrine, where you can meet Shinto priests or priestesses. Enjoy a lovely lunch, time to explore the town and a sake tasting too!

title: Island Hopping Kohama and Taketomi Island Tour from Ishigaki Island
description: Relax in the morning while lunching in a resort or tour the famous spots in the afternoon. Leisurely explore the beautiful sites of Taketomi and Kohama island.

title: Full Day Yoshino Sightseeing Taxi Historical Tour from Nara
description: Yoshino is famous for cherry blossoms from ancient times. See the ancient trees of Kinpusenji Temple and Yoshino Shrine, as well as other historic locations.

title: Full Day Cruise of Tropical Iriomote, Panari, and Taketomi Islands
description:
Set out to some of the most beautiful areas in Okinawa on a full day cruise that takes you from mangroves to beaches, and on a buffalo drawn carriage.
See three different islands in one fun day as you travel around the smaller areas near Ishigaki. Start with dense mangroves along the rivers of Iriomote, then head for the clear waters of quiet Panari Island for swimming and snorkeling. Then, step back in time on Taketomi Island, and get a feel for the lifestyle and relaxing way of living as you enjoy a buffalo drawn carriage ride through the village.

title: Yaeyama Islands Ferry Free Pass (2 day, 3 day or 4 day)
description:
Explore six of the beautiful Yaeyama Islands with this free pass. Ride as many times as you want, with easy passage from Ishigakaki and Iriomote!

Get free access to all the following routes:

・Ishigaki to/from Taketomi
・Ishigaki to/from Kohama
・Ishigaki to/from Kuroshima
・Ishigaki to/from Iriomote (Ohara Port)
・Iriomote (Ohara Port) To Kohama
・Iriomote (Ohara Port) To Taketomi
・Taketomi to/from Kohama
・Ishigaki to/from Hatoma to/from Iriomote (Uehara Port)

title: Sea Kayaking Experience Tour for Adults and Children in Miura
description: Check the sights from aboard a stable sea kayak. Great for families, ,paddle along with your kid! 2 passenger and single rider kayaks are available, so bring your friends or have a solo adventure.

title: Half Day Sea Kayak and Beach Walk Tour from Zushi
description: Combine some light sea kayaking with a lot of time on the beach. Check out the beach, find neat fish and animals in the water, and relax while having fun.

title: 6-hour Sightseeing Taxi Tour of Abashiri, Akan or Shiretoko
description: This private sightseeing taxi tour can take you to and from Memanbetsu Airport. See the best sights of Abashiri, Lake Mashu and Lake Akan, Kawaryu, Kussharo, Shiretoko and more!

title: Morning World Heritage Sites and Mt. Kasuga by Sightseeing Taxi in Nara
description: Discover some of the many amazing historical sites in Nara with a convenient sightseeing taxi. From Todaiji Temple to Mt. Kasuga, relax and find traditional Japan.

title: Convenient Car Rental from Nagano or Matsumoto
description: Tour around the rural areas of Nagano to visit historical castles, temples and shrines or venture out into the mountains to great hot springs or ski resorts thanks to your convenient car.

title: Hand Formed Pottery Making Experience in Hokkaido
description:
Perfect for pottery beginners, the owners will teach you the basics of pottery, then allow you free reign to create your desired works of art!
The Craft & Gallery Dream is run by the potters Tomitsugu and Hiroko Ikeda, located in Rankoshi (near Niseko). Learn the basics of pottery from these passionate craftsmen, and hand form works such as dishes, flower vases, drinking vessels, chopstick rests or whatever else takes your fancy!

title: Learn How to Make Wasabi (Horse Radish) Pickles in Kawazucho
description:
Make wasabi pickles using horse radish picked from the clear streams of Amagi, for a true taste of Izu. Try the local 'wasabi-don' rice bowl, and savor the fresh and spicy taste of the local wasabi!
Many people line up in front of the restaurant to eat the wasabi-don which has been featured on many popular TV shows! You can savor wasabi-don made from horse radish grown in the spring water around Izu Amagisan.

title: Snorkeling with Mantas and Taketomi Island Full Day Tour from Ishigaki
description: Jump into everything Ishigaki has to offer, from sightseeing on idyllic Taketomi Island to diving, snorkeling, and searching for manta rays in the blue seas!

title: Nahra River Sidestream Mangrove and Jungle Canoeing Course on Iriomote
description: Paddle along hidden spots on Iriomote Island as you head up the Nahra river. Enjoy the mangrove forest and a refreshing day among the tropical nature.

title: Aloe Gel Facial and Body Sunburn Spa Treatment in Ishigaki
description: This luxury aloe pack will sooth and smooth your face or your body.  Recommended to help skin heal from sunburn, or to refresh yourself after a day on the beach!

title: Trial Scuba Diving Tour with English-Speaking Instructor in Ishigaki Island
description: Hop into the bright blue waters off Ishigaki Island with an experienced English-speaking instructor as you dive among tropical reefs filled with lively fish.

title: Glass Music Box Half Day Workshop in Minakami
description: Create a small original music box with ornaments of lovely animals made of glass. Add a personal touch to any room, and enjoy the clear sounds it plays.

title: All Ages Stained Glass Style Photo Frame Making Lesson in Minakami
description: Ages six and up can enjoy this fun and simple workshop. Just add the colored film on glass to make it look like stained glass. You can take it home the very same day.

title: Short Glass Blowing Lesson with an Experienced Craftsman in Minakami
description: Turn molten glass into a personal vase or drinking glass with your breath. A professional is there to help you during the lesson, so you can relax and have fun.

title: Half Day Glass Design and Sandblasting Workshop in Minakami
description: Dust your design with a special powder and let loose with high speed sand to shape a glass with a personal and one-of-a-kind design in a fun workshop.

title: Half Day Dry Flower Arrangement Lesson in Minakami
description: Arrange dry flowers and nuts grown and dried in our garden on a wreath base or wood board. Create your original work with seasonal flowers, no matter the time of year.

title: Electric Pottery Wheel Ceramic Experience in Ikaho Onsen
description: How about trying ceramic art when visiting Ikaho hotsprings? The iron-rich clay creates unique colors, a perfect addition to the decor of your home!

title: Lolita Makeover and Photo Shoot Experience in Nagoya
description:
Transform into a cute lolita at a photo studio in Nagoya. Have your hair and makeup done by professionals and enjoy a photo shoot against adorable backdrops with a photographer. 
Enjoy a day dressed as in doll-like lolita clothes. You'll first be taken to a photo studio where you can dress up. A professional hair and makeup artist, as well as a professional photographer will help to make your experience even more memorable. Have a fun photo shoot of over 200 shots taken on a fittingly cute set. Then when you're finished, you can choose 15 of your favorite shots to receive on a CD-rom. If you like, you can choose the going out plan and spend 40 minutes freely walking outside, showing off your new look.

title: WiFi Router Rental at Chubu Centrair Intl Airport (2-Day to 30-Day Plans)
description:
Stay connected at all times in Japan with a portable wifi router you can pick up and drop off at Chubu Centrair International Airport. Choose from a range of plans, great for both work and vacations.
Get high speed, mobile broadband for your iPad, laptop and smartphone anytime and anywhere in Japan. The Pocket Wifi can quickly create group internet access and individual WiFi hotspots; connect wirelessly to many devices such as iPads, laptops, digital cameras, iPhones, Android phones and game devices to let you play games online, transfer pictures and keep in touch.

Visit the counter in the Access Plaza, located near the entrance to the parking structure.

title: Beginner-Friendly Japanese Taiko Drum Lesson and Performance in Nagoya
description: Get to grips with the tradition of Japanese taiko drumming! Learn about the traditional performance styles used in sacred ceremonial music in shrines, and have a blast playing the powerful drums.

title: Fun Snorkeling and Skin Diving Experience in Miura
description: Snorkeling is a fun and easy way to enjoy playing in the sea! Discover the beauty of the sights near the Miura Peninsula with professional staff.

title: Tour of Kamakura's Best Sights by Rickshaw
description: See all the best temples, shrines and sights of Kamakura from a comfortable rickshaw. Enjoy a taste of Japanese culture on this relaxing tour!

title: Beginner's Wakeboarding Lesson in Kamakura
description: Only about 60 minutes outside of Tokyo, you can ride the waves and learn to wakeboard. Located directly off the ocean, we're waiting for you!

title: 90 Minute Quick Nihonmatsu Observatory & Kottaro Marsh Nature Tour from Kushiro
description: Take a quick hour and a half tour of the Kushiro Wetlands, perfect for families with smaller children or those with a busy day planned.

title: Mini Parfait Food Sample Photo Stand Making Experience in Osaka
description: Create a cute ｍini parfait photo stand that looks just like the real thing. You can choose your favorite sweets and fruits as toppings for a personal touch. Lettuce making is available too!

title: Aroma Oil Massage Treatment at Cloud Nine on Ishigakijima
description: Feel all stress melt away with this aroma oil treatment, which will relax both your mind and body. Unwind in this Ryukyu-style spa, with three different courses to choose from.

title: Entry Ticket to iZoo Interactive Reptile Park in Izu
description:
Step into the habitats of rare reptiles and amphibians you normally do not see in zoos. Get up close to touch, feed, and take photos of the many snakes, lizards and friendly turtles.
Encounter the many unique creatures of Japan's largest amphibian and reptile zoo. A great way to spend your time in Izu with your friends and family. Explore the jungle-like zoo to search for reptiles hiding about or get up-close to touch and take photos with large snakes and alligators. Other fun activities include a feeding session for lizards and snakes or children under 30 kg can even ride a rare giant tortoise!

title: Full Day and Nighttime Sea Kayaking Tours in Nishi Izu
description: Discover the beauty of Izu on an all day sea kayak excursion or set out with a guide on a seasonal adventure to find a cave filled with seemingly magical trails of light.

title: One-Day Scenic Furano and Biei Private Taxi Tour from Sapporo
description: Drive through the panoramic scenery of Furano and Biei during the summer season on this private tour. Spend time in the fields of colorful and aromatic flowers at Farm Tomita and Shikisai no Oka!

title: Full Day Sightseeing Tour to Furano, Biei, Asahikawa with Private Taxi
description: Set out and visit fun places from Asahiyama Zoo, Lavender Field, Blue Pond, or far more. Take your time with a full day and a chartered taxi.

title: Petting Zoo and Animal Feeding Experience in Biei
description: Come meet cute horses, goats, sheep, cows and ducks up close, and give them a yummy snack! Great for introducing children to the world of animals!

title: Match Box Art Experience at Takumi no Sato in Minakami
description: Show your creative skills on the cute, tiny canvas of a matchbox. Framed in a colorful wooden frame, this unique souvenir of Minakami can bring a pop of color to your home.

title: Half Day Traditional Doll Making or Sekiga Workshop in Minakami
description: Create a traditional Meiji era style doll shaped like an adorable animal or learn the classic art of Sekiga stone painting in a relaxed environment.

title: One Hour Colored Gel Candle Making Workshop in Minakami
description: Freeze a perfect scene in a candle. Lay out the background with colored sand, then add cute ornaments and keep it all in place with the candle gel. It may be too cute to use,

title: Make Your Own Chopsticks from 1000-Year-Old Cedar in Yakushima
description:
Make your own chopsticks using fragrant 1,000-year-old Yakushima cedar while enjoying the experience in Yakushima itself! A great activity for the whole family that is safe for kids.
Make your own chopsticks from Yakushima cedar. No chisels or knives will be used to sand down the chopsticks, so this activity is fun for the whole family. Use sandpaper to whittle down the chopsticks to your desired style and receive a chopstick rest as a present! After your experience, you and your family or friends can take a tour of the factory and buy some cedar souvenirs.

title: Morning Nakanoshima Course Walking Tour of Osaka in English
description:
Discover Osaka's center of business and culture, thriving since the Edo era. Walk along the riverside, visit the historic locations of Ohatsutenjin Shrine and Teki-juku and stop by various shops. 

Stroll around Osaka in the morning and stop by some of its hidden historical gems. Get a taste of both the modern and historic parts of the Nakanoshima area. First take a look at the underground department store "depachika" in Umeda Station where you can find all sorts of snacks and sweets to buy as souvenirs. Walk down Midousuji, the main street of the city which is lined with ginkgo trees. Then start the historical leg of your tour by visiting the Tsuyunoten Shrine (Ohatsutenjin) with its interesting history, Teki-juku, the school of Dutch studies which opened in the 18th century, and the riverside of Nakanoshima.

title: Spanish Style Tile Art Painting Experience in Osaka
description: Learn the traditional fifteenth century painting methods using a dropper to design your very own Spanish Style interior decor. Make a great colorful addition to your house or room.

title: Special Dinner Buffet at Hotel Keihan Universal Tower's 'The Garden'
description:
Universal Studios Japan® is becoming even more popular thanks to the new Harry Potter attraction. After a day of fun in the park, enjoy a delicious buffet dinner!
This casual restaurant is ideal for the whole family and even has a great kids' corner.
Enjoy an all-you-can-eat buffet with over 40 tasty dishes, including the hotel's specially made curry, roast beef and more. From starters to desserts, there is something for everyone!

title: Half-Day Osaka Bay Area Tour with Kaiyukan Aquarium and Osaka Bay Cruise
description:
Spend an exciting afternoon at Osaka's waterfront. Explore one of the world's largest aquariums and cruise through Osaka Bay aboard the Santa Maria.
Visit the Kaiyukan Aquarium, one of the largest aquariums in the world. This aquarium is home to 580 types of sea life and about 30,000 creatures in total, including the enormous whale shark. Browse through the Tempozan Marketplace, and pick up tasty local treats or souvenirs.

Then set sail for a Osaka Bay Cruise on the Santa Maria, a replica of Christopher Columbus's flagship that is approximately twice the size of the real thing. This cruise ship journeys about Osaka Bay, offering fantastic views from atop the waves.

title: Drift Boat Nature Tour and Fishing in Nemuro
description: Enjoy with your family or as a small group, this tour is great for beginners looking to see the marsh and travel the river. You can enjoy sports fishing as well.

title: Natural Aromatic Spray Making Experience on Yakushima Island
description:
Take home the scents of Yakushima Island by creating your own aroma spray. Use the water and natural oils from the island to make a perfect souvenir of gorgeous Yakushima.
Find the perfect scent to match your memory of the island and blend natural oils made from the gifts of mother nature. Bring a little part of Yakushima Island back with you with your own handmade aroma spray, to use in your house or as a perfect souvenir.

title: Guided English Climbing Tours of Yakushima with Lunch and Shuttle Service
description: Choose between Kuromidake, Tachudake, Aikodake, and Mocchumu. Find the peak that suits your level and set out on to see the view from up top!

title: Asahiyama Zoo One Day Tour with Admission Ticket Included (Sapporo Departure)
description:
Visit the animals of the famous Asahiyama Zoo on this day trip from Sapporo, without worrying about train or bus schedules! Admission ticket and round trip transfers included.
See the animals in their winter habitat, and check out the popular 'Penguin Walk'! The unique enclosures allow visitors to observe the animals from various angles, many of which are unique to Asahiyama Zoo. Get face to face with a polar bear, or watch seals swim just an arm-length away!

title: Lift Off with a Powered Paragliding Adventure in Furano
description:
Ride the sky with a powered paraglider as you soar over Furano, the flower capital of Hokkaido! Check out the mountains and flower fields as you float up to 400 meters in the air.
Take part in the most exciting outdoor sport in Furano, powered paragliding! We recommend a morning flight, perfect to start the day before checking out the lavender fields or ski slopes. Take off into the wide Hokkaido sky for fantastic birds-eye views of the colorful flower fields in spring and summer or snow covered mountains in winter. Children of middle school age and older are welcome, making this a great family activity.

No charge for cancellations due to bad weather or high winds!

title: Kyoto Shore Excursion from Osaka City or Osaka Port
description:
Hop in a comfortable car in Osaka and head to Kyoto to see its best sights, such as Arashiyama and Kinkakuji. Have a hassle-free tour and let your English-speaking driver show you the charm of Kyoto!
Famous for its traditional charm and beauty, Kyoto is a popular sightseeing spot in Japan. Getting around the prefecture, however, can be a bit of a challenge for non-locals. This convenient taxi tour picks you up from your desired location in Osaka (including the port!) and takes you to Kyoto's top sites, including the Fushimi Inari Shrine, Kiyomizudera Temple, Arashiyama and Kinkakuji. You can also make changes to and customize your itinerary, to make sure that you get the most out of your one-day tour. Trust your English-speaking driver to get you to Kyoto's top attractions! 

*Requests for changes in the itinerary may require an extra fee.

title: Owl Cafe Experience: Meet and Photograph Cute Owls in Osaka
description:
Meet the fluffy feathered owls of the cafe and take pictures together with them. You can even rest them on your shoulder or head for a super cute pose.
We are working to spread the joy of owls to everyone! Now you can book 5 tables at our shop online for even easier access.

*On weekends and holidays the following start times are available; 11:00, 17:00, 18:00, and 19:00.

title: Walking Tour of Sumiyoshi Grand Shrine and Tsutenkaku in Osaka
description: See some of Osaka's most charming spots on this fun tour. Explore the 1800-year old Sumiyoshi Grand Shrine, ride a retro tram, relax in Tennouji Park and see the famous Tsutenkaku Tower.

title: Canoe Tour Of Lake Furen or Onnetou Marsh in Nemuro
description: Enjoy Nature in Nemuro by canoe as you go through marsh and river with lots of migratory birds, then into the lake to see Japanese Cranes and Ezo deer.

title: Hokkaido Crane- Viewing Private Tour from Kushiro
description: Come see the red-crowned cranes of Hokkaido, as they play and dance freely over the snow. Ideal for birdwatchers and photography lovers!

title: Temples to Skyscrapers Walking Tour of Osaka with English-Speaking Guide
description: From the 1400 year-old Shitennouji Temple to the dramatic skyscraper Abeno Harukas, and including stops at Rokujido (Garden of Paradise) and the urban oasis of Tennouji Park, get a feel for Osaka!

title: Samurai Sword Fighting Class and Kimono Dressing in Osaka
description: Change into a samurai or ninja and learn to sword fight. Practice the moves, then perform a fighting scene with a professional taking the supporting role.

title: Dinner Buffet at Hotel Keihan Universal City's World Buffet in Osaka
description:
Enjoy a full American style dinner buffet at Hotel Keihan, either on its own, or after a day at nearby Universal Studios Japan, just a short way away.
This is a genuine buffet restaurant, in the Las Vegas style, where diners can enjoy food from all over the world. The huge open kitchen is exciting to watch, as chefs dish out beautifully arranged dishes from various countries.

title: Half Day Walking Tour of Historical Sites of Sapporo
description:
Trace the history of Hokkaido through the iconic buildings of Sapporo. Let your guide take you through the exhibits in each area to learn about the development of Japan's northern frontier.
Take a walk through the streets of Sapporo with your knowledgeable guide and see the city through another perspective. Make your way to the famous sites that made the frontier island of Hokkaido into what it is today. 
Stop by iconic buildings such as the Hokkaido University or the Clock Tower from the 1800's with unique western style architecture and see the special exhibits inside. Take your time to unravel the mystery of this popular city of the north with a guide in the language of your choice.

title: Half Day Snowshoe Adventure Trek in Moerenuma Park from Sapporo
description: Moerenuma Park is designed by Isamu Noguchi, a famous sculptor, and is a wonderland  where you can enjoy strolling, playing in snow, viewing the artwork and a great view of Sapporo itself.

title: Organic Soba Noodle Cooking with Taxi Transfers from Sapporo
description:
Join the instructor of Iwamoto Farm and discover the secrets of making tasty soba noodles using organic buckwheat. Try some when you finish cooking, then take home more for later!
Using a blend of the finest organic buckwheat, an instructor with 15 years of experience will teach you how to make delicious soba noodles. Make 500 grams of soba during the lesson, then try out a fresh serving and enjoy the flavors! Take home the other 4 servings to eat later or as a special gift. The location is right by Shin-Chitose Airport, so this is a great chance to enjoy a last taste of Hokkaido before flying home!
Pick-up, and drop-off, from Sapporo or Shin-Chitose Airport are available!

title: Explore Popular Sightseeing Spots in Hokkaido By Sightseeing Taxi from Sapporo
description: Discover Hokkaido with a convenient plan from Sapporo to anywhere you want to go. From classic Otaru to beautiful Furano, and even Noboribetsu, Lake Toya or Chitose Airport, we can take you there!

title: Traditional Maiko Tea Ceremony with Snacks in Osaka
description: Experience a traditional tea ceremony with Japanese confectioneries. As you sip on a bowl of matcha green tea, meet a Maiko up close for photo opportunities and memorable conversations.

title: Easy Car Rental Service from Kansai International Airport in Osaka
description: Go straight from Kansai Airport (KIX) to navigate through the busy streets of Osaka and Kyoto by car. Enjoy exploring the Kansai area with an English GPS and road support!

title: Reservations for Legoland Discovery Center Osaka
description:
Visit Legoland Discovery Center in Osaka for the day at a discount price. View the Lego versions of Osaka's famous sights, build something yourself or enjoy the many attractions with your family.
Show your reservation at the counter of Legoland Discovery Center Osaka and spend your time at the facility freely. Booking this reservation allows you to enjoy Legoland at a lower price than usual! This plan is especially geared toward families with young children, so enjoy the day viewing the Lego recreations of Osaka's landmarks, the 4D cinema attraction or try building a car and testing its speed in a race!

title: Yukata Dressing for Couples in Osaka
description: Try your choice of either modern stylish or classic traditional dressing, whichever you like. This makes for a wonderful chance to see a festival or watch the fireworks together in a light kimono.

title: Meet Owls at an Owl Cafe with a Drink in Osaka
description:
Forget about daily life as you relax with cute owls! Take your time, feed and take a picture of them in a calm cafe. A drink for you are included too.
See real owls and even feel what it is like to hold one! Take tons of pictures of the owls. Maybe you will catch a serious look or some funny poses. This cafe is all about creating a fun and pleasant time, so you can relax with a drink for yourself, included in the price.

title: One-Hour Japanese Traditional Taiko Drumming Experience in Osaka
description: Feel the rhythm of Japanese traditional taiko drumming in Osaka. No experience or Japanese language needed, just come on in and leave with a great memory.

title: Ryukyu Dance Performance with Traditional Cuisine Dinner Course in Naha
description: Enjoy the unique and time-honored Ryukyu Palace cuisine, a blend found nowhere else, and watch a performance of classic dances carefully passed down.

title: Traditional Okinawan Ryukyu-Style Tea Ceremony Experience in Naha
description: Bukubuku-Cha (bubbly tea) is a traditional Okinawan-style tea, which used to be served to important visitors during the Ryukyu dynasty. Enjoy a unique tea break!

title: Beautiful Scuba Diving at Three Spots in the Kerama Islands from Naha or Chatan
description:
Take a day to dive into the crystal clear waters around the Kerama Islands. Explore coral reefs, see tropical fish and watch for sea turtles. Beginners and experienced divers welcome.
Just 40 km from Naha, this group of 20 small islands has some of the clearest diving spots in the world! Explore the underwater beauty of Okinawa, and check out the turquoise waters around Sea Turtle Island. Dive at three spots chosen for the day's conditions. Zamamijima, surrounded by lovely coral reefs, Kurojima, the emerald waters of Tokashikijima or Gishippu Island, famous for turtles, are all waiting. Enjoy lunch on the boat, and spend a full day diving!

title: Fun Snorkeling Adventure in the Natural Blue Cave with Departure from Onna
description:
Splash on in to a shining world of turquoise in the waters of the Blue Cave. Snorkel with tropical fish and explore Okinawa's underwater world!
Get to the Blue Cave the quickest and easiest way. Jump right off the boat into the clear blue waters for a fun half day snorkeling adventure! Appropriate for beginners and children too, this family friendly excursion takes you into a natural blue cave, where the sunlight and water create an incredible combination. Swim with tropical fish, and watch as they cluster around you for a feeding. Back at the shop, you can shower and change in comfort.

title: Okinawa World Heritage Sites Full-Day Charter Tour
description:
Explore all the important sights of the Ryukyu Kingdom at your own pace on this private tour of Okinawa's history and culture. Travel around in style, without having to worry about driving or buses!
There are are 9 UNESCO World Heritage Sites in Okinawa, all important representations of the unique culture of the Ryukyu Kingdom.

Wonder at the vividly red Shurijo Castle and tranquil Shinkina-en garden in Naha. Visit Sefa-Utaki and Sonohyan-Utaki's gate, two scared groves of the ancient Ryukyu religion. The 14th century Nakijin castle is one of the 5 gusuku (stone-walled) castle ruins left, along with the Tamaudun Mausoleum where Ryukyuan royalty was entombed.

See all of these ancient sights in one day, with hassle-free transportation and the leisure to explore at your own pace.

title: Sea Kayak Expedition from Cape Maeda with Optional Snorkeling
description: Explore the surrounding waters of Cape Maeda on a sea kayak. Paddle out to the emerald green sea and discover the underwater sea life with a snorkel you can only see here.

title: Full Day Car Rental Service with Churaumi Aquarium Ticket from Naha Airport
description:
Enjoy convenient transport from Naha Airport to the rental shop, then make your way around Okinawa in comfort. Visit the famous Churaumi Aquarium with an included entry ticket.
This car rental agent has the following insurance or compensations to cover the damages or responsibilities of the accidents. However, if it goes over the covered amount, the extra charges will be held by the customer.

The following insurance compensation system is included in the charge:
Interpersonal (per person): Unlimited
Belongings and vehicle (per accident): Unlimited (immunity from responsibility JPY 50,000)
Personal injury compensation in case of death: JPY 30 million per person (to the maximum amount of passengers)

title: Half Day Ocean Dives in the Sea of Okinawa from Yomitan
description: Get a new look at Okinawa from the blue tropical waters. Beach or boat dives available for licensed divers, each with its own fabulous views and variety of colorful sea life.

title: Explore Three Points in the Sea of Kerama with a Snorkel
description:
Travel on a boat to three special points and spend an entire day with a snorkel to see the colorful fish and tropical marine life in the seas of Kerama. 
The 3 points in our schedule are Zamami island, Kuro island, Tokashiki island, and Gishibu island. In the morning you can enjoy snorkeling and have a lunch break on the boat. In the afternoon, you can either enjoy snorkeling again at another point, or an option of diving is available for 5,000 JPY.

title: Naha History and Culture Private Charter Tour with English Speaking Driver
description:
Explore Naha on your own terms with this custom charter tour. See the rich history of the ancient Ryukyu Kingdom at your own pace. Great for groups or those with kids.
Visit the architecturally extravagant Shurijo Castle and Shureimon Gate, featured on the 2000 yen note. Then, get a feel for the Okinawa of old with a stroll down Shurikinjocho Road or relax in the World Heritage Shikina-en Garden. Look for pottery on Yachimun Street or interesting local treats at Makishi Market. Don't forget about awamori, Okinawa's fiery liquor, which you can sample at a distillery dating back to 1887.
