All of this can be taken at your pace, since your driver will take you to each one without rushing.

title: WiFi Router Rental with Easy Pick-up at Naha Airport (2-Day to 30-Day Plans)
description:
Stay connected at all times during your trip to Japan with a portable wifi router you can pick up and drop off at Naha Airport. Choose from a range of plans, great for both work and vacations.
Get high speed, mobile broadband for your iPad, laptop and smartphone anytime and anywhere in Japan, with unlimited data! The Pocket Wifi can quickly create group internet access and individual WiFi hotspots; connect wirelessly to many devices such as iPads, laptops, digital cameras, iPhones, Android phones and game devices to let you play games online, transfer pictures and keep in touch.

Visit the counter in the Terminal 1 Arrival Lobby for pick-ups and returns. The counter is open from 9:00am-9:00pm. For after-hours returns, please use the return box.

title: Parasailing and Snorkeling Double Adventure from Motobu
description: Taste the best of Okinawa with a combination of snorkeling and parasailing. See the waters from above and below, with enough time to go to the Churaumi Aquarium too!

title: Day Time Offshore Fishing Adventure from Onna
description: Aim for a big catch on the shores of Okinawa. Every season has something different for you to enjoy. Let the captain cook the fish you caught on the spot!

title: Okinawa Tour of Shurijo Castle, Naval Underground HQ and Okinawa World from Naha
description:
Feel the history and culture of Okinawa firsthand. See bright Shurijo Castle, the Former Japanese Navy Underground Headquarters, Okinawa World and more on this easy tour of the island's top spots!
Spend a full day exploring the southern areas of Okinawa, and feel both the power of the ancient Ryukyu Kingdom and the effect of the battles of WWII. 

Start off your day at the bright red Shurijo Castle, a massive structure decorated with Chinese-influenced dragons and surrounded by a red and white lined courtyard. Then head to the Former Navy Underground Headquarters, Himeyuri Monument and Peace Memorial Park for a moving view of the Battle of Okinawa in 1944. After lunch, explore the culture of the Ryukyu Kingdom at Okinawa World, and check out the 820 meter Gyokusendo Cave!

title: Southern Okinawa Full Day Private Charter Tour from Naha Hotels
description:
Explore the sights of southern Okinawa, without the hassle of driving or getting lost. Relax as your driver introduces the best sights, such as the Ryukyu Village, Okinawa Peace Memorial and more.

The most convenient and efficient way to visit the rural southern area of the island, this charter tour will take you to sights beyond Okinawa's famous blue sea and beaches. 
Learn more about traditional Okinawan culture at Ryukyu Village, and enjoy the wild profusion of plants at the South East Botanical Gardens. See the giant cacti and aloe plants at Himeyuri Park, then visit the Himeyuri monument, dedicated to the war nurses who perished during the Battle of Okinawa.

Explore Okinawa's beauty at your own pace.

title: Traditional Japanese Wedding Costume Dress Experience in Kyoto
description: Dress up in a gorgeous Uchikake or Shiromuku kimono. Perfect for a stylish photo with friends, for mothers and daughters, or as a couple!

title: Morning Paragliding Challenge Experience in Kyoto
description: Take your time leisurely gliding through the sky on a paraglider. Feel the wind against you as you soar above to witness the birds eye view of the city.

title: Authentic Maiko or Geisha Makeover and Photo Shoot Experience in Gion
description:
While in Kyoto, take the once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform into an elegant maiko or geisha! Take photos in dramatic white makeup and colorful kimono.
Choose to take portraits in the studio, or to enjoy some of Kyoto's most famous sights while dressed as an elegant maiko or geisha. Great for friends, family or really original engagement photos!

title: Car or Minivan Rental Service with Airport Transfers from Naha Airport
description:
Navigate around Okinawa with ease by car or minivan, and travel hassle-free to popular tourist spots and beautiful beaches. Convenient shuttle services and English GPS are also available.
Hop on the shuttle, which will take you directly to the car rental office!

title: Sunset Sea Kayaking Tour from Onna
description: Take a break from the day and relax on a kayak as you drift along the coast line. Let stress drift away to views of the setting sun on the Okinawan sea.

title: Family Snorkeling Adventure in the Blue Cave from Onna
description: This fun and easy tour features a coast line walk to the Blue Cave before snorkeling. Come explore the seas of Okinawa and swim with tropical fish.

title: Fun and Simple Okinawan Sanshin Playing Lesson in English in Yomitan
description: Enjoy the original sound and unique experience of strumming the three stringed sanshin in its birthplace, Okinawa! Perfect for a wide range of ages or as a family event.

title: Half Day Ceramic Shiisa and Okinawan Pottery Workshop in Nakijin
description: Experience making traditional Okinawan shiisa guardian lion-dogs and create your own take on the traditional figures. The shisa will then be sent to Japanese addresses within 30~40 days.

title: Whale Watching around the Kerama Islands from Naha (Dec 23-Mar 31)
description:
In winter Okinawa is famous as a migration spot for families of wild humpback whales. Join the cruise to see them splashing around playfully in their natural habitat, an unforgettable experience!
Every year, humpback whales take a long journey from the cold North Pole to the warm seas around the Kerama Islands to give birth and care for their young. Watch the dynamic behavior of the whales as they swim by the boat and communicate by tail slapping and breaching. Book early to make sure you don't miss this splendid natural Okinawan spectacle.

title: Okinawan Ryukyu Kimono Dress Experience in Naha
description: Take a short break during your trip and try on one Okinawan kimono. Men's, women's, and childrens' are all available, and you can take your own photos.

title: Gangala Valley Nature Expedition Walking Tour
description:
Enter a world of lush green forests inside mysterious underground caves. Explore the beauty of this collapsed cave with an audio guide in English, Chinese or Korean!
Discover this hidden gem of Okinawa by taking a 1 km hike through Gangala Valley with your knowledgeable guide. The Gangala Valley was formerly an underground cave until it collapsed almost 100,000 years ago. Forests began to form around the cave, which created an interesting plant formation that still remains today. It is also said that primitive Japanese people lived in the area around 18,000 years ago, from items found during excavations. Take a relaxing walk through the massive area and learn about the ancient world up close!

title: Clownfish Snorkeling Adventure by Banana Boat from Onna
description: Dip into the waters with the cute and colorful fish of Okinawa! Speed down on a banana boat to the special point to see some clownfish play among the anemone!

title: Family Friendly Blue Cave Snorkeling Tour from Onna
description:
Perfect for kids and parents, this ages 5 and over snorkel adventure takes you to the magical Blue Cave. Dedicated instructors means fun for everyone.
Set out on a relaxing boat ride to the enchanting Blue Cave, then head into the water with the guide. Explore beautiful tropical waters in a kid friendly tour that also includes a tropical fish feeding, to help you see the bright schools up close!

title: Half Day Ocean or Mangrove Kayaking Adventure in Higashi
description:
Kayak through the clear emerald waters of Okinawa, or explore the lush green mangroves on a fun half day excursion. See the more rural side of the island!
Get in touch with nature during these 1.5 hour or 4.5 hour kayaking tours.Enjoy a short adventure on the ocean, to see the beautiful contrast between the blue of the water and that of the sky. Adventurous travelers will have a blast on the mangrove and ocean kayak tour, to experience the best of Okinawa's vibrant nature. Children and groups are welcome!

title: Thrilling Jet Boat and Parasailing Experience from Motobu
description: Rip through the refreshing currents as you speed across the sea of Okinawa on a jet boat. After your exciting ride, add on a parasailing experiencing for a fun day out in the sea.

title: Painting Plaster Shisa Lion Dogs at Atelier43 in Okinawa
description: Get creative and decorate with your favorite colors to dress up a set of Shisa pairs, single ones or glass Shisa trays. Enjoy a drink by the beach for a full Okinawan experience!

title: Okinawa Bus Tour to Churaumi Aquarium, Kouri Island from Naha
description: Visit the whale sharks of the famous Churaumi Aquarium, gaze at the turquoise sea vistas from Kouri Island and explore tropical island on this full-day tour departing from Naha!

title: Gold Kindami Yuzen Kyoto Fabric Dying and Handcrafts Lesson
description: Kindami Yuzen is a dying technique using both traditional gold Kindami and Yuzen methods of fabrics that are used in Kimonos. Make fancy crafts using this authentic method.

title: Two Day Kyoto Train and Hotel Package from Tokyo
description:
This bargain travel package to Kyoto includes Hikari Shinkansen bullet train tickets to and from Tokyo and accommodations in the ancient capital!
Travel to Kyoto by Japan's famous bullet train and explore at your own pace with this unguided free plan. Explore the seemingly countless shrines and temples, as well as ancient buildings, of the old capitol!

title: Traditional Japanese Sweets Making Experience in Higashiyama
description:
Learn to make beautiful seasonal Japanese sweets under the guidance of a
professional pastry chef, at the famous Kanshundo sweets shop near Kiyomizudera Temple.

title: Classic Rickshaw Ride in Arashiyama
description:
Ride a retro rickshaw and step back in time in lovely Arashiyama! This private tour takes you around the best sites, filled with history and beauty.
Rickshaws first appeared in Japan in the late 19th century, and have been a fun and relaxing way to see local sights. Unlike a car or bus, you stay close to the real Japan aboard one of these. In modern day Japan, the shafu (rickshaw drivers) provide warm and friendly hospitality, guiding you to hidden gems. Choose the private tour that fits your needs, from 12 to 120 minutes, and each driver will customize your time to best fit the season, weather and your interests. Climb aboard the luxurious rickshaws and move deftly through Arashiyama, home to the Sagano bamboo forest and Togetsukyo bridge.

title: Half-Day Custom Kyoto Tour on a Private Taxi (4 Person)
description: Spend a leisurely trip around Kyoto and explore the shrines, temples and castles that highlight each area of the ancient city with your knowledgeable English speaking driver.

title: Five Hour Budget Friendly Sightseeing Taxi in Kyoto (4 Person)
description: Explore historical temples and castles of Kyoto with your friends or family on a comfortable taxi. Stop by famous locations with a helpful English speaking driver.

title: Tea Ladle Bamboo Carving Course
description: Sharpen white bamboo with a small knife as you slowly and carefully bring your tea ladle forth. You can also make a carrying case for the ladle.

title: Handmade Pottery Experience in Kyoto
description: Create your own special souvenir of Kyoto during this pottery class. Using 1 kg of clay, you can create your own unique ceramic vessels!

title: Afternoon Small Group Japanese Cooking Class in Kyoto
description:
Choose from three traditional dishes and cook up a storm in a friendly Japanese cooking lesson that comes with a glimpse into Japan's culture thanks to your local instructor, all in English.
You can choose to make sushi and dashi soup stock, the famous dish known worldwide and the silent partner of Japanese cuisine. Or, try mastering the secret to teriyaki chicken, whose simple ingredients bring a deep world of flavor with the right trick. Last, you can cook up savory okonomiyaki, a hearty and tasty dish with local variations all across Japan. This authentic Japanese cooking lesson is held with English instruction, and even covers Japanese table manners and the history and culture behind Japanese cuisine, giving you a deeper look into the culture.

title: Toei Kyoto Studio Park and Randen Ticket Combo
description:
Enjoy an exciting day at the Toei Kyoto Studio Park as you enter a world of drama and entertainment! Meet ninjas, transform into a Kyoto beauty or enjoy the performances. Great for families with kids!
At the Toei Kyoto Studio Park,  observe the filming of historic dramas (jidaigeki) and roam freely through the film sets. Take a peak at the backstage of these productions.

Other attractions include the Ninja Mystery House, where you can explore secret passages in a labyrinth! There is also a costume shop where you can transform into your favorite character with the help of professional makeup artists. Don't miss the acrobatic ninja show and ninja cafe.

Your visit to Toei Kyoto Studio Park and transportation back to your selected Randen station are covered in this combo!

title: Sake Tasting and Fushimi Inari Shrine Morning Tour in Kyoto
description:
Offer up a prayer to the god of rice and protector of warriors, Inari Okami. Visit his brilliant main shrine before being touring a sake museum and sampling their delicious rice wines!
Follow your expert guide and visit Fushimi Inari Taisha, a Shinto shrine famous for its endless tunnels of torii gates. Painted a brilliant and fiery red, they seem to beckon you to a sacred dimension. It is believed that the great spirit of Inari Okami inhabits this place. Check out the myriad of fox statues that populate this otherworldly locale.

Japan's national beverage (sake) cannot be created without rice, so your final destination will be the Gekkeikan Okura Kinen Kan, a sake museum and brewery. Sample a vast variety of Japanese rice-wine to find your favorite!

title: Morning Tour to Uji and Byodoin Temple with a Tea Ceremony from Kyoto
description:
Join a morning nature walk through Uji! Discover this idyllic town's ancient bridge and temples, including famous Byodoin. Then sample Uji matcha at a tea ceremony at Taihoan.

Uji is famous for matcha (green tea) and as the location of the final chapters of the epic "Tale of Genji". 

Visit Ujibashi Bridge, built in 646, one of Japan's three oldest wooden bridges. Follow your guide to Nakanoshima Park, a garden filled with over 2,000 cherry blossom trees, a must-see in the spring!

Along the way, take a moment to relax at Taihoan with an authentic tea ceremony. After tea, end your morning stroll with a visit to Byodoin Temple, a UNESCO World Heritage Sites.Originally built in 998, the image of the temple's famous Phoenix Hall is on the back of the 10 yen coin!

title: Elegant Oiran Courtesan Makeover and Photo Shoot Experience in Kyoto
description:
Enter the mystical world of the oiran and transform into a beautiful courtesan dressed in a luxurious kimono and elaborate accessories, for beautiful and memorable photos of your trip to Kyoto.
Feel like a beautiful Japanese courtesan during a special photo session inside a movie set-like studio in Kyoto. Begin your experience by selecting an elaborate kimono of your choice and let the experienced staff arrange your hair and make-up for the perfect look. Enjoy having photos taken by a professional photographer for gorgeous photos to take home as a souvenir. Guests from outside Japan will receive their photos on the same day!

title: Four Hour Scenic Temple Tour in Kyoto on a Charter Taxi (4 Person)
description: Visit popular temples and world heritages on a private taxi while using your time in Kyoto efficiently. Let a local English speaking taxi guide take you around.

title: Traditional Paulownia Box Crafts and Workshop in Kyoto
description: Add a picture using special paper templates to a lovely functional souvenir. Make and take home a box made of paulownia wood, both light and good at keeping things safe from humidity.

title: Half Day Tea Ceremony at a Traditional Machiya in Kyoto
description: Visit a traditional Japanese machiya, a wooden townhouse, and enjoy an authentic tea ceremony in a quiet and serene atmosphere. Learn Japanese culture in a friendly and relaxed way.

title: Kimono Wearing Experience for Men and Women at a Traditional Machiya in Kyoto
description: Assisted by a trained kimono dresser, transform into a vision in silk! Dress in the colorful kimono and take lots of pictures around the machiya. Men's and Women's kimono both available.

title: Half Day Art of Japanese Calligraphy Class in a Local Home in Kyoto
description:
Draw and create a unique piece of art during an intimate lesson of traditional Japanese calligraphy. Take your work home with you as a Kyoto souvenir.
Experience the beauty of Japanese calligraphy or shodo, a pictorial method of composing the Japanese language, and learn all about this traditional writing style. 

Your shodo instructor and English-speaking assistant will help you to become acquainted with the traditional fude (brush), suzuri (stone ink grinder), and sumi (ink) as you are guided step-by-step through the fundamentals of Japanese calligraphy. Choose the characters you wish to write and practice your new skills. You will have the opportunity to write out your favorite characters and take your art home as a unique souvenir!

title: Yatsuhashi Confectionery Making Experience in Kyoto
description: Learn to make your very own traditional Japanese confectionery to take home as a souvenir of Kyoto. No cooking skills required. Great for children and families to enjoy making a sweet treat.

title: Biwa Lute Storytelling Performance with Shrine Tour or Sweets Making in Kyoto
description: Listen to the Tale of Genji and Heike from over a thousand years ago performed on a Biwa lute. Take a tour around the Matsuno Shrine or learn to make Japanese sweets right from the story.

title: Traditional Japanese Sweets Making Experience in Arashiyama
description: Learn how to make beautiful wagashi, the traditional cutely shaped sweets of Japan! An experienced instructor will assist you as you make flower and fruit shaped treats.

title: Rock Climbing Adventure at the Hira Mountains near Kyoto
description:
Tired of temples? Get your adrenaline pumping with a beginner-friendly rock climbing adventure near Kyoto. The views of Lake Biwa and the Hira mountain range when you get to the top are beautiful!
This tour is suitable for beginners who have never had the chance to try rock climbing. With all the equipment prepared and set, you just have to bring your enthusiasm. Climb up the rocky wall with Lake Biwa lying right below you, for a fantastic adrenaline rush. Sweat it out during a fun rock climbing session and make it one of your fondest memories of Japan.

You will be climbing the Shishi Rock, a 50-m tall rock that offers a wide variety of climbing routes- great for everyone, from amateurs to experts!

title: Ultimate Kyoto 1-Day Pass (Randen Tram + Subway Pass)
description:
With just one pass, explore the bustling city, the traditional towns and the serene outskirts of Kyoto using the Randen trams and subway! 
The Kyoto subway consists of two lines- the Karasuma and Tozai lines,which connect you from the center of the city to popular tourist spots and hotels. The Randen tram line connects Arashiyama with Shijo-Omiya, in the middle of the city. Dotted along the tram line are world heritage sites, tranquil zen gardens and spiritual temples.

This pass allows you to all-day access to the Randen tram and subway, to explore Kyoto at your own pace, without any hassle!                

On the tram route you will find Tenryuji, the famous Zen rock garden of Ryoanji and Ninnaji, the temple of royalty.

title: Fushimi Inari Temple Visit and Sake Tasting Private Tour in Kyoto
description:
Spend the morning exploring often overlooked jewels of southern Kyoto! Explore the thousands of orange torii gates of the famous Inari Shrine, before enjoying a flavorful sake-tasting tour.
Start your morning off with a guided tour of Fushimi Inari, the most famous Shinto shrine dedicated to the goddess of rice and agriculture. Travel through paths lined by over 40,000 torii gates as you ascend the trails up the sacred Mount Inari, and look down over Kyoto from 230 meters up! 

After the morning hike, visitors will have an in-depth introduction to everything sake! First up will be a sake brewery, where guests can sample several types of local sake. After the brewery, visitors will go to a specialty shop that has over 80 different kinds of bottled rice-wine available.

title: Best of Kyoto Private Taxi Tour from Osaka City or Osaka Port
description:
Enter a fascinating world as you check out the best sights of Kyoto including Kinkakuji and Arashiyama. Hop in a comfortable taxi from Osaka, and avoid the hassle of navigating public transportation.
Known for its traditional charm and beauty, Kyoto is well-loved by visitors of Japan. For non-locals, however, getting around can be quite challenging, especially if you're not familiar with the language. This convenient taxi tour whisks you from your desired location in Osaka (including the port!) to Kyoto's top sites, including the Fushimi Inari Shrine, Kiyomizudera Temple, Arashiyama and Kinkakuji. You can also make changes to and customize your itinerary, to make sure that you get the most out of your one-day tour. Trust your English-speaking driver to get you to Kyoto's top attractions! 

*Requests for changes in the itinerary may require an extra fee.

title: Japanese Seven Spice Blend Making Lesson in Kyoto
description: Make shichimi,a traditional Japanese spice blend,by mixing the 7 ingredients to your tastes. Keep your spices in a traditional seasoning container made of bamboo for a touch of Kyoto wherever you are.

title: Retro-Modern Kimono Makeover and Photo Experience in Kyoto
description:
Get dressed and styled in an adorable antique kimono with a modern twist. Add to the nostalgic style with cute accessories and try a different type of photo shoot for amazing pictures.
Step back to the roaring 1920s of Japan as you dress-up in a fashionable Taisho era style kimono. The unique mix of traditional style, chic accessories, and modern make-up and hair blend into a one-of-a-kind Japanese kawaii style photo shoot.

title: Easy Kimono Rental and Stroll in Kyoto
description: Walk in empty handed and let us get you into a lovely kimono. You can choose from a variety of chic items then enjoy strolling Kyoto or have a small photo shoot.

title: Traditional Japanese Shibori Tie-Dye Workshop in Kyoto
description: Make a lovely item of your choice using traditional shibori tie dye methods to color your own design. Select from handkerchiefs, shawls, curtains and more. Enjoy a fun workshop in Kyoto.

title: Traditional Gozen Temple Dining at Daigoji Temple in Kyoto
description: Indulge in a rare meal at Daigoji Temple and taste the  delicate flavors of seasonal Kyoto vegetables before leisurely strolling the rich grounds of the temple.

title: Original Chopstick Marking Workshop
description: Create your own personal and unique pair of chopsticks from smoked bamboo during this workshop! Carve and shape them to be just right for you.

title: Two Day Japan Highlight Tour to Mt. Fuji, Hakone and Kyoto Roundtrip from Tokyo
description:
Take the Golden Route tour from Tokyo and visit Mt. Fuji, Hakone and Kyoto on a safe, worry free trip with a an English speaking guided bus tour! Perfect to see the sights in a limited time.
Recommended for first time travelers to Japan, this is a great way to head from Tokyo and see the top sites and wonders of Japan and also give yourself time to explore Kyoto on your own, with one night of accommodation included.

title: Samurai Sword Dance Lesson and Show at Samurai Kembu Theater in Kyoto
description:
Step into the Samurai Kembu Theater and experience the traditional culture of the sword. Wear a kimono as you watch an artistic performance by the masters.
Samurai Kembu is a traditional performing art with a Japanese sword (katana) and a Japanese fan. The word ‘Kembu’ means literally ‘sword dance.’ In feudal times samurais danced with their swords and fans to give themselves courage or to achieve mental concentration. In the movie "The Last Samurai" you can see actors performing kembu on the day before the battle.  Usually samurai kembu perform with background music, to create a beautiful moving performance!
Learn the basics of performing and martial art form, assisted by friendly professional teachers and get a unique taste of Japan's traditional culture.

title: Kimono Rental and Dressing for Women, Men, and Children in Kyoto
description:
Dress up in a lovely kimono or yukata for a stroll through the streets and sights of Kyoto. Blend right into the classic city with traditional wear, making for great photos and memories.
Located in the heart of Kyoto, our studio is waiting for you! Walk in and choose your favorite kimono then take a step back through time to ancient Kyoto. Our staff will help you dress, from kimono to accessories, then it is time to set out! Just a short walk from Kiyomizudera Temple and other lovely spots, you can easily stroll over and take tons of pictures to remember your day with.

title: Overnight Stay at Ninnaji Temple and Morning Prayer Service in Kyoto
description:
Spend a night in the tranquil beauty of Kyoto's Ninnaji Temple, a World Heritage Site. In the morning join a reflective prayer led by temple monks, an enlightening way to start your day.
With a five-story pagoda and an orchard of cherry trees that explode with pink blossoms in spring, Ninnaji Temple has been listed as a World Heritage Site since 1994. The tatami sleeping areas include freshly laid out futons and you will be able to bathe in traditional baths, perfect for relaxing. In the morning enjoy a healthy and hearty breakfast before attending morning prayers, open only to overnight guests and temple monks. You can also tour the grounds before the gates open to the public. After the morning service and breakfast, check-out before 9:00am to enjoy the temple gardens before setting off into Kyoto.

title: Meet a Maiko in Kyoto with Dance Show, Dinner and Easy Transportation
description:
Experience the real Kyoto by meeting a maiko. See her perform traditional dances, and get the chance to play Japanese party games! After that, treat yourself with an included Kyoto style dinner.
Your night begins with easy pick-up at central hotels, where your English speaking guide will whisk you away into enchantment. Watch a traditional maiko performance at Yatsuhashi-An and Shishu-Yakata. Once the dance is done, you can take commemorative photos and maybe even play a few games with the maiko. Cherish your memories with a special Senjafuda, the classic business card of maiko. Then your journey into Japanese art continues at the Embroidery Museum, where works of art resemble exquisite paintings. At last, complete the night with a Japanese style tempura meal, and feast on the culinary treasures of the city. All taxi transfers are included, making this a hassle free way to enjoy a night out in Kyoto.

title: Private Luxury Charter from Narita Airport or Haneda Airport to Tokyo Hotels
description: Travel in a luxurious Lexus from Haneda or Narita Airport straight to your hotel in downtown Tokyo. Meet your driver at the airport and enjoy the smooth ride into the city.

title: Private Tour to Mt.Fuji Panoramic Spots and Hakone from Tokyo
description:
Enjoy a private day trip to Mt. Fuji, Lake Ashi, Oshino Hakkai and other beautiful scenic spots around this World Heritage site. A helpful English or French-speaking guide is included!
Enjoy a hassle-free tour to Mt.Fuji on a convenient mini-van chartered just for you and your group. A Japanese, English and French-speaking multilingual guide will be on board to assist you along the way. A Chinese-speaking guide is also available upon request.

Capture a picture-perfect view of the five-story pagoda at Arakurasengen Park with Mt. Fuji in the background before making your way to the famous Oshino Hakkai village, where you can stroll among traditional houses. Stop by Lake Ashi and ride the ropeway in Hakone for a day of viewing Mt. Fuji from different angles.

title: Japanese Shodo Calligraphy Experience in Asakusa in English
description: Try your hand at Japanese traditional calligraphy, using a thick brush and black ink! Learn how to write the kanji character of your choice, and create your own unique souvenir of your visit to Tokyo.

title: Japanese Culture Experience Tour in Nihonbashi
description:
Make your way into the curious world of Japanese culture and tradition. Visit a local Shinto shrine, discover gold leaf, and try using Japanese knives as you visit the various shops in COREDO! 
An English-speaking guide will introduce you to the elegant crafts of Japan! Explore Japanese culture and history as you visit a local shrine, learn about traditional crafts, and visit renowned historical shops that have honed their skills for decades.

*This tour is also available in "With Lunch" and "With Dinner" options. Please refer to the recommended activities below.

title: Introductory Ninja Training Program in Tokyo
description: Experience the art of the Japanese ninja in Tokyo with your friends and family. Learn how to use the ninja star, blow darts or martial arts along with their history and beliefs.

title: Tour of Asakusa's Best Spots by Rickshaw
description: Get a feel for the Tokyo of yore on this fun rickshaw tour of Asakusa! See temples and buildings that retain the feel of ancient Edo as you ride in style!

title: Walking Tour of Tokyo's Hidden Gems with an English-Speaking Guide
description:
Explore Tokyo's old town, known as the shitamachi. Visit local shopping streets, see the Imperial Palace and the famous Ueno Park. Find the heart of Tokyo in Ueno, Yanaka and Sendagi!
Despite its modern image, Tokyo still hides a treasure of traditional neighborhoods. Visit Yanaka, home to a plethora of cats and charming shopping streets bursting with local treats and interesting shops. Explore Kaneiji Temple, the family temple of the powerful Tokugawa clan, and stroll though nearby Ueno Park. Your guide will also take you to the famous Imperial Palace, which is still home to Japan's Imperial family!

This private tour will go at your pace, so no need to worry about missing buses or following a large group.

title: Tea Ceremony and Kimono Experience at Tokyo TJT Studio
description:
Get the full Japanese experience! Wear a colorful silk kimono and take part in a serene tea ceremony led by a tea master. You can then take photos in the tearoom or garden, perfect all year round.
Besides the chance to wear a beautiful kimono, this activity will also allow you to learn about its origins and the traditional skills of Japanese dyeing and weaving. 

After putting on the various layers and fastening the broad obi sash, you will have plenty of time to learn how to move gracefully in the kimono. Take as many pictures as you like, for a memento of your visit to Japan.

Then learn about the traditional Japanese art of tea, explained by professional tea masters. Enjoy a cup of matcha tea and sweets in a serene tatami tea room.

title: Tokyo After Dark: Foodie Walking Tour to Discover Local Flavors
description:
Eat your way through Tokyo, and start out your night right! Visit Yakitori Alley for some grilled chicken, hop over to Tsukishima for monjayaki, savor sweets in Ginza and end the night in a local pub.
Take a tour of Tokyo after 5 with an English-speaking guide. Try out several favorite local foods such as yakitori (grilled chicken skewers), monjayaki (a delicious pan-fried batter with various ingredients), and traditional Japanese sweets. You can also sample local sake or beer, but if you don't drink or if you're bringing your kids, don't worry. Non-alcoholic drinks will be served as well. Enjoy the atmosphere of nighttime Tokyo while you eat, drink and make new friends.

title: Tokyo Open-Top City Bus Tour from Tokyo Station (Day or Night Courses)
description: Get the best views of Tokyo on a speedy one-hour tour by open-top bus. Feel the liveliness of the city while driving by Tokyo Tower, Rainbow Bridge, and Odaiba with handy multilingual audio guides.

title: Introductory Manga Drawing Workshop near Haneda Airport with English Instruction
description: Join a fun workshop to learn how to draw Japanese comics. With helpful English guidance, see the works of the professional manga artists and experience the world of manga yourself!

title: Guided Tokyo Walking Tour of Historical Yanaka (Various Languages Available)
description:
Considered one of the most beautiful and historical neighborhoods of Tokyo, explore the streets, temples and shops of Yanaka with your friendly guide! Get a feel for the heart of the city.
A beautifully preserved traditional area of Tokyo, Yanaka is a must-see for visitors looking for a more local experience of Japan's capital. With guidance available in your choice of English, French, Italian or German you can delve into the history and culture!

title: Sushi, Tempura, and Sukiyaki Cooking Lessons in English in Asakusa
description:
In the heart of Asakusa, learn the steps of making delicious sushi, miso soup, tempura and more from a professional chef in a restaurant, and bring home the flavors of Japan to your kitchen!
With morning, afternoon courses, you can find the right class to suit your schedule and cravings. Ingredients are fresh and recipes are without preservatives or MSG, so you can enjoy healthy and delicious Japanese cooking to your tummy's content!

title: Traditional Japanese Home Cooking with English-Speaking Chef in Central Tokyo
description:
Enjoy a fun cooking lesson in English, right in the heart of Tokyo. Learn to use seasonal and local ingredients to cook up authentic home-style dishes with recipes to take as a souvenir.
Indulge in the seasonal flavors and local specialties by learning how to cook a balanced meal with an experienced English-speaking chef. Learn the history of Japanese food to understand the traditions behind each dish. After your cooking experience, savor your delicious meal on the spot.

title: Family Friendly Decorative Origami Class in Tsukishima
description: Experience the art of origami with an English or French speaking instructor. See how traditional paper folding turns into fancy home decor or small table-top items you can use everyday.

title: Akihabara Exploration Tour and Fun Electronics Workshop Experience with a Maid
description: Explore the otaku haven of Akiba with a friendly maid guide! Shop for cool electronics or anime goods, and learn how to make your own electronics too! Dive into the heart of Akihabara.

title: Dinner Reservations at Asakusa View Hotel's Sky Grill Buffet & Bar Musashi
description:
You will dine on 150 kinds of delicious Japanese, Western, and Chinese dishes, including fresh platters cooked in a lava stone oven. Complement dinner with fantastic views of Tokyo from huge windows.
Feast on the wide variety of dishes available, from pastas to soups, oven-roasted dishes to scrumptious desserts, all while treating your eyes to amazing views from the massive windows. Superb views of Tokyo Skytree®, Sensoji Temple, Ueno Park, and even the skyscrapers of Ikebukuro and Shinjuku are spread out across the land! Perfect for a special night out, enjoy the cuisine and view with easy English reservations. Meat and fish are presented, freshly cooked on lava plates from Mt. Fuji, and a variety of other dishes are prepared to order, delivering quality taste. As a final note for the meal, make sure to check out the chef's daily selection of desserts.

title: Reservations for an Owl Cafe in Kichijoji
description:
Enjoy a day at an owl cafe in Tokyo! You can pet and take photos with the adorable owls at this cafe located in the hip neighborhood of Kichijoji. 
At this owl cafe, the friendly staff will tell you all about how you can interact with the owls. Meet owls of all shapes and sizes and enjoy petting and taking photos (no flash, please!) with them.

title: Tokyo Nights Food Walking Tour in Shimbashi with English-Speaking Guide
description:
Step into the local eateries of Shimbashi and taste the delicacies beloved by Tokyoites. Enjoy a few drinks with some tasty okonomiyaki pancakes, yakitori skewers, taiyaki dessert and more!
When in Tokyo, eat like the Tokyoites do. This gourmet tour will take you well off the beaten path and into the world of food stalls and hidden restaurants beloved by the businessmen and women who work around Shimbashi.

title: Soba Noodle Making and Wine Tasting Session in Kitasenju
description: Experience making fresh soba and pairing them up with specialty wines. With lessons in French or English, discover a new way to taste buckwheat soba noodles in a modern style right in Tokyo.

title: Glamorous Cabaret Dinner Show at Black Swan Lake in Shinjuku
description:
Welcome to a glittering, dazzling, occasionally sexy “neo-tavern”, where male, female and new-half dancers perform while you enjoy dinner and drinks.
Black Swan Lake is a jewel of Kabukicho's vibrant entertainment in Shinjuku, with a more than 40 year history of fantastic performances and dazzling dances. Always on the leading edge of style, the high energy and risque performances are sure to create unforgettable memories! Watch the cast of ladies, new half, and male dancers perform a creative and intense routine while you enjoy freely flowing drinks and a selection of premium dishes during your choice of curtain calls. A great option if you have already been to the Robot Restaurant!

title: Family Friendly Origami Paper Folding Class in Tokyo with English Teacher
description:
Get your hands moving as you learn Origami. This Japanese folk art transforms a sheet of paper into a little sculpture with folding and sculpting techniques, and is fun for all ages.
You will learn to create a variety of cool paper art, from a simple paper crane to intricate sculptures. Our instructors will teach you the basics of this Japanese art, and soon have you folding like a pro! You can tray about 5 to 6 different origami shapes during the class. Which designs you take on will be based on your preferences and origami abilities. Some popular simple designs are pinwheels, miniature kites, boats, kimono and hakama, ninja stars and cranes. More involved designs include boxes and more elaborate versions of cranes.

title: Wi-Fi Router Rental Service with Unlimited Data and Hotel Delivery Included
description:
Stay connected anytime and anywhere with a portable Wi-Fi router! Update your status on Facebook or tweet from anywhere during your trip to Tokyo!
Receiving and returning the Wi-Fi router is extremely simple. The reserved Wi-Fi router will be waiting for you at your hotel reception desk on the date of your arrival in Japan.To use the Wi-Fi router, follow instructions provided in the kit and make simple adjustments to your device.
To return it, simply place the Wi-Fi router and accessories in the provided return envelope and ask the hotel receptionist to post it for you, or drop the pre-addressed package into any Japan Post.
Connection is available for smartphones and laptops, for up to 10 devices simultaneously, letting you and your group all enjoy simple and easy access.

title: See the Best of Tokyo in the Morning with an English Guide
description:
Start your day the best way with a morning tour of Tokyo. Beat the crowds and check out Tokyo Tower, Meiji Shrine, the Imperial Palace and Ginza with ease!
Get a personal taste of the unique nature of Tokyo, where classic history meets the modern cutting edge. Join this morning tour, then head out to Tokyo Tower, where a bird’s-eye view of the city's vast urban landscape awaits. Stepp back in time to visit the Tokyo of old with a stroll through the tranquil Meiji Shrine and a pleasant walk through the East Garden of the Imperial Palace. After that, you will be whisked away to Ginza, the famous shopping and entertainment district that showcases brands from all over the world.

title: Dynamic Traditional Taiko Japanese Drumming Lesson in Tokyo
description:
Feel the beat in an energetic taiko lesson with an English speaking guide. The sound of the wadaiko drum will echo through the room as you strike and play in a casual, fun and exciting class.
Join professional award-winning wadaiko drummers for a high energy class that brings you into the culture and world of Japanese Taiko drumming. Skill, stamina, and excitement turns a taiko performance into an unforgettable sight to behold. From warming up to class choreography, now is your chance to be a part of the tradition! From children ages 5 through to retirees, you can learn original choreography and fantastic music!

title: Owl Cafe Reservations in Harajuku
description: Head to Harajuku to interact with some adorable owls. Take photos of them and have the staff help you to let one perch on your arm. You can also opt for a special experience with the cafe's hawks.

title: Full Day Barrier-Free Tour of Tokyo for Wheelchair Users with Personal Guide
description:
Explore Tokyo with confidence on this barrier-free tour. Your guide will introduce you to Tokyo's wheelchair accessible areas including iconic locations like Sensoji Temple, Shibuya, and Meiji Shrine.
This tour is a great option for those who might be worried about just how wheelchair accessible Tokyo is. With the upcoming Olympic games in 2020, the city is rapidly developing into a barrier-free environment. Your helpful guide, who is also a qualified home caregiver, will make sure that you have a blast exploring Tokyo's best sights. Seniors, family members and caregivers are of course welcome to join in the tour!

title: Nikko All Area Discount Pass to Nikko and Kinugawa Onsen
description:
Easily visit Nikko, creating your own self-guided tour. Start in Asakusa and work your way up to visit beautiful places like Toshogu Shrine, Kegon Falls and various other temples and natural spots.
Organize your own self-guided tour with the convenient Nikko All Area Pass making as many stops along the designated route as you like. Visit the many World Heritage sites in the area and take advantage of the unlimited ride zone. During your trips to shrines and temples like Toshogu Shrine, Rinnoji and Futarasan, receive discounts on souvenirs, restaurants and many tourist facilities and rides. There are also plenty of locations to see gorgeous views such as Lake Chuzenji or Ryuzu Falls.

title: Kimono Bustle Dress Transformation with Professional Photo Shoot in Ginza
description:
Slip back in time to experience the Japonism movement right in the heart of Tokyo. Don a gorgeous kimono bustle dress and take professional photos for a memorable souvenir in Japan.
Over 150 years ago, Japan first opened its doors to the outside world to welcome Western culture. In the mid 1800's the first western bustle-dress store opened in Yokohama, which spread rapidly among Japanese women. Dresses were significantly different from the kimono and were a challenge for Japanese women to get used to. That is when dresses were created using kimono fabric for Japanese women to combine the new aesthetic with tradition. Take this is opportunity to wear a piece of history right in the busy city of Tokyo. Bring back beautiful photos in a modernized kimono bustle dress as a memorable souvenir of Japan.

title: Budget Mt. Fuji Scenic Sights and Gotemba Outlet Bus Tour from Tokyo
description:
See the best spots around Mt. Fuji for only 6,180 JPY on this budget-friendly trip! Visit the colorful Asama Shrine, enjoy lunch by Lake Kawaguchi, soak up Mt. Fuji views and shop at Gotemba Outlets.
Take advantage of this budget option for a trip to take in the views of Mt. Fuji from Lake Kawaguchi, take beautiful pictures at the Asama Shrine and shop for brand-name bargains at Gotemba Outlets. See all of the best spots in the area for an affordable price that is great for solo travelers. Please note that a Chinese-speaking tour conductor will assist you on the journey, but non-Chinese speaking guests are welcome to join!

title: 1-Day Private Custom Charter Tour of Tokyo (English/French/Chinese Guide)
description: Customize your own trip with your friendly guide and explore your must-see sights in Tokyo. With space for up to 9 guests, we can help you create your dream tour of Japan's capital.

title: Crystal Decoration Workshop in Tokyo
description: Create a personalized accessory using high quality crystals. Take your creation home with you after the workshop as a memorable souvenir from Tokyo. English assistance available.

title: Private Guided Tour of Mt. Fuji's Best Sights With Luxury Transport From Tokyo
description:
Take a tour in a private luxury car from any hotel or station in Tokyo's 23 special wards. See sights near Lake Kawaguchi: Mt. Fuji, the Fuji no Jukai forest and wind cave, an art museum, and park!
Avoid any traffic or transportation confusion with this private tour! You can be picked up right from your hotel or any preferred station in the 23 special wards of Tokyo. From there, your guide will show you some of the amazing sights in the Lake Kawaguchi area! You have the option to view Mt. Fuji, the Fuji no Jukai forest and wind cave, Kubota Ichiku Art Museum and so much more! Enjoy this tour by yourself or with up to 5 or 6 people depending on the van. Once it's finished you will be dropped off at your hotel or station.

title: Japanese Samurai Armor Dressing and Photo Experience in Tokyo
description: Don the armor of a Japanese samurai and feel like a brave warrior right in front of the camera! Strike a pose with a sword for selfies of your awesome look to show your friends.

title: Private Round-Trip Transfer Service to Disneyland or Disney Sea from Tokyo
description:
Enjoy a fun filled day at Tokyo Disneyland or Disney Sea with your friends and family on this private transfer service. An English-speaking guide will escort you from your hotel to the Magic Kingdom!
Spend a magical day out with your favorite characters in the world of Disney, right from Tokyo. Get picked up right from your hotel and have your English, French or Chinese-speaking guide take you to the happiest place on earth! Check out the latest Disney attractions you can only find here in Japan! Don't want to wait in line for tickets? You can book them in advance!

title: Matcha Green Tea Making Experience at a Japanese-Style Cafe in Asakusa
description:
Learn how to make your own perfect cup of Japanese tea using high-end matcha　green tea with an English-speaking instructor. Enjoy the tea with some Japanese sweets in a cute cafe in Asakusa.
A perfect short break from sightseeing in the famous Asakusa area of Tokyo, you can learn the basics of the tea ceremony then enjoy your tea with some yummy sweets.

title: One-Day Charter Excursion by Private Car to Nikko from Tokyo
description: Conveniently make your way out of the busy city of Tokyo to slip back in time to visit the famous Nikko Toshogu Shrine and Edo Wonderland Theme Park with an English-speaking driver.

title: Half Day Stylish Oiran, Geisha or Maiko Style Dress and Photo Shoot in Asakusa
description: Discover a new side of yourself with a professional transformation into a dazzling oiran or elegant geisha. Stylish samurai styles for men available too.

title: Sushi Making and Tempura Cooking Lesson in Tokyo
description:
Learn how to make two of Japan's most famous dishes- tempura and sushi! After cooking up a storm, sit down to a lunch of the delicacies you created.
During this hands-on program guests will learn how to make several kinds of sushi. Impress your friends with your sushi making skills – the perfect Japanese souvenir! We offer ingredients besides raw fish, such as meats or vegetables, so that anyone can enjoy this experience. 

Our instructors will also teach you how to fry the perfect tempura, keeping the fresh ingredients crispy and light!

Once all the dishes are complete, enjoy sampling the fruits of your labor.

title: Seasonal Tour: Kyoto Cherry Blossom Viewing Tour by Bus
description:
Book this cherry blossom viewing tour by shared bus in Kyoto and visit some of the most popular cherry blossom viewing spots in Kyoto that are not easily accessible. Enjoy delicious Japanese cuisine.Cherry blossom Viewing (Ohanami) is a big annual event during spring for Japanese people.
Japanese people love cherry blossoms not only because they are beautiful but also because of its ephemeral nature, they only bloom for a very short period.

Because during this season they are many people who would go out for cherry-blossom viewing all the famous areas are very crowded. Due to this it is very difficult to find a place to go. 

Come and join this bus tour and be prepared to feel the beauty of spring in Japan!
A tour assistant will take you to all the famous cherry blossom places in Kyoto.
By going around by bus you have the advantage of being able to efficiently go around the cherry blossoms viewing spots. It is a casual plan with no need to get on a crowded train during the cherry-blossom season. 

◆Spots to visit
-Kitano Tenmangu Shrine
An important shrine that is dedicated to Sugawara Michizane, a scholar and politician who was unfairly exiled. It is said that after his exile his spirit cause number of disaster, to appease him many shrines were built. At this area there is a one and only kind of cherry blossom that blooms here. This old cherry blossom tree is said to be 120 years old, and its the only sakura in the world that turns white to pink. 

-Haradani-en 
Haradani-en is a privately owned garden covering 13,000 square meters with a variety of cherry trees, this spot is also a great place to view cherry blossoms because not many people goes to this area. 
Located at a steep hill above Kinkakuji Temple, however with the bus you can sit and relax while going up this hill.

title: Day Trip To Yamanashi Prefecture Including Wine and Fruit Tasting from Tokyo
description:
Enjoy this day trip from Tokyo and explore a 600-year-old Erin-ji Temple, pick and eat as much as you like fresh strawberries, taste local wines, view beautiful cherry blossoms as well as famous Kawaguchi lake, and much more.Once you are picked up at the meeting point, you will head to Koshu at Yamanashi prefecture, by a coach. Koshu is famed by its wine production, so you will first visit a Katsunuma winery, where you can also taste and purchase some wines for approx. 30 minutes. 

You will then continue to Enzan, where you can pick and eat as much as you like fresh strawberries for 30 minutes at a fruit farm, before heading to 600-year-old Erin-ji Temple to feel its history and atmosphere, and view cherry blossoms. Relish "Fuji Sakura pork Shabu-Shabu" (Japanese-style dish) and "Hoto Hotpot" (Koshu's local hotpot with noodles and vegetables) for lunch at the restaurant located in front of the temple. You will have around 80 minutes for lunch and sightseeing.

After lunch, you will continue to the small town of Misaka, famous for its grapes and peaches. You can enjoy beautiful peach blossom and field mustard there for around half an hour. 

Lastly you will continue to Kawaguchi Lake, the second biggest of "Fuji Five Lakes". This place will offer you majestic views of cherry blossom with the magnificent Mt Fuji. Spend about 60 minutes taking lots of memorable photos while enjoying the freshest air in the suburban area of Japan before heading back to Tokyo.

title: Day Trip to Tanbara Snowland Including Lunch and Trip to Strawberry Farm from Tokyo
description:
Enjoy this day trip from Tokyo and go first to play in the snow at the ski park "Tanbara Snowland" using a sledge, scoop, etc., enjoy a delicious crab lunch afterwards and end your tour with picking delicious strawberry on a farm in Gunma Prefecture. 

Please note: This tour is seasonal and runs yearly between December and April. The date is subject to change.Once you meet your tour conductor at a designated meeting point, you will get on a coach and head to the snow field in Gunma Prefecture, where you can enjoy snow-related activities, feast on a lunch of fresh crabs and so on. 

Once you reach the ski park Tanbara, you can channel your inner child and try the snow-related activities available - you can rent a bob sleigh with no extra charge, or just engage in a snowball fight. Please prepare thick winter clothes and gloves in advance, as rental service is not available. 

You will then stop by at a restaurant to enjoy a buffet lunch of seasonal ingredients, such as crabs or deep-water shrimps etc.

After lunch, you will go to a local Farm Harada where you can pick-your-own strawberries (for approx. 30 minutes), before heading back to Tokyo. On the way back, while riding the bus your tour conductor will be entertaining you with a game where you can win a Japanese snack, souvenir or other prizes.

title: Cherry Blossom Viewing and Tokyo Tower Tour
description:
Enjoy a full-day sightseeing tour of Tokyos most popular sites for viewing cherry blossoms, including  Shinjuku Gyoen and Showa Memorial Park. Your expert guide shows you the most dazzling displays of blossoms along with the iconic landmark, Tokyo Tower. Get great photo ops and learn about the Japanese tradition of hanami (cherry blossom viewing) throughout the day. Plus, for lunch, enjoy a delicious Japanese-style meal.

Please note: This tour is seasonal and runs annually in March and April. The dates are subject to change.
Meet your guide at the Keio Plaza Hotel in the morning and board a comfortable coach, driving through a cherry treelined boulevard in Kunitachi en route to your first stop: Showa Memorial Park (officially, Showa Commemorative National Government Park). On arrival, stroll for 1.5 hours with your guide through a grassy area featuring 200 cherry trees in bloom, and visit the Japanese garden and bonsai garden.

Take a break from sightseeing to enjoy a Japanese-style lunch in Western Tokyo, known as the Tama area. 

Then re-board your coach, and head to the Tokyo Tower Main Observatory to take in panoramic city views from the nearly 500-foot-tall (150-meter) tower. On a clear day, you can even see Mt. Fuji in the distance. 

This tour takes you to Shinjuku Gyoen. Your guide accompanies you to Shinjuku Gyoen, a large park that was originally laid out in 1772 as part of the residence of a feudal lord. The current configuration of the gardens was completed in 1906 for the Imperial Palace and rebuilt after the destruction of World War II. The garden features more than 1,000 cherry trees of 65 different varieties and is a favorite spot for hanami. 

After roughly an hour, say farewell to your guide at Tokyo or Asakusa Station and make your own way to your next destination.

title: Tokyo Robot Restaurant Cabaret Show Ticket
description:
Book the ticket now for the one-of-the-kind Robot Restaurant Cabaret Show in Tokyo featuring special discount! This product is featuring the matinee show starting at 4pm, which is perfect for travelers who have nothing planned for the afternoon or families with young children. You also have the options to book later show time starting at 5:55pm, 7:50pm and 9:45pm. Prepare to have your mind blown by an out-of-this-world spectacle of robotic monsters, neon-clad dancers and high energy music for 90 minutes. The Robot Restaurant is located in the center area of Shinjuku, where you can easily stroll around or do some shopping before and after the show!Arrive 40 minutes early at Robot Restaurant before showtime and, after check-in at the ticket counter, head to a lounge area where you can grab drinks or food at your own expense while enjoying live music before the show starts.
Sit back in your seat and be amazed by the flashy neon lights, dancing girls in colorful outfits, giant robots, and other oddities like a robot monster and dinosaurs. The show is accompanied by traditional Japanese "Taiko" drums and techno music  a crazy fun-filled spectacle not to be missed! 

Food and drinks are also available for purchase at intermission. The food options are sushi bento and BBQ bento, and drinks include draft beer, canned beer, sake, alcoholic coolers, mineral water, and various soft drinks.
Special Offer - Price displayed includes up to 25% off the local admission price! Enjoy a 25% discount valid only for the 4pm show time (Matinee Ticket), and an 18% discount on all other show times!
 
 - Book Now!

title: Aoyama Gyusai - Tokyo Teppanyaki Restaurant
description: Enter Aoyama Gyusai, Tokyo’s stylish Teppanyaki restaurant. Indulge in premium Japanese beef while enjoying the cool atmosphere.

title: [KKday Only]Peak Season．A Class 5-Seater Car Rental in Okinawa
description: KKday aims to provide you with the best Rent-a-Car service! It is highly recommended if you're planning to have a laid-back and relax Okinawa trip with your friends, family or other half!

title: 【人氣燒肉】大阪難波燒肉・鹽燒肉與甘辛鍋之店 Zerohachi
description: 位於大阪難波的人氣燒肉餐廳，每份套餐贈飲品⼀杯，通過KKday預訂才能享受到的福利哦！

title: Scuba Refresher Course at Okinawa's Kerama Islands
description: You love diving but haven't been in the water for a while? No worries! Explore the Kerama Islands while taking this refresher course.

title: Tokyo MariCar Go-Karting Tour: Mt. Fuji, Lake Kawaguchiko
description: Venture out on a go-karting tour of Lake Kawaguchiko and Mt. Fuji. Experience Mario Kart in real life as you cruise along, admiring views of Mt. Fuji, dressed as your favorite character.

title: 【東京賞櫻巴士一日遊】箱根海賊船・小田原賞櫻・草莓吃到飽
description: 春暖花開，櫻花的季節又到了。從東京出發，到小田原賞櫻，再到箱根乘坐海賊船，前往果園享用當季的香甜草莓，還有菜色豐富的自助式午餐，精彩的賞櫻巴士一日遊行程必定令您樂而忘返！

title: [KKday Only] Off-Peak Season．WA Class 8-Seater Car Rental in Okinawa
description: KKday aims to provide you with the best Rent-a-Car service! It is highly recommended if you're planning to have a laid-back and relax Okinawa trip with your friends, family or other half!

title: 《One way Pick up service in Okinawa》High quality pick up service from local driver for 9 passengers.
description: No need to be afraid of getting lost in the airport when you arrived Okinawa. We provide local the driver to bring you home or the appointed hotel.

title: 《日產》九州 NISSAN 租車・RV1休旅5人座
description: NISSAN日產租車線上預約！KKday為您提供最優質的租車服務。安心・舒適・整潔。不管是朋友、情侶還是家族旅遊都適合。行程不受限，盡情暢遊福岡、熊本、長崎等九州地區！

title: 【京都賞櫻半日遊】二条城東寺夜間點燈・高級京都大飯店享用晚餐
description: 櫻花季3/23 - 4/8限定行程。京都站出發，在二条城和東寺欣賞夜間點燈，快速入場，無需排隊，輕鬆欣賞燈光下如夢如幻的櫻花美景。本行程還包含在高級飯店東急京都大飯店的晚餐。享受美景與美食，不辜負美好京都時光！

title: 【美食評論推薦】專家首推手打蕎麥麵！東京 武蔵小山KURATA
description: 美食評論2017年大推的東京餐廳！位於東京都不動前/武藏小山的居酒屋餐廳，快來品嘗道地的日本料理與手打蕎麥麵！部分套餐贈飲品⼀杯，通過KKday預訂才能享受到的福利哦。

title: Day Tour From Kyoto: Arashiyama, Kinkaku-ji, and Fushimi Inari Shrine
description: Discover Kyoto’s stunning temples. Visit rural Arashiyama and walk through the bamboo forest. Take in Kinkaku-ji, the Golden Pavilion. View the Shinto gates at Fushimi Inari Shrine.

title: 【懷石料理】安靜的奢華・和食Tamasaka銀座
description:
和食・個室 たまさか 銀座是隱藏在銀座街道中的低調奢華懷石料理餐廳！
每份套餐贈送飲品一杯，通過KKday預訂才能享受到的福利哦。

title: 【姬路老店】傳統日式料理宴席・割烹森富
description: 每份套餐贈送飲品一杯，通過KKday預訂才能享受到的福利哦。

title: Okinawa 125cc Honda Motorcycle Rental
description: Discover the beauty of Naha and Okinawa with the freedom granted by your very own 125cc Honda Dio 110 motorcycle.

title: 【日式料理】三五好友聚會最適用！東京六本木 宴席料理御曹司 Kiyoyasu邸
description:
位於東京都六本木的宴席料理餐廳。
每份套餐贈飲品一杯，通過KKday預訂才能享受到的福利哦。

title: Handmade Pottery Experience in Sendai
description: Make your own ceramic vessel using a hand-turned potter's wheel. Learn how to mold the clay and watch as it transforms into your own pottery art.

title: Full Day Private Chartered Eco Tour of Miyakojima Island
description:
Discover historical ruins, caves, mangrove forests, and treasure troves of biodiversity along with coral reefs during a customized private tour.
Perfect for families or groups travelling together, this tour lets you discover Miyakojima Island from a new perspective. Learn all about the delicate nature of the region, and how you can help preserve the sights for future generations too.

title: Private Taxi Sightseeing Tour to Sarobetsu Flower Garden
description: Ride on a comfortable taxi to a beautiful flower garden where buds begin to sprout in spring, various flowers bloom in summer and leaves turn in the autumn.

title: Relaxing Half Day Takachiho Area Private Sightseeing Taxi Tour
description: See all the famous spots of stunning Takachiho with an experienced driver who is familier with the area. Comfort and stunning sights are just a click away.

title: Private Taxi Tour of Soya the Northernmost City of Japan
description: Cruise around on a comfortable taxi and tour around the northern most tip of Japan. Select from three courses to discover the highlights of the north.

title: Half Day Shirakami Trekking Tour to the Anmon Waterfalls and Charity Donation
description: We donate 3.11% of your participation fee to the earthquake recovery funds, making this a socially responsible and eco-friendly trekking tour to the towering Anmon Waterfalls.

title: Tsushima Island Sea Kayaking Tour from March to November
description: Enjoy a day of adventure of the clear seas of Tsushima Island as you check out the amazing sights by kayak! The tour includes a tea break on an uninhabited island, the perfect spot to recharge.

title: Ceramics Making Experience in a Historical Pottery in Aizu
description:
Enjoy trying hand-forming pottery at Suigetsugama, established in  1873 in Aizu.
Beginners and children are welcome, we look forward to sharing our love of pottery!

title: Overnight at the Historical Fukuzumiro Ryokan in Hakone (River-Facing Rooms)
description:
Experience true Japanese hospitality at this historical inn in beautiful Hakone. Enjoy the views from the river-facing rooms, and savor an elegant dinner!
The Fukuzumiro Ryokan has been in operation since 1890, right in the heart of the Tonozawa hot springs area in Hakone. With only 17 rooms, each decorated differently, this historical hot springs resort has been a favorite of Japanese writers and artistes for over 125 years!

The sound of the river, surrounding greenery and bamboo-enlivened architecture make this a unique gem, perfect for a truly relaxing ryokan experience.

Guests can relax in public hot spring baths, or enjoy one for private use. After soaking, tuck into a delicious Japanese meal featuring local specialties!

title: Kobe Tombodama (Lampwork Glass) Museum Entrance Ticket
description: See the intricate lampwork beads at this unique museum, where you will be surprised by these miniature works of art! From exhibits to hands-on experiences and shopping, stop by while visiting Kobe!

title: Two Day Hiroshima and Kurashiki Tour from Osaka
description:
Set out from Osaka on a tour around the hidden gems of Hiroshima, Miyajima and Kurashiki before returning to the bustling city center of Osaka.
Set out from the hub of Western Japan, Osaka, as you journey to visit the World Heritage Sites Miyajima, Itsukushimajinja Shrine, Hiroshima, and the Atomic Bomb Dome on the first day of your tour. Then, on the second day, stop at the popular Kurashiki and Okayama Korakuen, one of the three most beautiful gardens in Japan, a sterling example of the precepts of Japanese garden design.
Finish your tour back in Osaka, ready to explore the big city!

title: One Day Hiroshima and Miyajima Tour from Kyoto (Return Train to Osaka)
description:
Tour the World Heritage Sites of Itsukushima Shrine in Miyajima and Hiroshima's Atomic Bomb Dome on this leisurely yet educational tour with convenient transportation between Kyoto and Osaka.
Set out from historic Kyoto and get into the history and nature of Hiroshima on a one day tour that includes the UNESCO World Heritage Site of the Atomic Bomb Dome. Head out from the city and look forward to seeing wild deer in the untouched abundant nature of Miyajima. Then, finish your tour in Osaka, Western Japan's bustling hub. Departing from Kyoto and ending in Osaka, this is the perfect tour for visitors trying to fit in multiple cities in one day!

Cherry blossoms blooming season: End of March to the beginning of April

title: One Day Tour to Kyoto from Nagoya by Bullet Train
description:
This day tour includes round-trip tickets from Nagoya to Kyoto and sightseeing in the ancient capital. There will be free time to explore independently too!
Enjoy sightseeing at Kyoto's essential spots, including Nijo Castle, elegant Kinkakuji and the Imperial Palace.

title: Half Day Canyoning Nature Adventure in Hida (English or French Guided)
description: Climb up the river to the untouched waters as you follow your guide on a wet and wild adventure. Different routes for all ages with an English or French-speaking guide are waiting for you to try.

title: Charter Taxi for a Customized Sightseeing or Business Trip in Obihiro
description: Personalize your sightseeing tour in Obihiro according to your preference, or make use of a taxi to go around places for business according to your schedule.

title: Private Taxi Sightseeing Tour of Tokachi and Horseback Riding Experience
description: Enjoy the refreshing breeze of Hokkaido while visiting the wildlife of Tokachi. Stop by beautiful lakes and play with horses at the park while on a taxi.

title: Guided Mt. Tokachi Summer Climbing Tour
description: Climb Mt. Furano or Tokachi on a full day guided expedition. Each trail offers a variety of wonderful sights, including alpine wildflowers.

title: All Year Exciting Bridge Bungy Jump in Itsukimura
description: Liven up Kyushu with the only bridge bungy jump in the region. No tiny hop this, but a full speed thrill ride with a huge dose of excitement!

title: Charter Taxi Tour to Popular Spots of Otaru from Sapporo
description: Take a step out of Sapporo for a slightly extended trip out to the historical city of Otaru on a comfortable taxi. Stop by the canal, music box hall, Kitaichi glass and many more.

title: One Day Tokaido Fuji Tour from Tokyo via Bullet Train
description: See a different side of Mt. Fuji with dramatic views over tea plantations, a visit to a post town along the Tokaido Road, ukiyo-e woodblock print art, and a sushi lunch of freshly-caught seafood!

title: Full Day Shower Climbing in Shizuoka with Lunch
description: Challenge yourself to adventurous tour as you spend a day jumping into waterfalls and shower climbing. Enjoy an exciting activity and a fun day outdoors.

title: Night Safari Wildlife Watching Excursion in Shiretoko
description:
See the fluffy red foxes and cute Ezo deer that live in Shiretoko National Park! Gaze at the stars, and get back in touch with nature on this unique tour.
See the nocturnal creatures of Shiretoko on this fun night safari, such as Ezo deer, red foxes and more! Appropriate for guests of all ages, see a different side of this untouched National Park.

title: Balinese-Style Relaxing Facial Treatment Spa Menu in Hakodate
description: While in Hakodate enjoy a relaxing spa program of your choice, a perfect treat for skin in Hokkaido's snowy winters or as a short break during summer sightseeing.

title: Full-Day Custom Luxury Wedding Photo Shooting Plan in Karuizawa
description: Bring your very own dress and coordinate an unforgettable, original photo shoot in various locations of Karuizawa. Take home an album full of memories with you and your loved one.

title: Private Three Hour Taxi Tour of Motochika Chousokabe's History
description: Motochika Chousokabe was the supreme ruler of Shikoku from the Sengoku period to Aduchimomoyama period. Learn about this powerful ruler on a chartered tour.

title: Private Charter Taxi Tour to Lake Toya and Lake Shikotsu from Sapporo
description: Depart from Sapporo and see the best sights of Lake Shikotsu and Toya on this private charter tour. Great for small groups and visitors with limited time, customize your own itinerary!

title: Half or Full Day Mountain Downhill Experience in Hakuba
description: Ride with an instructor and feel the thrill of bouncing over dirt and trails as you improve your riding and enjoy the rush of a downhill free ride surrounded by the beautiful mountain views.

title: Tenryu River Whitewater Rafting Full Day Adventure Course with Lunch
description: Tame the dragon! The Tenryu River is 213 kilometers long and nicknamed the violent dragon, featuring all-season rafting full of thrills.

title: Bus Tour to Niseko and Shinsennuma Marsh from Sapporo
description: Depart from Sapporo on a comfortable bus out to the nature filled Niseko and Shinsenuma Marsh for a spectacular seasonal view of Hokkaido.

title: Rafting Excursion near Mt. Yotei
description: Enjoy a leisurely and relaxing rafting tour on a tranquil pond that is perfect for the whole family. From babies to grandparents, everyone can join.

title: Lake Toya, Shikotsu and Noboribetsu Hell Valley Bus Tour
description:
Visit the best nature Hokkaido has to offer, such as the Lake Toya Geopark, crystal clear lake Shikotsu and the Noboribetsu Hell Valley.
Designated as a Geopark due to its rare landforms and geological formations, Toyako (Lake Toya) has four caldera's in the middle of it, a highly unusual sight.

The Noboribetsu Hell Valley is named because of the heavy volcanic activity, such as hot steam vents and sulfurous streams. As the walking trails in the hills may not be accessible in winter, take the opportunity in summer to explore the valley. Next is Lake Shikotsu, the second deepest lake in Japan, famous for its crystal clarity. 

Visit Hokkaido's summer attractions on this one-day tour with English and Chinese audio guidance!

title: Hell Valley Night Walk Adventure on the Fox-fire Road in Noboribetsu
description: Take a walk along the Fox-fire Road in Jigokudani. Feel the steam blowing in the dark as you walk the mysterious path. You may even spot local wildlife!

title: Extreme 30 Meter Bridge Bungy Jump in Shigisan
description:
Mix some modern excitement into a trip to historic Nara with a bungy jump from the 30 meter bridge of Kaiun. Dive into a good time among over the waters and among the forest!
Welcome to "Good Luck Bridge", where you can make your own with a heart pounding, excitement fueled bungy adventure! Professional and highly trained staff ensure your safety, and the beautiful scenery makes sure your eyes have plenty to see. Relax after the jump, and check out the pictures taken on site.

title: Thrilling Zip Line Forest Adventure in Minakami
description: Cut through the trees and soar like a bird as you zip line through the forest of Minakami. Enjoy the thrill and feel the wind against you in the 1.2 km course.

title: Thrilling Bridge Bungy Jump in Minakami
description: Soar through the air above the Tonegawa River, with the tall peaks of the Tanigawa Mountain Range in the distance as you bungy from a 42 meter high platform for the ultimate in excitement.

title: Lake Nojiri Canoe Adventure for Paddlers of All Levels in Nagano
description: Explore the vast lake and the surrounding natural scenery of Nagano on a canoe. First timers or advanced riders can cruise around with your friendly guide.

title: One Day Tour to Mt. Fuji by Bullet Train from Kyoto (Tour Ends in Tokyo)
description:
Experience a different side of Mt. Fuji in Shizuoka, with great views of the mountain over tea farms! Visit a post town along the Tokaido Road, enjoy fresh local sushi and ride on the bullet train!
Ideal for visitors without JR Rail Passes who wish to get from Kyoto to Tokyo, with the added bonus of visiting iconic Mt. Fuji on the way!

title: Snowshoe Tours in Daisetsu, Biei, Shirogane, or Tokachidake in Winter
description: Set out on beginner-friendly snowshoe tours through some of the best powder snow in Japan. Make the most of the winter by playing in the snow and enjoying nature.

title: Private Group Guided Montain Climbing Tour from Sounkyo Onsen
description:
Alpine flowers colorfully blooming all around plateau are must-see in Mt. Taisetsu in summer. Vast field of flowers is beath taking.
Please enjoy mountain climbing in the flower world, Mt. Taisetsu.

title: 2 Hour Chartered Sightseeting Taxi Tour of Otaru
description: Let us show you the best of Otaru with a 2 hour taxi tour. See the most famous locations or choose your own spots to visit, then leave the driving to us.

title: Full Day Canoe and Nature Trek Combination Tour in Kira-Kotan from Kushiro City
description: Explore Hokkaido from the water and on land with a full day tour that combines a 3 hour trek with a 2 hour canoe adventure along the scenic Kushiro River.

title: Escorted Private Airport Taxi Service from Osaka Hotels to Kansai Airport
description: English-speaking staff will meet you at your hotel in Osaka and escort you to Kansai Airport in a private taxi for a smooth and hassle free transfer.

title: Handmade Half Day Soba Noodle Cooking Lesson in Minakami
description: Use 100% local buckwheat flour and learn to prepare tasty soba noodles from scratch in a beginner friendly cooking lesson for all ages.

title: Half Day Rafting Adventure on the Tonegawa River in Minakami
description:
Enjoy the thrill of rafting down the rapids of the Tonegawa River in beautiful Minakami! Feel the rush of adrenaline on this wild ride, open to beginners.
Rebuilt greatly in 2008, visitors can enjoy the outdoors more comfortably.
Even if it rains you can spend time comfortably under the big roof under the terrace. Less waiting time for using the restroom because  there are nine of those now.  Spacious dressing room and coin lockers for security are available. There is a spacious locker room. After your tour, you can also use the warm water shower for free.

title: Yakushima Island Sightseeing Tour with English Guide and Lunch
description: Leave the cedars behind and tour the rest of the island, from waterfalls, an undersea hot spring, the Chinese banyan forest, an old lighthouse and other World Heritage sites.

title: Tumulus Viewing Helicopter or Cessna Flight from Yao
description: See ancient Japanese burial grounds (tumulus) from the sky, on your choice of a Cessna or helicopter. Get a fee for the history of this area, and enjoy great birds-eye views!

title: Airport Guide Service from Kyoto Hotels to Kansai Airport by Train
description: English-speaking staff will meet you at your hotel in Kyoto and escort you to a JR line train bound for Kansai Airport for a smooth and hassle free transfer.

title: Pacific Coast Line and Hidden Hokkaido Private Taxi Tour from Kushiro
description: Enjoy views of the Kushiro coast, see the Kiritappu Marsh and explore some of the area's lesser known gems on this private taxi tour from Kushiro.

title: Two Hour Kushiro Sightseeing Taxi to Hosooka
description:
From Kushiro Port, let us whisk you to see the marvels of Kushiro's wetlands on a short two hour private tour! Great for groups and visitors on cruises.
See the Kushiro River meandering through the marsh from the Hosooka Observatory!

title: Four Wheel Buggy Driving Adventure for Kids and Adults in Furano
description: Try driving a four-wheeled dune buggy and feel the wind. There are kid's courses as well as adult ones, so the whole family can join and have fun!

title: Be a Miko Priestess for a Day in Osaka
description:
Dress up in real miko priestess clothing and learn the manners and skills to work at a shrine directly from the Shinto priest. Things you learn include how to pray and offer sacred tree branches.
Learn about the skills and manners required of miko priestesses who work in Shinto shrines. The priest of the shrine will tell you about shrine etiquette and how to offer a prayer. Then, once you have changed into your miko clothing, learn from a real miko about how to walk, present offerings, and hand out shrine charms like a real priestess. Once you have mastered these skills, offer a prayer to the shrine gods using sacred tree branches.

title: Half Day Jozankei Cycling Tour with Transfers from Sapporo
description:
This tour includes cycling, Hokkaido's natural hot springs and a curry lunch! Enjoy exploring Jozankei and indulge in a soak at the Hoheikyo hot springs.
Hoheikyo Hot Spring is a popular onsen spot for locals. Now it's your chance to cycle through the amazing nature of Hokkaido and then soak in the relaxing onsen, to recharge for your return trip. Lunch will be curry, with naan freshly made on a ceramic kiln. 

This trip offers you a full experience of cycling, a delicious lunch, an indulgent soak in the onsen, and wonderful memories of the beautiful land of Hokkaido.

Estimated Distance: About 10 km (60 m above sea level)
Estimated Duration: About 1.5 hours
Estimated Time to and from Sapporo: About 1.5 hours

title: Short Private Taxi Tour of Popular Highlights of Sapporo
description: Take a two or three hour trip around the city of Sapporo and visit major tourist spots such as the Clock Tower, Hitsujigaoka Observatory, Mt. Okura and many more on a comfortable taxi.

title: Mt. Kamuishiri Trek and Flower Viewing Guided Tour
description: Mt. Kamuishiri is a striking figure in the Kabato mountains. Its sharp ridges hold flowers as the snow thaws. Wander through the beautiful fields with a guide.

title: 10 Kilometer Mountain Bike Cycling Forest Cycling Tour from Sapporo
description:
Cycle through Nopporo Shinrin, a rare virgin forest in Japan in the suburbs of Sapporo! Ride through the forest park on an authentic mountain course.
Distance: 10 km
Difference in altitude: 40 m
Duration of riding MTB: about 1.5 hours
Time of round trip from sapporo: 1.5 hours
Animals: fox

title: Beginner-Friendly Japanese Cooking Class with Kimono Rental in Osaka
description:
Discover the flavors of Japan as you get to know their culinary history. Cook like a local with basic lessons to making sushi, miso soup, and more with an experienced English-speaking chef.
Vegan, vegetarian and halal options are available, just select your needs at check-out!

title: Night Hike and Forest Adventure Trek from Sapporo
description: Walk in a dark forest with your guide, then try sitting in the dark without a flashlight. Let your hearing discover a new side of the forest in this unique trek!

title: Guided Mountain Bike Tour near Sapporo City with Pick-Up Service
description: Set off through the trails and paths near Sapporo on a full mountain bike tour with a professional guide. Leave the city behind and get back to nature!

title: Half Day Sea Kayaking and Mangrove Tour from Nakijin
description:
Discover the amazing mangrove forests of Okinawa while paddling through calm waters in a stable sea kayak. Both fun and educational, this is perfect for families.
This tour is operated only in Japanese.

title: Full Day Luxury Bridal and Wedding Photo Session in Okinawa
description: Capture your pre-wedding photo on the beautiful island of Okinawa. Bring your own dress and get dressed up for a collection of unforgettable pictures to show during your special day.

title: Mangrove Jungle Expedition on a Family Friendly Private Kayak from Onna
description: Great for families with children that want to enjoy a tour through a mangrove forest. Infants as young as one year old can join and safely explore.

title: Maiko Dress Up Photo Studio Plan in Kyoto
description:
Experience wearing the extravagant kimono of a Maiko with professional make-up and hair styling. Feel like a different person for a day in front of the camera.
