Receive 20 shots with different poses with four 2L-sized photos and 1 photo card.

title: Half Day Fly Boarding and Marine Sports Outdoor Adventures in Nago
description: Set out onto the tropical Okinawan sea and hover over the water on the hit new fly board. Keep the thrills going with a combo pack of exciting rides.

title: Maiko Dress-up and Photo Shoot Experience in Kyoto
description:
Spend a memorable moment with your child in a traditional Maiko outfit and make-up in a photo studio. Have a professional photographer take beautiful photos of her for you to take home.
Receive 20 shots with different poses with four 2L-sized photos and 1 photo card.

title: Airport Drop Off Service from Kyoto Hotels to Kansai Airport with Staff Escort
description: English-speaking staff will meet you at your hotel in Kyoto and escort you to the Airport Bus by taxi. Hop on the bus for a smooth ride to Kansai Airport.

title: Morning Bullet Train Ticket and Transfer Service from Tokyo to Kyoto
description:
This transportation package includes a bullet train ticket, baggage delivery service, and escort service by an English-speaking attendant from your hotel to the station.
First time in Japan? Let us make sure you get where you need to go with ease and no stress! This package will allow you to be picked up at your hotel by an English-speaking guide, taken to Tokyo Station and led to your bullet train to Kyoto. At Kyoto Station, you will then be whisked off to your hotel. No need to worry about luggage, as it will be sent ahead!

title: Full-Day Private Mt. Fuji and Lake Kawaguchi Tour from Tokyo
description:
Explore the history and the culture of Mt. Fuji, with stops at Sengen Shrine, Oshino Hakkai and a relaxing hot spring. Your English and French-speaking guide will make sure you don't miss a thing!
Discover the history and culture of Mt. Fuji from a cultural perspective in a private tour visiting the pilgrimage spots around the beautiful mountain. 
You and your group will be whisked to Mt. Fuji in a private mini-van, which will provide pick ups and drop offs directly at your hotel. A Japanese, English, French speaking multilingual guide will be on board to assist you along the way, along with free wifi. A Chinese-speaking guide is also available upon request.

title: Private Custom Tour with an English-Speaking Guide in Tokyo
description:
Get around the city with ease with a private English-speaking guide who can tailor the tour to your interests! See the exact sights you want and learn about Tokyo on your own custom tour.
Get around the language barrier and tour around Tokyo with your own private English-speaking guide. Visit places only locals know or let your guide create the perfect day for you and your group!

title: Full Day Tour of Tokyo's Top Sights with River Cruise & Optional Skytree Tickets
description:
Spend a day visiting all the iconic landmarks of Tokyo, such as Asakusa, Tokyo Skytree, Imperial Palace East Garden and more! Discover the traditional and modern side of the city on a comfortable bus.
A perfect introductory tour to Japan's capital of Tokyo! See the brilliant red Sensoji Temple in Asakusa, shop for tasty treats at the foot of huge Tokyo Skytree and stroll around the Imperial Palace's East Gardens. Take a cruise along the Sumida River for a view of the city from the water. With free wifi, multilingual audio guides and 2 different drop-off points, this tour lets you make the most of your time in Tokyo.

title: Vegetarian and Halal Friendly Kaiseki Cuisine Dining Courses in Tokyo
description:
Learn about and taste fabulous Kaiseki cuisine in English. Both vegetarian and halal friendly menus are available, for a rare chance to savor these dishes for everyone!
Chef Yuki Tanaka trained at Kikunoi, a restaurant granted three Michelin stars, and has traveled around the world. Now, he works to spread the joy of wonderful Japanese cuisine and culture in English!

title: Tsukiji Fish Market Tour and Sushi Making Lesson in English or French
description: Enjoy a guided tour around the busy fish market in Tsukiji. After going through the many shops, learn how to make delicious sushi with an experienced sushi chef.

title: Handmade Ceramic Gift Making Class in Central Tokyo
description: Make a one-of-a-kind gift for someone special in your life during this fun pottery class! The instructors will make sure you know all the tips and tricks of the trade.

title: Japanese Plastic Food Sample Art Experience in Tokyo
description:
Cook up some tasty looking food samples, the perfect thing to do in Tokyo! Try your hand at creating your own plastic food art for a unique bit of local culture. From sweets to sushi, take your pick.
You can find plastic food in the display windows at Japanese restaurants, perfect for showing off what the dishes actually look like. Now, you can make your very own fake food in this family friendly tour in Tokyo. A big hit with all ages, choose your favorite treat from dainty fruit tarts to bowls of ramen and join a professional teacher as you shape, decorate, and create! These faux foods make a neat souvenir and are realistic enough to trick friends and family. Artistic skills are not required, and children are welcome!

title: Yukata Experience at Tokyo TJT Studio
description:
Learn how to properly wear a yukata (light cotton kimono) and obi sash, then take pictures in a tearoom or garden in this colorful outfit!
This unique activity allows guests to select and wear a colorful yukata (a light cotton kimono) with an obi sash. Assisted by the instructor, you will learn how to dress yourselves in a yukata. Less complex and lighter than normal kimono, in the summer you will often see people walking around the city in this traditional Japanese garb.

Then we will help you take photos in our Japanese-style rooms or in the garden, for a lovely memento of your visit to Japan.

title: Kimono Dressing Experience in Tokyo
description:
If you have ever wanted to try a silk kimono, this in your chance. Our professional dressers will assist you, and then you can take pictures in full dress!
Besides the chance to wear a beautiful kimono, this activity will also allow you to learn about its origins and the traditional skills of Japanese dyeing and weaving. Kimono are wonderfully versatile, even if one's shape changes, the same kimono can be worn with just some minor adjustments.

After putting on the various layers and fastening the broad obi sash, you will have plenty of time to learn how to move gracefully in the kimono. Take as many pictures as you like, for a memento of your visit to Japan.

title: MANGEKYO Taiko Drum Show Ticket in Tokyo
description: Experience the new taiko drum entertainment show MANGEKYO, performed by drum group DRUM TAO. The compact venue allows the audience to fully experience the power of this renowned group's performance.

title: Manga School Half Day Course in Tokyo
description:
Join this 3-hour intensive course designed to teach you the basics of drawing manga. From story planning to inking, renowned artist Mr. Toshio Maeda will help you turn your visions into reality. 
In this three-hour beginner course, learn about the basics of manga-making from Mr. Toshio Maeda himself, a popular manga artist whose works saturated the 80s and 90s. If you're a manga enthusiast, this is the perfect course for you to learn about the fundamentals of making manga as well as try your hand at making one.

title: Kimono Dressing and Rickshaw Ride in Traditional Asakusa
description: Choose your favorite style from among 30 types of kimono and yukata, and enjoy exploring the retro streets and  sightseeing by rickshaw in Tokyo's traditional area, Asakusa!

title: Hiking Tour of the Hira Mountains with Onsen Experience near Kyoto
description:
Discover rugged nature a short train ride from Kyoto, by the west side of Lake Biwa in the gorgeous Hira mountain range. Select your hiking route and explore the wilderness with your friendly guides! 
Suitable for mountain lovers, we will take you through popular hiking routes, or even less known and more challenging ones upon request. Come discover new routes that are not found in guidebooks.

Hira is easily accessible from Kyoto, Osaka and Kobe. Join your guide at a convenient meeting spot, then hit the trails!

Available Courses

1. The Bunage Mountains ~ Yatsubuchi Valleys 
2. Horai Mountains 
3. Jatanigamine Mountains ~ Omoide Forests
4. Douman Mountains ~ Toryo Mountains
5. Shakadake Mountains ~ Kanakusotoge
6. Little Hira Mountains
7. Others available on request

title: Meet, Touch and Photograph Cute Owls at an Owl Cafe' in Kyoto
description:
Our store concept is "a place to connect with owls". Just a short walk from Shijo Karasuma Station in central Kyoto, you can meet many different types of owls and take pictures with them!
Limited bookings now available! In response to everyone's demand, you can now book your spot here online! (10 of the 20 spots per hour are available.)

title: Private Taxi Transfer from Kansai Airport to Kyoto Hotels with Staff Assistance
description: Perfect for small groups and business travelers, a staff member will take you from Kansai Airport to your hotel in Kyoto. Let us take the stress out of traveling!

title: Guided Island Adventure Tour on Yonaguni
description: Yonaguni Island is full of scenic overlooks, underwater ruins, white seashores with coral, steep cliffs, and other natural wonders. Join your guide and explore!

title: Full Day Shikoku Pilgrimage Taxi Tour from Kannonji or Motoyama
description:
Make your way along a section of the eighty eight sacred temple pilgrimage route by taxi, and cover extra ground. Stop for a prayer at each temple on the way.
It takes about 8 days to visit all eighty eight temples. In this tour, we will take you to some of them by taxi. It is really time effective with reasonable price.
The driver will even help by attending to the "Nokyuodori" (visit certificate and stamp) while you say a prayer at each temple.

title: Half or Full Day Guided Mountain Stream Fishing tour in Oirase
description: Oirase Stream is said to be the most beautiful stream in Japan, and now it's your turn to set out with a guide and cast your line into the water. Enjoy a 2, 4, or 8 hours of fishing.

title: Best Sights of Kagoshima and Sakurajima Half Day Bus Tour
description:
See all the best sights of Kagoshima on this pleasant morning or afternoon bus tour, which includes a ferry ride over to the volcanic island of Sakurajima! 
Get great views of the volcano, visit the splendid Senganen Gardens, catch a glimpse of the Tsurumaru Castle and see the statue of Saigo Takamori. Lots of convenient pick up spots around the city make this a great way to make the most of your time in Kagoshima!

Tour time: 3 hours 55 minutes

title: Sightseeing and Fishing Boat on the Pacific Ocean from Nichinan
description: Experience fishing on boat with lure and feed and aim to land a big fish of 30 cm or over! All ages can join this tour, from children to grandparents.

title: Half Day Sandblasting Lesson to Make an Original Glass in Kotokuji
description: Stop in and join a family friendly activity sure to create great memories. Children can enjoy sandblasting their own glass and creating an original souvenir.

title: Full Day Private Charter Sightseeing Taxi in Yobuko and Karatsu
description: Indulge in magnificent views and the local cuisine of Karatsu and Yobuko, featuring fresh seafood. Let us introduce you to a delicious squid restaurant featured in a movie.

title: Rent-a-Car Service from Niigata Bullet Train Station or Airport
description: Explore the lovely country-side of Japan in a convenient car or minivan. Depart from the airport or bullet train station to ski resorts in the winter or head for fireworks in Nagaoka in the summer.

title: Underwater Glass Bottom Boat Cruise in the Seas of Amami Oshima Island
description: Cruise through the magnificent sea of Amami and witness the colorful tropical fish swimming through the coral garden. Stay dry while getting a special view on a comfortable boat.

title: Half Day Chartered Taxi Tour of Okinoshima World Heritage Sites from Munakata
description: Discover the World Heritage sites and history of Okinoshima with a private chartered taxi. Ride in style and comfort as you head all around.

title: Half Day Glass Working Lesson with Paired Glasses in Kotokuji
description: Drop in with a friend or special someone and make a set of glasses together. You  can even help each other create a wonderfully paired design.

title: 5 Hour Ceramic Tour in a Private Charter Sightseeing Taxi from Takeo
description: Learn about the 400 year history of Arita and Imari pottery on a private tour, and enjoy a blend of European and Japanese culture in a unique melting pot.

title: Personalized Full Day Guided Kayaking Course with Lunch in Hachinohe
description: Kayak for a whole day, enjoying the fun of gliding across the water, with a fully personalized course and included handmade lunch, to keep you paddling.

title: Retro Kimono, Hakama or Evening Gown Dressing and Rental in Hakodate
description:
Choose from more than 200 kinds of kimono, hakama or fancy dresses, then have fun exploring Hakodate's retro streets and taking pictures! Hair styling is included, and there are options for men too.
Swap your everyday clothes for a beautiful retro kimono, and have fun strolling through Hakodate in your finery. A great activity for groups and couples!

title: WiFi Router Rental with Easy Pick-up at Fukuoka Airport (2-Day to 30-Day Plans)
description:
Stay connected at all times during your trip to Japan with a portable wifi router you can pick up and drop off at Fukuoka Intl Airport. Choose from a range of plans, great for both work and vacations.
Get high speed, mobile broadband for your iPad, laptop and smartphone anytime and anywhere in Japan. The Pocket Wifi can quickly create group internet access and individual WiFi hotspots; connect wirelessly to many devices such as iPads, laptops, digital cameras, iPhones, Android phones and game devices to let you play games online, transfer pictures and keep in touch.

Visit the counter on the 1st floor next to the North Entrance. 
The counter is open from 7:30am - 9:30pm. For after-hours returns, please use the return box.

title: Half Day Adventure Trek to the Pumpkin Limestone Cave on Miyako Island
description: Explore the rare limestone cave called Pumpkin Hall, only accessible from the sea of Miyako Island. This amazing trek is sure to create wonderful memories for all.

title: Silver Accessory Making Experience with Silver Clay in Takamatsu
description: Great for beginners and even kids, use the neat silver clay to create a one-of-a-kind piece of jewelry! Once it was been fired, you can wear your 100% silver accessory with pride.

title: Lake Ashi and Jukkoku Mountain Path Chartered Full Day Taxi Tour from Hakone
description: Explore the vast Lake Ashi, Hakone Seiroku sky walk and the beautiful panoramic scenery from the Jukkoku mountain path on a leisurely full day chartered tour.

title: Sightseeing Historical Architecture of Shinai on a Private Taxi
description: Spend half a day visiting historical buildings such as the five-story pagoda at the Zenpo temple or former government offices and museums on a comfortable chartered taxi.

title: Beginner-Friendly Full Day Snorkeling Adventure in Kagoshima
description: Take your snorkel mask and fins to step into the world under the sea with your instructor. Discover the colorful underwater wildlife even if you don't know how to swim.

title: Half-Day Taxi Charter Tour of the Kirishima Area in Kagoshima
description: Tour around popular tourist areas of Kirishima. Visit shrines, hot springs and ancient ruins to unravel the history and the Japanese legends that live on in the city.

title: Taxi Tour of Locations from the Japanese Drama, "Atsuhime" in Kagoshima
description: Tour around location sites of the popular Japanese TV drama, "Atsuhime". Explore gardens and former residences of Shizamu Imaizumi families where the filming took place.

title: Rafting and Barbecue Combo Experience at Kuma River from Hitoyoshi
description: Cruise down the exciting currents Kuma river on a raft with your guide and team. After your adventure, enjoy a barbecue outdoors for a memorable day in the wild!

title: Explore Hiroshima and Miyajima by Bullet Train from Kyoto with English Guide
description:
Set out for Hiroshima as you visit some of the most sacred locations in Japan. Get to the heart of this country, both old and new, all with an English guide. Perfect for families staying in Kyoto!
Start this all-day tour with a shinkansen bullet train ride to Hiroshima. Once in the historic city, head a bit afield to the seemingly magical Itsukushima Shrine and its torii gate. Built on stilts, the shrine and gate both seem to float on the water, a fantasy brought to life at high tide. Back in Hiroshima proper, the Peace Memorial Park and A-Bomb Dome are reminders of the country's history, and a living prayer for peace and compassion throughout the world.

title: Hot Air Balloon Morning Flight Above Watase Resovoir in Tochigi
description: Enjoy a casual flight any time of the year, and check out the unique landscape over the Watase Resovoir. Experience the picture perfect scenery from above.

title: Private Charter Steam Locomotive and Temple History Tour from Tottori
description:
See another side of Tottori with the classic Steam Engine Locomotive of Wakatetsu and the temple hidden in a cliff, Fudoin Iwayado, a hidden treasure.
Fudoin Iwayado is a mountain ascetic temple, famous for being built within a cliff side cavern. The Acala in the main temple is one of Japan's 3 largest.

The Sanbyakudashi Residence is a farmhouse from the middle of the Edo era appointed as a cultural asset of Tottori. Said to be "a village of the Wakasa native culture" with Historical Museum and Japanese garden nearby. Enjoy the atmosphere of the old private house while observing inside the building.

Wakasajuku is the old castle town of Wakasa, with a clear stream that runs through quiet and pastoral scenery. Walk the streets and see classic storehouses and touch history.

title: Wind Surfing Lessons for All Levels in Wakayama
description: Feel the ocean breeze against you as you surf across the sea of Hamanomiya beach in Wakayama. Learn to windsurf or level up with experienced instructors.

title: Night-Time Tokachi River Ducky Raft Cruise Adventure in Obihiro
description: Paddle down the peaceful river in Obihiro on a ducky raft after sundown to spot some creatures of the night. Enjoy the seasonal scenery with your local guide along with some tasty sweets and tea.

title: Full Day Sea Kayak Tour to Kuroshima and an Uninhabited Island from Kii Yura
description: Kayak on the waves to an uninhabited island with intricate rocky shores and caves, hidden inlets, and natural features that look as if they were carved by man.

title: Private Five Hour Sightseeing Taxi in Chichibu
description: Recommended courses for hot spring and sake lovers or go local with temple visits and soba noodle making! Get to local spots with a special sightseeing taxi.

title: Private Five Hour Oboke and Iya Valley Sightseeing Taxi Charter Tour
description: See the hidden beauty of the Oboke and Iya Valleys with a private tour guided by a local driver and guide. Discover the Japan not in any guidebooks.

title: Private Omiya Bonsai Museum and Train Museum Tour from Tokyo
description:
Your guide will whisk you off to Omiya, to visit the artistic trees of the world's first public Bonsai Museum and the many trains of the Railway Museum. 
Take a half-day tour outside of Tokyo to Omiya, home to two fantastic museums. Your guide will first take you to the Omiya Bonsai Art Museum, where you can stroll among a forest of adorable tiny trees. These living works of art are one of Omiya's proudest achievements, and are beautiful in all seasons.

Next, explore the popular Railway Museum. Climb around the trains, from steam locomotives to early versions of the bullet train! Try the simulators, to feel like you are driving a train. Kids can ride mini-trains, and play in a train-themed playground.

title: Traditional Bamboo Toy Making Experience in Saga
description: Create Japanese handmade toys made out of bamboo, for a fun crafting activity for the whole family. Make stilts, flying 'bamboo-copters' and more!

title: Ninja Experience with Sword Fighting and Shuriken Throwing Lesson in Himeji
description: Join an actual ninja for a fun 90 minute experience in Himeji. Learn to throw shuriken and try chanbara sword fighting in a unique adventure.

title: 2-Day Hiroshima, Miyajima, and Kurashiki Tour from Kyoto
description:
This tour takes you around popular sightseeing spots in Hiroshima, Miyajima and Kurashiki for a combined tour of some of Japan's quieter spots.
Visit the World Heritage Sites Miyajima, Itsukushimajinja Shrine, Hiroshima, and the Atomic Bomb Dome on the first day. 
On the second day, the tour will visit the popular Kurashiki and Okayama Korakuen, one of the three most beautiful gardens in Japan.

title: Private Charter Taxi Tour of Iya Valley and Oboke Valley
description:
See the best sights in Oboke and the Iya Valley by sightseeing taxi. Enjoy the beautiful natural scenery of this remote area of Shikoku. 
The basic charter and price is for 2 hours, but you can choose to create a longer course by selecting additional 30 minute time slots for an additional fare.

title: Sunset Sea Kayaking Excursion in Naruto
description: Paddle into the sunset in Tokushima! The waves are calm in Uchinoumi and Konaruto Kaikyo Channel around sunset, so you can enjoy a relaxed tour on the water.

title: Lake Biwa Cruising Tour and Chikubu Island from Nagahama or Imazu Port
description:
Leisurely cruise Lake Biwa and land on Chikubu Island, a place that has been an object of worship from ancient times. You can visit Hogonji Temple while strolling the island.
Chikubushima is a small island on Lake Biwa, about 2 km in circumference. It is located basically equal distance from both Imazu and Nagahama ports. Visit Hogonji Temple to see the Karamon gate, a national treasure, or check out Funaroka, the roofed corridor. Stop at Tsukubusuma Shrine and try throwing earthen ware to ward off evil at Ryujin Haisho.

title: Full Day Mt. Oyama Sightseeing Tours by Taxi from Yonago or Sakaiminato
description: Enjoy the beauty of Mt. Oyama and the Adachi Museum Garden before checking out historic Matsue Castle or a variety of other wonderful sites.

title: Half Day Sightseeing Taxi Tour of the Hakuto Coast & Shikano Castle from Tottori
description:
Go from the ancient to the modern on a relaxing tour of history in Tottori. Check out the scenic Hakuto Coast before riding to Shikano, home to castle ruins.
Hakuto Shrine and Hakutosazou are written in folk history, the Chronicle of Japan. Famous for promoting great marriages, prospective couples will make 3 copies of the Hakuto personal contract promising eternal love, then each person keeps one, and the 3rd remains at the shrine.

Aoyakamijichi ruins traces of a village from the Yayoi Era, a prehistoric time. Many items used for daily life in the period were found here, including the remains of an ancient structure, giving this the name of "the Yayoi Museum."

The ruins of Shikano Castle are now home to cherry trees that bloom elegantly in spring. Relax as you stroll through the quiet and peaceful town of Shikano, where many historic buildings still remain.

title: Half Day Dune and Pear Chartered Sightseeing Taxi Tour from Tottori
description:
Taste the flavors of autumn in Tottori with a fun pear picking experience and a visit to a local factory that produces regional specialties. Taxi is for up to 4 passengers.
Taste Tottori with fun pear picking at the pear orchard Mikaen, close to the Tottori Dunes. All you can eat juicy pears! Limited to the season from August 1st to early November.
- Admission fee -
Adult: 1,000 JPY / Child: 800 JPY / Kindergarten child: 600 JPY / Group: 900 JPY per adult

Speaking of the Tottori Dunes, check out the largest sand dune in all Japan. Formed over 100,000 years as the Chiyo River and winds pile and arrange sand, this is a sandy beach dune on an unbelievable scale. Then, see the scale of industry with a visit to the Maeta Shoten factory, open until 14:00. This famous factory is great for seeing and tasting the local tofu chikuwa and ago chikuwa, unique local snacks.

title: Half Day Sea Kayak Tour for All Ages from Yuasa
description: Hop aboard for a short sea kayak tour, about 3 km, along the Suhara Coast. Explore shallows and rocky shores as you learn to paddle and handle a kayak.

title: Fly with a Tandem Paraglider Above Amamioshima Island
description: Fly like a bird on a Tandem Paraglider with a friendly instructor and see the tropical island and glittering beaches of Amamioshima from the sky above!

title: Guided Nature Walk to with Mt. Fuji View and Historic Shrine near Lake Kawaguchi
description: Walk past 100 year old cedars that line Asama Shrine and discover how Mt. Fuji shaped the life of people in Japan. Visit the sacred Haha-no-Shirataki waterfall and enjoy nature.

title: Full Day Private Taxi Tour of Yokohama from Tokyo
description: See the best sights of  Yokohama on this private tour from Tokyo. From Chinatown to the elegant Meiji buildings, explore the famous port city on a chartered taxi.

title: Day Trip to Hot Spring Hotel with Individual Room Lunch in Hida
description:
Enjoy the luxurious lunch at the Hida Hotel Plaza and soak in the natural hot spring baths. Enjoy the superb view of Japan Alps and the town of Takayama from the open-air bath on the 9th floor.
Bathe in the Hitennoyu spring, with colorless and transparent water with a hint of slight salinity to warm your body.

title: Private Charter Party Cruise for Large Groups from Yokohama
description: Set out for a private party on the waters of Yokohama or Tokyo with a chartered boat for 40 or more. Add dessert buffets or meals for an elegant night out.

title: Private Shore Excursion to Tokyo from Yokohama Port
description: Tour Tokyo's famous sights such as Shibuya, Harajuku and Asakusa by private car. Get whisked from Yokohama Port to the city, accompanied by a helpful English, French or Chinese guide!

title: Private Transfer Service to or from Yokohama and Haneda Airport
description: Travel between your Yokohama hotel and Haneda Aiport in a comfortable vehicle. Reach your destination without worrying about buses and trains. A great transfer option for couples, families and groups.

title: Yokohama's Best Sights Private Taxi Tours
description: These bargain private charters will allow you to see the best sights of Yokohama in style, riding in a private taxi. Great for groups or visitors with limited time.

title: Private Jumbo Taxi Sightseeing Tour of Yokohama and Bay Town (2.5 hours)
description: Drive through the busy port of Yokohama or the Bay Town on a jumbo taxi and discover the history of the city with a blend of the east and west.

title: Reserved Express Bus Tickets for Mt.Fuji and Hida Takayama Route
description: Reserve tickets to travel hassle free on a express bus connecting Mt. Fuji and Hida Takayama. With convenient pick up points at Fuji Q, Lake Kawaguchi or Hirayu Onsen, save money while visiting Japan!

title: Jumbo Taxi Private Sightseeing Tour of Yokohama and Chinatown (3 hours)
description: Make your way through the historic and the fancy streets of Yokohama on a comfortable taxi. Relax and take your time to see the many sides of the port city.

title: Beginner Friendly Pottery Class in Tendo
description: From trying out a potter's wheel to kid-friendly hand forming and painting experiences, enjoy creating your own ceramics in Yamagata.

title: Hakata Owl Cafe Reservations in Fukuoka
description: Visit one of Japan's famous owl cafes while in Fukuoka! Located near Hakata Station, you can take pictures with cute owls while they perch on your shoulder or head. Experience a real animal cafe!

title: Half Day Chartered Tottori Gourmet and Sand Dunes Sightseeing Taxi in Tottori
description:
Hop into a private taxi for up to 4 and check out the best of Tottori. From the huge sand dunes to the Karoichi market, let the driver handle the roads while you relax.
Some of the highlights of this course include the Tottori Dunes, the largest sand dune in all Japan. Formed over 100,000 years as the Chiyo River and winds pile and arrange sand, this is a sandy beach dune on an unbelievable scale.

Karoichi Market is where the fresh seafood unloaded from the Karo fishing port is sold. You can enjoy fresh seafood from the Sea of Japan in the restaurants and stalls, or get some tasty treats to take home. Speaking of treats, the Matsuba crab is a type of snow crab. From November to March, Tottori goes into action catching and preparing these winter delicacies.

title: One Day Shikoku 88-Temples Pilgrimage Course by Private Taxi from Kochi
description: Ideal for pilgrims and visitors with limited time, see your desired temples at your own pace by private taxi. Multiple days also available!

title: Hanamaki City and Castle Ruins Private Taxi Tour
description: Visit the dramatic castle and see all the best sights of Hanamaki on this private taxi tour! Ideal for groups and visitors who have limited time to see the sights.

title: Tandem Paragliding Flight in Akayu
description:
Soar 300m over Nanyo Sky Park! Feel the wind in your hair and enjoy the quiet of the sky, while gazing over Yamagata's dramatic mountains.
Take to the skies accompanied by a professional paragliding instructor. See the lush fields and soaring mountains of Yamagata spread beneath you. Kids welcome!

title: Private Three Hour Taxi Charter Tour in Kochi (Jumbo Taxi)
description:
See some of Kochi's best sights! Visit the beautiful Katsurahama Beach, then choose between Harimaya Bridge or Kochi Castle for a taste of local history.
The Jumbo Taxi can accommodate up to 9 people.

title: Full Day Tour of Hida Takayama and Shirakawago from Kanazawa Station
description: Visit Shirakawago and stroll through Takayama from early June to early November to see the beauty of rural Japan. Enjoy a lunch of local delicacies and making your own sembei crackers too!

title: Tour to Shirakawago and Hida Takayama with Gifu-Style Lunch from Nagoya
description: Hop onboard and let us whisk you from Nagoya to the traditional thatched roof house village of Shirakawago! Enjoy a stroll along the Edo period streets of Hida Takayama, and indulge in a local lunch.

title: Private Full Day Shopping and Historical Tour of Nagoya by Chartered Car
description: Explore the popular spots of the port city on a private taxi. Check out Nagoya Castle and Tokugawaen Garden, then pick up some gourmet dishes at Sakae and shop your heart out in the trendy Osu area.

title: Private Taxi Tour of Popular Sightseeing Spots of Hakodate
description: Let an experienced taxi driver take you around the popular and hidden sightseeing spots of Hakodate such as churches in Motomachi, Goryoaku Park, and more.

title: Couple Kimono Dressing and Rental Plan in Kanazawa
description:
Walk down the picturesque streets of Kanazawa together while dressed in traditional kimono. A fun date activity for couples, make sure to take lots of photos!
Choose from a wide selection of stylish kimonos in a massive variety of fashions, materials, and colors. The knowledgeable staff will help you find the type that best suits you, coordinate your outfits, and assist in getting you ready to explore the old streets of historic Kanazawa. Graceful and historic buildings line the streets, and it will feel like you have stepped back in time. Perfect for a romantic trip to Ishikawa!

The shop is conveniently located just a short walk away from Kanazawa Station.

title: Half Day Beginner's Sea Kayak Tour in Zushi
description: Enjoy the feel of kayaking on the waves in a fun and safe half day tour. Start with a safety lesson and paddling course, then head out onto the water.

title: Walking Tour in Hakone Park
description: Try some healthy hiking in the soft grass field of the park. The mountain views and clear air are a welcome break from the feel of the city.

title: Enoura Scuba Diving Adventure from Tokyo
description: Set out from central Tokyo with guided transport to the day's dives in Enoura. Explore the beautiful oceans of Japan in two diving sessions.

title: Small Group Full Day Windsurfing Lesson in Zushi
description: Enjoy a full day of personalized instruction with a limited group size lesson. With detailed teaching and all day to practice, you'll be skimming along in no time!

title: Full Day Tour of Samurai City Kiyosu from Nagoya
description:
Explore the samurai city of Kiyosu. Visit Kiyosu Castle, the birthplace of Oda Nobunaga, try on some samurai armor and become a certified samurai. End the day with a tour of the Kirin Beer factory.
Take an in-depth look at the samurai world in Kiyosu, the birthplace of famous warlord Oda Nobunaga. Visit Kiyosu Park where a statue honors his legacy, and explore the imposing Kiyosu Castle. Once you've learned about the rich samurai history of Kiyosu, you can try out some samurai armor and receive a certificate. Return to the modern world with a tour of the Kirin Beer factory which includes 3 complimentary glasses of beer.

title: Spring-Inspired Pottery Experience in Kamakura
description: Create your own unique pottery to celebrate the arrival of spring! Choose to make a katakuchi (lipped bowl), guinomi (large sake cup), small bowl, plate or anything else you like.

title: Haneda Airport and Hakone Resort Area Private Taxi Transfer Service
description: Enjoy a smooth, easy and convenient ride with no transfers when you charter a private taxi between the Hakone resort area and Haneda Airport.

title: Private Charter Taxi Tour to Mt. Fuji, Hakone and Lake Yamanaka from Yokohama
description: See iconic Mt. Fuji, charming Hakone or Lake Yamanaka on this full day private charter tour! Great for groups or travelers with limited time.

title: Sapporo and Otaru Tour with Drop-off at Chitose Airport
description:
See charming Otaru or Shiroi Koibito Park before your flight, and make the most of your time in Hokkaido! Half day and full day courses allow you to catch both afternoon and evening flights.
With easy pick-ups in central Sapporo, the tour will take you to visit the charming port town of Otaru and the Shiroi Koibito Park before dropping you off at New Chitose Airport.

title: Make Your Own Candle and Stained Glass Candle Holder in Otaru
description: Design and create a unique candle and holder, from pouring the wax for the candle, to adding the stained glass onto the base for a one of a kind display.

title: Battleship Island Gunkanjima Cruise and Island Exploration
description:
Take a cruise from Nagasaki Port to World Heritage Site Gunkanjima (Battleship Island). See beautiful views of Nagasaki on board, and upon landing, explore this abandoned relic from the Meiji Era.
Present your voucher at reception and hop on board the boat. Enjoy this cruise with its wonderful views of Nagasaki city and its landmarks and have an adventure exploring the island. 

Once a coal mine, Hashima, nicknamed Gunkanjima (or Battleship Island) became completely abandoned in the mid-20th century once the mines were depleted. The remnants of the buildings used by its residents remain and have made it a popular tourist location as well as earned it its World Heritage title.

title: Private Kotaro Takamura-Themed Tour of Hanamaki by Jumbo Sightseeing Taxi
description: See all the best sights of Hanamaki and learn about the life of Kotaro Takamura on this private tour. Visit the Takamura mountain house and Kiyomizu Temple!

title: Battleship Island Tour from Nagasaki with English or Chinese Audio Guide
description:
Set sail from Nagasaki and tour the ghostly ruins of Battleship Island, once home to 5,000. Uninhabited since 1974, see the impressive ruins of this island.
Known locally as Gunkanjima or Battleship Island, Hashima was once home to a bustling coal mining town. As demand shifted from coal to petroleum, the island was abandoned, and has been uninhabited since 1974! These modern ruins and testament to nature's power stand as both a living part of recent history and an overwhelming monument to time. The island's legacy is still felt, and directly inspires movies, such as the recent Bond film Skyfall!

English and Chinese language audio guide and pamphlets are available, however English or Chinese speaking guides are not.

title: Chartered Sightseeing Taxi Around Onuma National Park
description: Sight-see specific locations from a comfortable taxi to discover the beautiful nature around Lake Onuma and the surrounding marshes in the National Park.

title: Make Local Houtou Noodles at Lake Kawaguchi
description: Learn about the origin and history of the local Yamanashi specialty, the houtou noodle! After cooking, enjoy the flavors of the freshly made food too!

title: Kosuge Forest Adventure Course and Zip Line
description: Challenge the treetop adventures and ride the Flying Fox zip line more than 130 meters through the forest and over the beautiful scenery of the outdoors.

title: Tono Sightseeing Course (Two Hour Private Taxi Charter)
description:
This 2 hour chartered taxi tour will allow you to see all the main sightseeing spots in Tono! Experience the local traditions and explore temples of legend. 
Tōno is known throughout Japan as the location of the Tales of Tōno, a compilation of folk tales of the area. This book is now considered one of the greatest studies of Japanese folklore, many of which involve 'kappa', mischievous water sprites said to live in a local pond!

title: Tandem Paraglider Flight Adventure
description: Lift off into the sky with the instructor on a fun and safe paraglider flight. Nothing beats the feeling  of the moment when your feet leave the ground.

title: Underwater Cave Diving in Kumomi from Tokyo
description: With central Tokyo pick-up, you can easily head out for a fun day diving in blue waters and caverns in Kumomi! Explore the amazing features underwater.

title: Beginner Friendly Delicious Sushi Making Lesson in Nara
description: Discover the art of sushi through a step-by-step lesson from a professional sushi chef. Use the techniques you learn in the sushi school to make nigiri, rolls and many more.

title: Hanamaki City and Castle Ruins Private Jumbo Taxi Tour
description: Visit the dramatic castle and see all the best sights of Hanamaki on this private taxi tour! Ideal for larger groups and visitors with limited time to see the sights.

title: Famous Hanamaki Residents Private Tour by Jumbo Taxi
description: See all the best sights of Hanamaki, and learn about the lives of Kenji Miyazawa, Kotaro Takamura, and Inazo Nitobe on this private chartered taxi tour.

title: Sweets Taxi - Confectionery Tour with a Certified Guide in Otaru
description: Tour the popular confectioneries of Amatou, Niikuraya, and Kuwataya with a certified guide. This is a must-join tour for anyone with a love for sweets.

title: Entry Tickets to the Kita no Daichi no Aquarium in Kitami
description: Explore the aquarium that specializes in Japanese aquatic wildlife in the north. See Japan's largest freshwater fish or creatures that only live in the cold waters of Hokkaido.

title: White Water Rafting Tour on the Fujikawa River in Shibakawa
description: Enjoy the thrill of the rapids on one of the three great fast‐flowing rivers in Japan. Play in the river and enjoy a fun day out in nature in Shizuoka!

title: Surfing Class for Beginners with Experienced Teachers in Shizuoka
description: Join surfing classes with hands on lessons given by professional surfers. Great for beginners or even those who want brush up their skills! Learn to ride the waves of Japan!

title: Mt.Mitake and Shosenkyo Gorge Sightseeing Taxi Tour from Kofu City
description: Discover the beautiful nature of Yamanashi as you visit the Shosenkyo Gorge and Kanazakura Shrine. See Mt.Fuji in the distance and enjoy your tour with an English speaking driver.

title: Half Day Fused Glass Crafting Lesson in Shimoda
description: Find the charm of glass work in a casual and friendly lesson. Make a clock base, small plate, or other unique item for a useful souvenir.

title: Forest and Cave Exploration Adventure near Mt. Fuji
description: Explore a rare lava cave in Aokigahara, the forest in the foothills of Mt. Fuji. Go caving with an experienced guide and discover real adventure!

title: Full-Day Private Sightseeing Taxi Tour to Nachikatsuura Area
description: Drive down the coastal road of the Kii Peninsula and discover the historic areas of Nachi. Great opportunity to enjoy a relaxing trip to the Katsuura hot springs and Nachi Taisha shrine on a taxi.

title: Full Day Sea Kayak Tour to Takashima Island from Yuasa
description: Kayak around Yuasa Bay and make for Takashima in an open water tour. You can bathe in Shirahama Onsen after paddling and discovering amazing natural beauty.

title: Private Sightseeing Taxi Tour of North Shinano from Nagano City
description: Customize your tour of northern Nagano to enjoy your journey around Suzuka, Obuse, Iizuna and Togakushi. Discover the seasonal views and the rich history of the area on a comfortable taxi.

title: Noboribetsu Onsen and Jigokudani Hell Valley Tour with a Local Guide
description: Set out around Jigokudani, the Hell Valley with a local guide. Feel the heat coming from the springs and discover the untamed nature of the region as you enjoy a leisurely stroll.

title: Half-Day Private Taxi Tour of Highlights of Nagano City
description: Stop by the famous areas of Nagano City, Matsushiro or Obuse areas. Pay a visit to temples, shrines, castles and locations related to the famous Japanese artist, Hokusai.

title: Two Hour Plant Based Cotton Dyeing Lesson in Asuka
description: Learn an ancient way of dyeing using plants. You can use about 8 plants including indigo depending on the season. Create a personalized and unique item just for you.

title: Mangrove Canoeing and Jungle Trekking on Iriomote Island
description: Canoe through the tropical waters of Iriomote before setting off for Pinaisara Falls. The superb view from the top of the fall offers breathtaking views of the island and sea.

title: Kabira Bay Glass-bottom Boat Ride from Ishigaki Island
description: Hop aboard on the clear glass-bottom boat to see the many fish and colorful coral that live under the famous turquoise waters of Kabira Bay.

title: All Ages Short Glassware Painting Workshop in Minakami
description: Paint pictures or write letters on clear glassware to make a unique and colorful piece of art, then fire it in an electric furnace for about 30 minutes to finish.

title: Half Day Hand Twisting Ceramic Workshop in Minakami
description: Create your own hand made Japanese tea cup by working fresh clay. Even small children can join in and make a fun thing to use everyday at home.

title: Half Day One-Person Yachting Experience in Zushi
description: Learn how to sail a ship around the Zushi Bay, and get a real feel for life on the sea! Beginners are welcome, as our instructors will teach you the ropes.

title: 3 Hour Private Charter Taxi Tour around Abashiri
description: This private sightseeing taxi tour can take you to and from Memanbetsu Airport. See the best sights of Abashiri and the area nearby, including the Sea of Okhotsk, Kitami, Saromako, Sharicho and more.

title: Soba, Udon, Apple Pie or Pickle Making Experience in Minakami
description:
Learn how to make soba or udon noodle, apple pie, and Japanese style pickles during your trip. The flour and buckwheat are grown and milled locally, for a true taste of Minakami.
The pickles are alos made using vegetables grown on the farm.

title: Beginner's Half Day Woodworking Lessons in Minakami
description: Using just nails and a hammer, turn cedar into a book stand, chair, or tissue box in a fun lesson. You can take your creation home to use and enjoy.

title: Morning Sightseeing Taxi Tour of Horyuji Temple and Traditional Nara
description: Visit temples from Houryuji to Nishinokyou, then take a look around Chuguji, Hourinji, Hokkiji, Jikouin, Yakushiji, and Toshoudaiji Temples. on a full course.

title: Relaxing Anbou River Kayaking Tour of Yakushima
description: Kayak the Anbou River and check out Yakushima from a new angle. The natural beauty of the island is completely different than hiking! This family friendly tour is a great way to see it yourself.

title: Scuba Diving Tour for Licensed Divers in the Sea of Yakushima
description: In the sea of Yakushima there are both coral reefs and rocks, and fish of both the tropical and temperate zones can be seen. Dive into adventure here.

title: Overnight Stay at Zenkoji Temple Lodgings with Vegetarian Dinner in Nagano
description: Enjoy staying in a Japanese-style room of Zenkoji and enjoy a vegetarian dinner made from fresh ingredients. Attend a special morning service at the main hall before breakfast.

title: Lake Toya and Noboribetsu Area Shore Excursion Tour from Muroran Port
description: Stop by the scenic Lake Toya and Noboribetsu all on a chartered taxi with an English speaking driver. Convenient transportation for those on a cruise and stopping by the Muroran Port.

title: Night Canoe and Kayak Tour with Stargazing on Iriomote Island
description: Enjoy the night of Iriomote, where the mangroves grow and the skies are clear. Relax under the starry night skies and discover fantastic views.

title: Relaxing Ryukyu Facial Face Treatment in Ishigaki
description: Using oils from the lush plants of Okinawa, this facial treatment will leave you feeling blissfully relaxed and glowing. Great for skin that has been dried out by the sun and sea!

title: Fun Diving Experience for Beginners on Panari Island (English-Speaking Guide)
description: Set off for Panari Island, a quiet and hidden gem with crystal clear waters. Join your guide and try diving in shallow waters filled with vibrant coral reefs.

title: Pinaisara Waterfall Trekking Tour on Iriomote Island
description: Head from the basin to the top of Iriomote's tallest waterfall, the Pinaisara Waterfall. This whole day course is great for beginners who want to see nature.

title: One Day Private Guide Charter Tour for Nature and Bird Watching in Kushiro
description: Enjoy the great nature of eastern Hokkaido with a private guide to show you the special beauty of winter in Hokkaido in safety and comfort.

title: Eastern Hokkaido Full Day Sightseeing Tour by Private Taxi from Otaru or Sapporo
description: Discover the hard to reach environs of Shiretoko or Abashiri with a full day chartered taxi. From stunning vistas to historic sites, leave the driving to us.

title: Full Day Pinaisara Waterfall Trek and Diving Combo Tour on Iriomote Island
description: Go all over the tropical island, from the basin of a 50 meter waterfall to the tropical reefs of Barras Island to feel the beauty of Iriomote for yourself.

title: Reflexology Foot Massage Spa Treatment in Ishigakijima
description: Soothe tired feet and rid your body of toxins with a reflexology session. Ideal for boosting circulation and relieving sore legs, indulge a little while visiting Ishigaki Island!

title: Half and Full Day Boat Fishing Tours from Ishigaki Island
description: Aim for tropical and large fish in the beautiful waters surrounding Ishigaki Island. Choose from trolling or big‐game fishing while getting helpful assistance from experienced local fisherman.

title: Buckwheat Flour Soba Noodle Making Experience in Minakami
description: Make delicious soba noodles from buckwheat flour produced in Minakami at Horakukan. Learn how to knead and cut the dough, then enjoy your homemade noodles for lunch!

title: Traditional Straw Woven Sandal Half Day Workshop in Minakami
description:
Learn and make Zori or Waraji woven sandals in an all ages glass that even beginners can join. Turn raw straw into a special pair of footwear as a personal souvenir.
Wara straw is made from dried rice plants after the rice was harvested. Since old times it has been an invaluable item for daily life.

title: Ice Cream, Butter, or Cheese Making Experience on a Farm in Biei
description:
Let's cook using some farm fresh ingredients! Everything is very fresh, so you can enjoy the hand-made flavors of what you make, including ice cream or butter!
You can feed most of the animals on the farm! Keep an eye out for the animal feed boxes, to make sure you get the right treat for the right one!

title: Cute Decorative Sushi Roll Lesson in English at a Local Home in Nagoya
description: Add a touch of "kawaii" to your sushi by learning how to make colorful and decorative Kazarimaki sushi rolls. Enjoy a fun cooking lesson in English at a local Japanese home in Nagoya.

title: Five Hour Nishinokyou and Saboji Temple Sightseeing Taxi Tour from Nara
description: Visit the historic temples and castle ruins of Nara on a full morning taxi tour. Let the professional driver whisk you between destinations for the best use of time.

title: Joruriji, Gazenji, and Hannyaji Temple Sightseeing Taxi Tour from Nara
description: Triple the cultural learning with a special temple visit taxi ride. From the flwoing Kizu River see National Treasures, then wander the three temples.

title: Nara World Heritage Sites Afternoon Tour from Kyoto
description:
Take an easy half day trip from Kyoto and discover Nara’s most beautiful sights. Visit Kasuga Shrine and the largest bronze Buddha in Japan at Todaiji Temple.
Relax and let us whisk you from Kyoto to Nara, where Todaiji Temple awaits. Home to the world’s largest wooden building. Todaiji also houses Japan’s largest bronze Buddha. Constructed in 752, this statue of the Cosmic Buddha stands an impressive 14.84 meters tall! Nara Park is located just outside the temple, and is the perfect spot to soak in the beauty of the city and mingle with the famous locals, the Nara deer! In the Shinto religion deer are considered messengers of the gods, so the deer of Nara are considered special. We will also stop at Kasuga Taisha Shrine, a World Heritage Site known for the thousands of lanterns that decorate the shrine grounds.

title: Jet Bike Ride in Kamakura
description: Want to try riding a jet bike, but don't have a license or your own? No worries, just hop on behind an expert instructor as you race over the waves.

title: Half Day Windsurfing Course in Zushi
description: Have fun on the ocean and learn to windsurf the waves with this half day lesson from a skilled instructor, off the sandy beaches of Zushi.

title: Pillar Style Aroma Candle Craft Lesson in Otaru
description: Create a popular pillar candle with your favorite colors as a souvenir of Otaru. These pretty scented candles will be a lovely accent for your home or gift.

title: Half Day Blue Cave Snorkeling and Bikuni Tour on the Shakotan Peninsula
description: Abundant nature and the  beautiful shore line of Hokkaido create the beautiful Swim in a rare natural Blue Cave near the Shakotan Peninsula located right by Otaru.

title: Full Day Private Tour of the Akan Lakes from Kushiro
description: Visit Akan's 3 biggest lakes by taxi and marvel at the clarity of Lake Mashu, Lake Kussharo and Lake Akan. You can also check out the Japanese Crane Nature Park!

title: Muslim-Friendly Guided Walking Tour of Osaka with English-Speaking Guide
description:
Visit iconic Osaka Castle, shop around in Shinsaibashi, pose at Dotonbori, pray at the Osaka Masjid and more! Enjoy a full day exploring and eating in Osaka with a friendly English-speaking guide.
Discover the history and culture of Osaka with a fun tour around the busy city. Known as the 'Nation's Kitchen', Osaka is an ideal spot to try halal-certified authentic Japanese dishes you can only find here!  Enjoy a delicious halal sukiyaki stew at "BULLS", then hunt for tasty treats at the Kuromon Market. After shopping in Shinsaibashi, taking an iconic photo in front of the bright 'running man' sign in Dotonbori and getting a great view of Osaka from the Umeda Sky Building, the tour makes a stop at the Osaka Masjid in time for prayers.

title: Fly Board Lesson and Exciting Flight over the Ocean from Fusaki
description: Strap on to an awesome water powered hover board as you swoop, dive and fly over the fantastic waters of Okinawa, out on Ishigaki Island.

title: Diving Adventure for Licensed Divers in the Yaeyama Sea with Ishigaki Departure
description: Splash into the waters of Yaeyama where you can see manta and corals. Small group tours allow divers to enjoy a safe fun dive in the blue waters of Okinawa.

title: Mangrove Forest Canoeing Tour and Animal Watching
description: This is a canoeing tour down the river through a mangrove forest to enjoy viewing animals and plants of the subtropical area, for both fun and education.

title: Traditional Mask Painting Experience at Takumi no Sato in Minakami
description:
Choose from a large variety of masks, and make it your own by painting it in your favorite colors. A fun activity for families and children, located near Nonomiya Shrine. 
From local cartoon characters to traditional mythical creatures like kitsune (9-tailed fox) and even cute animals like cats, rabbits, monkeys and more, there are lots of choices available for you to paint.

title: Half Day Traditional Bamboo Work Experience in Minakami
description: Use bamboo and learn to make classic toys for children such as a paper gun, bamboo-copter, or a flower vase from cutting to completion.

title: Full Day Cultural Sightseeing Tour of Kyoto, Arashiyama and Nara from Osaka
description: Let the friendly deer greet you as you make your way to see the Great Buddha at Todaiji Temple of Nara. Experience a day of Japanese history and culture at temples of Kyoto and many more.

title: Easy Kimono Rental for Individuals and Couples in Osaka
description: Enjoy kimono easily with your choice of bag and sash to match your outfit. Once dressed up, you can go out around town on a walk or having fun.

title: Kushiro Area Sightseeing Bus Full Day Scenic Excursions from Kushiro
description: Discover Lake Mashu, with the most transparent water in Japan or learn about and maybe even spot rare red cranes as you tour the beautiful sights of the Kushiro Wetlands.

title: Shiratani Unsuikyo Forest Trekking Course in Yakushima
description: Trek through the mossy paths and ancient trees of Yakushima. Explore the mysterious, yet beautiful forest that is almost like a scene from Princess Mononoke!

title: Kushiro Marsh Tour by Private Taxi
description: Choose from a variety of courses to find the one that suits your interests, and enjoy the lush nature of Hokkaido's wild Kushiro National Park.

title: Car Renting for Hiking Trails in Yakushima Island
description: Rent a car to tour around the island of Yakushima. Conveniently explore with a built-in GPS and leisurely travel to your desired locations. Great for families or even solo travelers.

title: Sheep Wool Figurine Felting Experience in Nakafurano
description: While in Furano create cute animals out of local sheep wool, for an adorable souvenir of Hokkaido! Kids and groups are always welcome to join in!

title: Full Day Sightseeing Bus Tour of Osaka
description:
Your English-speaking guide will show you around Osaka's highlights. Enjoy a day exploring beautiful historic locations such as Osaka Castle and Sumiyoshi Taisha, and try some of Osaka's famous food.
Enjoy the highlights of Osaka on this full day bus tour. With the help of an English-speaking guide, you will be able to explore Osaka Castle, famous shrines Namba Yasaka and Sumiyoshi Taisha, as well as Daisen Park Japanese Garden in the neighboring city of Sakai. Enjoy famously delicious Osaka food such as kushikatsu (deep-fried skewered meat and vegetables) for lunch, a ride on the retro tramcar, a visit to Hamono Museum and then be dropped off at Namba Station.

title: Two Day Universal Studios Japan Pass, Bullet Train & Hotel Package from Tokyo
description:
This hassle-free package is perfect for guests staying in Tokyo who want to experience the fun and magic of Universal Studios Japan in Osaka. Stay overnight so you can check out the city too!
This special package includes a USJ Pass, shinkansen tickets and one night at a nearby hotel!

Step into the magical world of Universal Studios, including The Wizarding World of Harry Potter, Hello Kitty Fashion Avenue, Jurassic Park, Jaws, and the Magical Starlight Parade. After a full day of fun, check into the convenient Granvia Hotel. In the morning, take advantage of some free time and explore Osaka before your smooth and convenient return trip to Tokyo on the comfortable bullet train.

title: Evening Walking Tour of Osaka's Liveliest Locations
description:
Enjoy an evening strolling around Osaka and absorbing its lively atmosphere. Visit the famous areas of Dotonbori and Shinsekai and try some delicious Osaka-style snacks and street food along the way.
An English-speaking local guide will bring you around Osaka after 5. View the difference in the modern city's vibrant atmosphere and its more historic backstreets. Experience the neon lights in Dotonbori, the historic Shinsekai as well as shopping areas Kuromon Ichiba market and Doguyasuji  with its array of fake food!
Don't forget to sample some famous Osaka snacks such as takoyaki (fried batter balls with octopus) and kushi-katsu (skewered meat and vegetables).

title: Temple Lodgings at World Heritage Mt. Koya and Train Tickets Package from Osaka
description:
Escape the hustle and bustle of the city and enjoy this wonderful getaway to the serenity of Mt. Koya, home to over 100 Buddhist temples and monasteries.  
Hidden in an idyllic mountain valley surrounded by 8 peaks, Koyasan is the heart of Shingon Buddhism. After arriving, guests are free to explore the many beautiful temples, hike, or relax in the temple gardens.

After a dinner of “shojin ryori”, Buddhist vegetarian cuisine, rest in the elegant tatami rooms of Henjoko-in Temple, savoring the quiet. Early in the morning, visitors can join morning devotions and meditation with the temple monks.

After breakfast, spend the remainder of your day exploring Mt. Koya before making your way back to Osaka on the shinkansen (bullet train).

title: BMW X1 xDrive20i Luxury Rental in Sapporo
description: Hop behind the wheel of a BMW with full-time 4WD. Easy to drive, yet boasting an impressively responsive engine, this sporty car is perfect for in the city or all around Hokkaido.

title: Kimono Rental and Dressing Experience in Central Sapporo
description:
Dress up in a beautiful kimono as you enjoy the city of Sapporo. Choose whether you'd like to have photos taken by a professional photographer or walk freely around the city with your friends.
Dress up in kimono and choose the plan that's best for you. Once the staff has dressed you in the kimono of your choice with some beautiful accessories, you can have your photos taken in their studio or tour the streets of Sapporo on your own.

title: Make An Original Cookie at Shiroi Koibito Park in Sapporo
description:
Become a cookie chef for a day as you make a personalized Shiroi Koibito cookie at the workshop, perfect to give to a loved one as a tasty trip souvenir.
Let your imagination run wild as you decorate and create a truly one of a kind Shiroi Koibito cookie, the most popular souvenir of Hokkaido. With chocolate layered between langue de chat cookies, this treat is a hit with all ages!

title: Full Day Private Taxi Tour of Sapporo's Best Sights
description: See all of Sapporo's most popular locations on this chartered tour! See the Meiji-era buildings, such as the Beer Museum and the Clock Tower, then take a stroll at Hitsujigaoka Observatory Hill.

title: Origami (Paper Folding) Crafting Class Near Shinsaibashi
description: Discover the colorful art of Japanese origami! Create beautiful figures by folding Japanese rice papers as a teacher shows you how it's done. A great activity for families and friends.

title: Traditional Shodo Japanese Calligraphy Class in Osaka
description: Learn the fascinating art of shodo! Get to know the history and vibrant culture of Japan through its beautiful writing as an experienced teacher guides you on how to write like a true calligrapher.

title: Japanese Home Cooking Lesson in Central Osaka (Halal Friendly)
description: Experience cooking up some popular dishes with a certified Halal instructor. Make some  sushi, okonomiyaki or some traditional Japanese wagashi confectionery with a lesson in English.

title: Narita Airport and Hakone Resort Area Private Charter Taxi
description: Enjoy a smooth, easy and convenient ride with no transfers when you charter a private taxi between the Hakone resort area and Narita Airport.

title: Chartered Taxi Sightseeing Tour of Chiran in Kagoshima
description: Trace the lengthy history of Chiran on a taxi. Visit traditional samurai houses, remains of houses of feudal lords and the Peace Museum for Kamikaze pilots.

title: Two Day Hiroshima and Kurashiki Tour from Kyoto (Family Plan)
description:
This tour takes you around popular sightseeing spots in Hiroshima, Miyajima and Kurashiki for a combined tour of some of Japan's quieter spots.
Visit the World Heritage Sites Miyajima, Itsukushimajinja Shrine, Hiroshima, and the Atomic Bomb Dome on the first day. 
On the second day, the tour will visit the popular Kurashiki and Okayama Korakuen, one of the three most beautiful gardens in Japan.

title: One-Day Private Taxi Tour Around Six Kirishima Shrines in Kagoshima
description: Make a pilgrimage through the city of Kirishima and pay a visit to the Gods enshrined within. Stop by the unique natural forests created by molten lava from volcanoes near by.

title: Local Seashell Art Making Experience in Tanohata
description: Use seashells to create your desired craft, such as a cellphone strap, photo stand, candle and more! Make a cute souvenir of your visit to Iwate.

title: Short Private Taxi Tour of Yokohama's Port Areas (2.5 hours)
description: Choose from the Yokohama harbor course and Yokohama bay town course, and get a taste for the history of this bustling port city on a quick chartered tour.

title: Private Night Views of Yokohama Taxi Tour
description: Enjoy the views of Yamashita Park, the Red Brick Warehouse and the Yokohama skyline sparkling after dark from the comfort of a private taxi. Great for groups!

title: Tono Sightseeing Course (3.5 Hour Private Taxi Charter)
description:
Experience the local traditions and explore temples of legend. This short chartered taxi tour will allow you to see all the main sightseeing spots in Tono!
Tono is known throughout Japan as the location of the Tales of Tono, a compilation of folk tales of the area. This book is now considered one of the greatest studies of Japanese folklore, many of which involve 'kappa', mischievous water sprites said to live in a local pond!

title: Sunset Stand Up Paddleboard Tour from Ishigaki
description: Relax and glide across the water on a wide SUP board as the sun sets over the mangroves of Ishigaki. Relax in the unique atmosphere and let stress melt away.

title: One Day Mt. Fuji & Hakone Tour Departing from Tokyo (Disband at Odawara Station)
description:
Discover the beauty of Japan’s highest mountain on this full day sightseeing tour of Mount Fuji and Hakone. Visit Mt. Fuji's 5th Sta, Komagatake Ropeway and cruise on Lake Ashi. Tour ends in Odawara.
A great tour for visitors making use of the Japan Rail Pass, as you can use your pass to return to Tokyo on the swift, comfortable bullet train!

title: BMW 335i Cabriolet Rental in Sapporo
description: Feel the breeze on your skin with the retractable sun roof of this 4 seater luxury rental. The powerful engine makes this a sporty treat to drive on the open roads of Hokkaido.

title: Okinawa Trial Diving and Blue Cave Snorkeling Tour from Onna
description: Jump into the refreshing waters of Okinawa and enjoy half a day of trial diving and snorkeling with an experienced instructor as company. Perfect for beginners eager to explore the sea!

title: Okinawa Main Island Car Rental Service in Naha (24 Hour Rental)
description: Explore the tropical island of Okinawa at your own pace with a rental! Select from compact cars to spacious vans, all with a helpful English or multilingual GPS, insurance and 24-hour road service!

title: Beginner Scuba Diving Adventure from Cape Maeda Misaki in Kunigami
description: Trial diving off Maeda Misaki. Enjoy swimming with fish in the crystal clear sea of Okinawa. You can see sea turtles, if lucky. Don’t worry, if it's your first time. Give it a try! Fish bait included.

title: Half Day Okinawa Mangrove River Kayaking Adventure in Higashi
description:
Explore the pristine mangrove ecosystem by kayak on this fun short adventure, a short 30 minute drive from Nago. Open to beginners and children as young as 3, see a different side of Okinawa!
See the wild side of Okinawa on these exciting kayaking tours of the vibrant mangroves and shining ocean of Higashi. The river mangrove course is so smooth, children from 3 years old and up can join in! Bring the whole family for an unforgettable outdoor experience, and check out the unique wildlife of the mangroves.

title: Powered Paragliding Flight Adventure in Nakagusuku
description:
Try the hottest new activity in Okinawa: powered paragliding! Fly over the blue sea with an experienced instructor by your side. Enjoy great views and an awesome adrenaline rush. 

Starting and ending on the pristine beaches of Okinawa, powered paragliding uses a large fan motor to whisk paragliders up into the sky. You can choose the height you are comfortable with, making this a great activity for beginners and kids!

Your experienced pilot will ride with you in tandem, so all you have to do is enjoy the breeze and views of Okinawa's mountains and sea. Very safe, you are welcome to bring your camera up with you.

Experience the thrill of paragliding, and see Okinawa in a whole new way.

title: Kayaking and Snorkeling in Okinawa's Blue Cave from Cape Maeda
description:
Soak in the gorgeous view of  Okinawa's beautiful Cape Maeda from a kayak. After that you can enjoy snorkeling in the famous Blue Cave!
Conveniently located in Onna. Pick-ups may be available. Free parking available.

title: Chartered Fishing Boat with Okinawan Fisherman Captain
description: Set out with a local captain who will guide you to the best fishing spot of the day! Fish with your friends and family while kicking back and relaxing in Okinawa.

title: Northern Okinawa Tour of Churaumi Aquarium with Airport Drop-off from Naha
description:
Set out in the morning to discover the top spots north of Naha. Meet the whale sharks of Churaumi Aquarium, explore Nago Pineapple Park and discover how Ryukyu glass is made.
If you're looking for a very convenient way to see Churaumi Aquarium and get back to Naha Airport, look no further! This one day bus tour takes you straight to the famous Churaumi Aquarium, where you can see huge whale sharks and familites of manta rays glide past, just am arms-length away. Check out the other exhibits dedicated to local sealife, deep sea creatures and even an unusual petting zoo! On the return leg, stop at Nago Pineapple Park, where you can tour the grounds and sample locally grown pineapple and treats, from cakes to wine. Splash a bit of traditional art in as you see real Ryukyu glass at Glass no Mori!

title: Okinawan Arts and Crafts Activity (Heiwa Dori)
description:
Create your own shisa (lion-dogs), colorful candle or painted glass as a memento of Okinawa. Take it home the same day! Great as a rainy day activity too.
Located near the famous Kokusai Dori, at Chura-kaji you can sculpt shisa (the guardian lion-dogs found on Okinawan houses), make beautiful etched glassware, decorate a music box or paint wavy Ryukyu glass. A fun activity for both kids and adults, the staff will show you the ropes of these cute crafts. Make your own one-of-a-kind souvenir of Okinawa!

While waiting for your shisa to bake or candle to set, why not try the famous EM ice cream at the shop?

title: Private Snorkeling Tour of Okinawa's Blue Cave from Onna
description:
Explore the sparkling turquoise waters inside Okinawa's famous Blue Cave and have fun snorkeling with tropical fish in the clear sea. Everyone is welcome, from beginners to experienced snorkelers.

Located near the Moon Beach Hotel and Onna Marine View Palace Hotel, this private snorkeling is available both for solo travelers and groups. Enjoy this truly intimate tour, swimming through Okinawa's marine wonders at your own pace. With an experienced instructor by your side, young children and senior guests can enjoy this tour in safety. With easy access to the Blue Cave and all the amenities (free parking, showers, top of the line gear for all sizes and ages) let us make your snorkeling experience fun and stress-free. We even offer a complementary photo service!

As this is a popular activity, please write three possible times and dates.

title: Kayaking Tour and Cliff Coast Line Adventure from Onna
description: Paddle along with an adventurous kayaking tour from Maribu Beach. The coast is filled with steep cliffs, huge caves, and subtropical jungle, making this a great nature tour for all ages!

title: Half Day Diving Experience for All Levels with Motobu Departure
description: Dive right in with small group scuba north of the main island in Okinawa. Each instructor will guide up to two people for the utmost in fun and safety. After diving check out the Churaumi Aquarium.

title: Beach or Boat Snorkeling Tour of the Blue Cave from Naha
description: Enjoy snorkeling at the Blue Cave, a famous spot of Okinawa. You can go by boat or meet at the beach, and with four starts per day, it is easy to fit into your schedule.

title: Half-Day Winter Whale Watching Tour from Motobu (January ~ April)
description:
Get up close to humpback whales as they swim and play in the waters in the Motobu sea. Continue your marine adventure with an optional ticket to the Churaumi Aquarium for a day of fun!
With a viewing success rate of over 98%, and guaranteed refund or rescheduling if you are not able to see whales, this is the perfect chance to get up close and personal with the whales! Set out for the seas between Iejima Island and the main island and watch the whales come right up to the boat. You can see them breach, tail slap and play right before your eyes. Come get to know these beautiful creatures! Located near the Churaumi Aquarium, you can make a stop there during your day in Motobu!

title: Private Helicopter Tour of Kyoto
description: Get the best view of scenic Kyoto from the air as you lift off in a helicopter. See the ancient capital's temples, shrines and World Heritage Sites from above, and take amazing photos!

title: Classic Gold Powder Painting Workshop in Kyoto
description: Learn traditional Kyoto style arts with a fun makie lesson. Makie is a technique to add decorations on lacquerware by using metal powder on fresh lacquer patterns just before it dries.

title: Okinawa World, Shuri Castle, and Shopping Bus Tour from Naha
description: Explore the southern half of the main island of Okinawa on a bus. Experience the culture and highlights at Okinawa world, Shuri castle, Chinen Misaki park before shopping at the outlet mall.

title: One Day Bus Tour of Churaumi Aquarium, Kouri Island and Highlights of Okinawa
description: Ride on a comfortable bus and visit the Churaumi Aquarium, Kouri Island and the Nago Pineapple Park. Discover more of Okinawa with a handy multilingual audio guide.

title: All Ages Underwater Sightseeing Cruise Ship Orca with Departure from Naha
description: Get a look at the beauty of the ocean, just like diving, while staying completely dry as you cruise on the Orca. Check out the tropical coral, fish, and maybe even sea turtles as you cruise.

title: Diving and Snorkeling in the Blue Cave Tour from Onna
description:
You can enjoy the popular Blue Cave from both the bottom of the ocean and the surface! Beginners can join with confidence thanks to the small group sizes and skilled instructors.
This tour includes everything you need for diving and snorkeling in the Blue Cave, food to feed cute tropical fish, a waterproof camera to capture unique memories, and much more. Enjoy a a great family friendly tour and check out the beauty of Okinawa for yourself.

title: One Hour Parasailing Tour from Naha
description:
Lift off from Naha and enjoy a bird's eye view of shimmering blue ocean and the Kerama Islands on a quick tour perfect to add some fun to any day.
Cruise out over the waters and then begin to lift off into the air behind a powerful boat. You will get amazing bird's eye views of the shining blue waters of Okinawa as you glide high above the waves! See the Kerama Islands from high above, with coral reefs and tropical fish far below. Parasailing is great for families, letting children ride with adults, and it makes an exciting addition to any solo or group trip. Located within Naha City, you can easily add parasailing to any day's plan.

title: Naha Airport to Churaumi Aquarium Direct Tour (14:00 Departure)
description:
Make your trip to Okinawa easier with this combo sightseeing and transportation tour. Land at Naha Airport and hop aboard the bus to the Churaumi Aquarium, then relax with easy drop-off or dinner.
Hit the ground running with this convenient combo tour. After arriving at Naha Airport, be whisked off to the fabulous Churaumi Aquarium, one of the largest in the world. Watch the huge whale sharks and family of giant manta rays (the first successfully bred in captivity) swim right past you. With 20,000 different kinds of fish, from Okinawan tropical fish to deep sea creatures, this aquarium's fame is well-deserved.
Leave your luggage safely in the bus, so you can wander through the marine worlds without carrying anything extra around. Hungry? Choose a plan with an included teppanyaki dinner at Sam's!

title: Night Snorkeling in Okinawa's Blue Cave From Onna
description:
Experience the mysterious atmosphere of the Blue Cave by snorkeling at night! Seeing the beautiful night scenery of Okinawa and its famous cave is a once in a lifetime opportunity!
Conveniently located in Onna. A unique snorkeling experience in a famous location. Participants can experience the beautiful cave's landscape and the unique marine life which lights up the water at night.
Pick-ups may be available. Free parking available.

title: Ocean Fishing Half and Full Day Tours from Onna
description: Cast a line at beginner friendly shallow points and try to catch various kinds of  fish! Okinawa is home to colorful and tasty varieties to test your skill.

title: Visit a Kyoto Fan Workshop and Make Your Own Uchiwa Fan
description:
Stop by the workshop of craftsmen who make beautiful Kyoto-style fans, which you can use or display as ornaments. Watch and learn from the artists before trying your hand at making your own fan!
Come create your own unique Kyoto souvenir, assisted by traditional craftsmen.

title: Private Maiko Dance Performance in a Traditional Restaurant near Gion
description:
Relax with your group and enjoy a private performance by a maiko in a classic high-end Japanese restaurant. Savor a delicious kaiseki dinner, lunch or a few drinks in the heart of Kyoto.
Experience the grace of Kyoto's maiko and the best of Kyoto's hospitality! Enjoy a dinner of fine Japanese cuisine while watching the maiko dance, and discover the beauty and artistry of the ancient capital's icons.

title: Japanese Washi Paper Souvenir Book Making Lesson in Kyoto
description: Get hands on with traditional Kyoto culture as you make a 40 page book using Japanese washi-paper, bind with string, and finishing with drawing a picture on the cover.

title: Leisure Paragliding and Tandem Paragliding Courses in Northern Kyoto
description: Spend your time leisurely soaring through the sky by yourself and with your instructor. Enjoy the gentle breeze and the thrill of flying high above the ground.

title: Sake Tasting Experience at a Traditional Sake Brewery in Kyoto
description:
Tour the Horino Memorial Museum or Matsui Brewery, then sample a few glasses of delicious rice wine. Discover the taste of top-quality sake in Kyoto with a friendly guide!
When in Japan... drink sake!

You can choose to visit the Horino Memorial Museum, a former sake brewery which used to produce one of the highest quality sake brands in Japan, or the Matsui Shuzo Brewery, a modern-style sake brewery. Enjoy a tour (in English) of the traditional townhouse architecture or brewery facilities, then sample a few glasses of several different kinds of sake at the cafe corner in the storehouse. A great way to start off your evening.

title: Makizushi Sushi Roll Cooking Lesson at a Machiya in Kyoto
description:
Learn how to make tasty sushi rolls in a traditional machiya just 5 minutes away from the Kyoto Imperial Palace. Great for amateur chefs and foodies alike!
Join an English speaking cooking instructor to discover the tips and tricks to making perfect sushi rolls. Makizushi (sushi rolled in dry seaweed) may look difficult to make, but you will be rolling in no time. Cooking lessons are a great souvenir, since you can make sushi rolls after you return home, perfect for dinner parties or other events.
Once you have put the finishing touches on your makizushi, enjoy your handmade treats for lunch or dinner! Side dishes such as miso soup or sumashi clear soup, a side salad and seasonal fruit will also be served.

title: Advanced Traditional Hand-Dyeing Workshop Kyo-Yuzen Course in a Machiya
description:
While you are in Kyoto, spend a few hours creating a hand-made one-of-a-kind piece of Kyo-Yuzen, or dyed-fabric, and bring home a beautiful piece of art!
The traditional art of "Surikomi Yuzen" (Yuzen-style brush dye technique) was created  in the mid-18th century and has been the most popular way to dye kimono cloth ever since. The craftsmen of Marumasu-Nishimuraya, a 100 year-old business, will take you step-by-step as you make your own masterpiece.

Using paper stencils and ink, layers of color are carefully brushed onto fabric. Designs range from realistic flowers and plants to abstract designs. Sit with the craftsmen as they help you create Kyo-Yuzen pieces, such as noren (curtains) or furoshiki (wrapping cloth).

title: Gion Walking Tour and Dinner with a Maiko in Kyoto
description:
Immerse yourself into the world of the Kyoto geisha. Tour one of the city's geisha districts with a friendly guide before having a light dinner while watching a maiko perform!
Famous for their flawless white painted skin, beautiful kimono and skills in the Japanese performing arts, the geiko and maiko are regarded as living works of art.  

With your expert guide, explore the Gion geisha district and learn everything there is to know about the history and culture of the Kyoto geisha.  Then enjoy a light dinner attended by a maiko, who will dance and chat with you. Feel free to ask any questions you may have and take pictures. 

This is a unique opportunity to get to know one of the members of the elite geisha world!

title: Kyoto Nishiki Market Food Tour with 7-Course Lunch & English-Speaking Guide
description:
