Walk through Nishiki Market, also known as the "kitchen of Kyoto." Sample fresh delicacies in one of the richest culinary atmospheres in the world and gain in-depth knowledge on how to prepare them. 
Stop by the delightful Nishiki Market, 12 family-owned food stalls in "Kyoto's Kitchen" and taste specialty products like the world's smoothest sashimi tofu known as "Yuba" and Macha Warabi Mochi, a special traditional dessert covered in ground tea leaves. Learn about the history of the market while you sample its delicious food and discover the secrets on how it has kept up its amazing atmosphere for generations.

title: Traditional Zogan Inlay Handicraft Lesson in Kyoto
description: Kyoto zogan inlay is a traditional craft using stamped parts of pure silver or pure gold to decorate an iron plate. Create your own pendant or braided strap as a lovely gift or souvenir.

title: Full Day Chartered English Sightseeing Taxi Tour of Kyoto (4 Person)
description: Spend your time hiking up the Fushimi Inari Shrine or have a cup of matcha green tea at Uji. Stop by the iconic areas of Kyoto on a private taxi with a local English speaking guide.

title: Three-Hour Private Taxi Tour to Historical Temples of Kyoto (4 Person)
description: Discover the history of Kyoto by touring around famous temples on a chartered taxi. Stop by popular locations, such as the Golden Pavilion or Ryoanji Temple with an English speaking driver.

title: Folding Fan Picture Drawing and Painting Lesson in Kyoto
description: Create your own personal "sensu" folding fan, one of Kyoto special traditional crafts. In this lesson, you can draw on a folding fan and make an original design.

title: Gold Leaf Stamping Traditional Art Lesson in Kyoto
description: Set your hands to work learning hakuoshi, an art style that draws gold patterns on lacquerware by putting lacquer as an adhesive before  placing the gold leaf on it.

title: Kyoto Cuisine Lunch or Dinner at a Traditional Machiya near Shijo Karasuma
description: Enjoy delicious Kyoto delicacies in a traditional machiya house over 160 years old! From light lunches to elegant dinner courses, experience the best of the city's cuisine in beautiful surroundings.

title: Serene Tea Ceremony at a Local Instructor's Home in Kyoto
description:
Experience the serenity of the Japanese tea ceremony, learn all about the symbolism and history of this sacred event and prepare your very own authentic cup of Japanese tea!
Come experience an authentic Japanese tea ceremony at the home of an expert tea master! Guests are treated to an educational and enjoyable lesson in the art and symbolism of traditional Japanese tea ceremonies. Not only will your guide help you prepare your own Japanese-style tea, you will also be given an overview of the basics of Japanese tea, Kyoto, and Japan’s rich history and culture.

Upon your arrival to the tea master’s house, visitors will be taught proper etiquette and the historical significance of Japanese tea. You will be taught how to prepare your very own authentic cup of tea before you are given the opportunity to practice your new skills! Finally, you will be able to relax and enjoy your fresh-brewed cup of tea, along with delicious Japanese desserts. You will also have ample time at the end of your lesson to ask the instructor any questions you may have about tea, Japan, or even life in general.

title: Yudofu Dinner at the Junsei Restaurant in Nanzenji Temple, Kyoto
description:
Dine in the elegant Junsei Shoin for a true Kyoto experience and savor the delicious tofu of Nanzenji Temple. Presented in a variety of ways, this refined meal is a treat for the senses.
Savor a dinner of delicious Kyoto cuisine in the elegant atmosphere of the Junsei Shoin building, recently designated as a Tangible Cultural Property of Japan. Gaze out at the garden, and experience a moment of culinary zen.

title: Private Guided Walking Tour of Kyoto's Geisha Districts and Zen Gardens
description:
Discover the hidden streets of Kyoto's old geisha districts of Gion and Miyagawacho, and keep your eye out for strolling maiko. Then visit the home of Japanese Zen, and check out the tranquil garden.
Walking through the old streets of Kyoto is the closest thing to a time machine in Japan, and you will be able to feel the history of the area during a privately guided walking tour. See how life has changed from the past, while the traditional arts have been passed down, from dance and song to meditation at Zen temples.

title: Kimono Dress-up Experience With Hotel Returns Near Nijo Castle
description:
Be it summer or winter, Japanese kimonos complement all seasons perfectly! What better way to explore Kyoto than to do it in traditional Japanese garb!
Don't miss the opportunity to fully enjoy Kyoto's culture, by wearing a kimono. Create fond memories of this traditional city that will last a lifetime! Take pictures in a silk kimono, posing in the lush beauty of parks and the serenity of ancient temples.

Composed of various layers and sashes, it takes practice and patience to put on kimono. But do not worry, our friendly staff will help you select the perfect one and have you dressed in no time.

With three different packages: Simple, Overnight (the most popular!) and Private Kimono Service, there is something for everyone.

title: Lunch and Entertainment with a Maiko in Gion
description:
The traditions of the geisha and maiko are an intriguing mystery. Now you can enjoy lunch and entertainment with them in a traditional tea house.
Since the 1800s, geisha and maiko have been a beautiful sight throughout Kyoto with their signature white make-up and elaborate kimonos. Trained in various Japanese arts, being entertained by a geisha or a maiko (apprentice) is truly unforgettable.

Normally they will not receive new customers without a recommendation from a regular client. However the Tomikiku tea house in Gion offers this once in a lifetime opportunity. Relax as you enjoy your meal and watch a graceful dance and lyrical music performance, maybe even play traditional games with a geisha or maiko! 

Your start time between 11:30 and 13:30 will be confirmed after booking.

title: Traditional Japanese Dance Lesson in The Art of Nihon Buyo
description:
Immerse yourself in Japanese culture and learn nihon buyo (traditional Japanese dance), an art form that has been refined over the past 400 years!
In an intimate home atmosphere, your instructor and English speaking attendant will teach you the ritual and history of this treasured Japanese dance form.  Your unforgettable experience begins as you are clothed in an exquisite kimono! 

Watch closely as your expert instructor teaches you the basic foot steps, gestures, and usage of props like the folding fan. By combining these movements, you will soon find yourself moving gracefully, just like a professional! This course allows beginners without any prior dance experience to learn the basics of this ancient art form.

title: Sagano Bamboo Grove and Arashiyama Walking Tour with Yakatabune Cruise
description:
Take a tranquil morning walk through serene Arashiyama, visit Tenryuji Temple, and stroll the Sagano Bamboo Grove. An optional river lunch cruise is also available.
Nestled beneath the stunning Arashiyama Mountains of Kyoto, Sagano-Arashiyama is one of the most scenic destinations in Kyoto. Your morning stroll begins at Tenryuji Temple, home to one of the most acclaimed Japanese gardens in Kyoto. Stroll though the Sagano bamboo forest and visit Jojakkoji Temple. After crossing the scenic Togetsukyo Bridge, you can opt to have a tasty Japanese-style lunch aboard a traditional yakatabune river cruise boat, the perfect way to drift downstream. Especially in autumn and spring, the region comes alive in bursts of colors and flowers, creating a perfect venue for strolling.

title: WiFi Router Rental with Pick-up at Kansai Intl Airport (2-Day to 30-Day Plans)
description:
Stay connected at all times during your trip to Japan with a portable wifi router you can pick up and drop off at Kansai Intl Airport. Choose from a range of plans, great for both work and vacations.
Get high speed, mobile broadband for your iPad, laptop and smartphone anytime and anywhere in Japan. The Pocket Wifi can quickly create group internet access and individual WiFi hotspots; connect wirelessly to many devices such as iPads, laptops, digital cameras, iPhones, Android phones and game devices to let you play games online, transfer pictures and keep in touch.

Visit the counter in the International Arrival Lobby, located on the 1st floor of Terminal 1 (Near the South Arrival Exit and next to Airport Exit F).

The counter is open from 7:00am - 10:00pm, but after-hours returns can be made via the return box.

title: Full Day Kyoto Bus Tour to 3 World Heritage Sites from Osaka
description: Venture through the ancient capital city to see the famous Fushimi Inari Shrine, Kiyomizudera Temple and the Kinkakuji Temple. Visit the highlights of Kyoto on a convenient bus.

title: Kimono Dressing and Rental near Honganji Temple in Kyoto
description: Select from hundreds of kimonos and obi sashes to let the experienced staff transform you! Walk along the streets of Kyoto in the traditional garment.

title: Dinner Reservations at NINJA RESTAURANT in Kyoto
description:
Enter through a secret passage way leading you to this famous restaurant run by ninjas. Enjoy a night of surprises, magic and delicious food in Kyoto!
Spend an evening in the world of stealthy ninjas in Kyoto as you enjoy your ninja-themed dinner! Savor a delicious selection of Japanese, Chinese, French and Italian cuisine with a modern twist. The beautifully presented dishes will also contain a surprise for you to discover! Witness the art of ninjas through fun magic tricks performed right at your table, for an evening out that is lots of fun for kids of all ages.

title: Kyo-Yuzen Hand Dyed Accessories Workshop in a Traditional Kyoto Machiya
description:
Create your very own souvenir of Kyoto by joining in and learning the art of Kyo-Yuzen. This local dyeing technique creates bright, fantastic designs great for all ages.
Join the craftspeople of Marumasu-Nishimuraya, a 100 year-old business, and dye your very own item with step-by-step instructions. The traditional art of Surikomi Yuzen, a brush dye technique was created  in the mid-18th century and has been the most popular way to dye kimono cloth ever since! Using paper stencils and ink, layers of color are carefully brushed onto fabric. Designs range from realistic flowers and plants to abstract designs. While a kimono takes days or weeks of work, you can make your own shopping bag, mini tapestry, T-shirt or cute mini tote in just a few hours!

title: Kyoto Private Limousine Tour with an English-Speaking Driver
description:
Treat yourself to an an incredible private chartered tour of Kyoto, the ancient capital of Japan. Ride in luxury in a spacious limousine as you discover the area.
No need to deal with crowded buses or hard to use trains when you book this chartered limousine tour! Your English-speaking driver and guide will take you wherever you wish and assist you in experiencing the best that Kyoto has to offer. You can choose from a 4, 6, 8, 10 or 12-hour tour. Before your tour date, you will have the opportunity to discuss your interests and the areas you would like to visit with your guide. Keep in mind that nothing is set in stone, so you can change your itinerary on a whim!

title: Cycling Tour of Historic Kyoto with an English Speaking Guide
description:
From Kyoto Station, bike around the city's most beautiful historic and spiritual locations. Pedal by the Kamo River, iconic Heian Shrine, Nanzenji Temple and the Philosopher's Path!
Meet up at the Tourist Information Center of Kyoto Station and start the cycling tour. Your English-speaking guide will take you cycling around Kyoto's best historic locations. Ride along the Kamogawa river, stop in at Nanzenji Temple and Heian Shrine to soak up the culture of Kyoto and continue along down the Philosopher's Path. The tour will end back at Kyoto Station, making this a satisfying day tour.

title: Private Maiko Dance Performance with Dinner or Snacks Plan in Kyoto
description:
Entertain guests or family with special maiko performances in a private tea house in the heart of Kyoto. Enjoy sake and delicious Japanese cuisine for a memorable evening of refinement and culture.
Experience an evening of true Japanese hospitality in Kyoto, being entertained by elegant maiko as you savor a kaiseki meal in a beautiful private room or bar. Discover the mysterious world of Kyoto's iconic entertainers.

title: Half Day Traditional Batik and Indigo Dyeing Lesson in Kyoto
description:
Learn the traditional method of dyeing intricate patterns on cloth, and choose your favorite sketch from more than 200 types or bring your own sketch. You can take your work home on the same day.
Japanese batik makes use of a brush to draw patterns in wax, which gives you a subtle nuance like drawing with Indian ink. Draw once again over the patterns you have drawn to make them look solid. When the fabric you draw the pattern is dyed, the wax cracks and the ink permeates through the cracks, making the unique patterns. You use wax of about 150 degrees Celsius. If the temperature is too high, the wax permeates through the cloth, and if it is too low, the wax becomes translucent, which also adds a unique touch to every piece.

title: One Day Premium Tour to Uji and Fushimi Inari Shrine from Kyoto
description: Visit World Heritage Sites like Ujigami Shrine and dramatic Byodoin Temple, the enjoy a Japanese-style lunch near the Uji River. Learn the secrets of the tea ceremony and explore famous Fushimi Inari!

title: Traditional Japanese Hand-Crafting Sessions in Kyoto
description: Use traditional methods unique to Kyoto to make traditional crafts such an an embroidered handkerchief, Yuzen fabric dye or a cocoon puppet as a gift or for yourself.

title: Dynamic Tandem Paragliding Experience in Kyoto
description: Experience flying at a high altitude and stroll in the sky at 470 meters above the ground. Witness the amazing view of the surrounding cities from above.

title: Special Family-Friendly Maiko or Geisha Makeover Experience in Kyoto
description: Make special memories with your family, dressed as a colorful maiko or an elegant geisha! Take beautiful photos and experience a bit of Kyoto's culture.

title: Samurai Sword Dance Lesson at Samurai Kembu Theater in Kyoto
description:
Discover the techniques of the samurai and learn the basics of kembu, a refined style of sword dancing that passes down the samurai spirit and methods.
Learn and practice the traditions of Japanese samurai with the elegant yet martial kembu sword dance. Kembu, literally sword dancing, was designed and practiced by samurai to prepare themselves before battle. In the movie "The Last Samurai" you can see actors performing kembu on the day before the battle. Later, the practice changed to ensure sword work could be passed on and taught, even when the samurai class was prohibited from openly carrying swords. Join this informative and fun cultural class, and take a step to becoming a samurai!

title: Private Ohara Temple and Garden Sightseeing Tour from Kyoto
description:
Set out, just your group and guide, and visit Sanzenin, Jikkoin, and Shorinin Temples. Each is famous for serene gardens made more than 1,000 years ago.
Head off the beaten track and discover three temples dedicated to music and traditional Buddhist chanting. Located near Kyoto, but far enough from the center of the city to allow nature to showcase its beauty are the temples of Sanzenin, Jikkoin, and Shorinin. Each also boast varied gardens that capture the feelings of the seasons and soothing atmospheres. Calm your mind as you walk through the gardens, and maybe even have the chance to hear the monks chanting. With a private guide, there is no need to worry about rushing, so you can enjoy the tour at your own pace.

title: Kyoto Zuikougama Pottery Experience
description:
Try your hand at making the famous local Kiyomizuyaki pottery at Zuikogama, which has been creating high quality pottery in Kyoto since 1771.
Learn how to create your own piece of beautiful Kiyomizuyaki pottery at Zuikogama, where expert craftsmen have been producing Kyoto-style pottery since 1771. Great for visitors of all ages, the passionate instructors will help you get a feel for the heavy clay, pottery wheel and traditional painting techniques. The reasonably priced plans only take about an hour each, making this a great short break from sightseeing. Create a unique memento of Kyoto, so you can remember your trip every time you use your pottery cup or dish!

title: RANDEN ONE-DAY PASS
description:
Explore the outskirts of Kyoto city with this convenient one-day pass. Discover hidden gems and get special discounts at select shops and attractions!
The Randen Tram Line connects scenic Arashiyama, in the western outskirts of Kyoto, with Shijo-Omiya, which lies in the middle of the city. Dotted along the tram line are world heritage sites, tranquil zen gardens and spiritual temples and shrines.

With a one-day pass that costs a mere 500 yen, you can get on and off the tram as you please, visiting these popular tourist sights at your own pace, without any hassle!

title: Rickshaw Ride from Ginkakuji
description:
Step back in time and experience a unique Kyoto rickshaw tour, starting at Ginkakuji! This private tour will allow you to customize the perfect day.
The word rickshaw originates from the Japanese word “jinrikisha”, which means “human-powered vehicle”. They first appeared in Japan in the late 19th century. In modern day Japan, Ebisuya's “shafu” (rickshaw drivers) provide “omotenashi,” a distinctly Japanese form of hospitality.

Choose the private tour that fits your needs, from 12 to 120 minutes, which each driver will customize to best fit the season, weather and your interests. Climb aboard the luxurious rickshaws and move deftly through the area around Ginkakuji temple, known as the "Silver Pavilion".

title: Full Day Tour of Uji and Nara (Departing from Kyoto)
description:
Spend a full day exploring Uji and Nara, two of Japan’s oldest cities. Visit Byodoin and Todaiji, take part in a tea ceremony, and play with deer!
Located on the southern outskirts of Kyoto between two ancient capitals, Uji is known for its matcha (green tea). Enjoy an authentic tea ceremony at Taihoan, across the river from Byodoin's famous Phoenix Hall. Guests will visit Uji's main historical sights, such as Ujibashi Bridge, Nakanoshima Park, and Byodoin Temple.

After lunch, visitors will be taken to Nara, one of the original capitals of Japan that celebrated its 1300th anniversary in 2010. Visit Nara Park, home to over 1200 friendly deer, and stroll through the lofty Todaiji Temple and Kasuga Grand Shrine.

title: Kyoto Backstreet Biking Tour with English Guide
description:
Get a special local's eye view of Kyoto as you cycle through hidden back roads. Pedal past all gems of this fantastic city with your on an incredible, private bike tour!
Cycle through Japan's ancient capital, Kyoto! Take the backstreets as you discover the sights that make this city so popular. Meet up with your guide at the Kyoto Station Terminal, then slip into the past in Miyagawacho, one Kyoto's 'hanamachi' (flower towns). Stop in Gion, the most exclusive geisha district in Japan, where you can see the famous maiko.
Kyoto isn't complete without a ride along the Shirakawa River, a gentle and relaxing interlude on your way to the gardens of the Kyoto Imperial Palace Park. After the guided tour you have the option to return to Kyoto Station or keep your bicycle and explore further, all the way until 19:00.

title: SEIBU 1 Day Discount Train Pass for Tokyo and Saitama
description:
Plan fun day trips from Tokyo with a 1-day discounted rail pass. Visit beautiful locations of your choice like Kawagoe or Chichibu. You can also use the pass to make your way to seasonal activities.
Plan your own self-guided tour through cities like Kawagoe and Chichibu from Tokyo. Visit various places along the Seibu lines all courtesy of your discounted pass. Depending on the season you can locate the best sakura viewing spots, summer festivals, fall colors and winter illuminations.

title: Traditional Yakatabune River Cruise with Lunch or Dinner in Tokyo
description:
Slowly float down the Sumida River as you pass through Tokyo. See Tokyo Tower, Rainbow Bridge and the colorful night views of Odaiba while drinking and enjoying a Japanese lunch or dinner.
Pamper yourself with a day of delightful cuisine and romantic views from this yakatabune. These 'pleasure boats' have been operating since the Edo Period, when the feudal lords and wealthy merchants would throw parties or host cherry blossom viewings or poetry gatherings on them. Today the boats are popular for romantic cruises and celebrations. Join the brightly colored boats as they congregate in Tokyo Bay and raise a toast to the city skyline with your choice of beverage.

title: Massage and Facial Treatments at a Japanese Style Salon in Central Tokyo
description:
Treat yourself to a luxurious massage, facial treatment or both that is tailored to your needs. Enjoy the same treatment as the celebrities who have visited this location in classy Ginza.
Have a perfectly relaxing day with no worries of language barrier thanks to the English-speaking spa therapists. Choose which plan of treatment and/or massage you would like and enjoy the same treatment as the spa's high-profile clientele.

title: Udon Making Lesson in a Local Home with Japanese Culture Classes in Tokyo
description:
Get a full course of Japanese culture by learning how to cook delicious fresh udon noodles while enjoying traditional shodo calligraphy or origami crafts, all with an English-speaking instructor.
Join this special Japanese cooking and culture class at a local home located in the heart of Tokyo. Begin by making your very own udon noodles from scratch. Mix the flour, water and carefully knead your noodles to the perfect firmness. While letting the noodle dough rest, enjoy a fun calligraphy or origami lesson with an experienced English-speaking instructor. 
Once your noodles have been rolled out, cut and cooked, get ready to savor your own bowl of freshly cooked udon noodles! Take home your artwork and a handy recipe to continue your pursuit of Japanese culture even after returning home.

title: Private Customized Taxi Tour Around Tokyo from Central Tokyo
description:
Spend a full day or half-day touring around the city of Tokyo and visit places of your choice right from your hotel. This hassle-free taxi charter includes English support for your peace of mind.
Travel in comfort on a convenient taxi which will take you around all the hottest spots of Tokyo. Customize your own self-guided tour around the city or consult with an English-speaking assistant to find places of your interest.

title: Japanese Calligraphy Experience and Name Writing in Asakusa
description: You will learn the basics of Shodo, Japanese calligraphy, including how to hold the writing brush and sit. Once you get the hang of it, write your name or favorite kanji on a fan!

title: Half Day Traditional Japanese Cloth Weaving Experience in Asakusa
description: Use a classic weaving loom to get hands on with traditional techniques and create a pair of coasters or cute mat, perfect for the house. All ages can join this family friendly tour.

title: Yakatabune House Boat Dinner Cruise Around Tokyo
description: Enjoy a few drinks with a tasty dinner as you cruise down the river on a traditional Japanese Yakatabune house boat. Relax as you take in the sights of Tokyo!

title: Panoramic Tokyo Full Day Tour with Lunch and Bay Cruise
description:
Discover Tokyo from Meiji Shrine, Sensoji Temple, Odaiba, the Imperial Palace Gardens and more on this full day tour! Enjoy garden views at lunch and see the city from Tokyo Bay as you cruise.
Begin your day tour at Meiji Shrine, a Shinto shrine dedicated to Emperor Meiji and his wife, the Empress Shoken. This huge shrine is an island of tranquility in the very middle of the city. Continue on with a stroll though the vast Imperial Palace East Garden, followed by a visit to Sensoji Temple in Asakusa. Take a peek and see what you discover in the Nakamise shopping street! After lunch cruise around Tokyo Bay on the elegant riverboat Symphony before heading to Odaiba, an artificial island off the coast of Tokyo. On the way back into the city you will drive over the spectacular Rainbow Bridge, lit up with colorful lights, giving you one more magical glimpse of Tokyo after dark!

title: Modern Tea Ceremony in Ginza with Tea Bowl and Whisk Set to Take Home
description:
Experience a modern counter-top tea ceremony held by a professional tea master in the Kabukiza Tower in Ginza. After your lesson, the matcha green tea and tea ceremony set are yours to keep!
Take home the knowledge of how to perform Japan's famous tea ceremony, with all the utensils needed to create a frothy bowl of green tea back home.

title: Tokyo Bay Evening Cruise with Theatrical Performance
description: Gaze at the mesmerizing sunset or the captivating night lights of Tokyo and experience the wonders of traditional Japanese theater, all on a cruise along the delightful Tokyo Bay.

title: Tokyo Car Rental Service with English GPS from Haneda Airport
description: Visit famed tourist attractions hassle-free from Haneda Airport and get around Tokyo or other spots smoothly with a handy car and English GPS. Great for families or groups of friends!

title: Full Day Classic or Modern Kimono Rental in Harajuku
description:
Stroll around Harajuku and Shibuya in style with kimono from a shop right near Takeshita Street. Choose from various styles from traditional kimono and hakama to gothic and lolita kimono styles. 
Conveniently located right across the street from Harajuku Station, you can rent a beautiful kimono with ease. The staff will dress you in the style you have chosen - basic, hakama, furisode, gothic or lolita! After you've been dressed up by the helpful staff, enjoy an afternoon walking around Harajuku and nearby Shibuya. Visit the famous Meiji Jingu shrine or talk a walk around the bustling streets.

title: Full Day Muslim Friendly Tokyo Tour  (English or French Speaking Guides)
description:
Tour around Shibuya, Asakusa, Harajuku and more with an English or French speaking guide. Stop by for a Halal-certified ramen lunch and visit the largest Mosque in Japan for Salat. 
Hop on a train and go on an adventure through the busy city of Tokyo on a tour which will be fun for Muslims and non-Muslims alike! Explore Sensoji temple in Asakusa, shop around in Harajuku, and take photos at the famous Scramble Crossing in Shibuya. Enjoy a special Halal-certified ramen lunch at Naritaya in Asakusa and visit the largest mosque in Japan at Tokyo Camii & Turkish Culture Center for Salat. 

Guides who speak English or French are available, to make sure you enjoy your tour in your preferred language.

title: Maid Cafe Photo Shoot and Otaku Dancing Experience in Akihabara
description:
Enter the paradise world of the otaku with an ultimate maid cafe experience. Along with a super-kawaii meal, dress up as a maid or learn how to do the extreme wotagei cheering dance!
Step into the subculture world in Akihabara by experiencing a full course of otaku life at a charming maid cafe. Start by being treated like a master with a personal maid serving you your food with a cute drawing and one non-alcoholic drink. 
After your cafe time, girls can try on an adorable maid outfit themselves and take photos, while guys can learn the extreme wotagei dance to root for their favorite idol or anime character!

title: Half Day Traditional Japanese Glass Craft Edo Kiriko Workshop in Tokyo
description: Learn Edo Kiriko glass art, passed down through the centuries, and create your very own personal drinking glass or uniquely patterned paperweight.

title: Mt. Fuji & Lake Kawaguchi Private Sightseeing Tour with English Guide from Tokyo
description:
Join an English speaking guide as you embark on a private tour to discover the beauty of Mt. Fuji and Lake Kawaguchi, the rich forests of Aokigahara, a classic kimono museum, and Iyashi no Sato.
Meet the gentle side of Mt. Fuji as you make your way through Yamanashi. Stroll around Lake Kawaguchi, where flowers of all kinds blossom year round, then see the mountain from below as you explore the Saiko Bat Cave, an expansive natural lava cavern. A stop at Iyashi no Sato is a step into the past of Japan. Relax a moment among the classic thatched roof buildings and drink in the clear air and close view of Mt. Fuji. No trip to Japan would be complete without kimono, so find the beauty of the traditional styles preserved at the Kubota Itchiku Art Musuem.
Guides are available not just in English, but in a wide variety of other languages too!

title: Private Rickshaw Tour of Asakusa (Two Hour Plan)
description: Enjoy a personalized tour of traditional Asakusa in comfort and style on a Japanese rickshaw! An only-in-Japan experience that gets you up close with the city.

title: Kendo Lesson in Tokyo with Optional Armor Factory Tour and Kendo Lunch
description: Unleash the samurai in you and learn kendo. Don the armor, grasp the bamboo sword and practice your strikes. Feel the adrenaline rush through your veins as you go head-to-head with your opponent.

title: Stone Juzu Buddhist Rosary Making Lesson in Daikanyama
description:
Handmake your own rosary, perfect as a meditation aid, and a traditional tool of Buddhism in our open cafe. The gentle stone also makes a great present.
What is Tera Cafe?
We aim at making Buddhism more familiar to everyone.
To fulfill that aim, we bring the temple to the city, and create a gentle cafe refuge for people living in modern society.

If you cannot find anyone to talk about your troubles, or if it is a bit difficult for you to come to a temple for you do not know much about Buddhist temples, or have never been to one before, then we will go and meet you!

That is our concept.

title: Yokohama International Cruise Port Shuttle Service to/from Tokyo
description:
Enjoy a comfortable and a hassle-free shuttle ride connecting Yokohama International Port and central Tokyo. A great door-to-door transfer from the port to your hotel.
Whether you are returning from a cruise or going on a cruise from the Yokohama International Port, get a direct transfer to or from your hotel in the 15 wards of Tokyo. Be greeted by the staff to bring you to your destination comfortably. Great for families or those traveling in groups or even solo travelers.

title: Mt.Fuji Sightseeing, Gotemba Outlets Shopping and Hot Springs Tour from Tokyo
description:
Jump on this tour and visit iconic Mt Fuji, shop at the Gotemba Premium Outlets and relax in a natural hot spring on this fun one day tour to Japan's most famous mountain.
An English speaking guide will smooth your way as you drive up Mt.Fuji, a stunning World Heritage Site. Gaze down upon the countryside from more than 2,000 meters above the sea! After a tasty lunch of Japanese delights, soak away any stress in the delightful onsen hot springs at Lake Yamanaka. You can get unparalleled views of Mt. Fuji from the baths, for the ultimate in enjoyment. After that, have some shopping therapy, still in sight of Mount Fuji, as you check out the huge Gotemba Premium Outlets, the largest outlet mall in Japan. A special discount shopping coupon is included, for even better values.
In addition to an English-speaking guide, audio guidance in Chinese, Thai, Malay, and Indonesian is also available!

title: Private Kimono Walking Tour of Asakusa
description:
Experience getting dressed in an elegant furisode kimono, and get to know the traditional neighborhood of Asakusa on this unique guided tour.
Get the full Japanese experience: stroll through one of Tokyo's most famous traditional neighborhoods, dressed top-to-toe in an elegant furisode kimono or a hakama, the Japanese men's kimono and split pants.

After seeing first-hand the layers and art that goes into dressing in Japanese clothing, your guide will take you on a private tour around Asakusa. Explore the Nakamise shopping street, pose in front of the bright red Kaminarimon Gate, and check out the shrines and temples this area is so famous for.

Take photos in kimono, for great memories of your trip to Japan!

title: Morning Light Kimono Lesson in English With Souvenir Take Home Yukata in Tokyo
description:
Stop in to learn how to wear and tie a yukata, a light cotton kimono, and obi sash, the perfect thing for summer festivals. Dress up, take some pictures, then keep your yukata as a wearable souvenir!
Choose a colorful and light cotton yukata along with an obi sash and learn to wear this comfortably stylish outfit. Our experienced instructor is here to help, and since the yukata is less complex and lighter than normal kimono, it is both easy to learn and perfect for the hot Japanese summers. After dressing, you can take photos in our Japanese-style rooms or in the garden, to really capture the feel of Japan. The best part is you can take the yukata home with you as a wearable souvenir of your visit.

title: Tokyo Sky Bus Tickets: Ride a Hop-On Hop-Off Double Decker Bus (24 Hour)
description:
Discover the most popular spots of Tokyo from an open double-decker bus, the best way to get a unique street level view. Hop on and off as you wish to see Tokyo Skytree, Asakusa, Odaiba and more!
Tickets are valid for up to 1 week from your selected date!

Each route offers multilingual audio guides available in English, Chinese, Korean and Japanese, making these convenient buses an easy way to see the best of Tokyo at your own pace.

Asakusa-TOKYO SKYTREE® Course
Operating Hours: 9:30 - 18:00 Daily
*The bus comes around every hour
Stops Include: Akihabara, Ueno, TOKYO SKYTREE, Asakusa and more!
From the classic to the ultra-modern, hop off at the stops that catch your eye.

Odaiba Course
Operating Hours: 9:50 - 18:30 Daily
*The bus comes around every 70 minutes
Stops Include: Tokyo Tower, Fuji Television, Ginza and more!

Roppongi - Tokyo Tower Course
Operating Hours: 10:10 - 17:30 Daily
*The bus comes around every 2 hours and 20 min.
Stops Include: Tokyo Midtown, Roppongi Hills, Tokyo Tower and more!

title: Two Day Mt.Fuji & Hakone Tour with Stay at Yumoto Fujimoto Hotel from Tokyo
description:
You will explore Mount Fuji and Hakone, then spend the night relaxing at a Japanese hot springs hotel. Enjoy a day of free sightseeing in Hakone, before returning to Tokyo aboard the bullet train!
Leave the fast pace of the city behind with this two-day tour of Mt. Fuji and Hakone! Begin with a scenic drive through the countryside before stopping at Mt Fuji's 5th Station, all the way up at 2,300 meters. The afternoon is filled with striking photo opportunities, combining natural beauty with Mt. Fuji as the perfect backdrop. You can even take a cable car up Mt. Komagatake for panoramic views. Spend your night at a Japanese style hotel, soaking in the natural hot spring baths. On the second day, roam Hakone on your own using the Hakone Free Pass. Finally, watch the landscape fly by as you head back to Tokyo aboard the comfortable and fast shinkansen bullet train.

title: Private Sightseeing Charter to Mt Fuji and Hakone
description: Take a private tour of Mt. Fuji, Hakone or a mix of both. Your driver will bring you to locations such as Ashi, Kawaguchi and Yamanaka lakes, Mt. Fuji 5th Station and the volcanic valley of Owakudani.

title: WiFi Router Rental with Easy Pick-up at Haneda Airport (2-Day to 30-Day Plans)
description:
Stay connected at all times during your trip to Japan with a portable wifi router you can pick up and drop off at Haneda Airport. Choose from a range of plans, great for both work and vacations.
Get high speed, mobile broadband for your iPad, laptop and smartphone anytime and anywhere in Japan. The Pocket Wifi can quickly create group internet access and individual WiFi hotspots; connect wirelessly to many devices such as iPads, laptops, digital cameras, iPhones, Android phones and game devices to let you play games online, transfer pictures and keep in touch.

Visit the global WiFi counter in the International Terminal on the 2nd Floor for pick-up and drop-off. The counter is open from 6:30am - 11:45pm.

During hours when the counter is closed, pick-ups are available at the JALABC Counter on the 3rd floor. Off-hour drop-offs are available at the 2nd floor JALABC Counter.

title: Reservations for an Owl Cafe' Experience in Ginza
description:
Don't miss the chance to experience one of Japan's famous owl cafes when visiting Tokyo! Conveniently located in popular Ginza, have a blast meeting and petting various types of cute owls!
More of a 'owl meeting spot' than a cafe', while in Japan take the chance to get up close with lots of different owls at this neat shop.

title: Private Transfer Services between Narita Airport and Tokyo with English Support
description:
Make your way to or from Narita Airport in style, in a stylish private taxi! Avoid the stress of trains and heavy luggage with a door-to-door transfer service. English interpretation available!
After a long flight or business meeting, the last thing you want to do is wrestle your way into a train or wait in a long line at a bus stop. This private transfer service makes getting around a breeze!

title: One Day Mt. Fuji and Tokaido Road Tour from Tokyo via Bullet Train
description:
See a different side of Mt. Fuji with dramatic views over tea plantations, a visit to a post town along the Tokaido Road, ukiyo-e woodblock print art, and a sushi lunch of freshly-caught seafood!
This new tour to Mt. Fuji will take you to the opposite side of the mountain, for a totally different experience! Look at the symbol of Japan framed by lush tea fields, and avoid the crowds in the Hakone area.

title: Home-Style Healthy Chanko Hot Pot Cooking Lesson in Tsukishima
description: Learn to cook up a hearty  Chanko hot pot with a former nutritionist of the Japan Sumo Association. Taste the delicious meal that has been a long time favorite for the mighty wrestlers.

title: Ninja Training at Jidai Academy Dojo in Tokyo with English Interpreter
description:
Learn from the ninja masters of the Musashi Clan and train in real ninjutsu. Try throwing ninja stars,  practicing meditation, and see real ninja weapons in the heart of Tokyo!
Study with ninjas and learn the secrets of the ancient Japanese martial art. With an English speaking interpreter, nothing will be hidden as you practice both the physical and mental skills of ninjutsu. Learn the kujikiri hand signs, work your body, calm your mind with meditation, and get hands on with traditional weaponry.

title: Avant-Garde Dinner Theater Drag Show at Roppongi Kingyo
description:
Get ready for the signature Neo-Kabuki style dinner show featuring an energetic cast of female, male, and new half dancers on a moving 3D stage!
Visited by movie stars, designers, and lovers of avant-garde theater, Kingyo mixes the traditional and the modern for a unique spin on Kabuki, dance theater, and acrobatics with an amazing dance performance. Keep your eyes open, because the dancers pop up from below, zip down from the skies, and create a high-energy performance that will leave you wanting more! Enjoy freely flowing drinks and a selection of premium dishes as you watch your choice of curtain calls

title: Become a Sushi Chef with a Professional Lesson and Shabu Shabu Lunch
description:
Learn to make sushi from an experienced chef, then enjoy the flavors of your efforts along with a special beef hot pot after the lesson.
This tour is perfect for sushi lovers and anyone dreaming of becoming a sushi chef. Learn how to make different types of sushi, then put it to practice as you create tuna nigiri, cucumber rolls, salmon roe gunkan wraps, and more. The best part is sitting down to lunch to taste what you made, along with a Japanese beef shabu shabu hot pot.

title: Nighttime Tour of Ogasawara Island
description: Discover the hidden secrets of Ogasawara Island at night. Shy animals come out of hiding under a starlit sky that feels like a different world.

title: Full Day Hike of the "Eastern Galapagos" of Ogawasara
description: Take a full day hiking tour of a number of small islands called the Eastern Galapagos, each with unique ecosystems, plants and animals,

title: Private Tea Ceremony and Kimono Dressing Experience in Tokyo
description:
Take part in a private and traditional Japanese tea ceremony. Wear a colorful silk kimono, drink tea, and take photos in the tearoom or garden when finished.
Discover and join the historic art of the tea ceremony with a private course in your choice of English, Korean, Chinese, French, or other languages. Start by dressing in the multi-layered silk kimono before learning how to gracefully move in the delicate wear. Make sure to take photos as a lifelong memory! Learn about the traditional Japanese art of tea, as explained by professional tea masters, and sip a cup of matcha tea while tasting wagashi sweets in a serene tatami tea room.

title: Kyoto Full Day Trip by Bullet Train from Tokyo
description:
Ride the famous shinkansen bullet train and zip from Tokyo to Kyoto for a full day in the ancient capital. Visit golden Kinkakuji Temple, Nijo Castle, with free time to explore in the afternoon!
Set out from Tokyo to Kyoto an on all day adventure. Your day begins as you board the Nozomi, Japan's fastest bullet train. This scenic and efficient way to travel to Kyoto is hard to beat! 

Once in Kyoto, you will visit Nijo Castle, where in 1867 the last Edo Shogun restored the authority of Japan's Imperial Court. Next is Kinkakuji Temple, home of the Golden Pavilion, a glittering pagoda gilded with about $5 million worth of gold leaf! No visit to Kyoto is complete without seeing the Imperial Palace, where you can catch a glimpse of ancient imperial life. In the afternoon you will have extra time to explore on your own, so you can personalize your visit.

title: Tokyo Private Sightseeing Tour with English Speaking Driver
description:
Explore Tokyo with an English-speaking driver. Customize your day or let the pro guide you to the best spots, including Asakusa, the Imperial Palace, Skytree, and more.
Available from 1 to 60 people!
Visiting Tokyo and don't know quite where to go, or only have a little bit of time and you want to pack the most you can in to a day? This is the tour for you! With a completely flexible start and end time, you can fit in sightseeing around your schedule, with a convenient pick-up and drop-off at your hotel or other locations in Tokyo., including drop-off directly at Haneda Airport. Take a fully customizable tour and head off to some of Tokyo's best destinations, from the imposing Kaminarimon Gate in Asakusa to the famous Tsukiji Fish Market. Gaze over the city from atop the TOKYO SKYTREE® or stroll through the Imperial Palace gardens, all with an English speaking driver and guide.

title: Harajuku Back Street and Street Food Half-Day Walking Tour
description:
Join this walking tour through one of Tokyo’s hottest districts, Harajuku! Explore unique clothing stores as you stroll through Japan's fashion capital, and try the famous local crepes.
Renowned for its unique street fashion, Harajuku has been the birthplace of many of Japan’s notable fashion trends. Your tour begins at Harajuku Station, where your knowledgeable guide will take you down the famous Takeshita Street, the heart of Harajuku! Check out several famous side streets before making your way to the tree-lined avenue of Omotesando, the Champs-Élysées of Tokyo.

As your tour continues, there will be stops at Tokyo’s largest "100 Yen" store and the world-famous Kiddy Land toy store, the perfect place to buy quirky souvenirs for friends and family back home.

title: Tokyo Robot Cabaret Show Including Dinner at Kyoto Themed Izakaya Restaurant
description:
Enjoy this exclusive package of a Robot Cabaret show ticket and dinner at a Kyoto-themed Izakaya restaurant. Discover the magic of a robot show with neon lights and dance music, and including an authentic Japanese Wagyu beef dinner, such as sukiyaki and shabu-shabu.This package includes access to a show at the Robot Restaurant and a dinner at Kyomachi Koishigure restaurant. You can first go to dinner and then see the show, or vice-versa (depending on the option you select at the booking - please see the Important Info tab for details on these options). The two venues are only five minutes apart on foot. 

Enjoy real Japanese food in the nostalgic space overlooking the towns of Kyoumachi and a man-made river within the restaurant. All decorations are from the Showa Era and are authentic items used in private residences or purchased at the antique fair of Toji-temple in Kyoto. Enjoy the little Kyoto trip while in Tokyo.

Please choose dinner option from below choices:

Dinner plan A: 


Steamed pork
Handmade Tofu
Two side dishes
Salad
Salmon sashimi
Fried chicken
Pork skewers
Pickled vegetables
Rice
Fruits

Dinner plan B:


Appetizer
Handmade Tofu
Assorted side dishes
Avocado salad with fried Tofu skin
Assorted sashimi
Shrimp and vegetable tempura
Jelly
Beef sukiyaki
Rice or udon (thick noodle)
Dessert

Dinner plan C:


Seasonal appetizer
Assorted Kyoto-style appetizer
Wheat starch with miso paste
Assorted sashimi
Grilled fish
Assorted vegetable and shrimp tempura
Assorted salmon roe and nameko mushrooms
Greater amberjack and tofu skin shabu-shabu
Chirashi sushi (assorted sashimi on the bed of rice)
Miso soup
Seasonal dessert

*Menu is subjected to change by season

title: Tokyo Robot Cabaret Show and Authentic Kaiseki Dinner
description:
Enjoy an exclusive package which includes a Robot Cabaret show ticket and an authentic Kaiseki cuisine dinner. 
Discover the out-of-this-world magic of a robot entertainment show with flashy neon lights and dance music, followed by a high-end traditional Kaiseki cuisine with fresh ingredients direct from Ise region.This package includes a ticket to a show at the Robot Restaurant and Kaiseki dinner at Ise Sueyoshi restaurant in Nishi-Azabu. This restaurant uses very fresh seasonal ingredients directly transported from Ise region. You can first go to dinner and then see the show, or vice-versa (depending on the option you select at the booking - please see the Important Info tab for details on these options). The two venues are approximately 30 minutes apart via train and walk.

<Sample dinner menu>
・First drink SAKE
・"Hassun" - appetizer
・"Sashimi" - Fresh Raw fish
・"Wanton" - Simmered foods
・"Tempura" - Fried foods
・"Gohan", "Tomewan", "Konomono" - rice, soup, pickled vegetables
・Sweets or Fruits
・Japanese tea

Show at the Robot Restaurant 
The Robot Restaurant in Kabuki-cho in Shinjuku is one of the most famous entertainment venues in Tokyo, offering a fusion of Japanese culture and robots. This unique, futuristic and loud show will target all your senses and is definitely something worth experiencing. The music, dancing and state-of-the-art technology will leave you impressed.

title: Snow Tour from Tokyo
description:
Visiting Tokyo in the winter/early spring season? Why not go for snowboarding/skiing for 1/2 day? This tour provides a rare opportunity to try JaPOW - Japan powder snow - while visiting Tokyo! As an option - the tour can be paired with onsen (hot spring) and Japanese sake tasting! 
Please note: This seasonal tour runs annually between December and March. The dates are subject to change.Many people claim that Japan is a tiny country, but this tininess sometimes translates into convenience ---- You can plan a day trip to a fine snow resort from Tokyo.
Take Joetsu Shinkansen, a bullet train, from Tokyo Station. It will take about 70-80 minutes to get to Gala Yuzawa Station in Nigata.

Gala Yuzawa is the most convenient resort from Tokyo. Everything but the slopes, meaning changing room, hot spring, and restaurants, is located in a building, which also houses the station. You can get changed to your gear after 10 minutes you get off the train, and you are off to the the slopes in 15 minutes. Can't bring your gears to Japan? No problem, a rental service is also available.

The tour leaves Tokyo Station around 0730-0800 and arrives at the foot of slope at 0900-0930. The next 6 hours are well spent on the slope. (Depending on your skill - your guide will navigate you the suitability of each slope.)

After hours of indulging with snow - onsen is available for those of you who wish to soak your ice cold body.
As an option - we also make a stop at Ponshukan - (A house of Japanese Sake) Walk into a room called "Kikizake Machine (Sake Tasting Machine)" and JPY500 is all you need to enjoy 5 small cups of sake, out of 130 selections from 96 brewers.

The tour ends in Tokyo Station - around 6pm to 7pm, meaning you still have plenty of time to grab dinner and continue the day with night activities in the city.

title: Tokyo Cherry Blossom Walking Tour in Asakusa
description:
Theres hardly a more iconic place to view the breathtaking Japanese cherry trees (called sakura) in bloom than the Asakusa district of Tokyo. See brilliant displays of springtime blossoms in their full splendor along the riverbanks of the Sumida River, where youll stroll with a local guide in the morning. Cross Azuma-bashi (Azuma Bridge) to the Japanese garden at Ushijima Shrine, one of the most popular spots to see the trees. Conclude at Asakusa Temple on this 2-hour walking tour that is not to be missed! 
Numbers are limited to 15 people, ensuring an intimate experience with a small group.

Please note: This tour is seasonal and runs yearly for approximately one week in March and April. The date is subject to change.Start your cherry blossom tour in Asakusa and follow your friendly local guide on foot across Azuma-bashi, a bridge that was rebuilt in 1931 to replace the original 18th-century construction. Crossing over the Sumida River, youll be awed by the rows of Japanese cherry trees (or sakura) that bloom along its banks each spring.

Take in the magnificent sight of these breathtaking blossoms awash with delicate pink and white petals. Youll have photographic views of Tokyo skyscrapers en route to the opposite bank. Continue on until you reach Ushijima Shrine, located in Sumida Park. With more than 1,000 years of history, the shrines Japanese garden remains a favorite among the locals for its springtime showcase.

Next, take your small-group stroll along the riverbank where 1,000 sakura burst in a vivid display. In addition to the more typical somei yoshino  think tiny white and pale-pink petals  youll find different varieties that bloom with larger flowers and in darker hues of pink. 

Your last stop is Asakusa Kannon Temple (also known as Senso-ji), one of Tokyo's oldest and most significant temples that receives 30 million visitors a year. After exploring the grounds with your guide, you'll conclude your walking tour at the Asakusa Kannon Temple. From there, you can continue on your own to expl

title: Japan Unlimited 4G Portable Wi-Fi Rental (Pick-up in Hokkaido Chitose Airport)
description: 出國去日本上網神器！4G高速網路吃到飽！日本機場即可取機，方便又省時！

title: Okinawa Sightseeing Hip Hop Bus-B-1 Course (Depart from Naha)
description:
The Sightseeing Hip Hop bus will take you to all the major Okinawan oceanic attractions on this newly opened route. 
Tour includes tickets, audio tour services in 8 languages and free wifi on the bus. So what are you waiting for? Make your booking now!

title: 【日產】東京NISSAN租車・P5輕型5人座
description: NISSAN日產租車線上預約！KKday為您提供最優質的租車服務。安心・舒適・整潔。不管是朋友、情侶還是家族旅遊都適合。行程不受限，盡情暢遊日本關東，日本首都東京！

title: 【長野滑雪體驗】黑姫高原・雪場玩雪券・纜車一日券
description: 冬天總是有檔不住的滑雪慾望嗎？長野的黑姬高原滑雪場是冬日滑雪勝地，有難度較高的坡度，但接近山麓後坡度逐漸變緩，新手及孩童也能盡情享受，適合全家大小一同出遊！

title: Tokyo Vegetarian Kaiseki
description: Located in Tokyo. Azabu Kadowaki Restaurant offers one of the highest quality Kaiseki cuisines. And, every reservation comes with a complimentary drink.

title: Universal Studios Japan™ 1.5 Days Entry Ticket
description: Visit Universal Studios Japan™ in Osaka and leap into a world of excitement. Experience Hollywood-themed characters and thrilling rides.

title: 【長野滑雪體驗】冬季白馬慢活三日遊：雪上煙花・燒餅製作・瑜珈體驗
description: 想像過雪地裡的慢生活是怎麼樣的嗎？早上，來杯特調熱飲及豐盛的早餐暖身；下午，來個火爐前瑜伽伸展，舒展開一天下來疲憊的身體；晚上，來品嚐看看信州的日本酒，身體暖暖的入睡。2018年的WINTER HOLIDAY不僅是雪上極限活動，而是在雪中體驗生活！

title: JR Alpine-Takayama-Matsumoto Area Pass
description: Explore Japan’s spectacular alpine scenery at the Japanese Alps with the JR Alpine Takayama-Matsumoto Area Pass giving you unlimited use of JR trains and certain bus routes over a 5 day period.

title: Okinawa Churaumi Aquarium Tickets & Airport Shuttle Bus Service
description: Visit Okinawa Churaumi Aquarium, one of Okinawa's most popular attractions, and one of the largest of its kind in the world. Take advantage of a combo ticket including direct shuttle service from Naha Airport (OKA) and returns to a number of hotels and convenient locations across Okinawa Island.

title: Osaka Aquarium Kaiyukan Tickets
description: Discover marine life at Osaka Aquarium Kaiyukan, one of the biggest public aquariums in the world. Celebrate its 25th anniversary with a spectacular winter illumination at night.
